reviews.review: Excellent food with great service that's near the strip. Although a Korean BBQ, this place is also great for pescatarian and vegetarians as well.  What's great about this place is that it's not saturated with tourists. I highly recommend!
We were in town for the weekend and really enjoyed our time here!  Clean, good energy, great attentive staff and best of all, amazing food!

Yum yum yum this place is so good I love everything on the menu and I love their happy hour from 3pm to 6pm service is pretty good and I love cooking the stuff myself or having them do it . Had to make this my first stop

We came here for happy hour and I was starving so I order everything on the hh menu and it was so delish and I'm so full I also order a soju cooler green apple flavor it was good also but I'm so full I couldn't even drink it. But this is a good place close by the strip I would definitely come back again.
Service was great very attentive staff. Food was amazing. I will recommend to all my friends and family .

Wow!!!this restaurant is on my top five best, the food was amazing the service was also great and you get a free Ice cream macaron with checking in. The most reasonable price I have seen from this type of restaurant.

This place never fail for big party and meat lover.

Fresh meat and good portion with right price.
above average service
The food was delicious, service was speedy, restrooms were clean. I'm definitely recommending this place to everyone.
Traditional Bibimbap is quite delicious.  Service was great too. If you want something off the strip that is worth checking out, I'd recommend this

This is one of the better korean bbq restaurant in las vegas.  I would give this a 3.5 stars based on all the korean bbq ive tried. We ordered the premium beef combo and added a bunch of meat. The kobe style beef was pretty good, and over all marinations in general was decent.  If your in vegas I would go here over the other ones

I haven't been this satisfied with Asian BBQ before!
I've been to Sura BBQ and Tofu hut, but they don't even compare to Gangnam. Sura is too pricey and I am a little taken back by how they place the raw meat outside.

Anywhoo, Gangnam was a nice alternate to that, since they serve you your food like Tofu Hut. However the quality of the meat is far tastier. Everything that I had was delicious! 

We ordered the beef belly, BACON WRAPPED SCALLOPS, spicy garlic edamame, fried chicken karrage and the banana tempura with ice cream. This is definitely one of the rare occasions where i can honestly say i loved every bite. The service was phenomenal and we came during happy hour. They also have a Robata special after 10pm, must try!

The proportions were excellent and presentation was beautiful. (Especially the beef belly and banana tempura)

The exterior of the restaurant does not give it justice to the inside because i was pleasantly surprised by how pretty it was in there, and I did not expect a place like that to be so close to UNLV. 

The ambiance is appropriate for all types of parties from romantic to large parties. (:

I will definitely return & try the whole menu!

This was our first meal in Vegas and really, not a bad one. The place is not huge, but does have accomodations for a few large groups. We weren't a large group but still had to wait around 20 minutes for lunch to get seated.

The food itself is more Korean style - not the most authentic Korean BBQ you're ever going to get, but it's not bad at all. The prices aren't terrible (could be cheaper like in other cities sometimes, but still not bad). Nothing stood out at me, but it was all decently solid food. Our main waitress kind of seemed like she didn't want to be bothered though. It wasn't bad service, but she still kind of gave off that vibe for some reason.

Anyway, if you are in the area and need something like Korean BBQ, this is not a bad option at all.

Friends and I just finished having lunch here. We decided to get the Meat Lovers for 4 and it was the perfect amount of food for us all!! We've had Gyu Kaku before and this place is very similar but IMO the food is a lot tastier here! 

I will definitely come back and bring friends and fam here when we are in town.

The quality of food here is very good. I had a gangnam combo and there wasn't anything I disliked and for 2 people it was very filling. It is a good relieve from the numerous buffet options on the strip.
We got the combo for 4, it was a lot of variety and everything was well flavoured. Definitely worth a visit :)
I'm never disappointed whenever I dine here. My bf absolutely loves the kalbi stew. You can never go wrong with the spicy seafood tofu soup as well. Service is equally as awesome as the food!
love it so much. I will come back this restaurant again if I come to Las Vegas once again
Woooo! After a night of party party party, Gangnam BBQ is the way to go. Great selection of meat & great service. My belly is all ready for EdC Day 2!
Awesome food, great service! And the Las Vegas was so much food! It was a great dining experience. Overall everything was good, would highly recommend.

This place is as good as it gets for Korean BBQ.  We had the Gangnam for 4 and it was the perfect amount of food.  The raw oysters that came with it was fresh, BBQ was so flavorful.  The bulgogi bi bim bap was yummy in my tummy.  It satisfied 4 hangry Asians and a definite try if you're in Vegas.

Bulgogi, toro, come hungry and leave happy.

The atmosphere is ultra trendy. 

Banana fried ice cream to close out.

 Naega jai jal naga. Great music too.
Found this place during a conference. It was delicious. I was especially impressed with the sides available as they definitely exceed what is available in my hometown.
Hands down the best korean bbq I've tried in Vegas. The quality of meats are excellent, very reasonable price, and the best service. I strongly recommend this restaurant to everyone!!!!
Awesome meat quality and great appetizers! Will come back next time when I'm at vegas again!
When looking for great Korean BBQ in Vegas, this is the place. Great food, great environment. Always a crowd pleaser!

Just came here for lunch. Mediocre at best compared to all the great KBBQ joints springing up around town! Food and service were so-so. We ordered beef tongue, skirt steak, bulgogi, and kalbi beef... Plus a salad and a miso soup. They had the traditional sides available. We ended up paying $50 for two of us. I would have rather gone to Hobak or Magal. The happy hour may be something to check out. Other than that, probably won't be making this a go-to spot for KBBQ.

The ambiance of the restaurant was really nice, loved the decor. The food was A+ quality. The meats were tender and really tasty! I loved the waiters and waitresses, the service was fast and friendly. I would love to come back again and have a party here next time! Would definitely come back again :)
Great atmosphere for groups or even just grab a quick bite solo, good food nice staff and under priced of u ask me

Awesomeness.  Prices were decent. Food was filling. Service was good. Next trip to vegas I will be back! 

My family and I came here with hurt tummies from all the rich vegas food. We came here because they had the veggies we wanted. We had a party of 5 so we had to wait (reservation for parties of 8 or over). Waited about 20 minutes.  It was well worth it.

The Korean prime rib- my favorite.  Tender and juicy with flavor!

Beef brisket- it was good, just a Lil fatty here and there. 
Brocoli- bomb.com

K squash- not my favorite thing to grill, came out kinda hard

I will definitely be back. Thanks guys!
Great price for the amount of food they serve. $99 for four people, comes with various good meats, salads, soups and rice!!!!
This place gets better and better. Happy hour gets lit haha. Definitely come check this place out. I honestly think the Kobe beef is a must, after all it is number one.

I went in here for some BBQ, but rather for the yook gae jang (spicy beef soup) since I had a craving. I probably went wrong in walking in here for the purpose of eating this soup, since it's a meat specialty place. 

The menu, decor, and set-up totally reminded me of GYU-KAKU. Even the little details like the color of the plates and their logo. I got to try some meats off of a set menu, and the meat quality was quite impressive. They have good meats, if you're willing to shell out the price for it. 

As for the yook gae jang and soon tofu, it tasted like salt with no other flavor, and totally was ruined in my opinion. The side dishes however were good. 

Service was slow, despite the restaurant only being half full. I had to ask for water and certain side dishes multiple times to get it.

This is my 3rd time being here and I plan to keep coming back. The meat here is prime, the sake is to die for. And the food is top. The prices are right, and it's fun! You cook it yourself on a BBQ in the middle of your table. I love this place
Bulgolgi is the shaz and the music selection is out of this world. The decore is nice and the people are welcoming. The only problem i had was small food size.

Service: Always on point. There may be a wait when you come on a busy Friday or Saturday night, but they are always very nice and courteous. 

Atmosphere: Cozy and cute. Much better decorated than a lot of other KBBQ around town. 

Food: AMAZZZZING! Being a LA native, we are constantly being spoiled with $9.99 to $16.99 AYCE KBBQ so it was a change to get out of the cheap AYCE mentality, but this place is definitely worth it! The portions are good, it will definitely fill you up. I usually get the "Gangnam" meal. 

Price: It is a little bit on the pricey side compared to AYCE, but the meat quality makes it more than worth it. 

Highly Recommend!

Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas ! 
Meat quality 5/5
It didn't have a heavy BBQ smell after we were done :)
First time my mom actually said kbbq was good haha

Loved this place! I was hesitant for years because it opened shortly after that Gangnam Style song came out, but moved to this side of town and I didn't want to go to Chinatown for Korean BBQ. This isn't all you can eat, but it's actually a lot more fun ordering and you get to be a little more selective. We ordered the spicy karaage, Kabocha squash tempura and the shishito peppers as appetizers. All delicious, especially the squash. We had reservations so all the complimentary side dishes were arranged around the grill upon arrival. For the grill we ordered two orders each of the scallops with bacon, bulgogi, harami miso, and Kalbi, along with an order of corn. We had five people in our party and we didn't finish it all, but got pretty close! It's a really fun experience and it doesn't feel as rushed or impersonal as other places. The decor is also really nice and it doesn't feel like your typical all you can eat/buffet place. Loved it and will definitely be back
Great service and their happy hour is really good. Fried calamari was really amazing and the sauces for the meat is amazing
Came down here from Phx,Az. Hands down thee best place to eat. Friendly service, awesome vibe & great prices. I recommend the Bulgogi Bimbimpap.
Great food and atmosphere. It honestly reminds me of gyukaku but the Korean version! We got the meat lovers set for 4 but felt like it was enough for 6 people. Will definitely come back! :)

Good place for korean bbq. Portions of meat are big and all the sidedishes are delicious. The macaron ice cream is very good. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in vegas and want korean food. The prices are decent too.

Cool spot to hit up when you're feenin' for some asian BBQ. Trendy and inviting local restaurant in a strip mall. Beware of parking as it always seems jam packed. 

The food was reasonably priced. We got the gangnam special for $65 for two people. Well worth the money if you're going to eat everything. I do mean everything. Otherwise I would have ordered a la carte. All the meat was seasoned and marinated very well that you didn't really need the additional bbq sauce that they offered. We also ordered the steamed chili dumplings..... Don't get those. It's a big dose of spicy sauce with otherwise bland flavors. 

We'd definitely come back only if we felt like splurging. After dessert, drinks and taxes, $90+ is a bit more than we'd like for a quick casual meal.
Definitely hit up the place again when I visit Vegas next time. It's a decent place with good service and nice Korean food. I would say it can be in the top 5 Asian food restaurant list of mine.

Fantastic off the strip Korean BBQ!! Must try the Kobe beef and garlic calamari. You get the traditional Korean banchan that are very fresh - kimchi, cucumbers, sprouts, dried squid, pasta salad. We ordered the Kobe, pork belly, squid and Japanese peppers. Every bite was very good and memorable. 

The restaurant is very clean and has nice ambiance, additionally, the waitresses are very cute  

Definitely recommend!!
Phenomenal korean!  Short walk from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.  The bulgogi bibimbap was very good.  Looking forward to coming back to try even more culinary delights they have to offer!

Authentic Korean BBQ with a grill in the table. The wait staff was friendly. They were helpfull in deciding what to order and explaining what the dishes were. I especially like the big screen tv with music videos playing.
Awesome k BBQ. Recently moved from NYC and this place blows all the places in town away :)
Food and service was fantastic...it reminded me of eating in downtown seoul, s. Korea.
Loved their package deals!!! The tofu is amazing!!! Even their miso soup was flavorful. The environment is cozy and the tables are large. Will definitely be back.
Wow! Came here by accident. Very impressive selection. Great service and tasty food. If you're looking for a fun place for dinner, you can't go wrong here.
Hands down the most delicious Korean bbq your little tongues will ever taste. Stop reading reviews and go there now! Now I said!!!
Wow, lots of great food and fun!  Came here after reading other reviews and checking out other restaurants near by our hotel.  We couldn't have chosen better!
Really great service and very good food.  We wanted Korean and found Gangnam on Yelp.  My kids and I loved the marinated Kalbi and bulgolgi.  We ended dinner with macaron ice-cream.  So good!
Great food, very good service.  The place is a hidden trasure! We got the Gangnam special for 2. It was a lot of food for 2 adults and 2 kids. Even our 4 and 6 year Olds loved it.
Second-time visit. Came during Happy hrs. Good price and awesome food! I love their bulgogi bibimbap.Our server is very friendly too.
I was so disappointed that they don't even offer seafood, not worth the one hour wait for sure, way overrated...

Great lunch special that enabled us to taste several types of meat, appetizers and vegetables at a very reasonable price. Great flavor - - - especially the marinated beef. Very friendly and helpful staff.

We've been wanting to try this place for a long time already.we set our expectations pretty high due to all the great reviews we've seen and they didn't disappoint us at all! The food was amazing, the meat cuts were of good quality, they offered various foods it's not just your basic Korean bbq place.

First time here & this place is bomb! Service was good & they are all friendly. Good with groups & their music was enjoyable. Their food was bomb. Had their yakiniku menu & there was so many options to choose from. Appetizers were yummy, we had their calimari, chicken karaage, and cheese wontons. Portion size was decent for the price. For entrees, we had the spicy pork, beef toro, pork belly, & their korean prime kalbi. Those were bomb too. If you're ever in the neighborhood & you're hungry, then check this place out.
Awesomeness! Great food, price, selection, and service. We have been to a lot of KBBQ places. Gagnam is one of the best!
Definitely coming back. Found this place on my family trip. Can't wait to bring my friends on my next trip to Vegas!
Delicious Korean food and friendly service. We had pork belly, pork cheek and kalbi - all delicious.
Walking distance from hotel. Kids had their fill. Mission accomplished. Happy hour was great. Xoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxoxo
The guy is very helpful in giving us information about the food information  & it is delicious.
I love the ambience and the service. Great service!!!! I am Korean and i can tell the Food was vey authentic and delicious. I would come again. Awesome place.

Everyone in my party was extremely impressed with the level of the service!!
The quality and freshness of the food was amazing.
Ordered the Las Vegas bbq combo.
And macaroon ice cream sandwich.
Highly recommended!
Service is great like last time.  Food is still pretty good.  But this time the quality of the prime kalbi is not as good.  Not much flavor and kind of chewy. But overall not bad.

Such a fun atmosphere! Great place great food! We ordered the Las Vegas for two and there was plenty of food to spare! Loved the beef and the shrimp in particular. The boibob rice was to die for! So flavorful and delicious! Highly recommend if you've got some time! Yumm!
Great food! Great for groups. Cool environment with music / music videos and stays on n late.

This place was amazeBalls!! The amount of food that was served in the gangham was perfect for two. The meat was delicious. All the complimentary veggies were yummy as well. The bulgogi was the best I've ever had. My husband and I will definitely be returning. Recommend this place to all our friends :)
So I came here for dinner with my Frds, we didn't have to wait too long before we are seated. It is really tasty Korean bbq in Las Vegas. Happy thanks giving

Food is really good!! My first time at Korean BBQ and it was amazing. Will not be my only time. I will come back based on this experience. Servers are very attentive and make sure your water is filled. Overall, I had a great time. I definitely will come back.

Macaron ice cream is good 
Good food
Poor customer service
Food comes so late
The grills are not clean
They need to clean the grills thoroughly 
The tongs are not clean left some food marks in the claw part of the tongs
Just visited this restaurant and the quality and variety of beef options are wide. Love their Korean premium Kalbi beef, their Beef Toro and bulgogi
Harami miso and prime Kalbi were delicious...great quality meat and marinated to perfection. Will definitely come back again.

First of all - we were inspired to come to Korean BBQ after setting an ad for another place on a billboard. After Yelping some nearby options, the 1300 reviews and a 4.5 star rating, drew us in. 

At 7pm on a Saturday, we just weren't sure we could get in so we called ahead and a friendly young man answered. While they don't have a call ahead or reservation list we were able to walk right in.. Though apparently it's not uncommon to have a wait. 

After being immediately seated, we were promptly asked for our drink order. And moments after asked if we were ready to order -- through out our meal the service has been efficient,  immediate, and impeccable! 

Let's talk about the meal! 
We selected the meat lovers meal for 2, though you can order piecemeal - this included 6 meats, 7 sides, and 3 appetisers for $60 after tax. So if you aren't familiar with Korean BBQ, the premises is that they provide the food and you cook it at a grill on your table.

Breaking it down: 
APPETISERS
Miso Soup
Green Salad
Steamed Chili Dumplings
Spicy Garlic Edamame 

MEAT
Spicy pork
Bulgogi
Beef Toro
Flat Iron Garlic
Pork Belly
Filet Minion

SIDES - I am guesstimating what each of these items are, we did not get a rundown. 
Bean Sprouts - Good, nice crunch to them, and not particularly strong in flavor.
Kimchi - very flavorful without being off putting (assuming you don't dislike kimchi in general)
Fish Cakes
Jalapeños, Onion, and Ginger - they were in a mild marinade of some sort, really good when we grilled them too!
Macaroni Salad - noodles were a little soft for my taste and too mayonnaisey but my friend liked it. 
Spicy Squid (I think!) - really delicious (and I don't like seafood, at all), the dressing/marinade was flavorful, almost like the kimchi, and the texture was just right, not too chewy but hardy 
Spicy Baby Cucumbers - may have been pickled, but overall nice crunchy texture with a 
Rice - sticky and white.. Just a vehicle for everything else!
(Forgive me for the constant 'flavorful marinade' comments but I have no idea what it is... Just good! Ha!)

DESSERT
Banana Tempura
Lava Cake

SAUCES - provided in a little side dish per person! 
Spicy soy sauce
Sweet soy sauce
? Mild soy sauce-type

Now, you'll notice the extensive reviews for this restaurant... Because they offer a free dessert per Yelp review. They definitely follow through and not based on the score or content! They only check that you post it! 

A couple thoughts on improvement -- 
Provide some direction for cooking each item (meat and sides). While I was familiar with the process, its always nice to hear tips and tricks to making this a  delicious and easy meal.
Awesome place! Friendly and fast staff specially Back. The food was delicious too. Definitely coming back :)
Went here the second time and service still great! Staff are super friendly! Answer questions! Would recommend this place for some Korean food in Vegas !!!

Best Korean food I think I've ever had! The flavors were spot on for EVERYTHING (and I mean everything!). We ordered 6 different cuts of meat (spicy chicken, spicy pork, harami miso, kalbi, bulgogi, and regular pork). It was deliciously marinated and juicy and easy to cook yourself. I didn't even need the side sauces. The kimchi was perfectly spicy and the cucumber side dish was nicely sweet. The miso soup had the perfect temperature and flavor. Rice was perfectly cooked as well and service was extremely friendly and very attentive. Best part of it was all that came out to a price that was very affordable and reasonable for lunch (because you're off the strip). Highly highly recommend!!
Great kbbq place. We both felt it was worth the price and the food was great and delicious! You also grt a free dessert for posting a review afterward!!
The Mac and cheese is the  bees knees. Loved it. Order like 5 servings of meat and you'll be good for all day.
Good service! Taste good! I like this restaurant! Nice! We ate the $ 170 for 6 people.
Great food, great atmosphere, great cook for a great price. It's a must visit on a trip to Vegas.
Meat was good, food was amazing, service was the best! I recommend it , everyone you should come here!
The food is delicious and the service was excellent! We are from out of town and we came here since it was close to the airport. It was a good decision!
How do u say awesome in Korean?  Everything was excellent...food, service, atmosphere...top notch!!!  I had the spicy pork, kalbi, and bacon wrapped scallops...wow!

Hands down to this place! The crew, the manager (John) and the owner are the best! The quality of food is exquisite. I have been to a lot of Korean place in town but so far my experience in this place is remarkable! You can never get wrong with the quality of food and service! Btw, we had the Gangnam type of bbq and it was amazing! I totally would recommend to anyone!!!
Soo good! First time Korean BBQ goer and it was fantastic. I can't wait to go back with my friends. The flavor a were unique. The meat lovers was perfect!

I can't believe how great this restaurant is.  It is a gem.  We come to LV every year and my husband found this on the web and we decided to try it.  What a deal for the price.  We had lunch there.  For less than $13, you have two selections of meats, one salad or soup with one appetizer.  On top of that, we get 7 side dishes.  The portion of the salad and appetizer is huge.  How I wish they can open one in San Francisco.  I would eat there every week. You have to try it to believe it!

A wonderful dining experience! The restaurant has a modern and trendy decor. 
We were warmly greeted by the hostess and seated promptly. The waitress was very attentive and friendly. 

We ordered the marinated Kalbi, bulgogi, and the steamed egg dish. All delicious!! 
There are so many dishes we want to try!
Delicious and great selection!  There was four of us and we were full with food to take home. There was a good variety of banchan and everyone was super helpful.
Great fresh food and good service.   Recommend the BBQ shrimp and uni rice.  And you get free desert for a yelp review

Its hard to find a good Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas.  This place is definitely a good place to try. My favorite was the kalbi which was very tender and juicy. Lemon chicken was also good. Side dishes were great too. I'll be back very soon.
Solid food and service. The side dishes were a lot better than most Korean restaurants I've been to. Got extra noodles and veggies for only $2!

We came from LA and been to many KBBQ places there. Surprisingly, this restaurant has a new approach in preparing its dishes and meats. 
The portions are good enough for one couple and we had to take some to go in the end. Not many waitress inside but the service was great!
They now removed the traditional wire griller, but the new Korean type griller is also useful to get rid the greasiness of meat.
Also, their bimbimbam (stone rice) is a bomb, recommend everyone to come and enjoy :)

Recommended by an uber driver~ tried today, really like the place! 
For 2, we ordered the meat lover's set, and got overwhelmed in the end~ the food was so good and the price is really reasonable! 
Highly recommend anything beef related!
The waiting time is a little crazy, we waited around 1.5 hours, but it turned out totally worth it!
Food is delicious and the restaurant is very clean. It is really popular, we waited for an hour! By the way, this restaurant is actually far away from the strip!
Always amazing and a MUST when coming to Vegas! Great food and service! The sides are yummy, meat is flavorful, and the atmosphere allows for good conversation!

First time and loved it! Kal bi was awesome. Japche tasty. Meat quality is good for the price. Side dishes were good, not outstanding. My aunt had the scallops, meaty, good quality. 

Saw this on Yelp, been to many Korean barbeque in Las Vegas. This is the best one. Highly recommended. Enjoy!
clean, great service and delicious food.  we enjoyed the meat lovers BBQ, it's cook your own to!

We came here for the happy hour after 10pm. We loved Beef Toro, mushroom assortment and hot sake from happy hour menu! In addition, the place got a nice ambiance, cozy booths and friendly stuff! Will be back again.

The best Korean BBQ I've had in Las Vegas!!!! Great quality meats and appetizers. We ordered the beef, pork, Kalbi and then the noodles sukiyaki. I would go back and recommend this places to everyone coming to Vegas.

Vising Vegas all the way from San Diego. Ate some good bbq, the prok belly and the bulgogi was delicious. Great marination and flavor, broke da mouth as we say in Hawai'i. Love to check out local food places that are not on the strip.
The bbq there is very delicious. Fresh and nicely cut. People here are so nice and friendly. Fabulous experience!
The place had a very nice vibe to it. The food was really good, filling and cheap. Coming back for sure.

Appetizers are all so yummy! 
Got the spicy tuna kimbap
Dynamite shrimp
Steamed chili dumplings
Spicy tuna poki** 

Kobe style beef
Asparagus with bacon 

And of course the honey bread :)


Asahi dry for the thirst! 

Enjoy !

Came here for a Memorial Day weekend dinner and had no complaints. The beef was tender and juicy. The servers were pleasant and helpful. The wait was not too long and the ambience was perfect. A perfect place to get your carnivore needs satisfied. Plus free dessert for yelpers!
Great Korean BBQ place, very clean! Not all you can eat but very worth it. You don't feel like you're about to explode after because you're trying to get your money's worth.
Was here for my brothers birthday diner. Food was delicious. We ordered the meat combo for 4 people. Enough food for everyone. Finished the whole entire combo. We will be back!!!

Ordered the "Las Vegas" dinner for two, was worried it wouldn't be enough food for two but we were completely wrong, it was more than enough, essentially a sampler of an array of meats and side dishes they offer. Everything was absolutely delicious, steak, prawns, chicken, all the meat was very tender and you grill it yourself, great service.

This place has an unbelievable happy hour for food and drinks. We ordered three of their appetizers each and it was way too much food for us to finish! Service was fast and helpful. And I'm a huge fan of the Korean pop music videos they have playing on the wall. We will definitely be back... and with more friends next time so we will be able to finish what we order!

Fabulous service! Tons of food, reasonable prices. Yelp review earns you a free dessert :)  

We ordered the Gangnam meal for two and we are stuffed!! Only enough room for dessert ;) 

The food was good. I didn't give 5 stars cuz it wasn't eyes-rolling-back-in-your-head good, but it definitely was yummy :) 

Would recommend!

What a fun way to have dinner!  We ordered the Ganghan for 4 people & there was so much food, we couldn't finish. The sides were plentiful & tasty. Ask for the special sauces - there are 2 red sauces that are much better than Siracha with the beef. My favorite side fish was the bibimbop and my favorite meat was the filet mignon, but all of the meats were marinated nicely.
The side dishes is so good! And we ordered the Meat Lover for 2 people! The Bulgogi in this set is my favorite. Five stars for the nice service and great food. By the way, I love the Kpop music here!

So we were on a drive to vegas for a work related convention... Of course we were behind schedule so we decided we wanted something Asian/Korean late at night.  It was good for us to be here at 10 PM because we caught the place during happy hour. 

We ordered a lot small plates for the four of us. A few stood out so much we reordered or contemplated reordering them. Among those were the calamari, sweet corn, jalapeño popper, beef toro and pork belly.

It helps to take the kimchi and put it on the grill and then eat with the pieces of meat. Needless to say this place will be on the vegas rotation for food for me.

We really enjoyed this place.  We ordered the Gangnam package and all the meats were marinated well and great quality.  The sides and it came with were all delicious and oysters were fresh.  We will definitely be back when we are in Vegas.

Lives up to all the hype and then some! The very best dishes were the prime rib; the macaroni salad bonchon; and the filet. 

We stayed at the hard rock hotel, and this was a very quick walk across the street - less than 3 minutes' walk, and probably just under 20 minutes or a 5-min cab from the strip. The price was exceptional for the quality as well. Can't recommend enough. I just wish I had a location like thos at home.

This place was amazing. Great food and good service. The thing that made this experience a lot better was our server "Donkey" he said we wouldn't be able to pronounce his name right so he said call him donkey. Best server in the whole place.
Bomb! bomb food great happy hour prices great service and flavorful dishes. Perfect for late night or an evening with friends. Bulgogi and gimshi is delicious

Amazing service & delicious food!!! Definitely a fun spot. Went with my family and we really enjoyed the atmosphere here. There are many things to choose from. They also give complimentary appetizers that are delicious!

Really great food! The waiters were extremely friendly and I loved the miso soup. Deff recommend to anyone who loves Korean food.. Or food in general. The restaurant has a unique atmosphere. You're bound to have fun trying to cook your own meat!
Great food! Great place! Ordered the Gangnam meal for 2... It was good for 4 people! :)
Delicious!  The Yelp reviews don't do this restaurant justice.  We decided to order the Meat Lovers and it was a great choice.  We're definitely coming back again!

Excellent service and I especially liked their variety within the menu!

I'm looking forward to coming back there with my wife
Excellent food excellent service especially for happy hour cuz the food and beer is worth the price

We ordered Premium combo for two people. I must say everything is PERFECT especially the KOBE beef and the shrimp bibimbap! We really enjoyed the late lunch after whole day hiking. They also have the promotion if u rate them, they will offer free dessert :)

This was probably the best Korean BBQ I've  had. All the meat was extremely tender. We did the meat lovers and I was expecting the meat to be tough and chewy, but it was so tender. All the sides were delicious. I also tried the spicy tuna appetizer and the fried wontons which were also super yummy. The server was super sweet and even asked if our cocktails were made to our liking! Who does that? I don't live in Vegas but if I did this would definitely be one of my go to places. So in the meantime I will recommend it you you tellers. Enjoy!
I've been to several Korean BBQ places and this place is the best. Definitely recommend this place!

Everything is pretty good. We ordered ala carte. Definitely recommend the kobe sam which uni on top of beef. All the meat we tried were really good. The kalbi beef was tender. My cousin who has eaten a lot in LA said it's comparable to the kbbq there. Macaroon ice cream is hit or miss. Depends on the quality of the macaroon. My sister had one that was drier. I recommend the mango macaroon.
It is really nice place. I usually can't eat a lot. It is small portion so, I can order what I want. Service is good too.

My partner and I had the lunch special and were presented with a vast, sprawling feast that accommodated a wonderful variety of flavour combinations. Everything was delicious and astonishingly good value.

Wanted some Korean BBQ and found this place on yelp. We ordered Gangnam combo for four and everything was more than great! The oyster was more fresh than those in the Caesar's Palace buffet. A must try!
Damned good, especially the spicy tuna kimbap! Plus they have this sweet deal where you get free desert if you write a review :)
Tasty Korean bbq, Food and taste is exactly what I want! Already not enough meat for me lol Definitely would come back next time visiting Vages.
THIS PLACE IS NOT AYCE!! But besides that, the food was good. Unlike AYCE KBBQ where I usually leave really, really full, I left satisfied. But don't go here if you have a huge stomach.
A wonderful assortment of Asian meats cooked to perfection by our resident chef. Delicious fish, great service, and a ton of good food made this dining experience exceptional.
The noodle is great. The beef and corn is delicious. Moreover, the service here is good.

My husband and I ordered the gangnam deal. That will definitely fill you up and some. The meats were all tender and flavorful. The complementary side dishes were alright; fish cakes, bean sprouts, shredded squid, kimchi, and some other things. 

The service was surprisingly really good. Got there and they sat us right down. We never had to call our waitress because they were always checking on us. I never had to ask for a refill. Once we were done, they gave us our check and we are out in a minute after that. Super fast service. I love it 

Overall, I really like this place. It's worth your money going here rather than those all you can eat places
Luv'd there food it was fantastic! Just wish it was all u can eat but other than that the service was great & the set up of the restaurant was good too:)) I also like that they're open very late!!!

Good food. Completely made me ignore my diet plan. Have to get kids gym membership now as now the whole family has become morbidly obese after just 1 and a half hours due to the the godly amount of beef ordered. Can i has my snack now

Still the best kbbq in town! Great customer service and great food, what more can you ask for? If you are in Vegas, this is the only kbbq place you should try. Big portions, taste great, and the atmosphere is awesome! Music is awesome, and the caterers are very attentive, I always feel great at this place.

This is a great restaurant to introduce you to Korean Food.
The grill in the middle of the table is so much fun to cook with your loved one.  We had the lunch special with the beef, rice and salad and some chilli dumplings with the most amazing dipping sauce.  You get about 3 sauces to dip with and all were very yummy.
Christine was our server and she is so sweet and attentive and very genuine, she added to our experience for sure.
I would have given the place 5 stars if it had a little more atmosphere.   But given the area I understand why.
Highly recommend!!!
The quality of the meat is great and the service is fantastic. They were very accomodating for our big party. Will definitely be back!
Awesome taste I have never had before. The bbq order set is recommended and it come with side dishes that was delicious too.

OMG this is the best Korean bbq I have had in Vegas! Our waiter was very helpful and gave awesome recommendations and the happy hour was so good! I would definitely come back to this place every time I visit vegas.
This place is the freaking best.  Value taste everything.  Neff said.  Def Coing back

Came with 8 people and we had the meatlovers combo to share. it was fabulous. the service was great as well. we asked for some extra sauces (ask for sesame oil and salt if you feel the meat doesn't have much flavor, it really adds a nice touch) and lettuce wraps and they were delivered no problem and no extra charge. this is a must go restaurant in Las Vegas.

I'm not writing this review just because they bribed me with a free dessert!!! The place actually impressed me. The meat was simply prepared wonderfully. The appetizers which we ordered (beef tongue and spicy tuna) were simply mouth-watering. The stone pot rice that came with the gangnam style dinner set was excellent. Let's just say spending $200 eating here for 6 people was a better decision then eating at any of the casino buffets.

First time here! We went during happy hour and the prices are very cheap, but they only have a few selections. Also take note that at this place, you have to cook the meat yourself!

Overall, everything was delicious. However, the beef toro isn't as tender as I've had before. The beef tongue is really good!

Honestly if you come to Korean bbq, order beef. The other meats aren't as good for the worth, but they are still tasty. Also if you write a Yelp review, you get free desert!
First time here , love it nd loved the service !!! Its like happy hour sushi but korean bbq i will defently be back
It is my first time here and i definitely come again. Oyster is not so fresh but overall is excellent. Tofu chigea is a bit spicy. Taste is so Korean. Love it!
Excellent service--handled all of my family's spastic requests with grace and a smile. Food was delicious and came in generous portions for a decent price. Would love to come again.
Really great selection and fun atmosphere, they have a projector playing K Pop and America pop music that keeps it interesting! Food is great

This is PERFECT for all of you that do not want AYCE KBBQ. There aren't many of you, but if you're like, who really can't eat all that much in one sitting, it's excellent. Come during happy hour (1130am-5pm and then again after 10pm) and it'll be better bang for your buck.

We didn't eat much and was still really content and full (for me, at least). We only got short ribs, which they do remove the bones for you so it's just all meat. Then, we got beef brisket, which is pretty typical, as well as 2 orders of pork belly. I'm sad no tripe but I'll live. There are a lot of other things on the menu but I'm not a fan of marinated meat at KBBQs.

During my second visit, I got pork cheek, which was my first time eating it so I'm not sure how I feel about it yet... I wouldn't say everything is awesome-tasting but it's not too bad.

They've got a small selection of desserts but we only got ice cream ($1.95). Flavors: vanilla, green tea, and strawberry. It's a good portion size.

I doubt I'll come when it's not happy hour so there you go. But if you're in the area during happy hour, why not?
Nice service, the interior decoration feels like korean style, the food look very good and fresh.

Everything is just perfect! I've never tried any Korean food as good as these. We almost gave up while waiting. Thankfully we returned and enjoyed our meal. The mix tempura and the prime kalbi taste so good!

We ordered the Meat Lover for 2 and it was filling and delicious. This was the first time we went to this restaurant and we will definitely be back when we are in the area. The atmosphere is amazing and the prices are reasonable
This is the first time we've tried this place. And so far I'm really amazed. The service was awesome. The food was delicious.... And don't can't forget the amazing macaroon ice cream
This is the third time I tried this place. This is the Best Korean bbq in lasvegas ! Must try!

Amazing food && great service. Will come again! Awesome pokemon too!!! bulgogi is always a must and i cant compliment the amazing service enough! the atmosphere and music they play really does add to the experience. All i can say is well done && a great restaurant experience. swag.

Bugolgi here is well marinated. Expect a great meal only limited by your skills at the grill. Rice is extra though. Since its tapas style you can easily mix and match even if you have a small party. As long as you get at least two dishes you get all the tiny dishes with your meal. Wonderful with a bottle of asahi.

The food was okay but the service left a lot to be desired.  They serviced another table about 6 times more often than ours. Maybe I'm used to gyu-kaku and their excellent service but this was really bad. No one explained what any of the sides given were. No one ever turned off our grill (my boyfriend).

Update* a new server just asked about our experience and I told him about the service. He's really nice and even offered us complimentary ice cream.

I don't think I'll return but the food was good. It was just the service.
Really good meat lovers bbq for 2 we had for 3ppl and amazed at the brocolli cheese fondue!

My second time trying this joint. They don't have all you can eat but they have some good combos for a great price. The quality of meat is also higher than most for the all you can eat places in town. This place is definitely worth a try. Tip - Make a reservation because it gets busy!
Great place just a few minutes off the strip. The food is delicious and the staff is super friendly!

The Kalbi was so delicious and the bulgogi was also savor I also liked the chow rice
Great service too!
This will be go to korean bbq for us in vegas !
Great selections of different meats,  especially liked the prime kalbi! Definitely will come back again!

This restaurant was recommended by locals... and I am so glad I asked about Korean BBQ! 
I am in a food coma...trying to absorb what I just indulged in...'!
Got the meat lovers starter...and a side of pork belly
Amazingly generous portions of meat... and Korean sides. Loved the kimchi!  So much food to taste, with great spicy sauces for dipping. Fun concept with cooking the meal yourself... enjoy the slower relaxed pace, will try it again, so many choices....
We were here for a wedding celebration and service was great. The food was also delicious!

Tried this place for the first time today! Hands down my favorite Korean restaurant in Vegas! So glad I followed the reviews and came here! Very delicious and well priced! The service is outstanding and the ambiance modern with clean lines. Will definitely be coming in again. Especially to be served by Back! It's so refreshing to eat somewhere that has such tasty food complimented by great friendly servers!

Good food, great price, fast service, and a nice atmosphere. Great for lunch or dinner in Vegas when you are craving some Korean food. Will come back again. Free ice cream if you write a review too 

P.S: K-pop in the background is a plus.
Coming here from LA..as expected, foods are great and delicious. The place is also clean with good services!:) Definitely will come back here!!
ODELL BECK ! that's was our cool ass server. He took care of all our friends and make our experience really good. I would go back to this place because of him. ODB!
Come to this place! You get to grill your own beef (which is a lot of fun) and the staff is very friendly and attentive. They also have lit music

For our last night here in Vegas, we were in search of something filling and delicious - and this place easily delivered! 

The service here is awesome! We were warmly greeted at the door, and the servers here were very attentive. 

THE FOOD! There wasnt one thing we regreted ordering. If it wasnt for the awesome variety of food to choose from, I wouldve ordered the Harami Miso all night! So tender and tasty.. do yourself a favor and grab 2 (or 3) of these. 

Also, make your taste buds happy and grab the Spicy Tuna Kimbap. If i didnt love my wife, I wouldve hog cheese that thing and ate the whole thing. Im from Hawaii, so spicy tuna over cooked rice isnt uncommon, but there's were definitely the best i've ever had..

definitely one of the best cook your own food style of eating ive ever been too. great quality of food and awesome service. you cant go wrong by dining here!

My experience here with a party of four. 

We arrived around 6:30 PM, and was seated right away. It wasn't too packed. We ordered the $120 for four deal. 

Pros and Cons 

PROS:
-The miso soup that came with the deal has been by the most favorable. 
- The wait staff was on it. We didn't have to waive them down at a all. They continously checked up on us, offered refills, and changed our grills.
- the attitude and the demeanor of the staff was great. 
- the meat that came with the deal were all great tasting. 

Overall, the service and the food were both great. 

I didn't have a bad time here with my party and we enjoyed the food. Therefore, I give em 5 / 5 

Great job

Love it here. They offered lots of gf options, they are family friendly and their prices are decent for the meal size. They have high chairs for the baby and so many drink options... Oh and they have macaron ice cream sandwiches?!?! Yes. Yes. And yes!

Sooo good，much better than gyu！We always come here，and it is open latenight. 
And I recommend this restaurant to lots of my friends！
There are not enough words to describe the transcendence of flavors we experienced. THE best Korean BBQ we have ever had. The kimchee is spot on!
Good foods!  Love kobe beef. The server is great and entertaining.  Definitely will come back for more.

Oppa Gangnam Style! 

Oh, wait! that's PSY's line. Actually, Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining is Tapa Style and not all you can eat Korean BBQ, (keep in mind, AYCE KBBQ it's not big in Vegas than it is in Cali). 

We happened to come here during their Happy Hour menu offerings. So we paid for some of the meat choices at a really good price. For that we ended up doubling are orders of the: Toro Beef, Basil Chicken, Bulgogi Beef, Spicy Pork and Pork Belly. The portions we got were good for a party of three. 

- Toro Beef: Its marbleized beef brisket and very flavorful. Not as fatty as the ones that you"ll find at cheaper Korean BBQ places. It was my favorite out of our five choices. 

- Pork Belly: Standard cut pork. Not bad at all, they were seasoned. The quality of the pork was good, and had tastiness to it. 

- Spicy Pork: Tender cut pork. Smothered in spicy sweet marinade sauce makes this super delicious. 

- Chicken Tender Basil: Tender white pieces of chicken. With touch of lemon and basil. They were simple but delicious and it accommodated well with my white rice. 

- Bulgogi Beef: Beef was really tender and marinaded with a lot of flavor, very good! 
nuff said. 

The sauces that came with these were: Spicy Soy Sauce, Sweet Soy Sauce and Ponzu Sauce. The Spicy and the Sweet Soy were good. I even combined the sauces and it even adds for more taste to the tip of your tongue. The Ponzu, was the one I enjoyed dipping my meats in. It had that vinegar, sweet flavor to it.

Overall meat quality here, Excellent! The five choices we got didn't disappoint. Every meat was tender and easy too eat. Again, they were less fatty. We enjoyed every bite that came out of the mini-grill. 

We got friendly service here. Our server was very personable, and she turned out to be a cool chick. We even got some Kimchi's on the house. Atmosphere here is modern. There is a big screen TV in one side that would play random upbeat music videos. Also there appears to be space to lounge or dance for the late night vibes. 

Even though they don't offer all you can eat. They do combinations, but anything extra outside of that, can get pricey. That's why when they offered the Happy Hour menu, we chose meats with deeper discounts and for a party of three the portions were just right, for a tab around $35. 

Eh, sexy lady...nom,nom,nom,nom...Oppa NomNom Style!
Yummy food, the steak was the best with the sauces and sides. The combos have the best value, also the kimchi was very good.

Best Korean barbecue place in Las Vegas!!!!! The beef toro and bulgogi were delightful. Garlic edamame were spicy but tasted really good. 
The service here is quick and the staff is friendly. The only problem is that there is a long wait and they do not take reservations. So be prepared to wait for a while before you get to the yummy food. Trust me, its worth the wait!!! 
I would definitely visit this place again!
the bacon wrapped asparagus tho! they give you a lot of , so that's good. great service and free dessert with review huhu. bring a jacket! it's cold in here...

My family had to wait for more than an hour to be seated but it was well worth it. The food was awesome & well priced. The wait staff was patient, accommodating & welcoming. We will definitely visit if we are in Vegas again.

The gangam bbq combo was terrific. This place is not all you can eat but we were really full after this platter.  The fresh oysters were a nice touch. They even served bulgolgi bibimbap as one of the appetizers which was also quite tasty!

We got the gangnam combo and it was a bit too saucy for my tastes. But if you like it saucy, you'll like it here.

Service was attentive. Made sure we had enough food and water and such.

I thought they were generous portions. I'm stuffed.
Excellent barbeque! Best in town, hands down. Ordered meat lover for 4 and that's enough for us six people! Bimbibum is also great!

Amazing BBQ experience!! We had the Gannam combo and it taste amazing!! For three people we had the two people combo and they gave us choices of white rice or hot stone bimbimbab. The  oysters are fresh too! Marinated beef taste like heaven!! Would definitely come back again!!!!

Terrible service!
Too slow to prepare table!
It took 30minutes to complete the order.
It's unacceptable!!

Beef bulgogi was an absolute must! Super tender and the glaze was amazing. Salmon was a little bland but still good. Would recommend the bulgogi for sure.
Only comments are that I wish the sizes were bigger and the BBQ sauces were labeled, but the sizes you get are what you pay for. Yum!
Great time enjoying Korean BBQ...my six year old never had it before and loved turning the food while cooking for himself.

Good kbbq prices were ok and meat was ok
The tongue was a little taste less(get it hahaha) but no really needed more seasoning
It's hard to beat Korean food in L.A., and this was a quick stopover on a long trip. Great quality meat and fantastic service!
highly recommon... low price and good service. Amazing and fresh beef rib. I had a wonderful lunch here with my mom
Flavorful food! Plenty of options and good service. I have tasted better Korean food, but the prices and location of the restaurant cannot be beat.

What an amazing place to dine with your fiancé! Show her some cooking skills on the grill and enjoy some great service at the same time! 

The food was absolutely amazing! They have some great flavors and marinated their meats to perfection! Please come and try this place out!
Great food.  Got meat lover dinner for 2 and it was more than enough.  Service was great.  Definitely coming back next time I'm in town.

We came here to escape the strip and boy  was it worth it!  The prices were on point and the food was unbelievable!  Definitely a place to return to on our next trip to Vegas.

Came to Vegas for my birthday and I just had to hit this place up again!  And bonus we came during happy hour which is the best deal ever!  Seriously ditch the strip and make this your go to spot!

Holy smokes! I'm so glad I came across this place! I've been to a couple of Korean bbq places around town and this one has to be one of my favorites. The food was amazing!!! A little pricey and small meat portions, but insanely delicious. It's really nice and clean on the inside, and the service was fast and welcoming. The menu is quite expansive so I can't wait to come back for more!

What a find!  After watching the #MJLive show, we wanted a bite of something good to eat....we came across Gangnam Korean BBQ and it exceeded our expectations - Happy Hour food and drinks after 10pm combined with  cheerful service and tasty menu items equals extremely happy customers.  Add in some awesome K-Pop videos in the background and we are complete!

In town for a business trip and just felt like some Korean food... And this restaurant is great!! The BBQ comes in just the perfect size for 1 person. I've been to so many Korean BBQ places and this one is one of the top notch.
Super yummy and supper fun. Visiting for the weekend and decided to try it based on high reviews. Really glad we stopped in.
Very nice food!!!! Definitely worth the money. I highly recommend this restaurant.with the free ice cream,  for desert , it's an incentive to give the review.
I haven't had this good Korean BBQ in a very long time. The waitress, JaYoung is so sweet. It's very clean and everything tasted excellent and it was a lot of food. We had the combo for 2.

We go to Vegas for memorial weekend and want to have some good food. This restaurant happen to be the first one showing, so we are excited to try this out.  

We arrive at around 5:30 pm and we are seated immediately.  We are party of five with 4 adults and 1 baby.  We ended up ordering the gangnam meat set.  Food is huge portion and very tasty, beef quality is excellent.  I never have that amount of meat in my life I would say.  Everyone is satisfied with the food they offered.  

I didn't give them five stars because I think their servers can do a better job in treating their customers.  I literally saw the girl roll her eyes in front of us when she takes our order.  

**They give you free dessert if you write a *good* review about their restaurant on Yelp**

PRO: trendy, clean, excellent quality, bulgogi, bibimbap, udon.
CON: no appetizer with meal (typical for Korean)

My husband and I were excited to try Korean BBQ during our recent trip to Vegas so we chose Gangnam over some other choices because of the plentiful and rave reviews. We did not have to wait, which was a plus, and we were given a large array of different sides (banchan) that we started sampling right away. We ordered way too much meat for just the two of us, but before we could even try to get our fill of the BBQ, we both started to feel nausea and stomach pain. We asked for our food to-go but never got around to eating it back at the hotel. We crawled into our hotel bed and slept away the pain. We never figured out what could have set off our stomach troubles. Our experience could have been a fluke and it should not be a reason to avoid visiting. The service was friendly and there seemed to be a lot of other happy diners!
Delicious is an understatement. Although the set up of cooking your own food has thrown me off it was a great meal.

Workers were really nice and helpful especially with our friend and his complicated orders. The food was wonderful and the portions were good. I've been to others like this but this place is really good.
Great food, fresh meat and the marinades were great. Orders the Gangnam feast and the appetizers were well balanced. Friendly and fast service.

Amazing sides.  Amazing meat. Grilled!

This place is great.   Two visits in my three day visits to Vegas.

I would have given it a five star if they have slice pickle radish and rice paper noodle to go with the bbq. However, that's beside the point right. There is good choices of meat here. And their meats are fresh and well marinated. Server are on point and friendly. Give it a try!
Good food! Great service. What more can we ask for? I was craving kimchi so we came to eat dinner here. Lol I love the bulgogi. The spicy tuna kimbap was good too!!

Amazing service and food! The restaurant had a line when we got here but the wait wasn't long. Service was incredible and fast after we were seated, and the food was definitely worth the short wait! Would highly recommend!

Hands down the best soft tofu soup I've ever had! The tofu is super soft and the soup is extremely flavourful with a good kick to it. Our waitress was also very friendly and diligent with replenishing side dishes and water. I'll definitely be back!
Variety of food options. Large table with space to cook and have other dishes. Will come back to bring visitors.

First time  trying Japanese BBQ and I gotta say it was fun and tasty! The atmosphere was nice and cozy. The help was really friendly. The food was amazing. I would recommend anyone to eat here. The only thing to watch out is the food servings. They give a lot! So you may want to share a meal

The kobe beef is awesome!!! 

I came here alone at 4 so I sat at the bar. All my items were cooked for me which was great! I didn't have to worry about charring my meat. 

I got the Kobe beef, spicy garlic short rib, bulgogi, and the beef toro. I pretty much liked everything except for the highly recommended beef toro. It was extremely dry. I'd probably opt for the brisket instead. 

Anyways I had a pretty good experience. The male server was extremely attractive and all the servers kept checking on me to see if everything was okay.
Excellent. Loved this place! We got the Gangnam platter and had enough food for 4 ppl!
Food was great. Happy hour was awesome! The short rib  and spicy pork were great. However the bulgogi was amazing.

Got here at almost 12 and this place is still packed. Sat reasonably fast. First time here, so the menu was something to behold. Everything looked reasonably priced. I'm from San Francisco, so this was a pleasant surprise. The ambiance is definitely nice with some adult music videos playing.

The food is tops. Even though I am writing this for the free Macaron, but this rating is well deserved. Ordered stack of bulgogi, Korean prime kalbi, and tuna poki. All is A grade tasting.

Wished they swapped my grill mid meal since I got that burned crust on top, but that is minor. Adds flavor.

Easily 5 stars. Recommended for people who feeling food before 1am. Happy Hour from 10pm to 1am(closing).

Come here!
looking for a good korean meal off the strip? Well, you can stop looking. Just come to gangnam, you wont regret it.

Place is visible right on the shopping center. We had a party of 7 people and waited roughly about an hour.

The service was decent and the food was great.

I gave this place four stars due to the accommodations. It was super hot inside and it felt like there was no AC inside the building. Our server didn't check on us often and we had to ask for water unfortunately. 

I'll recommend the Korean prime and miso. It's so tender and delicious!!

Would I recommend this place? Only if you have time to kill.
This restaurant is pretty nice! We had good time here! We ordered galbi tang, denjangjjigae and galbi over rice. Everything was so yummy. We will definately come back later!

Our party of three adults and two kids arrived on a Saturday evening just before the end of their happy hour, 6:00pm.  The place was already quite busy, but we were seated immediately. Staff was friendly and attentive, and the food was excellent.

One of the things we appreciated was that we were able to order the dinner for two, despite our larger party.  An AYCE-format restaurant would not have permitted this.  We added on a couple happy hour food items and the food quantity was more than enough.

One thing I missed from other korean BBQ places was the dipping oils with the salt at the bottom.  They gave each diner a three-sectioned dipping sauce variety bowl and the sauces in them were fine, just not the salted oils I was hoping for.

Our dinner experience here was very positive and we would gladly return.
The best food ever I would came back the next time I'm in las Vegas and the service is the best
I would eat here again, ordered the meat lover option  and got more then what we expected.this place is clean and meat is tender

We ordered Gangnam set. The chicken is really juicy and tender, but other items are actually too sweet that you hardly taste the meat and get sick of the sweetness really quickly. The soup and hot tea are not hot at all. Portion size is ample and can easily be for double the amount of guests they recomend. Among all the staff, only one of them is attentive and friendly. We ordered the honey toast which we waited for over 15 minutes and thought it would never be served. We also got the free deep fried banana for making this rate. I believe this is how they got all the reviews and good ratings because you have to show them the rate to get the free dessert!
In conclusion, Gangnam is an up coming trendy restaurant with modern/urban feeling if that is what you are into, but as far as Korean food, I would rather spend my money at many other great selections around the city.
Great restaurant !! You get a lot of food for your money !! Will def come here again.

So I meet up the homie Mike C. at this place. Been wanting to try it for a minute now. It's eveningish and not busy at all.  It has a nice, dark, and clean ambiance. I'm not too sure on the dynamics of this establishment. We were the ones manning the grill, which I had no problem with. I've had places where an angry looking Korean lady snatches the tongs away and takes over. It wasn't the usual AYCE but I'll still pho'ks with it. 

The dishes we sampled was the carpaccio, pork belly, brisket, filet mignon, and prime kalbi.

I saw on Yelp that this place had beef carpaccio. Ever since Woonam Jung stopped serving carpaccio, I've been looking for another joint to replace that empty spot in my heart. Gangnam's carpaccio wasn't as extravagant as Woonam's, but just as good. Served on an oily sauce and some greens on top. Simple and delicious. This was my favorite during the feeding.

The pork belly and brisket. What can you say? It's always good. There is nothing special about these other than the pork belly being thick. Dip them things in the sesame -salt & pepper concoction and you got a happy customer. 

ALRIGHTY THEN!  Now to the beef. The filet mignon was good and tender. We cooked it quickly to a nice medium rare. It was perfect! Again, I'm glad we were manning the grill. These could have easily been over cooked and ruined. We actually got another order of the filet mignon. The server finally brings in the prime kalbi. He says that this is their signature dish. It was very tender and sweet, but it didn't leave an everlasting impression with my palate. Would I still pho'ks with it?  Sure. The first four orders is a definate though. So in the end, the crack that will have me on the come back is the carpaccio and the filet mignon. WINNER!

Yay!, I'm a fan!!!

Definitely worth your time going off strip. We came for a late dinner and their happy hour menu was off the charts. We were able to get pork belly, bulgogi and beef toro for $4 each (amazing!) Drinks were also 50% off which was fantastic. From the happy hour menu, we also ordered all the veggies (broccoli, corn, mushroom medley were all $2, seaweed salad was $3) in an attempt to be healthy. Off the happy hour menu, we ordered beef tongue, skirt steak and kalbi. We also ordered peppers, ramen and bibim ngan myung. Lots of side dishes, really good bang for your buck!

Such an amazing place! Servers are super friendly and food was awesome!!! So much better than other Korean BBQ places around. I loved all the appetizers. Spicy tuna kimbap is a must try!!!!
I'm coming back tomorrow!!
Great restaurant, food was great, servers were fast and helpful. Cheap happy hour prices. Restaurant is very clean and tidy aswell
The bulgogi bibimbap is delicious and reasonably priced. The service is really good too.
Wow, spicy pork! Finally somewhere where I can get it besides Mrs Page's house! Jane killed it serving! And my boss thinks she should be a model. Everything was on point.
Awesome place! Kalbi is really delicious. You definitely should get a Asahi with the meat!

Terrible customer service at this PDQ store . Will not be back .
Went in for the first time . Saw a posted sign at the register advertising a three peice tender combo meal for $5 bucks . 
I clearly pointed to the sign and told the cashier I would have the $5 combo special.  She rang up my order and charged me $7.46 . I took the food to my table and looked at the receipt thinking the combo special probably didn't include the soda . But why would soda be an extra $2. 46 ?   
I told the cashier I thought the combo was $5 dollars ? She said " oh that special starts at 7 pm . I asked her to tell me the time since I didn't wear a watch . It was 6:48 pm . I asked her if she could reimburse the difference . I had assumed it was already 7 pm (my fault ) . 
She went to get someone else . The manager ? Shift supervisor ? Obviously someone who was in charge .  I explained that it was my fault for not knowing the proper time . But since I had clearly pointed to the sign when placing the order , I should've been told that it was 12 minutes too early to receive that special .
In a not so friendly manner told me he was unable to refund the difference.
I asked him if I didn't like the taste of the food or if the food was too cold would he refund the entire price ? He said yes . So I then told him the food was cold and he gave me a very slow and drawn out refund for the entire amount . Plus then he took the plate of food which I had already handled and put it neatly back on the kitchen where I'm assuming he planned on re selling it . ( health code violation) .
So for the difference of $2 dollars and 12 minutes in time ... He would rather refund the Entire price of the meal , and also lose a customer forever ? No problem . This is Las Vegas and we have many different  choices on each block to choose from.  The reason I give ONE Star and will never come back is the poor customer service combined with him not throwing away the food I had already handled .

First of all, our experience here was iffy at first an hour wait was what we were told. We took the risk and are glad we didn't look back on the waiting time because it was worth it! Very friendly service and great food!  Staff members constantly checked up on our table. Also, the music here is POPPIN!
This place is by far my favorite kbbq!! Definitely coming back next time I come around. FYI the filet mignon is
Ordered the meat lovers combo and it was enough for three people. The side dishes are amazing. We were in a hurry and the service was quick.
Recommended: seafood pancakes, Harami beef, beef toro, garlic calamari, and mushrooms medley. For the best deal come during Happy hours. Drinks are 50% off. We got a pitcher of Sapporo for $8.50
Best restaurant .. I'm a meat lover .. Very reasonable prices .. Very generous with amounts and side dishes ... Courteous staff .. Very clean .. This will be my favorite restaurant in Vegas :)

I was recommended to check this place out by a Korean friend, and am glad I did.

A large selection of things to BBQ at your table and for the newbie, they had set meals with suggestions.
Recommended that you get a reservation, it was quite busy while I was there.

 Will definitely be back next time I am in Vegas!

I'm from LA and it was the first time i had korean food in LV.
Food was great and service was exellent.
Decent Korean BBQ & some japanese izakaya selections. Harami miso beef was my favorite.
Side dishes were also good.
Would come back for Korean food on my next Vegas trip.
I really like this restaurant and the servers are very nice and welcoming. Good place to try if you've never been here.

I think my life will never be the same. After eating here I feel like I can take over the world. The food was legit and the staff was awesome. I've had Korean bbq at other place and I can honestly say this is one that is pretty amazing. Only thing is if big group like I went with, need 2 sets of sides. But yuuuuuummmy
Sukiyaki is da bomb dot com!  endless side dishes  spicy pork, not too spicy, very tender. Filet mignon super juicy and soft and yummy and awesome and I want free dessert
really nice. we have fun here because of the delicious food and warm serves.
If you're in Vegas and you like Korea Bbq; you should definitely try this place! The food is good, the staffs is nice and it's affordable! They deserve 5 stars in my opinion. :)

Nice place to visit in Vegas, it is located conveniently on the Strip. I got the spicy chicken BBQ with lemon sauce, which tasted fresh and cooked well. They also have a 50% Sapporo beer during happy hour (3-6pm).

Stopped by here during an airport layover. We had 2 orders of kalbi as an appetizer...a little pricey but delicious.  Frank was our server and kept up with all of our particulars. Very good service. I had the Dumpling Soup...enough for 2 people.  My wife had the Basic Bip Bim Bop: lotsa food and again, delicious. The chicken salad had fabulous dressing.  And the Bilgogi Bim Bim Bap had only meat and no veggies...FYI.  Basics:  Clean and friendly.  Restrooms even have hot water.  This is our new Korean restaurant in Vegas...a great lunch.

At first I just wanted to go to other all you can eat place but after having a dinner here, I just decided to put it in my favorite list in Vegas. The service was amazing. I was a very picky person but this restaurant changed my mind. 4 must-have are: Bulgogi, beef toro, harami miso, prime kalbi. FYI, the happy hour is from 10pm-1am
Best choice after bug winning!!! Love this place so much!!! Nice service nice environment nice food!!!!!! Most importantly nice price !!!!
This place is amazingly good and the service is just amazing! Coming here for the second time never amazes me! Will be coming back again and again in the future!
Acceptable service, pretty fast, juicy meats, and yes come here. You won't ragrets it. #FuckingYolo
Very good food love the meat lover special they have an assortment of berf and pork meats. Grrat customer service.
The food is very very good and the price is reasonable，best Korean BBQ I ever been in Las Vegas

Good for Vegas , wish they had Pori-cha and rice paper. Jap Che was oily - waitress was super cool and took care of it. Pa - chan decent. Still a little hungry , meat size could be bigger. Kalbi was great , loved the tuna appetizer , over all good experience. Skip the macaroon deserts

Stopped in on a Sunday night while driving home from the airport. Made it in time for happy hour. The short rib is so tender and the appetizers are great. Service is really nice and welcoming. Had some soju. The happy hour is Great! Fast service! Yummy meat! What more can you ask for?
Trip to Las vegas. Came for the happy hour. Can say that it was the best meal I had here!

For Korean bbq, I usually frequent all you can eat places but here you pay by the order. A little more pricier but the food is well worth it. I really enjoyed the Korean Prime Kalbi, it was so juicy and perfect-- exactly what I want from korean bbq. I would definitely come here again!

Such a great find! If you are in Vegas this place is a must to visit! We had the Gang nam dinner for 2 that included miso soup, salad, bimibap, 5 choices of meat and all the apps/side dishes w oysters!

Service is fast and friendly!
This place is awesome! Atmosphere and food was the best. Service was amazing! Good quality meat with the side dishes. Just off the strip in front of Hard Rock Hotel. Great location :)
Amazing restaurant, food, and atmosphere. Didn't get a chance to do the bbq but definitely will next time I'm back. I just moved to Vegas and found my favorite Asian restaurant.
Have been here for several times and the food is always so good. I like the kimchi bibimbap and soft tofu soup and sometimes I will try the BBQ with a big group. Recommend you to come!
Great meat and great combo. Lots of meat selection. The side dishes were plenty and if you get the combo you have more stuff. I came hungry and now I'm satisfy. Free desert with review. Cool!

Thus far my favorite go to kbbq place in town. It is not AYCE, but the food is much fresher compared to other kbbq places. It has abnice red toned ambience. Music is on point. Very clean. The service is excellent. The staff is attentive. If you make a review on yelp, then you get a free dessert! There is also a happy hour menu from 3 pm to 6 pm and 10 pm to close.
Delicious food and a lot of it for the money. Service is great!  Worth a try.  Make reservations as this place gets packed.

This place is great! The quality of the meats are very top notch! They start you off with a variety of tasteful side dishes from spicy in your face kimchi to the creamy macaroni salad all circled around the grill. Personally the bulgogi is my favorite because of the sweet and savory blissful taste it leaves after you swallow every bite. Brisket, kalbi, and filet mignon are also good. The only thing about this place that I disliked was the service. They don't visit your table too often and when they take the side dishes they take forever to bring them back on several occasions but other than that this place isn't bad. Give it a try!
Really enjoyed all the various meats, especially the spicy pork, it was yummy. The banchan was great as well. I was quite impressed with the kimchi, had a great flavor to it, made just right.

I was very nervous about the "grill your own meat at the table" situation. I am a horrible cook and was terrified I would burn it. However, the quality of meat and marinade on it far surpassed my cooking novice. It tasted amazing! We ordered a few meats and shared. We also had the seaweed salad, chicken chile dumplings, and mushroom medley (came at happy hour and stuck to the special menu mainly). Everything tastes great. We love all the tiny bowls of... garnishes? They gave us and the waiter was patient and explained what each of them were. Delicious and definitely worth the money, especially during happy hour.
Good service with great side dishes. Excellent ventilation that makes bbq more enjoyable.
Had a great dinner tonight w the premium grill package. It's also great for Yelpers as they give you a free dessert for writing a review!
Took my family here for lunch and had a great time. Ordered the Meat Lovers dinner for two and it was amazing. My wife really liked the pork belly and karaage. Definitely we'll be back.
Best part about this place is their BBQ.  I'm from new York and I've had very good bbq, this is probably some of the best BBQ I've had. It's not too expensive and the atmosphere is great.
Great place to eat. The meat is delicious and the food was brought out fast. Great place to eat faded
First time trying this place and very cool!  It's not a true Korean. It's more fusion and there are a lot of AYCE but this is different.  Very cool and excellent food.

1st time here. Nice little spot in a strip mall close to the strip across from Hard Rock Hotel. No waiting.  Excellent service. Traditional Korean BBQ at great price.  Must try macaroon ice cream in a variety of flavors. Nice assortment of deserts. I also ordered chocolate lava cake and banana tempura.  Will stop by next time in Vegas.
Loved everything we ordered from the BBQ meats (harami, kalbi, spicy pork) to the appetizers (seafood pancakes, poki, tempura). Great atmosphere too!
great service! food is awesome! First timers and we got our food fast and it was fresh & tasty! Will definitely come again when we're back in town.

My fiancé and I went here for the first time during late night happy hour. Our overall experience was 5 star worthy. We were seated right away and greeted with a smile. Happy hour menu is small but all items had good portions. Our favorite was the beef carpaccio. Must must try! We had the beef trop and pork toro was so juicy and flavorful. We'll definitely come here again in a few days heheh.

I read the reviews and had to come check it out.  Let me say I wasn't disappointed.  I came during happy hour @3pm and it wasn't busy.  The service great.  All of the servers were helpful and courteous . I ordered most of the happy hour appetizers and the three meat offered (bulgogi, pork belly, and beef toro).  Very good taste.  I will definitely come back when I'm in Vegas to visit.

Staff was amazing, nice and accommodating! Clean and chill environment! Great food!! 

10/10 would recommend!

First time visit!

Quick and efficient service...great meats - tender and flavorful. Went with the Gangnam combo. Our favorites were the Kalbi Korean marinated meat and the miso meat. 

Banchan was yummy - especially loved the fish cake, cuttlefish and kimchi.
Delicious food. My favorite was the Korean Prime Kalbi. It was so juicy and flavorful. The family enjoyed.
Great place in the middle of las vegas. We were craving for asian food here and suddenly this place pops up. It was a lot better than expected.

I have to say... One of my favorite Korean restuarant here in vegas. I addicted to their seafood pancakes for the spicy tofu soup I always get but everything else on the menu is amazing. Highly recommend! And the macaroon ice cream ! Oh, plus the service is awesome as well!

Pretty great Asian BBQ! Came here on a whim after seeing 900+ reviews - well in accordance with the star rating.

Tons of food. Will definitely recommend!
High quality food and service. Would come back next time I'm in town. Good music with the projector as well. Got full off the meat lovers combo for 3 of us
It's our first time to try this kind of restaurant and we're all satisfied...Food are great.. I recommend this place..
Craving some Korean food and my friend recommended this place.  So glad I came here.  I love macaroons and ice cream and this place offer macaroon ice cream.

Great food and ambiance!! We took a lyft from The Aria to get here and the location is very easy to find although it's away from the strip. Their serving size is big compared to others. It's worth your money. Definitely coming back!

My fiancé and I came here for dinner the night he proposed to me. It was late about midnight and there were only a few other people there. This place is fun and romantic, definitely setting the mood for the amazon night ahead of us.
