We had the premium combo with Kobe beef, need tongue, shrimp rice bumpy bop or something, among other yummy things. This was my first taste of Kobe beef and I certainly fell in love. The meat is fresh and well as the veggies. I love how you can cook your food perfectly the way you want it.

The staff was very friendly and not very invasive. Always refilling our drinks and occasionally checking on us, making sure we were enjoying our experience. 

The price is a little steep, but what do you expect when you order Kobe beef. I would have paid more. I'm sure there are less expensive places in china town but this was close to home. 

Over all we had a very good experience, the food was delicious and the staff was very nice. I will be going back.

The food was good and service was good. Came in a group of four for lunch and ordered tteokbokki, pork belly, kalbi, and beef brisket. The wait for dinner time was very long, which is why we ended up going for lunch instead.

It tastes really good here! Especially pork belly! Everyone must try!
Cannot wait to try other food and desserts next time! I can say this is the best korean bbq restaurant in Vegas!

I've never been to another Asian BBQ place like this, but I don't feel the need to try anywhere else.  The food is awesome, the service is just as good.  I've tried many of the menu items and can't find anything that isn't delicious.  Very satisfied!
Food was very delicious!!! Won't be disappointed...100% satisfied!!! Best Korean Bqq ever!!
Nice atmosphere and the food was very delicious! We got the gangnam set and it was more than enough for two people.

Me and my friend went here and we ordered GangNam grill which is the best seller. 5 different kinds of meat, A LOT of side dishes and appetizers, sooo delicious, little too much for two people but we finish them all anyway. People who work here are nice too, I think I might come back.

Its a value and great deal.  That being said, a foursome (2 couples) with eats and drinks is going to be about $120.  $40 bucks a person, if you want to be like super stuffed.  Otherwise, you can probably get away with $30 a person (tip not included with that price).  Great food, great service, great AYCE Korean BBQ in Vegas.   Been here 2x and still loving it.
A great Japanese/Korean BBQ joint you can find in Las Vegas.  The meat quality, service, dining environment, are all deserve five star!
First time having Korean BBQ and it was a great experience! Came with 8 other people and the service was still great!

Great food. Got the meat lovers platter for 4. 
Lots of food for a great price. 

Highly recommend. Service was prompt. 

Bill definitely visit again when in Vegas

Fantastic lunch! Shared meat lover deal with my girlfriend and we had a badass meal (with filet mignon!) plus a nice leftover meal for later after hittin the tables!

Several servers/busser for help. All friendly and attentive. Will be back next Vegas trip or maybe even again in 2 days on the way out!
Hate to write the review the first time visit but this place is outstanding. Food taste delicious. We love the spicy tofu soup and the bbq is awesome. Waiter are nice.

What can I say, this is the best Korean place I've gone to in LV ever and I've been to almost all of them. What makes this place good is that the service is attentive and the prices are affordable, especially during their happy hours that run from 3-6pm and 10pm-close. The HH is worth going to if you plan on eating a lot and drink alcohol. I don't drink that much alcohol anymore so when I'm in LV you can catch me here beyond HH.

The variety of the food items is pretty stellar also. I'll admit the value isn't as great as some AYCE Korean places like Gen but the quality is good and taste better than what I've had in LV before going here. The atmosphere is pretty cozy also. I like the hugeness of the booths and the quality of the grill that cooks my food. I highly recommend this place if you are looking to eat off the strip or away from Chinatown.

Plus, they give you a free dessert if you write a review of the place. No, I'm not being bought off my rating with a dessert it really is what I think of the place.  It doesn't hurt that they offer this for new reviews of the restaurant though...nice!

Oh my...I started writing in Yelp again for a dessert.

Food is good!excellent service,five stars!. Was here with my friends post basketball. Luckily we made it to the happy hour menu and it was the best. Got the calamari and bulgogi bibimbap. Sooo good.. First time to have that and i think i know what to get everytime i go here.
Amazing food at amazing price.  Great service.  So much better than a casino restaurant !!!
The food was great! Totally worth the trip.

Giving this place 5 stars because of value for your money, especially during HH. If it was more expensive. I'd probably rate it a high 3 or 4. Kobe with uni was not as good as I thought. But for $10, you get what you pay for. 

We ordered a ton of food, 2 bottles of sake, 2 rounds of Japanese beer - all for $100.
Gangnam combo for 4 people plus 1 pitcher of beer =$156. Kinda pricey but good quality meats and plenty of side dishes. Overall, very good and will come back again.
Quality, price, service, everything is really good! Dont compare the meat quality with any other AYCE bbq place. Recommend Gangnam special.
Received great and speedy service here! Food was served quick rather than gyu kaku. Didn't have to wait long for our food to arrive. Also got free desert for rating this place on yelp.

Meh was pretty good, marinated meats are sweet which we liked

You get a free dessert if you rate at the end 

The meals for two are enough for 3 people.

I really liked eating here! The food was really good and plentiful. Only problems I had was the wait time :( We waited for an hour and 40 minutes before finally sitting down and ordering. Otherwise this place is worth it if you have the time :)
Great atmosphere and service. All dishes were premium quality! Will come here every time I'm in Vegas.
Food are very delicious and big portion. Willing to come again...  Recommended for all your BBQ lover..
Great, efficient service and amazing food. We got the Meat Lovers for two, but it was good enough for 3. Filet Mignon was our favorite!
Amazing kbbq. The marinated kalbi is to die for! If you're lazy like me feel free to get them to cook it for you.

I've dined here with friends for dinner a couple times and we all enjoyed our dining experience. Both times, It wasn't too packed so it was a nice, casual atmosphere. The interior was clean and on the hip side perfect for groups. The service is also friendly and attentive.

The menu has a nice variety options and we ordered a bunch to try. From appetizers, drinks and freshly prepared meats and veggies. Everything was tasty and were of good quality, nothing disappointed our taste buds. 

I highly recommend Gangnam if you're in need to try a new spot off-strip. 

*note: If you give a good yelp review on the spot, you'll get a free dessert. It's not something I'm crazy about giving an instant review for, but if you really like dessert, it's there.

We ordered the gangnam family entree and it was very fulfilling for the 4 of us. $120 and it came when 4 meat dishes, dual orders of raw oysters, shishito peppers, fried tofu appetizer, full salad, grilled mushrooms. Meat was very tender and moist. Flavorful, I must say that it was worth the price. Overall would recommend. Happy Hour on the weekends start at 10pm till close. They're usual happy hours start at 8pm. Servers were attentive and always clearing up our plates as we finish up plates.
Awesome portions and very good tasting bibimbap. My second visit and willing to come back again.
Great bulgogi and kalbi. It also has the extra advantage of being a little off the strip and allow for beating the traffic.. free deserts for honest yelp reviews help too :-)

Having come to your place for a long time  and everything is still amazing. The meet is fresh good tasting the sides are amazing I highly recommend a bigger size of the macaroni salad. I always do ask him to bring me some bean sauce and oil with salt just to intensify the flavors. Good choice when my favorite in Vegas

First time dining here thanks to awesome Yelp reviews! Service was amazing and so was the food. My picky 3 years old ate everything I gave her and more. We ordered the Gangnam and everything came out super fast and the meat tasted tender and juicy. Will definitely be back!

This is one of the best Korean BBQ joints in Las Vegas. Quality food. Great services. 10/10

(PS: You also get a free dessert for rating it on Yelp.)
I tried numerous things on the menu and I have several favorites. some are great and some and just okay. Overall, I recommend this place.

Very nice service !!
We had reservation for 6 people and the table was ready when we arrived.
Food is great and very tasty, I would recommend the miso steak.

Really good Japanese/Korean BBQ fusion. The ambiance is nice and clean with a modern edge, well ventilated tables meant my hair didn't smell like smoke after, and servers are pleasant and eager to please.

We did NOT get a combo, but instead ordered a-la-carte, mostly premium meats with a simple bowl of rice, kimchi and pickles. We satisfied our hunger, enjoyed almost every meat dish, and cleansed our pallets with a dessert all for less than the combo price...the difference? We didn't fill-up or waist money on the appetizers (that come with the combos).
Amazing! Everything we had was delicious. Dynamite Shrimp, Steamed Chili Dumplings, Asparagus, House Salad, Korean Prime Kalbi and Bulgogi. All wonderful. Very clean and nicely decorated space.

This place is great!!! Happy hour food is reasonably priced and allows you to try several different menu items!!! I'll definitely be back with more of my friends!!! My server was polite, assisted me with cooking and answered all my questions.
Good BBQ place. Meat is fresh and well marinated. We especially liked the Korean chicken. The kalbi soup is great too.

I'm from Wisconsin and I've never had anything this good!! You guys need to try this place! Their services is also awesome! I love everything we ordered today! I highly recommended this place if you are looking for a place to dine in Vegas!

We arrive about 10-15 minutes before happy hour at 3. Server wasn't to pleasant when we asked about tree happy hour menu.

Atmosphere: Nice ambient place with booths for groups up to 6 and provides plenty of privacy.

Service: Slow and not very observant.

Food: Quality of food was pretty good. Unfortunately they don't give a lot of ban chan after the first round even after asking multiple times. We got the meat lover for 4. Hey a free dessert for making this post.

Would give a better rating if service was better and the person meeting us at the door was nicer. Waited quite a while for the check to arrive and then after paying, still had to wait.
This place was awesome. I wanted to try non-hotel food and found this wonderful place. The food was authentic and great! Lots of choices!
Awesome Korean BBQ place! The Kalbi is delicious as is the bulgogi. The happy hour is really good value for both food and drink.

Traditionally inspired, but modern and clean setting, playing k-pop for ambiance.  The plate portions are a generous quarter-pound, and the variety is great; but best of all was the quality of the meats.  We tried seven or eight different cuts, and they all ranged from good to excellent.  The service was prompt and courteous.  So overall we really liked this place snd will definitely be back.

Oh, and they had macaron ice cream!

We stop by here last July for dinner! We were starving and they sit us promptly. The wait takes a while but it worth it. Service was great! They are friendly and answer whatever question you have. We came back here again after that trip! Even with our flights in two hours!!!!

Came here on a whim because Hard Rock Hotel is under construction.  What a great choice of places to eat!!!  The wife and I with the company of our daughter enjoyed a meat lovers for 2 and it was plenty of food!  I highly recommend this place, the ambiance and food was above par!
This place has one of the flamest happy hours in Vegas. Drinks and food are SUPER cheap with pretty decent quality. Great place to go before a night out.

So good! Ordered the Gangam for 2, and definitely left full! Also had a pitcher of Sapporo which was reasonable and Sake. It doesn't give off a fancy vibe being off the strip but the food is great and you price is reasonable.
Great food and atmosphere few minutes minutes away from the casino restaurants. Totally worth coming! Plenty of food for us three!
Best Korean BBQ in Vegas! If you love meat, get the Meat Lovers and you will be glad you did.

What a great Korean restaurant! They give you a ton of food and it is all delicious. The service was really good, and they were ready to help whether you were a new or experienced Korean food eater. Great place to come in a group, order one of the specials and try a wide range of meats. Also there were some wonderful vegetarian choices even though this place is a meat eaters paradise. 

Quick tip: there is a lot of parking but if you are a Las Vegas visitor without a car there is a hotel very close by where you could pick up a taxi.
Food was good and moderately priced! Would definitely come again! The food was tasty and the general vibe was excellent. The location is great for a late night dinner!

Never was a huge fan of Korean bbq before. Boyfriend was craving - and we're glad we found this place. The portion was more than enough, especially for the price. We had the "Las Vegas" and it definitely could've fed three people. The soju cocktail was refreshing as well. Surprisingly all the meat plates were very tender and also well marinated. Jade took great care of us. Happy bellies.
I try a lot of things： Yummy！ tastes good！Will recommend it to whoever visit Las Vegas!

Super cheap, really tasty, extremely clean KBBQ. I will be coming back, this is a new favorite and is close to home. The other ones in Las Vegas has noticeable crud in places near where you eat. GangNam is CLEAN!
This place is so big and huge!! I love the deco and the menu selection!! Will defiantly bring more friends back!!

This place is my favorite Korean bbq restaurant in Vegas, hands down. I'm local, so I don't always like to eat at the Asian restaurants in China town due to all the unsanitary reports on the news... Eww, Thank god for this place! Delicious food, great service, and inexpensive!!
Very good food.  Good and attentive servers, had plates removed and drinks refilled almost right away.  Would recommend.
So good! Get the bulgogi and spicy pork. Wouldn't recommend getting bibimbap If you get a set meal, it's a little TOO meaty. #meatsweats

I love this place. It's absolutely delicious and we come here quite often. My friends and I always get the bulgogi bibimbap. They are consistently good and have great customer service. My girlfriend absolutely loves this place and it's perfect for date night as well as hanging out with friends. The Korean BBQ is also great and priced fairly. They do not have all you can eat, though, so if that's what you're looking for, this is not the place for you.

Ordered 2 paradise meals for a group of 6 and had plenty for everyone.  Service was excellent.  Food was fantastic, loved everything.  Needless to say looking forward to coming back and would recommend especially if you are staying at Hard Rock.
We came here for a Meat Lover for 4 and left so full! The side dishes are limitless, the food is delicious and the service is excellent!!

Really really good! We got the meat lover for 2 and they lets us share it with our group! That Korean Prime kalbi , filet migon, and flat iron garlic were bomb dot com! We also got the bibimbap and Tofu is a must  try too! Above all the service was the best props to CALVIN! Wish they had a place like this in LA!

What can I say about this place that hasn't already been said? It was amazing and even the Korean BBQ virgins with us were very happy with their meals.

We got there right before 6:30pm and were seated fairly quickly. It's inside a shopping center that is a little difficult to see from the road. They had K pop playing on one of the walls from the projector which is always fun to watch. Service was good and very attentive.

The only thing that sucks is some of the items that usually come as part of the BBQ is charged a la carte here - like the sea salt and sesame oil dip. They charge $1 a pop for it. Not expensive but a little annoying. The drinks here were all really good and SO REFRESHING. I swear, they've made the best lychee martinis I've ever had and I wish I had their recipe. It was that good!

Down to the food - nearly all of it was nothing short of amazing. We ordered the Meat Lover's BBQ for 4 which was $99. Not a bad price for all you get. The meats were all flavorful and marinaded well. The pork belly was the only thing that could have been better - it was not as thick as some of the other places I've been. I also ordered the seafood soft tofu soup which was good but not the greatest. I still enjoyed it. 

I'm in Vegas about once a year and when I come back, I'm definitely going back!

Really delicious food, fun experience. Easy menu, we ordered filet migon and garlic shrimp you get to cook to your liking which is a plus, most restaurants never cook my steak the right way. They give you a bunch of sides which were interesting, my favorite was the fried squid. Chicken fried rice was really good, really big portion good for two people. The sangria was awesome !! If I ever come back to Vegas we would definitely come back. Wish New York had something like this it would do really well!
Really great Korean BBQ!!! All the meat marked by the restaurant are worth to taste! Very delicious!!

Awesome food and service. I would recommend everyone to go here. One of the best Korean BBQ I had in a long time. People are super helpful and friendly. Wife and I will be coming here for dinner when we come to vegas.
Love the food. This place is open late. The payout is very nice. I love the bimbibap.
At my favorite Korean bbq in Vegas.. Great food at great prices. I just wished they had OB wheat beer

Amazing food.  I had a fun time with family and friends for my birthday! 
The service was great and quick.  I recommend it if you would like to try new things.
Delious food and really reasonable price! Recommend the beef and steamed eggs, both my friend and I love this place!
The waiter is super handsome in this place, food is very delicious, place look clean and new, right off the Las Vegas blvd, not expensive at all!!! Will definitely come again!!
great food! nice ambience! and the service is awesome  they seated my party of 18 right away!

Super good!
Pretty damn pricey!
We got the gangnan combo for four, very fulfilling and satisfying!

I wish this flavor in my mouth would never end. After this meal, I'm literally going to spit in a cup to preserve the flavor and then drink it tomorrow just so I can have a taste of this restaurant again.  In fact,  I am going to soak up the meat juices off my plate with a napkin so I can smell it later and reminisce about how great this restaurant is.

I was craving Korean Bbq and decided to go off the strip for once while in Vegas to appease my appetite. I was not disappointed as we ordered their #1 seller - Gangnam for 2.  The highlight of the beef was the kalbi but the rest of the other meats were also favorable.  We definitely full with lots of leftovers for a late night snack later tonight.  We will be back next time we are in town!

Best Korean BBQ in town. Good service. Everything tastes great. Must try beef tongue and pork belly.

Will stop by again!!!
The spicy seafood noodles tastes delicious! The seafood in there is fresh! If it can be a little less sweet, it would be better! Will come back again!
We had the meat lover. It was great! They give you free macaron ice cream. That's honestly why I'm on here
The food was great. Gangnam is Korean Bbq's middle name. The food was amazing. Great food and staff.

If you like grilled meats and seafood, this is the place.  Grilling your own food is a lot of fun especially with a group, and you get to cook it just like you want it.  We got the meat lovers dinner and it was a delicious great value - more food than we could finish.  We'll definitely be back on our next trip to Las Vegas!
Soondubu and meat on point. Portions are kinda small but food was very good. Line and wait times are pretty long, but it was WORTH
The food here is absolutely delicious and the service was amazing. I love the a la carte setting and how you can try a little bit of everything.

It's my first time here on Gangam and my family of four chose the "Gangnam" menu. And it is just amazing. Five types of marinated meat. Different side dishes. It was a fun experience. 

The Miso was a bit salty than expected but other than that, it will definitely fill you to the brim and it's much better than a buffet. I would definitely come back here! The place will not disappoint!!!!

This place is great! We got the meat lover platter for 99$, which came with 5 types of meat that were all well-prepared. The staff was polite and accommodating, and they gave us lots of ban-chan. The location is nice, the inside is cozy, and you get free ice cream if you review.

Delicious food, great pricing. Something about lightly searing delicious meat in bite sized peices to eat at my leisure makes me all warm and fuzzy inside. But on a serious note the gangnam combo is great. :)
Really good food, the portions are big. They have macron ice cream when you first walk in. The staff is very friendly. I would go back when I am in Vegas again.

It started off slow but only improved from there. The food was very good.

We ordered the beef tongue with green onions and were impressed. A good start.

From there we also got harame miso skirt steak, beef and pork toro, more beef tongue and stuff called veggies including the mushroom medley, tofu, kabocha squash and Zucchini.

Everything was good to very good. Hit the spot perfectly!

In exchange for a macaroon, I will give my review. Screw this place. They're so slow. It's been 20 minutes and they haven't taken the check yet. I want to LEAVE. I WANT TO GET OUT OF HERE. HELP ME. GOD DEMMIT LET ME FREE. FINALLY. SHE TOOK THE CHECK. I HAD TO GIVE IT TO HER. WTF. 

This is not all you can eat though. So be prepared. The food was really good.

Friendly and helpful staff and food was all reasonably priced. Came during happy hour so my wife and I ordered a good spread of food. The squid salad was delicious.  First time trying Bulgogi and the marinade was very tasty. The chicken fried rice was well worth it,  and the pieces of chicken were by far the largest I've seen. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good fun meal.

Nice place and food. Ordered meat lover for 2 and 4 more additional dishes for four people. Like the beef tongue, pork belly, and beef toro a lot. Good place for family dinner. Just the waiting time is a little bit too long.

My boyfriend and I came here for the first time and ordered the meat lover for two. Seems a little pricey, but SO WORTH IT! My new favorite kbbq place. Nice atmosphere and great food for a reasonable price. Way better than an all you can eat place!
This place is the bomb! Very good prices and good customer service. Not to mention they have good Thai Tea! Come here and eat if you can!

I was wondering why this restaurant has over 3000+ reviews. Turns out they offer a free macaron ice cream sandwich if you write one. What a brilliant marketing scheme! Every restaurant should implement this Yelp hack. Food-wise their dishes were quite good and varied, independent of the free dessert offering. Came out very fast and efficiently. The uni bib bim bap was quite delicious, but be sure to specify that you do not want them to mix it. Unfortunately they mixed mine before I had a chance to protest but were nice enough to bring me extra uni on the side to compensate.
Awesome meat and veggies and it comes out pretty cheap! The servers are nice happy hour is good, and I'm pretty into the music videos projected on the wall...
Had the Kalbi and bulgogi and it was delicious. Plenty of sides. Great dessert selection. Macaron ice cream, lava cake, and Mochi ice cream.
Just dined here for the first time visiting Vegas based on Yelp reviews. The Harami Miso had amazing flavor! Bulgogi was also on point. Definitely recommend!!!

Great service, great food!  The food can't get better than this. A must eat in Vegas.  Premium meat. Super good.  

The desserts are great too. And you can even get some free!!!  Can't beat that deal.

My boyfriend and I have tried many korean bbq places here in Las Vegas, but none can compare to GangNam. It's quality and clensingness surpasses all other korean bbq restaurants here. Great location and great service. Highly recommended, this is one of our favorites!!!

The food was good. The Kalbi meat was my favorite. I also like the bulgogi cut. The pork belly tasted like bacon. The karage chicken was delicious. The meat portions to grill were small. You did get free Korean side dishes though. We came during happy hour, so some meats were half off. The food came fast and the service was fairly good. Just be prepared to smell like barbecue after you leave. Airing out my coat now.

Went here last night with my husband for dinner since we haven't had Korean BBQ in a few months and we saw this place had some good ratings. 
When we walked in we were greeted and seated immediately by the host/server. He was very polite and, thank goodness, spoke really good English! 
We already looked at some of the stuff on their menu before we got there so we had a pretty good idea of what to order. 
We ordered a few choice of meats: Bulgogi, flat iron garlic, beef toro, Korean prime rib kalbi, and the Harami Miso. The last two I mentioned were definitely a must have and it's also in the top two of their best sellers. The meat was really great quality and flavor was perfect. 
They also had three different meat sauces that they provide which is perfect for the other meats that may not already be seasoned. 
I love the little booths that they had as well. Only thing I probably would improve from this place is to have refillable hot tea and to have the sesame oil with salt side as something already provided for. I've never been to an Asian BBQ place that doesn't already do that so I guess that's why I mentioned that. 
But other than the last two things, the entire place was awesome and highly recommended. I would go back there again with friends for sure!
Cool place, nice food, comfortable environment but not too many people for lunch, and cute Korean waiters speaking Chinese haha.

It was our first time in Vegas, and the food was great! You get to cook the meet on the grill right in front of you, and there's nothing quite like the sizziling of meat to get your appetite started. The drink special are also great. Good food, good drinks, I would definitely come back the next time I visit Vegas!

I love their bulgogi bibimbap and tofu chigae. I have come here for so many times and their service is really good. I also love the other menus they have like their original bibimbap. It's super good. If you want some really good Korean barbecue this is the place!!! Worth every penny.
Great experience. I was expecting buffet but it didn't matter that it's not buffet because the combo meals come w a lot of food. Our whole table was full. Everything was flavorful.

Simply best Korean Bbq in town will come again



And the service is great too


Pork belly is the must have

First Korean dining experience. I had Bulgogi and Gyoza. They give you a lot of sides, but only 4 oz of meat per entrée. The service was not terribly friendly, but the food was good. The water was good. I'm doing this for the free dessert.

After looking at all the good reviews, we finally decided to come to Gungnam Asian BBQ.
The overall environment was great. Service was wonderful.
For appetizer, we ordered chicken karage and tobiko. The spicy mayo with the chicken karage was an amazing combination with lots of flavor. The tobiko was cooked to the right texture.
For our entree, we ordered beef tongue, beef toro, beef Kali, pork belly and mushroom medley. All the meats were really fresh and delicious.
To add a little extra onto your meal, they offer 7 really good side dishes of the day as well.

Food is great. When i visited the place it was busy night at Gangnam restaurant. If you are coming during the dinner time you might want to check the waiting time. Another way to look at it, people really love the food at here. You wont regret it. If this is first time of trying Korean food make sure you ask your server. All the servers were really nice.

The meat lover set is great but the side dish is the best. I really love kimchi. Good korean BBQ in vegas. Very good option out of the strip. Combo for 2 is good for 3. Banana tempura for dessert was my favorite. I would definitely come back.  The service fast and the staff is very nice.
First time at Korean bbq and it was great. Good range of meats to choose from. My favorite was the beef bulgogi. Very helpful staff too.

We ordered the kalbi, bulgogi, and naeng myun. The meat was marinated well and the side dishes were also tasty. The naeng Myung was cold as it should be but lacked flavor so I ended up added some spices from the side dishes.

Can to this Restaurant with my sisters after looking on Yelp to find a place to eat. It is everything the reviewers wrote plus more. We had the Meat Lovers Special and All Meat was delicious with any of the sauces. The filet was THE BEST meat I've probably ever eaten anywhere. The texture was like biting into a marshmallow, really, I'm not even kidding!!! I usually like to review later but they give you a free dessert if you review now...

Top notch ingredients, sauces, and marinades. Hip place with a projector playing music videos and a cool vibe. What's crazy is that it is actually a great value too, not including extra cheapness on the happy hour menu. Check it out!
The service was great and the food was incredible! Our favorite was the filet mignon and the Galbi and they were both very tender and flavorful :)

Clean and chic Korean restaurant! Came here for lunch on a Friday.  This place serves quality meat you can taste. Service is very quick and friendly. The side dishes are all tasty. There are korean music videos playing inside, keeping patrons entertained and in the korean mood. The spicy tuna kim bap was the surprise of the meal - very tasty. The Kimbap  was fried with marinated spicy tuna in a bowl. Korean prime kalbi was excellent as well!

The only caution would be the meat portions are VERY small. For example, the prime galbi only comes out to be like 4 or 5 tiny pieces....bulgogi portion was also very small...I killed it in literally two bites.....if you want to get more meat, stick with samgyupsal because it looked like they give you more portion for pork meats.

Also, for limited time only, if you write a yelp review and show it to them, they will give you a free dessert! We got the fried banana tampura with green tea ice cream..it was really good!!

We sat down and then didnt see a server for 30 min. If we werent so hungry we would have leave left. We put in the whole order as soon as he came over... He then had to be reminded to bring out each individual item, He was so busy Drinking sake with the cute 21 year olds at the other table. Then when we asked to split the check he just charged one person double and not the other... *FacePalm*  The Food was ok. The music was very offensive rap music (I wouldnt mind in a club) Dont bring your children here.
This is the best Korean bbq place in Vegas. I come here twice and will come again. Delicious food, good service, clean space.

Excellent food, creative presentations and combinations and good for dates and families.  

Great photographic menu provides generous combination meals for two to six people and a la carte choices.  Very high food quality all around (meats, seafood and vegetables). Lots of variety for any palate.  

First day serving mul nang myun (cold soup with buckwheat noodles).  Absolutely fantastic and I eat it everywhere Korean I dine (which is often).  

Definitely recommend.

First time here and everything we ordered tasted good. Service was excellent too. Only 4 stars because I need to come back and order other stuff to check lol

Kalbi prime beef
Kobe beef
Kim chi fried rice
Spicy tuna
Seaweed salad
Fried dumplings
Fried calamari

Don't forget to rate them guys! They give free dessert!

I came here with two friends and we were starving. We saw that they had Kobe beef from the window menu and was excited to order that. We went for the Premium Cut package (which included the Kobe beef) but we also tagged on another extra order. 

The Premium Cut package features a lot of great dishes such as fresh shucked oysters, beef carpaccio in ponzu sauce, oven baked asparagus, and my personal favorite was the grilled shrimp fried rice in the clay pot (forgot the Korean name). The rice was so good that we ordered another one to share. 

The Kobe beef was pricey but well worth it - it practically melted in your mouth when cooked to a medium rare. 

The three dipping sauces they give you are nice (one was chili based, another had sesame oil and one was ponzu?) and complemented all the beef cuts really well. Overall it was an amazing BBQ from start to finish. Service was friendly and I will come here again when I'm in town.

PS: The reason why they have so many reviews is because you get a free dessert when you show them your Yelp review - however, I found the dessert to be below average (they are ice cream macarons and looked better than they taste) but that doesn't change how I feel about the awesome BBQ. Skip the dessert :)
Came in with the hubby for sown Korean food... So good!! Great service and meat quality! Gotta come try this place!
Great place during happy hour!! Loved the $4 Bulgogi :D so nice with some rice! Pretty cheap with happy hour when wanting that late night dinner!! Recommend!

First time eating asian bbq. I loved the presentation. All the proteins were served raw and there is a grill in the center of the table. This allowed me to undercook my meat while my friend charred hers to a crisp, we were able to enjoy our food at our own pace without having to wait for the longer cook time for her food.
Legit Korean BBQ. Came here for happy hour although the meat off the regular menu was way better!

One of the bet Korean food places around, my gf and I ate here and prefer coming here instead of Tofu Hut or Honey Pig... Food quality is great and the atmosphere is amazing... The servers are very attentive and made sure everything was going well. Highly recommend giving this place a try, and enjoy yourself...
I came here with my family and the food was great. Very tasty barbecue and fresh ingredients. We benefited from the happy hour so the price was also great.

Incredible...got the gagnam for two people. This included an insane amount of incredible food. The meats are cut perfectly and in a way that people afraid of grilling wont mess it up. All of the sides are awesome and the bibimbop is great. The value and quality of this plsce are some of the best in Vegas.

As my friend and I were new to Asian BBQ, this was an amazing first experience! All of the employees were very kind and helpful and The food was delicious! -Friend here! I loved this place. The food, the atmosphere, and the staff was fantastic. Please make this place a stop on your next Las Vegas adventure!

Delicious Korean BBQ!!! 

The Gangnam set for four was perfect for 5 people. This place did not disappoint at all. The meat was super tender and nicely marinated. The service was great and super  quick. I highly recommend this place.

If you come with a big group make sure to call in advance.
Best Korean barbecue place in Vegas! Bulgogi beef is a must to order, pork belly and Korean chicken cheese fondue is my next best favorite!

Food was okay.  It needed little more seasoning.  We got pork belly and it was thin. Nangmyun and soft tofu soup was good. Here you cook your own meat. Service was good and deco was good. I would still go back if I'm in town. But if I want some good korean, this wouldn't be my first choice.
very yummy！so close to our hotel！I will recommend the gangnam bbq set！I feel i really like the asian food～and here can satisfy me
This was my first visit to Las Vegas and first meal at a restuarant and thid place exerted our expectations. I love korean bbq but this was definitely the best one I've ever had.
Good meat. Long queue. Free dessert. Generallyvgood although we took a long walk here.
Excellent food and service. They use high quality meat and complinentary side dishes are delicious. Two thumbs up!

We decided to try Gangnam for the first time, and we are not disappointed. We ordered the Vegas grill and it's a good assortment of yummy food, very fast service! Staff friendly, and always on the go. Will definitely come back

First time here tonight and seriously feel like I died and went to heaven. Super chill, hip environment! The food is delicious and big portions, plus it is interactive over the grill so it's fun as well. Definitely will be back!

3.5 Stars

Came for the late night happy hour, table for two.

Banchan - fish cake, mac salad, cabbage kimchi, dried squid, bean sprouts, pickled radish/onion, and cucumbers. They were ok, I just wish some were a little spicier.

We had two orders of beef toro and pork belly, one order of bulgogi and spicy pork, and two orders of white rice. 

While the meats weren't the highest quality, they were still pretty good and an awesome value for the happy hour prices. Our bill was $29.10; we left feeling pleasantly full and not AYCE overly stuffed. 

You get a free macaron ice cream sandwich if you post a review while at the restaurant, which I think explains the copious 5 star ratings.
Worst service ever... Came with a party of seven and didn't check up on us at all! Didn't even give us our complimentary kimchi!!! I would never go there again....

I came to Gangnam during happy hour and ordered a la carte. At first I thought I was kinda sucky that this was a Korean BBQ place that wasn't AYCE and I thought our bill was gonna end up being really pricey for all the things we ordered (spicy seafood soup w/ tofu, cream cheese wontons, salmon carpaccio, toro beef, and pork belly), and I also thought that I wouldn't leave feeling full. 

But I was SO wrong. The quality of the meat blows Tofu Hut, Sura, and all those other KBBQ joints out of the water. Yeah, it's a bit pricier, but the quality definitely makes it worth it. 

The soup was delicious. It came with rice on the side, which I used to eat my meat with. THAT SALMON CARPACCIO THOUGH!! That was probably my favorite thing we ordered that night. I highly recommend giving it a try. Even the cream cheese wontons were really good!

The layout and decor of the restaurant has a modern feel to it. They have big booths along the side walls and tables in the middle. They also play American and Korean music videos on the wall. 

Not to mention the service/servers are beyond excellent. My waitress was attentive, informative, and very friendly.

Still a five star review, but as others have pointed out, they changed their menu slightly from what is pictured here. The platter I got the last time (and again tonight) is called the Gangnam.  Again, they were willing to substitute the appetizer; we traded the oysters for fried calamari. Ordered 4 extra items: two meats, the beef and enoki,  and the mushroom plate and easily fed three people. My boyfriend, and now our friend, is still raving about the bulgogi bibim bap.

Came with wife based an the Yelp reviews and..we are Asian. But, kidding aside, I've had my share of Korean and Japanese BBQ and this is place is really good. Be sure to make a reservation or you will be left waiting. I also suggest ordering ala carte. You can the cuts of meat you want without the filler stuff (salad, soup, dumplings) after all it's all about the meat. Everything we got was great, but standouts included marinated kalbi, pork belly, beef toro and mushroom medley. I would skip the flat iron garlic and go for the kalbis. We were stuffed for 25/person. Convenient location about a mile off the strip. Highly recommended!

When looking for a very well deserved alternative to the wondrous world of ayce joints in Vegas, we opted to try this highly rated and mega reviewed spot.

And guess what?
it was hella good.

Not that you really had to guess since my four star rating clearly indicates I liked it.
Oh Dan B, your redundancies grow more and more with each passing day.
Anyways.

First of all, what looks to be a fairly standard strip mall restaurant from the outside takes on a very unexpected turn once you step inside and behold a very sleek, modern, and spacious layout.  What really got my attention was the absence of the billowing smoke wafting around tables when people are grilling - it's something I both fondly and annoyingly associate with most Asian BBQ places.

The staff was super attentive from the get go and really helpful when it came to best deciphering which combination of set menus and a la cart items would yield the best sampling of what Gangnam had to offer.

And I have to tell you the selection, quality, and flavor of the meats we grilled were impressive: tender, well seasoned, and fresh.  The servings aren't necessarily huge, but it needn't be when it's that good and so reasonably priced that ordering extra isn't too exorbitant.

Overall, Gangnam has to be one of the best BBQ experiences I've had in awhile: great food and drink, stylish decor, and somewhere my little one would enjoy going. It's also helps reminds me how nice / necessary it is to take a break from buffets every once in awhile.
Food was delicious, amazing!!. Service was friendly and prompt!! Ate so much I can't breathe!! Lol!

I'm visiting my family at the moment, and I thought this would be a great place for my siblings and I to meet since they have tables big enough to seat 10 people. There are so many good reviews on this place that I expected it to blow me away. 

At first glance, the place is very nice, clean, and neat. The table we were seated at was huge with 2 large stove tops. There were so many sides laid out around the stove tops, but I only liked the fish cake, kimchee, and macaroni salad. The rest were pretty bland. 

We ordered 2 Meat Lovers and 2 Las Vegas to share amongst all of us. I honestly thought there would be more of the specialty meats, but there was just enough for all of us to have a little of everything. The meats were not very flavorful so I didn't actually get the names of them except for the Bulgogi which was excellent. 

The servers were okay. Not very attentive. The ambiance of the place was great. Very nice to talk and catchup with my brothers and sisters. Overall, the place itself was awesome, but the food and service were mediocre. Unfortunately, I will not be going back.
Awesome service,  staff, and food. Make you sure you check it out when you are in vegas because it's hidden. The prices are very reasonable and the food tastes good
Came here because the reviews were all good & they were right! My 2nd time going in the same week, not disappointed at all!

I visited this place because the review was quite good.
Yes, as other people mentioned, quite nice plce for casual dinner.
We ordered #1 appitizer Kobe Ssam.
For 2pieces are expensive than others.
But most of this kind of place is like this.
Not bad.

Steaned egg is quite nice.
Quite clean and new. 
Staffs are nice. 
But a bit noisy.
Love this place!  It's a great value and it doesnt compromise on taste.  I've never had something bad here.  You should definitely try it.

The food here is absolutely delicious! Fun to come with friends and grill meats at your table.  I could literally sit here all day and eat this amazing food. I was shocked at how inexpensive everything was. Such a great value for everything you get! The service was great too. Definitely coming back when I visit Vegas again!

Second time visiting, another wonderful experience! The preselected menus for 2 or 4 people is almost too much food, but nice to have a variety. Good option for your first visit. Recommend ordering individual dishes and order more if needed. Bulgogi bibimbop rice dish is a MUST! Let it get crispy before digging in. The harami miso is also to die for! It's worth the walk from the strip! Come during off hours for no wait (we came at 4pm).
Professional staff and great food, at affordable price.  Be prepared to be stuffed - the portion sizing is big+...

Let's be honest here. How many of you gave a 5 star to get free desert?
Sure it's not the worst, I think it's fair to say 3 star in term of food. However in term of service I gave it a zero if I could.
1. Ultra long wait, not because it's crowed. it's just because the people there are not prepare to serve people.
2. The server pretend not to see you raise your hand, even though you do it right in front of her.
3. Talk about happy face, these people look grumpy.
4. I did notice some table get serve better than other.
5. food arrival after order = 1hr. eek!

PS. It should be illegal to bribe people for good review.
Good meat quality, reasonable prices. Plates are small, two people will spend over $50 easily. Side dishes can use more variety and better flavor.

Good price but some of the food was so so. I sampled a friends bbibimbap (sp?) and enjoyed that the most. The marinated prime rib was good as well. Beef tongue was not as enjoyable and the quality was not as good.
Service and food was fantastic!!!! Good quality meat and sides. Not all bbq places use good meat bit gangnam is top notch!
Gangnam set meal is great! Get the bulgogi bibimbap. Avoid the steamed egg.  Solid Korean BBQ close to the strip.
Sever Back is a great sever. I loved foods and the service. I think this place is one of best restaurant in las vegas
Pretty place & yummy food!    Doesn't look like much on the outside but opens up when you go inside.  Very nice environment!

What a fun spot to have a dinner! 

It's a grill it yourself type of meal where you cgoose types of meats, veggies and sides and you cook it yourself at the table with a grill in the middle. 

They also have some noodle plates and soups, so everyone can find something!

Affordable and fun!
Great atmosphere, service and food!! All of the meat cuts are fresh and delicious! The banana tempura is amazing! Will definitely come back!!
Good Korean BBQ ever! Had Gangnam set and every thing was so good. The meat was perfectly tender, friendly staffs as well. Highly recommended!

A solid Korean BBQ near the Vegas Strip

TIP: In case you want 1 free dessert during your visit, you have to show a posted Yelp review to your server! Just SHOW it!

Location (4/5): The restaurant locates in a corner of a big plaza. Watch out for the big Gangnam sign! From the outside, the restaurant looks pretty dark but it becomes divey when you walk inside.

Services (5/5): We came at 7pm in a party of 7 and quickly get situated! Our server was very friendly. She was also quick at prepping for our BBQ and bringing out side dishes! Since we came in a large group, they also helped us to calculate 18% gratitude fee in the bill. 

Food (4/5): You have the choices of ordering individual dishes or order a set such as Las Vegas, Meat Lover, Gangnam (#1 bestseller) and Premium (best cuts). All sets come available for 2, 4 or 6 people with different prices. We ordered Meat Lover for 4 people for a party of 6 adults and 1 child. The portions were huge! It also came with complimentary side dishes, miso soups, rice bowls, salads and dumplings. It was more than enough for us! We also ordered the Kobe Beef Carpaccio ($9.95) and Salmon Carpaccio ($7.95). The Kobe beef was literally melting in my mouth! Soooooo sofffttt! The salmon, on the other hand, added a hint of freshness in a jungle of grilled meat! For dessert, we shared a vanilla macaron ice cream from Brick's! They have the macaron ice cream fridge right at the door, so give it a try if you need a togo dessert!  

I will definitely come back for more :)
This place is amazing omg yummmmy. You definitely need the here it's very affordable All I  can say is yummmmy

Great Korean BBQ place located in a small strip mall right across from the Hard Rock Hotel.
There's some parking out front but plenty of spots towards the back.
I was there on a Sunday night for dinner and it was pretty busy. I opted for a seat at the bar to skip the wait. The only difference sitting there is the food is cooked for you and bought out to you instead of cooking it at the table. 
They had some combos for parties of two, four or six. You can also order individual plates. I think you have to order at least two to get the free sides. 
I ended up trying the Bulgolbi, spicy pork and the sweet corn. All three were good. The pork was a little sweet but it was good. 
The sides were Kim chi, spicy bean sprouts, spicy cucumbers, and three others that I forgot but all were good. A very filling meal. 
Service was excellent even though it was busy. I'll definitely be back.

Good. Affordable. Tasty especially top three juicy plates. My favorite was korean kalbi bbq tapas.side dishes were also delicious. 

Tapas are servers as quarter pound and each of those were very delicious.

The food was excellent and the service very professional. The happy hour menu is full of great deals on both meat and appetizers, and that's when we came and were able to keep our bill down to a reasonable level. The bulgogi was definitely the tastiest of the 3 meats we tried. The atmosphere is excellent as well, clean and modern. Absolutely come here for Korean BBQ.

We've always been looking for a good Korean restaurant, and finally found one of the best Korean dining restaurant. Very delicious food, pleasant server and nice ambiance. Would really recommend this place to my family and friends.

This was my first time being at Gangnam. Had an awesome dinner with good company! Our host, Song, was very attentive to our party and extremely friendly. He came by often to help us cook our meat and made sure it didn't burn. I have to say considering the amount of food we ate, the meal was reasonably priced compared to other restaurants. We came during happy hour and ordered a la carte. We were given ban chan for ordering enough BBQ dishes - which were just okay; however, the BBQ and the rest of the tapas/appetizers were good quality and filling. Overall great dinner :)

By far the best korean/japanese bbq yakiniku place ive been at. We ordered the prime kalbi the korean kalbi. They were so juicy and u can tell the quality of the meat is superb! We also had the toro pork cheeks and that was heavenly as well as the pork belly! The side dishes were pretty good as well like the sweet and spicy squid and mac salad also the kimchi was bomb! Will definitely come back here again and again.  Only thing is they may need more servers specially when it gets busy.

Recommendation for meat lover or not! You will love this place. I came from Chicago for a 4 days stay in Vegas. Tried a lot Korean BBQ there. But I love this place even better. This is already the second time I having diner here. 

Pork belly, Kobe style beef, spicy calamari, enoki with bacon, etc are the favorite dishes! BTW, if you still have some space after, don't forget the macaron ice cream!
Came here for lunch from neoncon, it was amazing. Great amount of food for the price and everything was nicely seasoned so had a great taste
second time here. fresh food you can grill yourself.  It's entertaining and delicious!!! The prices are good too.  Free dessert with review on yelp!
Nice ambiance, friendly and efficient service and tasty food! And close to the strip :)
Fresh and traditional ingredients with excellent service.  Great experience!!!  Great place to visit when in town.
Great place. Great atmosphere Great food. I would definitely come again. I enjoy the marinated short ribs the best.
Wonderful food, great service, and great drinks. If you are craving Korean bbq in Vegas, this is def the place to be.

I love this place! It is absolutely delicious and you get so much food. The meat lovers for 4 can really feed about 5 people. Everything from the miso soup to the seaweed salad was amazing! When you check in you get a free macaron ice cream that's super yummy. Our server was friendly as well.

Great find! Place is super clean, decor is modern and atmosphere was really good. The ribeye, kobe and chicken  were delicious. Bonus for us was when the waiter told us the chicken was organic!  My 10 yr old loves to grill at the table so we frequent gyo-kaku grill at home BUT this place has better food and prices.
I went to this place after a convention to get off the strip.  Made it right on time for happy hour half price drinks and deals on bbq and appetizers.  Excellent!!!!

Never have I been so satisfied with Korean BBQ for so little. My boyfriend and I are visiting from Calgary, AB and we've just had the most wonderful experience ordering off of the happy hour menu. Our server was so friendly and just the right amount of attention. 

Shout out to the person who creates the video playlist as it's super awesome and spans the usual top 40s, KPOP, JPOP, and my fav Boi Drake. 

If you're feeling the late night munchies, Gangnam'a 10-close happy hour's your best bet. 5 stars.
Must come and check out its delicious!!! If it's your first time or even second time to Vegas you must come before you leave and get some Korean BBQ!!
food and service is great!  we ordered bibimbap and that was delicious.  we also ordered the beef brisket, chicken and bolgogi and all were great!
Food here is great.  It's hard to find good Korean BBQ  places in Las Vegas.  Definitely must try

This place is pretty good. We got the meat lovers and split it three ways and it was just the right amount of food. (We did order extra beef brisket, though.) 

All of the cuts of meat were excellent, the side salad that came was the best side salad I have ever seen at a kbbq restaurant before, and the grill we had was perfect. (Usually you come across bad cold or hot spots on grills, but theirs was great.)

The only thing I didn't care for was the speed of service. Took a while to get our food, and desert took a long time. Service with expeditiousness aside was fine. Hostess and servers were very nice.

Would I recommend this place to others? Yes.
Would I come back here myself? Yes.
Food was great and service was timely and polite. I got the meat lover combo for 2. Prices were very very fair. The happy hour is very cheap and worth checking out.

First time having kbbq in the Vegas area! Definitely impressed by the quality of the meat but ESPECIALLY the seasonings. We ordered the meat lovers special for our party of 3. Even though the special was meant for 2 people, we were all content with the serving sizes.

The price is reasonable for the amount of meat they gave us. The service was exceptional as well, the female worker was very nice and friendly.

Would recommend to all friends who are in Vegas and who need their kbbq fix.
Very substantial meals and affordable being right by the strip. Delicious, good service!

Sooooo good. The Gangum for two is enough to easily fill three. Excellent variety on their combos. We were in-town and in the mood for shabu/hot pot, but this blew away our other options.

Just do it!

We ordered the Korean Prime Kalbi which was my favorite, because it had a lot of flavor. The Salmon with bacon and premium tongue which were equally as good. Then for vegetables we got the broccoli fondue and cheese which was pretty yummy. I would recommend this place.
This place was exactly what we needed. Amazing food. Awesome atmosphere. We had great service and this really started our night off right. I will definitely be coming back.
I was visiting Las Vegas for my thanksgivings break. For me, I am big fun of Korean Bbq.  GangNam is a really nice traditional restaurant in Las Vegas. You definitely need to try it.

The service was fast and I had not one complaint about any of the food.

My friend that I was with is usually particularly picky about chicken and had no complaints. He ended up ordering four portions of it.

Being a vegetarian obviously my options are limited but everything else about the restaurant was right on point to me.

For omnivores this is a must visit spot for 2-4 people to fill their stomachs!

This place has a nice modern ambience.  They have music videos playing on a giant screen, but not to loudly, to give a slight party feel without intruding into your dinner conversation. 

 The menu is a la carte but the food quality is extraordinary. I've been to many KBBQs in Vegas, and this is by far my favorite. I've been here maybe 4-5 times. 

Their spicy tuna appetizer is really good. The beef carpaccio is average, I ordered it once and never again. 

The skirt steak, galbi, toro, bulgogi and filet are all excellent. Their beef tongue is the best in Vegas. The chicken here is okay, but I always get the chicken cheese fondue because I love cheese.

Overall, a great ambience, location, never any wait and great food quality. I will be back!

I'm here because there's 4 stars over 2000ish review.  I didn't get disappointed. Food was delicious and they've got some creative dishes that I haven't had on other Korean BBQ place. and I think service is attentive as there aren't many people here on a Sunday lunch hour. Although I'm a visitor Vegas , I think I will return when I'm in Vegas in again. The only thing Is the chairs are uncomfortable.  They need to put some cushions to support the back. Hope management can pay attention to this detail.
Great food! Excellent customer service! Brought some friends here from new york and got the meat livers for 4 perople.. it was more than enough! We're all so full and there's still food to spare
This is a beautiful place to enjoy the best tofu house in Las Vegas. I confused about choosing a Korean food and GangNam is the best Korean in town.

Exceptional service and food!!! Will definitely come back when I am in Vegas again!! Went to happy hour 3-6PM. All the meat tasted great, seaweed salad was yummy( with ponzu), the kimchee jigae was "OK" only... Oysters were delicious!!!! KOBE SSAM was awesome!!!!! Uni and Kobe are both nice combos. Much much love to this place!! Definitely recommend.

Went here around 4:30pm for happy hour and waited over an hour for a table of 4, but so worth it.  We've tried a few Korean places, so far this was the best Korean place.  Reasonable priced.  The services are friendly and nice.  Overall, we all had a good time and definitely recommend to friends and family.
The food here was amazing! The waiter was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this spot!
This place is awesome , the food here are great , I tried their premium combo and it's more than enough for two people to eat . The service here is great too . I would highly recommend this place
Cook-it-yourself concept. Japanese tapas. Generous free appetizers. Great menu. Top 3: bulgogi, kabocha squash tempura, and cream cheese wonton.

This is our first time visiting the restaurant and we absolutely love it! We ordered the Premium package and ordered an extra plate of beef tongue and pork belly to go with it. The menu is easy to read and has pitcures for you to see what each item is (good for first timers). The food presentation was very nice and fresh. 

The staff is very welcoming and polite. They were prompt with getting our food out. We loved that they didnt hover over us. They gave us space and let us cook the meat at our own pace (unlike other korean restaurants where they just dump all the meat on the grill and start cooking anything and everything for you whether you're ready for it or not). 

The restaurant also has a nice and clean dining atmosphere. We came here around 2pm on Friday and not many people we eating here. We will probably come here every time we visit Vegas (we are from TX). 

We recommend anyone who loves korean bbq to come out and try this place when you're in Las Vegas! You will not be disappointed :)

Came here during happy hour and it's incredible value! Had the spicy chicken, pork belly, duck breast and mushroom medley and the quality of the meat was fantastic! The price during happy hour is a can't miss!

Update! Came here again 2/15/16 and the happy hour can't be beat! My wife and I both ate for $17! Beef, pork, onions, corn and mushrooms! Outstanding value! 

Another update! Here on 3/15 and still love this place! The happy hour is just such an amazing deal with all the beef selections at $4
Staff is great and attentive! 5 stars!!

Really great place! I was super hungry and they were quick to seat me and my party. Really friendly staff and fast service with food too! The meats were really fresh and tasty  I would come again for sure next time! But with more people :D
We ordered the Meat Lovers platter, and it was more than enough food for our party of 5. Portions were more than generous. The seafood soup it came with was a hit as well. Service was excellent!
Great atmosphere and delicious food. Our kids loved grilling their own food! Definetly will come back again!

In the mood to try something different. We usually go to the ayce Korean places in Chinatown but come across this joint at yelp. Fast service and place not too busy, we got lucky, it's Happy Hour too. Half off drinks! Everything is delicious, great portion. Will definitely come back
clean atmosphere and friendly staffs. a bit pricey for the portion sizes but the meats were good.
This restaurant was delicious, amazing Korean BBQ! It definitely hit the spot, it was a very clean restaurant and nice staff.

Great spot! Of everything we bbqed, I liked the bulgogi the best. Great selection of delicious meat and seafood to grill. It was also nice to wander away from the Strip for a break from bright flashing lights. The free dessert for posting this review was delicious- macaroon ice cream sandwich! And the 5 stars are genuine.
Really good variety and the meats were excellent quality.  The yuzu drink is highly recommended.

Wow. Absolutely amazing. We travel often and have never had such a perfect meal of authentic Korean BBQ. The flavors were all bold and fantastic, service was exceptional. I can wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas.

12/20/2015 Update: just came back tonight and got the Gangnam Menu for 4 persons. Well worth the money, lots of food that came out fast. 


Best Korean BBQ! Love the harami miso beef, the beef carpaccio and spicy tuna kimpbap. Excellent service.

Seaweed salad was amazing along with the cuts of meat. Lovely find.

We ordered the meat lovers for 2 and needless to say, we're stuffed. I can just rollover and sleep happily.
The meat is super tender!  Wow! So close to UNLV and definitely awesome place to go after a test!

Now one of my favorite places in Vegas! Authentic, fun. The food was perfect. The service was more than excellent. And the atmosphere in there was very nice. I love the k-pop videos going into the background, the striking colors. I had a Somek to drink, ask for that it's fun and tasty. We also had the Yuzu, which was excellent. Then we had Kobe beef, Japanese peppers (shishito), asparagus, cheese fondue chicken, and a variety of other things. It was tasty and filling!

Best KBBQ in town, I'm always so stuffed when I leave. Cow tongue, Bulgolgi, Kalbi...all SO delicious. Great prices and love the amazing service. Always so friendly and swift service.
Recommended!
Great service. Good food. Don't get me wrong, 4 or 5 stars would probably be a stretch for this place if it was in New York, but it deserves at least 4 stars in Vegas.
this is the best korean restaurant in town....must try. They have delicious food, desserts, service and venue is fantastic...will take family here every week.
Great service and great umbiance. I come here every time im in Vegas. If you come by try the Bulgogi if magnificent.

Super delicious and affordable! I will definitely come back when I'm in Vegas. The only problem we had was that they forgot to bring out the side dishes and that they took forever to give us their check.
Just dined here for the first time. The food was very fresh and the experience was awesome. The garlic shrimp, marinated short ribs, and fried rice was so delicious.

Great Asian restaurant, I recommend strongly recommended it!
Love the kimchi and the meat!
It is really delicious!! This place is the best Korean BBQ in Vegas!! I visited several restaurants in this area but here is the place that I want!!
I wish this place was back home in Austin, TX! Best food and service by Back and Jin!! We will be "Back" ;) GET THE BULGOGI!!!!!!!

After 100 minutes of wait, we finally got a table. Went for the #1 Gangnam beef dinner for 4 ppl, cuz we were starving. Food is very good. Meat is a surefire 5 stars. All the side dishes are good and full of flavor.  Service is good, but our server was so busy to the point of forgetfulness(but he was definitely cute), therefore, four stars for that. My biggest complaint would be the cold draft being let in constantly by the opening and closing door as our table was close to the door.  My kids will beg to come back here, so yes for another successful find on Yelp! Now I can enjoy my free dessert for posting a review

We saw it on Yelp while we're visiting Las Vegas. They have great review. We ordered Meat Lover meal combo. The portion is great and I taste amazing. The only issue we had is long waiting time but it's all worth it.
If you like KBBQ don't miss out food and service is excellent and it's not to far from the strip.  Better go in hungry cause when you leave it's bound to be a food coma cause you ate to much.
Very nice and clean place. The service is awesome and the food tastes delicious! There are various items on the menu for anyone to choose, even the picky eaters. Definitely coming back!
This restaurant is the best. It has good price, food, and has good prices. I love the BBQ food. I recommend to anybody that like chicken, pork, and lamb.

Yummmmmy!!!! Lots of delicious fresh Japanese/Korean food!! And great service. You get A LOT of food when you order they give you lots of side dishes so you will definitely leave here happy and full :)
Best bbq in town!! Definitely order the prime rib! Tofu soup is also good, sides are delicious too!! Yummy
Good food, quality meats. It would be awesome if they had all you can eat KBBQ because we don't really have that in the Las Vegas Valley.

Great food, nice service. 
Awesome happy hour.  Get try the Korean prime Kalbi! So good!!!!!!!!!'
Food was good the atmosphere is nice, service is ok. The steamed egg was over cooked #steamedbun. The meat was good but the portions were really small.
fantAstic experience. Meats are very juicy and the service is great. Beef tongue is a must try, extremely tender and in good size.

Awesome food. 
Great service. 
The harami miso, Korean chicken and pork belly are my favorites.
Always great food and the staff is amazing! Every time we have friends or family in town we always make it a point to bring them here.
The side dishes arent exactly traditional korean but the meat is decent. They charge for lettuce wraps and korean sauces which all come with a meal at all Korean bbq places.
This is the second Korean bbq restaurant that we've been too and this one by far is one of the best ones here in Las Vegas! Portions are just right it even made my husband full!

This was my first Asian BBQ experience and what a great introduction. We ordered the pork belly, Korean Prime Kalbi, Korean chicken cheese fondue, vegetarian dumplings. Most everything was very tasty and overall a fun experience! Happy hour from 10-close was a nice surprise too.

Definitely one of the best kbbqs I've ever been to! From the food up to the service, everything was excellent. Not AYCE tho but their menu offers a plethora of choices that definitely fulfills any craving haha.
Greeeeat food! Quality meats! A bit pricy but well worth it. Come with big groups to get more bang for your bucks!

The food was amazing. We had a lot of food.
(All the meals come with side dishes at least 8 of them)
This is what we had.
2/ pork belly 
1/ beef Toro 
1/ cabbage
1/ mixed tempura
2/ rice
1/ squash
Our drinks where
1/ orange soju
1/ sprite 
1/water 
1/ ginger ale
All of this was $57.98. I'll get a meal set next time.
Great place for Korean BBQ. Everything tasted good. The service was a little slow initially.
Great place love the food. Be back on Friday. I suggest the meat lovers and the spicy tuna Kimbap.

We are on a west coast road trip and discovered this place via Yelp! Totally worth the wait! We did the #1 Gangnam for 2, the food was amazing! On top of all that, the staff are super friendly! I will definitely come back!
Would definitely come back.. Meat was marinated very well and meat was so juicy and melts in mouth

This place is awesome...we ordered the korean prime kalbi..pork toro and beef toro..they are all good and we ordered spicy pork also good..and finally we ordered fried dumpling...I think this korean restaurant is the best in the city..
Great design and menu. The only negative point is sweetness of the meats, they r mostly marinated in sweet marina sauce. Too much sweetness!
Great service and close to the strip. Crowded is good sign with minimal wait! Great time with kids.
Awesome food with big portions! Loved the white peach sake.. Pleasant atmosphere and great, attentive service..
Long wait of 90 min on Thanksgiving night!  Good food that is well seasoned!  Don't miss it!
Great food for good price ! Spicy pork was good and they didn't joke about the spice.

Great deal for Happy Hour ! Discounted prices for appetizers and meats. Its like $3 for an order of pork belly or beef toro (brisket). 

Came here for "dinner" before an event i had to go to, with a friend. She had been here before and was on the way, so had me order (before it hit the end of Happy Hour time). She liked the Pork Belly and Pork Toro. 

Service by this young korean waitress was superb. Very friendly and funny. 

We had ordered 3 pork belly, 1 pork toro, 2 toro beef, and 1 prime kalbi. 

The pork toro (pork cheek) isn't discounted. - $5.95 - As the "toro" name suggests, it is highly marbleized with some thick areas of fat on the edges. This isn't the first time i've had pork cheek (similar to pork neck meat as well). When cooked properly, and a good quality meat, it should have a super tender texture, and "crispy". Not like a hard crispy but like crisp to bite through. I cooked it in a way where it seared the fat giving it a nice crisp in the fat. The pork toro is NOT marinated or seasoned in any way. Quality, to me, seems not up to what i had imagined. Overall still not bad, but could be better. But pork cheek/neck meat is quite expensive. somewhere along $10-15/lb, wholesale. X_x 

Prime kalbi - $8.45 - quality wise, wasnt that good either. For them to put the "prime" name, id expect a high quality cut of meat, flavorful and tender. Not to the point of aged meats, but you know what i mean. The prime kalbi is seasoned with some slight marinade topped with some finely minced garlic? Pieces are a fair thickness. Cooks nicely. Not as tender as i hoped, nor was it as marbleized as i have had this cut in other places. 

Toro Beef - $3.45 - otherwise quoted as "Beef Brisket". By no means it is the Toro i was thinking of. It is straight up brisket, similar to that of what you get any where else. Misleading name, but i guess it was my fault for believing it may be more towards to the Toro name vs the quoted brisket name. Thin slices of meat. Cooks fast. Simple as that. 

Pork belly - $2.95 - surprisingly, this was probably the best of the 4 items we had ordered. Even compared to the pork toro or prime kalbi. sad but surprising. Lol. Simple pork belly cuts. 

Overall, not bad experience. Priced fair during happy hour. Pretty sure i wouldn't be ordering the meats not during happy hour though. Nice place to try if you are in the area. 

They have a lot of appetizers discounted during Happy Hour as well. Didn't try any though.
Great food and nice atmosphere !!  I would definitely come here again.  Ate a lot.  Good find in Vegas for Korean food!!!

I had this joint on my list of spots to try while in Vegas this time. I saw this on Food Network and coupled with some Yelp reviews I thought it was a good idea. Right before we left the hotel to go to the restaurant I read Yelper Betty N's review and was hoping her review was off a lil in relation to the majority of Yelp reviews. As the evening wore on I quickly realized Betty N was on point with her review and the rest were skewed and off kilter. We ordered the Las Vegas which is a meal for two, and added the ribs. The ribs were ok but for me this was the most flavorless meal the whole trip. I was sorely disappointed. I have nothing more to say about this.  Oh wait...the drinks were ok.

The quality of their meat is great, you can really taste it. It's deceivingly small  on the outside, but spacious inside. They have combos with appetizers and meats good for multiple people and the portions are perfect. You will seriously get full off of one combo. Overall great place for Korean BBQ, definitely coming back!
Nice atmosphere, friendly staffs & service, best of all yummy BBQ!  Well worth the wait! Would love to come back again.
New favorite restaurant in Vegas! Food + Service = Great! Go during happy hour if you want to spend less $.
Really good Korean BBQ and good service but you will leave smelling like smoke.

My favorite place to eat when I come to Vegas!!! I gotta come at least twice when I'm on my annual Edc trip!!! Good service , delicious food great atmosphere. I think this might be my favorite restaurant in general even better than Hawaii!!!! I'll always come back plenty of food and can I tell you how good the bulgogi is ?!! To die for.

Patrick went above and beyond for me. I had a small reception after a ceremony at the Hard Rock Hotel. Our party of 20 walked over as it is across the street. 

I started communicating with Patrick several months before the ceremony. He was very attentive and helpful even when I started to forget about the food as the wedding got closer. 

Patrick and I facebooked and texted as the date came closer. He confirmed with me the day before and the day of. When we walked over, they were ready for us, all set up and immediately began bringing food out. Everything was delicious and we were all very full walking back to the hotel. It was an overall amazing experience.
Amazing food. The kobe beef is so marbled and the banchan are perfect. They have teokbokki which i'm obsessed with. Perfect dinner!

Great food great people definitely a place to go 
I ordered a set for 2 people. 
Great amount of meat and side dish. 
The fire on the grill is a little bit weak.
Delicious spicy pork and Kalbi was good. Good quality meat. Definitely worth a visit in Vegas.
Food was good! Service my awesome. The jalapeno poppers with salmon was great! Would love to have it again.

Wow!  Wasn't expecting such an amazing meal right as I got into Las Vegas. Always good to eat off the strip. 

The meats were perfectly marinated and good cuts. Cooked at the right temperature the meat tastes were tender and flavorful.  Order the salt and sesame oil as a side!  The bulgogi bibimbap was exactly what I was looking for. We ordered the Gangam for two and extra left over. It was the best deal!

The oysters, calamari apps and sides were just that sides. 

You come to a Korean BBQ house for the meat and that was phenomenal.

Best Korean food I've had in such a long time. I'm from Chicago and also have eaten at multiple restaurants in New York.   Their style of ordering is ala carte.  It's similar to gyu kaku (Japanese chain located in Chicago and New York trying to be Korean, which they prolly learned during their occupation of Korea which is a whole different story) but meat quality is so much better
Very good. Super fast service and very friendly staff & food was delicious. Would definitely come back next time I'm in the area. Highly recommended!
One of my favorite places to visit while in Vegas!!!! Happy hour after a day of shopping!!
This Korean BBQ is authentic, and tasty. The service is top-notch, and I highly recommend their food!
Got the "Las Vegas" and loved it with the Kimchi Chigae Best lunch break before class
Good food and great service. The meat is seasoned great. Will definitely come back.  Venue is great as well.

Amazing Korean bbq. Definitely worth trying if you're in doubt. Place is a bit small but once you're seated, service is fast. I ordered the premium set and it was somewhat on the pricier side but it was great!

Pretty good kbbq, with a decent selection of banchan. The meat lovers option is great with good quality meat. 

Only con is that the staff doesn't grill the meat for you, and we had to ask for refills of the sides. Guess I'm just spoiled by LA kbbq.
Man, one of the best night ever! Good food, and awesome service! Soo full right now :-)
Great quality meat, ban chan and awesome service. My boyfriend and I got 3 plates of meat and cold noodle and bill came out to be 40$! Not bad, we were both full afterwards.
If you love meat especially beef, just SKIP all others and order Korean Prime Kalbi and *KOBE STYLE BEEF!!!ONLY!!! Calamari and scallop with bacon also very delicious. Highly recommended!
Would like to come back for happy hour. The beef carpaccio is very good. The beef toro, prime galbi, scallops were what we ordered.
Cool design of the restaurant inside ,however,  the food was mediocre. Happy hour was worth the price of the food, but other than that not the best option to eat authentic Korean food .

We came here because of the great yelp reviews....the reviews don't lie!  The food is excellent and the staff are extremely nice.  The marinated meats are absolutely the best options...they're delicious.  That's saying a lot for someone that very rarely eats animals.  We will 10000% be back really soon.

Celebrating my friend's birthday and craved Korean bbq. Great quality meat and attentive service. Prices not bad for good quality near. Nice and fun ambiance. Will be back with family and friends for sure. Gotta be here for the reverse happy hour.

This is the best restaurant! Love the way the waiters and waitresses are so polite and nice. They are truly fantastic! I wish every restaurant was like this. One time I went to a place similar but it gave me a tummy ache but no bathroom accidents here! The end.

We were a party of 5 and ordered the meat lovers combo for 4. Thinking that the portions would not be sufficient for us, we additionally ordered 2 orders of the  chicken wings and the seafood pancake. 
Our server proceeded to bring what seems like an endless array of meats. Everything was good quality ,except for maybe the pork belly(bacon), it lacked taste and flavor.
