They were attentive to our needs until at the very end when it was time for us to get our check, it took to long, you would think that they would want to get you out ASAP so the table could be turned to awaiting. customers.

Great food! Excellent service! !! You get to cook your meat on this oven that's in your table!  Wow, great experience,  food was amazing. Service was quick! I can not recommend this place enough!  And the prices are very reasonable!
Awesome k-bbq and bomb bulgogi. Really good happy hour, got a pitcher of Sapporo for 8 bux. Definitely worth the 20 min drive from my house

My name is Julian Glasser from Century 21 JR Realty. This place has great food, it is also a good place to bring clients and friends. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that enjoys Korean BBQ!
Food and service are good with a fun friendly atmosphere. Portions are plentiful and the wait wasn't long for a Saturday night. I will definitely be coming back.

I am totally not just reviewing this place for the free dessert.   

But seriously this place is great.  Cool atmosphere, great service, and incredible food.

Get their premium combo. Unbelievably delicious. 
We had their kimchi soup as well. Heads up their kimchi stew has tuna instead of pork. Although you could probably ask for pork instead
It was really great. Great food and a great price. The bulgogi, pork belly, and scallops where out of this world. It had really great flavor and I left full and happy.
Amazing service from our waitress/hostess Kristan!! The quality of food is great and for a reasonable price. It is worth the wait!!

Food is as usual really good, big portion and I just love this place. I wrote a review about this restaurant. Check it out!  http://itsmestef.blogspot.com/2016/08/gangnam-asian-bbq-korean-restaurant-las.html?m=1
One of my favorite places. Good food and good service. Fun place to come with your friends. Lots of ban chan- bean sprouts are my fave. Try the Kalbi. Thinly cut, marinaded perfectly.
I love eating korean bbq and this place is great! You get a lot of food for the price and the marinated meats are on point! Services was spectacular as well!

Some of the meat is pretty good, such as the prime kalbi.  Other meat quality is inconsistent throughout a single plate, especially the pork belly.  Side dishes aren't that impressive.  The corn is bad.  The steamed egg isn't good.  Food wise probably 2-3 stars.

What is horrible is the service and attitude of the servers.  We came for lunch and weren't given lunch special menus.  When I asked for the menu, the attitude started.  We didn't end up ordering the lunch special, but not one smile or happy service for the entire meal.  Each request was met with a grumpy grunt.  They don't refill side dishes without being asked like good korean restaurant experiences.  They don't see a utensil falling to the ground in front of their face and move to address it.  They don't move out of the way when you are trying to walk down the aisle to the restroom.

Terrible service will ruin decent food everytime.

First time customer, loved & Enjoyed the Food. With my bottle of Sake aside perfect. AWSOME waiters definitely recommend and will be returning. All the other low star Raters don't know what there talking about. Take my word for this 5 star Restaurant!
Be prepared to eat lots of food! The specials come with lots of sides. You get your moneys worth and everything is very tasty.
Expect to smell like Korean BBQ leaving, but the food is worth it!  There is a variety of meats, well marinated.  Food came out fast and staff was friendly.

We like this BBQ restaurant. It's traditional Korea BBQ. We love their grill beef. Good service. Price is reasonable. Compared with the buffets in Las Vegas, we love this restaurant. It's the second times we came here those days. We will bring more friends come here next time.
wonderful place in LV, a good choice except all buffets. I like the beef most. Since I have eaten so much bbq and Korean meals in NYC, this one is also wonderful!

No wait on a Wednesday for lunch!

+fast and great service
+clean and nice set up (good vents!)
+solid variety of beef
+parking in the plaza

-not the best kbbq I've had but def worth checking out! Overall, 4.5 stars.
Food was delicious! Best KBBQ in town! Bomb desserts. Must try!!!! Right by UNLV campus, super convenient after a long night studying!!!

Kobe beef carpaccio $10 EXCELLENT HIGHLY RECOMMEND 
Harami miso $9 QUITE GOOD
Korean prime kalbi $9 VERY GOOD
Beef toro $5 pretty dry. Could be dipped in sauce but still. Quality meat but just not as tender or marinated as we'd liked.
Bulgogi $5 VERY FLAVORFUL AND TENDER
Dynamite shrimp $7 good but sauce can be better. Pretty common spicy mayo.
FREE DESSERT WITH YELP REVIEW

Everything we tried is pretty good. Our entire party was vegetarian but we had plenty of dishes to choose from. They were able to remove the meat and seafood from many of the dishes we ordered. They also have a pretty extensive selections of vegetables to grill. The corn, zuchinni, and enoki mushroom were particularly good.

It's not your typical Korean restaurant, meaning it doesn't have the all you can eat Korean BBQ. But if you're looking for quality cut meats this is a great place to dine. Been here already multiple times and still haven't tried all their dishes. Hospitality is really nice and the set up of the place has a relaxing ambience.
We ordered the Gangnam for two. The portions were really big and filling. They were really attentive. Fast and friendly service. The side dishes were really tasty.
Great service with amazing happy hour deal. Went with a group of 8 people and didn't wait too long to be seated.

Good service. Awesome price.
Great tapa like korean bbq idea.
We loved it.

Beats all the other korean places in lv.

Trust me. Im korean and from so cal.
We are here for our sister's birthday. It's our first time and we're all impressed. High quality meat & good service with a lot of alcohol choice.

Coming from Chicago, we have a decent amount of Korean food/BBQ. I ordered the beef bibimbap and it was on par with what I've had before. My friend order the original bimbimbap, and it looks awesome as well. The order came with the standard appetizer dishes, which all tasted great. I would recommend this place to anyone with a craving for Korean food.
Great food! Great service! The meat lover is the way to go if you love meat! The extra Korean dishes are also very tasty.

Ordered the Gangnam combo and pretty much ate everything that had come out. 

 Pros
My favorite was the Fried calamari and marinated peppers.  

Cons
Food took a bit longer than expected.  Fresh oysters were not as fresh as I had wanted...keeping fingers crossed for now.

Overall this is Vegas and met my standards.
I like bulgogi, pork, good service and wonderful food! My family really love soy sauce soup too.

I was starving, haven't eaten all day, and was in the mood for some great kbbq. Although not unlimited, the servings were way more than satisfying. The servers are very helpful and friendly! Yummmm filet mignon!
Came here for family dinner. We chose meat lover: $140 for 6 ppl. Good portion for everyone, love the prime Kalibi.

This was my first time here. Came with my husband, brother , and his girlfriend. They were very quick to get us seated , take our order, and get our food out. The food was very delicious. We got the meat lovers for four. I also got the egg ramen noodles, but I wasn't too impressed with that. But everything else was quite tastey. The reason that I didn't give this place a five star rating is because once the food was on the table no one came by to check on us. We all needed refills on water and my husband needed another beer. Also, the check was brought before asking if we needed anything else which we were interested in dessert. This is a huge pet peeve of mine. We ordered the honey bread and it took 25 minutes to come out. That's way too long for toasted bread and ice cream in my opinion. However, it was delicious.

Delicious, fast, and fairly priced! My sister and I had a great meal here. Servings are huge! We ordered the meat lovers for two, it was absolutely delicious and very fresh. I would definitely go back.

I loves me some KBBQ and since my family from Korea and I were in Sin City, I decided to try this place out. I typically like to do the AYCE for KBBQ but this place had such high ratings, I felt it was worth my while. The flavor of the meat was great and the side dishes were pretty darn good. We got ribs and pork belly and the usual meats. I have to say that it's a bit costly since each order is kinda small. Would I come back? I think I most certainly would.

Is not one star but I'm tempted to give it.  Do not be fooled by the 4.5 stars.  They offer free desert for a good yelp review.  Hence the reviews.  The food was 3.5 stars at best.  Throw on atrocious service they deserve one or two.  

The bbq wasn't horrible but it certainly was no where near 4.5 stars.  It took 30'minutes to settle the check.  The bbq wasn't warm enough, they didn't provide scissors to cut meat, the seasoning was just ok.  They meat was not cut appropriately.  They brought 3 glasses of water to 5 person table. None of the little things went right.  The seasoning was meh as well.

This place is good, but not great. Decor is beautiful. Big red tables for all your many dishes to come, however the grill itself is not the best like gyu-kaku because the meat we were grilling kept sticking on, even if you brushed oil on grill. We had to change grill twice and we didn't even cook a lot of meat. 

*SERVICE WAS GREAT, FRIENDLY STAFF 

Gangnam is Korean with some Japanese flavors. Located next to "get nailed" nail salon. Open til 1am! Bring all your friends. Food was average, kind of lacking in flavor. Our bibimbap that comes with the combo took forever to come out, we really wanted to enjoy it with our meats. I wish the beef brisket was sliced thin. We just the "LAS VEGAS" combo for 2 people. I love how they give you the korean side dishes (banchan) especially the cuttlefish!  

I couldn't wait to try it, now I did, and now I'll move on. I'll stick to my gyu-kaku and tofu hut. It wasn't bad, it was like I said average. Great to bring out of town guest. 

Oh btw don't forget to review here so you can get complimentary dessert! That was nice!

Food was delish overall, but wasnt a big fan of the spicy chicken kaarage-it wasn't bad, but i was expecting crispy fried chicken and it is covered in way too much sauce for my taste. Meat was very good quality! Ordered beef toro, pork toro, pork belly, bulgoggi bibimbap, fried calamari, spicy chicken kaarage, kalbi, bacon enoki.  Place is nice and clean, Service was awesome too! Will definitely come here again next time we're in vegas. You also get a free dessert if you post a yelp review during your visit,  so we got banana tempura, lava cake and a macaroon, all were sooooo yummy too!
Great menu, fresh meat and bbq seafood choices! Prices are reasonable and service was fast and helpful
Cool atmosphere. Friendly staff. And if your willing to pay extra, they offer "Kobe" type beef! Yum Yum!!!

Came from out of town for a convention and found this place through local recommendation. It's authentic Korean BBQ with great service. I've been spoiled this visit since we don't have anything like it back home. Oh well, need to come back to Vegas more.
This place had a really nice atmosphere and was packed with people even at 9pm. We ordered the gangnam set for 2 and it was a lot of food ! Delicious and really quick service :)

The host was very nice in updating me how many tables were ahead of me, even though it really did not shorten my wait.  It took them about 5 minutes to take our order since it was a rather busy night.  The server brought us the side dishes right away.  When I asked a passing waitress for water several minutes later, she told me that MY server will bring me water later..........the water came 3 minutes later but with quite a bit of attitude.  Just placed it on the table without saying a word and with a rather annoyed look about her.  My experience with the service so far has been average., although may be typical for a Korean restaurant.  Now on to the wait for the food.........(the longer the dots....the longer the wait)..........is 10 minutes a long wait?........3 of the 6 items ordered came at the 11 minute mark........5 more minutes later 1 more item came.......3 minutes more and my fifth item came......I don't get how long it takes to cook udon for my little daughter.....anyway, 3 more minutes later and my daughter finally has her udon.  The food was actually very tasty and worth the walk from the strip but I am not entirely happy with the service.  Would I come back again ($64K question)...probably as long as I can tolerate the wait and service.  Time to hit the slots and win me back some money.

The Harami Miso and Korean Prime is delicious! A must try. Green tea macaroon was fantastic as well. Food was great, but service was extremely slow. The wait was an hour and the check took 20 minutes to come.
Great food great service and great environment. I have nothing but delight for  their presentation. Fresh hot and delicious!

First time here and it was amazing! I will definitely come back here every single time I am in Vegas. The food was fresh, tasty, and plentiful! The service was friendly and fast. Try this place when you're in town!

Pretty delicious and great service. Food arrived very quickly after we were seated. The four of us got the meat lovers for two, and each ordered a main. It was just the right amount of food. Wish they gave some complimentary vegetables to go with the grilled meat (garlic, peppers, lettace). Would recommend!
the prime kalbi and pork belly are really good. Waitresses are friendly and helpful as well.
We come here everytime we come to Vegas. Best Asian food here! The spicy tuna kimbab is a must try!
Great service,  great prices and delicious food!  Coming from LA, tried many different Korean bbq places but I must say this place is one of the best.

One of the best Korean BBQ places in Vegas. It is honestly hard to beat this place. From the friendly staff, to the amazing food, this place is awesome. So Much Juice On That meat. 

I went here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and we truly enjoyed ourselves.  There was a minimal wait, but this allows you to take in the scenery.  You can watch TV as well as watch k pop and pop videos. It has a nice soft red tone to the restaurant. We honestly couldn't wait to sit and eat .
Very good food! Great service! Good meat quality! Recommend the sea weed salad. Enjoyed the pork belly very much. Can't go wrong with this place!
Pretty good food overall and service is great. No complaint. Server named Christine has been awesome!

Me and my fiance went here for dinner and it was great! They have group meals and you will surely walk out stuffed! I ordered japchae and it was great tasting yet the noodles was too rubbery. I wasn't gonna complain but the server noticed we haven't even touched it and not taking it to go, so I said it's too rubbery and we'll just leave it. She took it back to the kitchen and I guess she tried it herself and offered to take it out off the bill. We will definitely gonna come back again :)
My son loves this place. Clean and really good food. Friendly, very attentive staff. Will definitely bring family and friends here. Superb
Sooooooo good!! The employees were all incredibly nice, and the food was delicious. Eating here is absolutely worth while, I recommend it any day!

First time here with my girlfriend, and wow what a surprise! The meat was very high quality and fresh compared to most Korean BBQ places. Bulgogi was nice and tender. The star of the evening was the Flat Iron Garlic beef! It all came nicely in the Meat Lovers package for $55.95.  

Decor was a nice deep red with a fun atmosphere. Definitely felt like I was back in Seoul! Honestly my new favorite spot. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Service was quick too! 10/10 will eat again.

The food here is fresh and tasty we ordered the beef platter and raw beef.  The food comes in 5mins later, I like how they grill the food for you which gives you time to enjoy the food.  I took out one stars because my server forgot to come back to turn the meat so it was a bit burn.
Kalbi BBQ yum, Jigae delicious, pan chan scrumptious, wait staff the crowning jewel to a perfect meal!  A must visit place off the strip.
Just off the strip. Glad we found this place. Open till 1! Fast and attentive service. Food was excellent for the price! Come for happy hour
Awesome food and experience! Got Meat Lovers for four for $99 and it was plenty of food and a great variety.

This restaurant was amazing. The food was delicious. I loved the idea of Japanese and Korean food on the menu. My boyfriend and I ordered the meat lovers meal. We loved the variety of meat and appetizers that came with it. We would definitely come back again.

Came here because of the 4.5 star on yelp, but the food actually only deserves a 3 star. It's good, but it's far from anything 4 stars and above.  If you are wondering why this restaurant have so many reviews and high ratings this might answer your question. (See photo) Yes, for every review you write on yelp, you get a free dessert and the server screens your review. "You must show posted review to your server." After seeing the so-called "Limited Time Offer" poster (placed on every table) I felt cheated by yelp. I always use yelp for honest reviews, not reviews that have been somehow influenced and manipulated by the restaurant. It's one thing to give people discounts on their bill if they check-in with yelp, but it's another thing to bribe people with dessert and screen their reviews. My utmost disappointment to the unethical promotional strategy this restaurant uses.  Never coming here again.

Love this place. They were very quick to get everyone seated and the food is absolutely delicious! For two of us we got the Las Vegas which was a variety of different apps and meats. It was delicious! Highly recommend checking this place out.
Great food and service! Highly recommend the steam egg, chicken fondue and spicy ramen.
Delicious! My girlfriend and I are pescatarian and were invited by friends for dinner. There was plenty of seafood and veggies to cook and still have a blast!! Thanks David for wonderful experience.
Great food and great experience! We really enjoyed our Gangnam Combo for lunch. Also had the salmon and fried rice and loved it all.

非常好味及價錢合理，一定再黎!
Taste good and price resonable, sure will come again.
Went here with a few friends on the weekend and it was great! Service was fast; their hospitality is one of the best I've experienced. Huge fan of Korean bbq, would definitely go again.

I've been to many Korean BBQ restaurants here in Las Vegas and around the U.S. this one had a very friendly staff at the front and throughout the restaurant. Food has great flavor with perfect marinating time on the beef. Side dishes are one of the things that I am always critical on in any review, these sides are amazing Jim her has great flavor as well as all the others, I think i found my new favorite in town!!!
Amazing service and high quality meat, this place will be my "go to" while I'm in town everytime. Special shout out to Jin for providing the best service I've had in Vegas yet!
the food was amazing. meat love style. Yassssssss! Thank you. The filet mignon was the best mean and so was the flat iron steak. So come  in and have some Korean BBQ.

This is my favorite Asian restaurant in Las Vegas. 
My favorite meats are filet mignon, spicy chicken with lemon sauce.

I ll definitely come here again!!
Good price for what you get in Las Vegas, the atmosphere is nice and the stuffs are nice.
Awsome awsome place to eat highly recomend there banana deserve was delicious.  Loved the BBQ here I'm in love
Lots of great selection in Korean food. Perfect to pair with beer! Come early during happy hour as it can get very busy!
Best place and it's next to UNLV which is a plus! Food is amazing and it has something for everyone!! 10 out 10
Galbi is sooooo good and the service is great too. Cold spicy noodle was pretty delicious and they have so many side dishes. This place is clean and nice to come with family. We'll be back.
Awesome Korean BBQ, loved the spicy chicken. Should have all you can eat option. The desserts are also good.
Service is great, food came out quick and it was delicious! Don't forget to order the cream cheese wontons, mmmmmm!

One of the best places in Vegas to eat. The quality is better than most restaurants we've been to. Tucked away in a little strip mall just a short cab ride from the main strip, this restaurant is well priced. The portions are generous and the servers are quite friendly. I will definitely be back for their Korean prime rib next time I visit Las Vegas.
It's super good place, very delicious and authentic Korean BBQ~ I love it~ me and my friends enjoyed very much~

I ordered meat lover and side dishes. I love Bulgogi and pork belly. The side dishes are so good. I really love kimji, bean-sprout. I really recommend the meat lover set. If more accompany, I really recommend you guys to order premium grill set b/c there are scallop and shrimp also
Overall the food is good,we ordered 4 ppl meat killer meal, the meat are pretty fresh. I like the desert. However, the Side dishes are not that good comparing to other Korean BBQ.

Went there for happy hour. Their happy hour menu offers very good choices. The environment is good and comfortable. The waitresses and waiters are friendly and welcoming. I had a great time dining there!
This place is perfect for a late night get together for two or more!!! Food is always fresh and ready to eat upon ordering, not to mention a happy hour early and late that kicks ass!!!!

Inconspicuous little spot in a strip mall near the Las Vegas strip. The food was fantastic and the portion sizes were filling. Very reasonable priced entrees. The complimentary Kim chi sampler to start was a perfect way to begin the meal. The best part of this place is the service. The staff was attentive, courteous, and efficient. Overall one of my top 5 dining experiences in Vegas.
Best Korean BBQ I've had. Great service and great food. Highly recommend the Gangnam meal. Good way to try the food.
This place is great, the Kalbi is unbeilable. Everything on the menu is perfect. All the sides are very tasty too
Everything taste so good! very friendly staff! we ordered the lunch time special, a lot of choices and side dishes, all the side dishes taste delicious!
Fantastic. Loved everything. Definitely would recommend the bacon scallops and the filet mignon.
This is the best Korean BBQ in Vegas!!!!!!! I would advise everyone to eat here when they come to Vegas. It's a 6 star restaurant and a definite 10/10 and would eat here every time.

Great service and meat! Came here on a Saturday afternoon within a reservation and was seated fairly quickly. Our group of 5 ordered a meat lover for 2 and a gangnam for 2 and it was the perfect amount of food for a hungry party.
First time here, ordered the Premium set for 4 and everything was delicious. Definitely will come back on our next trip...
Side dishes and sauces are on point. Highly recommend the marinated Kalbi and bacon wrapped scallops! Nice atmosphere for a group or couple.

After a hard core night out on the town, Korean BBQ truly hits the spot! And Gangnam delivers!!! 

My friends and I ordered the Meat Lovers combo for 4 and it was amazing! For $100, it comes with 6 different meats, 3 types of salads, chilli dumplings, miso soup, rice and side dishes. The quality and quantity is superb! We ate to our fill and still had food leftover. 

The service was phenomenal. Very attentive and friendly. The place is packed but they are well staffed; only had to wait 5 minutes to be seated. 

Sure, there are all you can eat Korean BBQ places, but I'm all about quality and flavor and will be making Gangman a regular stop when in Vegas!!!

I really enjoyed this place!  The food is setup in good portions and the sides that come with it are both tasty and interesting!  I would definitely skip the strip restaurants and try this place instead. I got the filet with bacon wrapped asparagus a long with tempura veggies!

After reading the reviews of Yelp, I decided to try this place. Not bad, just some things I wanted to point out. 

1) the menus posted outside the restaurant is old, Gangnam package shows calamari, they now replaced the sit down menus with corn (I've posted the new menu)

2) I got my miso soup and salad BEFORE my drinks. When I asked the waiter, he said he didn't work my table. 

3) the waiter who said he didn't work my table, was quick to take my money and ring me up after I was done eating.

The restaurant is located near the strip, vegas, just pass through the hotels and casinos and you will be there soon. a decent korean bbq which quite unusual in Vegas. the portion is tapas style so you need to order a lot. the meat is juicy and tender but I would like the meat to be cut more  thinner. overall, It was a quite fine experience !!!

We showed up at gangman and it was packed - an hour wait.  But they had 2 seats at the bar so we took those.  Food was great but the service was even better.  We found one of the four corn pieces was a bit burnt.  They replaced the dish and took it off the bill.  We will go back for sure.
Holy cow.  This place is AMAZING.  IVE NEVER HAD A BETTER DEAL FOR 4 people to stuff our faces with QUALITY Korean bbq and drinks.  Definitely will come back and recommend to many.
I had the Harami Miso and the shrimp garlic bbq. Sooooooo delicious! Great service, great food, great price! Highly recommended!!!

We ordered Gangnam style for 2 and a Meat lovers special for 2, It was the perfect size for 5 people. The waiter seemed to be constantly forgetful after being called over for assistance multiple times. Food was good but the review loses a star for the hostess who was rude to our party checking in and had to have a waiter stop her from speaking with our table.

Food is great, service is great, A+.

We discovered that ordering one of  everything off the happy hour menu was the same price as the "for two" option. Also discovered it was an enormous amount of food. But it was all amazing!

As a local half Korean, my Korean mother and I  frequently go to Korean restaurants while we are out shopping. We were in the area and decided to give this spot with over 4,000 reviews a try. We had big expectations! Perhaps this spot is a hit with tourists but we weren't impressed. First of all,  it irritates me as a culinary professional when restaurants use culinary terminology so loosely. I ordered Sukiyaki Noodle with Beef. If you know Japanese cuisine you know Sukiyaki. I was expecting noodles along with something that resembles Sukiyaki. After all that's what it's called, right? What I got was stir fried noodles with chunks of beef and sliced red peppers served in a stone pot. What is so Sukiyaki about this? Nothing in this dish is anything you would find in Sukiyaki. In Sukiyaki, the beef is thinly sliced rib eye and there is no red bell peppers in it but rather, spinach, shiitake mushrooms, onions, green onions, tofu, bamboo and yam noodles. More appropriately this should be called Yaki Noodle with Beef which simply is stir fried noodles. It looked nothing like the photo on the menu and the portion was very small. My mom had the bean paste soup and it was nothing special. The pickles were bland and lacking any flavor. We ate our lunch but knew we would not come back again. The service? My tea cup sat empty without any question if we would like more hot water.  I finally asked for more hot water since I was never offered it. For $2.50 for each hot tea? At other Korean restaurants in town, hot tea is complimentary.
Didn't have bbq for this time, I had tuna salad and steam egg, it was great. Nice environment, location and services. Close to UNLV, hotels and airport.

I came here to have lunch with my husband. We were considering the set menu, but the portion seemed too large. We ended up ordering 3 appetizers and 3 plates of beef, and the portion is just right. Food are delicious, love it.

I was excited to try out this Korean restaurant while on vacation since the one near me closed down and left me deprived. The complimentary sides were good --- macaroni salad was a little odd but still okay, but the kimchi had some nice heat to it. I ordered garlic duck breast and bulgogi along with a bunch of appetizers...tuna poki, salmon jalapeno poppers,spicy tuna bimbap, and seafood pancake. Oddly, when the meat came out, rice didn't accompany it. Is that common to order rice separately? Bulgogi was flavorful and tender, and so was the duck breast. Tuna poki was spicy...not my favorite...spicy tuna bimbap was so yummy! Seafood pancake was a HOT MESS. Not cohesive...fell apart and properly need a few more minutes of cooking and a lot more seasoning. Salmon poppers had too much going on. I personally didn't like most of the appetizers but the main meats were really good.

I wrote this honest review in exchange for a free macaron ice cream.

I'm a sucker for Korean. I always wanted to try this place since it was near UNLV and one day after work I was by myself and said what the heck, let's go here! The food was amazing. They had some Kpop music videos playing. It was a very neat place and was better than I expected. The waiters are pretty polite. I most definitely and likely be back.

Amazing Korean BBQ. Excellent service. Kobe beef was super. Side dishes are fresh and awesome. Portions a bit on small side, but reflects the cost. You can try more meats this way! Top it off ... they have PSY music videos in the background. Truly a Korean experience. Next time we fly by ... will definitely stop by. Also the ice cream macaroons were awesome!
Bi Bin Bap was delicious! They were able to accommodate my gluten free issues. And the Kobe beef was out of this world!!
All meats are well sautéed, the kalbi and mushroom are really good, not far from the strip, definitely worth a visit!
This place is great! Great food. Service, awesome employees! Tasty meat and is a must go to! I highly recommend the beef toro. Great meat quality!
The pork belly here is amazing!!! Most try it, you wont regret!!! Better than many other Korean bbq. There are vary kinds of sides, I love it~ Servers are really kind also.
Happy hour 3-6pm...pitcher of Sapporo $8.50, beef toro $4, bulgogi $4, & free ice cream macaroon with Yelp check-in...this place ROCKS!!!

I came with my sister for a Sunday lunch and we were quickly seated. We each ordered a bowl of noodle, they came out sizzling and flavorful. We also ordered the meat to grill as we ate, yum yum. My only request is if they could think out the meat a little, it was cut a little thick. but overall a great experience.
Delicious meats and appetizers! Everything we tried was yummy. Bacon wrapped asparagus was one of my favs.
amazing food!  first time and i loved it! I'm from Manhattan visiting Las Vegas and the dinner is to die for!!!! Great food. Good company. I highly recommend!

awesome and friendly servers. great food and inexpensive. everything I had was good, the skirt steak, bulgogi bibimbap, filet mignon, spicy tuna kimbap and a large pitcher of Sapporo. I'd recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

Best Korean BBQ place I've ever been to! The staff were very friendly and the interior design is so stylish. There was so much food, we couldn't finish everything! We ordered the Gangnam dishes for 8 and seriously, so much food, for such a good price! Highly recommended!!!
got here for my first meal in las vegas. Foods are great and staffs are extra nice. I like the chicken and shrimp. Will definitely come again.

Perfect place for a late night meal after a 5+ hour drive from CA to the Vegas Strip!  The restaurant has a relaxing ambience with efficient service from a very courteous and attentive staff. The tables and grills are spacious, especially for our party of five. The  items we ordered were served quickly and with great pacing. Everything was delicious! And we had the good fortune to see Mr. Carrot Top here :) can't wait to come again!!
Came for a late Saturday  lunch.  They recommended the gangham platter and we were impressed.   Quality of meats and flavors outstanding.   Staff attentive and friendly.  We will be back!

Long wait but worth it, good food!

Not very big place so make sure you make reservations or be prepared to wait a bit.

We contemplated between going a la carte vs one of the preset combos, ultimately combos are much better value.

You won't be disappointed!

Good service and good food!
Nice owner and especially quality meat is very good. I will come back definitely. 

I think this is one of the best BBQ restaurant in town.

Came on a Tuesday night around 10:30 to try their happy hour as well as other items on the menu.

From the happy hour menu my boyfriend and I ordered the 
cream cheese wonton $3
spicy tuna kimbap $3
Ordered all 3 meat $3 each (pork taro, beef brisket, and bulgogi)
and a pitcher of Sapporo beer for $9.

Everything was delicious I feel like the bulgogi, tuna kimbap, cream cheese wonton was our personal favorite. The bulgogi was very tasty but kindve small in portion so would recommend order of 2 instead of one.

We decided not to go with the set combo menu and order a la carte of marinated galbi, side of lettuce and paste wrap (comes with celery), and raw garlic as the side dish to make a Korean version taco (aka "Saam") 

Overall the place is very clean, attentive servers, good quality food and affordable price range for everyone (can do set combo meals or a la carte). It may not be the best Korean bbq I've ever had but the quality and the chill ambiance is nice for the Vegas area. Had a pleasant experience and would come back again.

Probably 4.5 stars food-wise, but we fell into this place because it was late-night, and the happy hour prices were hard to beat.  My girlfriend had never had Korean BBQ so we got the basic proteins.  The help wanted us out of there, but snobby service is expected.
Food was delicious. Portions were generous (we did 4 for 85$) and we got free dessert. Recommend the spicy chicken and pork belly it was fantastic!

The interior of this restaurant is really nice! I love how it's red and black, gives it a really chill environment. 
As a huge kbbq fan, I would have to say that the meat isn't as great as it could be. Some of the cuts were thicker than they usually are at other places which is why I docked one star. 
Despite that, I find myself coming back here frequently. I enjoy the food and I like the service! 

Thank you guys for another great experience!

Best food in Vegas! Coming back again and again! Customer service is over the top! Never thought I'd find something like this here in Sin City! Highly recommend you coming to eat here and experience their Asian BBQ! I will tell all my friends that visit from Hawaii about this place! Can't go wrong, plus you get FREE DESSERT! You can't beat that!! Love it! We had the Gangnam dinner for two and we are stuffed!

Here again and this place is still amazing. We did have to wait 30 minutes instead of the 15 they said but I won't take away anything of that. The service is always fast and they are excellent with correcting mistakes. The food is always delicious as well!

Excellent quality Korean BBQ!  While its not an all you can eat place, the ala cart options are small enough to custom pick your meats without being overwhelmed with only 1 type of meet.  Overall great ambience and friendly staff.  Definitely coming back here!

When you come, do your self a favor and try the Flat Iron Garlic!

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. Quality is A+. We got the Gangnam platter an it was more than enough food to feed two people. The steam egg is superb! It's a must try. We will definitely come back later on whenever we are in town.
Great food, very taste, cool atmosphere. Definitely need to come here. Staff is very friendly, fast and willing to accommodate all your needs.

Great customer service.  They hopped right on getting our drink orders.  The food came out quickly too.  We went with the Gang Nam for 2.  A lot of food for a reasonable price considering the amount of food you get.  The sides are endless.  Their kimchi is good and the cucumbers are too.  The bibimbap is awesome also.

The fried bananas are so bomb!  I actually don't like bananas that much.  When I eat them they have to be almost green.  But damn these were killer!  And the mochi was yummy!  

After a meal here I am gonna go home and sleep until tomorrow night.

Came here for lunch and ordered the salmon as my meat choice with salad and steamed dumplings, my husband ordered the 2 choice of meat (Bulgogi and spicy pork) with cream cheese wontons and salad while my mother ordered bibimbap. Every single plate was really good!! I cook Korean food myself at home so I'm pretty picky when eating out so I find myself to be a reliable source to trusting this Korean restaurant. The side dishes are also delicious AND the service is outstanding. Price point is more than affordable for what you get. I'll be returning when I visit the trade shows! :)

Wasn't sure how to start but our waitress explained everything and it was all really good. Service was poor. Waitress took our order and never came back. No refills, no check on us, we had to flag anyone down that we could.

Read the reviews, don't go by quantity..  They offer a free dessert for a Yelp review. I got mine for this one.

Found this place on Yelp and our meal was awesome! For five of us we got a meal for four and it was more than enough. Also, a pitcher of Sapporo for happy hour after 10pm -- can't beat that! 

Our server, Donkey, was outstanding as well. Will definitely return and recommend to others.
The food is yummy and the side dishes are good.  Good place of enjoy.u can come here to eat.But u need to wait for a long long time!

This is my new favorite spot in town! They have a great selection on the menu, and the price is right. Service is spot on, and i love having the grill right at the table to cook my own! Definitely a great date night, or change of pace to the usual watering hole.

This place was recommended to us by our friends in Dallas as his favorite Korean BBQ of all time. 

The quality of food was great as well as the selection. 

The service was also excellent. Highly recommended if you're in Las Vegas and craving Korean BBQ in a very relaxed atmosphere.

Me and the wife tried this place because she was craving korean appetizers.. we ordered the meat lovers and loved everyrhing... except the macaroni salad side. My favorite was the bulgogi and the kobi style beef.

I'm from New York, so comparing the price of their meat, it's such a good deal, and everything is so delicious! 
I'm only staying in Las Vegas on a trip for 4 days and I've been here for dinner 2 nights in a row, cuz it's just that delicious  and trust me, cuz I'm a pig 
All the top 3 beef are so yummy and all their side dishes are on point  THEIR KIMCHI IS JUST MY TYPE! 
I will highly recommend to anyone and everyone who is in this area.
EAT HERE!

So good! We got the Meat Lovers meal, $54.99 for a ton of panchan and meat dishes.  Food quantity and quality was excellent, our meal came with pot stickers, salad, rice and yummy sides. I recommend the pre-fixe meals if you are new to Korean BBQ or have a big party. Our Meal fed two adults and two small kids, and sent us away full and happy! Clean restaurant, nice staff, excellent location across from the Hard Rock (we stayed at a nearby hotel).

Gangnam is not AYCE and I'm used to AYCE bbq so i get worried that these type of places won't satisfy me. Having that said, the meat lover's dinner for 2 and a side of Pork Toro for myself and my wife was MORE than enough. We could have easily done without the extra dish. The quality of meat was really good and we were very pleased with everything. The restaurant is clean and we didn't wait long.

VERDICT: Clean, newly renovated, but tough meats.

QUALIFIER: Came in right after happy hour and right before dinner rush on week night.

FOOD: Went with Gangnam package. Even the tender filet was relatively tough, but still softer than other served steak. Salad was refreshing and not too sour. Favorite was Harami Miso for the flavor.

SERVICE: Very attentive waiting staff, quick refilling drinks, coming by asking if food is ok and side dishes replaced.

Got the premium special for 2 people and it was awesome! The quality of the meat was pretty good and there was more than enough meat/seafood to fill us up. My only compliant is that one of the meats was too sweet and it was the least favorite meat. The Thai tea is also tiny for $3.95. However, everything else is great. Service is awesome too

Waaaay better than the best Korean food I ever had in Nyc for three times the price of what it is here. The banchan are delicious. The meats are very good quality and very well flavored. The bibimbap wasn't the best I ever had, but it was good. The dipping sauces are spot on. Very flavorful. 16.95 for a pitcher of Sapporo isn't revolutionary, but it's a good deal. The lettuce wraps are better than pf changs, and that's saying something ;)
Saturday night and we didn't have to wait longer than 15 minutes
And they have macaron ice cream sandwiches for dessert. Can't complain about a single thing here.
Very good meat. Reasonable price and good service! Very close to the strip too. Definitely coming back :)

Been craving Korean bbq food for a while now especially some pork belly and this place did not disappoint. The sauces are definitely reminiscent of a Japanese style Korean bbq, with some ponzu and soy sauces. The Kim Chee at this place is pretty good which is a good indicator of the quality of the food of Korean restaurants. The service was on point and happy hour prices are amazing! Would definitely come back on my next visit to Vegas.
Yummy meat, great quality, friendly server, good music...  Only wish I have the stomach to try more before coming...
The scallop with bacon was DELICIOUS!! The sauces were great!! The prime kalbi was thick, tender, and juicy!!
Great service and awesome food! Coming back again :) the Kobe carpaccio is my favorite and the Korean prime kalbi is delicious!
This place really awesome. Love it. 5 stars!!! I will come back when I come Las Vargas again.

Omg, omg...this place is so off the charts in every way. We ordered appetizers of firecracker shrimp, squash tempura and the urchin over Kobe beef. We then ordered the meet, which was ribeye, prime rib and beef short ribs. It also comes with lots of little sides. The beer selection is great our service was excellent with Kiki and Jay. We will definitely be back. Btw, Yelp gave them a 4 1/2 out of 5 with over 3000 reviews
Great food. Nice service. The only thing I don't like is the location. Long walk from the strip. But it's worth the time cuz you can't find this Korean BBQ place on the strip.

Solid, not especially great but gets the job done.  

Banchan was meh, bean sprouts in particular tasted like dishwater. But hey, you're at a table with your friends, being served by friendly kids, in front of open fire with a plate of kobe beef, scarfing it down with romaine, sesame oil and salt for $21.. add a large bottle of Chamisul Soju for a few more, so.. there's THAT!  Life is good..
We got the Bimbibop and it was great! First time having one and I think this was as authentic as it gets. Great prices for where it was located in relation to the strip.

This place is always delicious and hits the spot. Bulguli Bimbap,  Salmon poppers, and Tuna Kimbap. I cannot lie,  this is my favorite place to bring my friends. The waiters are attentive and the ambiance is chill. It's never a bad idea to get Korean BBQ and gangnam is the place to go.  It might sound like an advertisement,  but it's not.  This place is truly this great. 

Go here, bring a group, and have a blast.  Make your meat to you're liking on your personal grill.
Stopped by here for our last meal before leaving Vegas, awesome Korean Bbq with a large variety of meats.

Great place off the strip! Literally only 5 minute drive from PH. We came here before our flight leaving Vegas based on yelp reviews. It was such a good decision to come here as we were just in time for happy hour! Happy hour on a Sunday (bomb!!!) after a long night out = pure happiness!!!!! The servers were friendly, food was delicious. Everything is small plates only, similar to Gyu Kaku.

We tried pretty much everything from the HH menu, the spicy pork & beef toro & pork belly were our favorites for the meats. Steamed dumplings, seaweed salad were also good too. This place is definitely worth the try if you don't want AYCE bbq. Can't wait to come back again if I'm in the area!

Came in for a late dinner during the week. The restaurant is in a strip center and parking was easy to secure.

The interior of the place is decorated modern and has 2 flat screens to watch your fave sporting event. Each table has a grill to cook your food. My Hawaiian waitress was friendly and sweet but for a Korean joint I was disappointed the only banchan you receive is Kim chi. I ordered shrimp with head on and sliced prime rib beef. My order  didn't include miso soup and steamed rice so there was an up charge. I did enjoy the three dipping sauces for the entrees which were ponzu, sweet and a spicy sauce. The beef was tender but it was a only 4 ounces for $11.95 The shrimp was decent but was priced at $5.95 for 4 pcs and were on the small side and I've had fresher.

Overall I thought the decor and service was solid, but the food fell short on value and quality and don't think I would return.

Second time coming here and quality and value still as good as the first. We were a group of 5 people. We got the gangnam for two people and added extra meat to it and it was enough for all of us.  

Service is awesome and fast. Servers were attentive and friendly. Never felt bad to stop anyone and ask for a favor. Willing to come back!

WE WERE SURPRISED

**2016 Yelp 100 Challenge #9**

The place was empty & we were seated right away.  They have a PRIVATE dining area as well.  The place looked clean but I was a bit EH because I looked up & the filtration grills looked absolutely DISGUSTINGLY dusty & oily.  To the point I was scared that the dust might fall into my food....  I used to work at a  ASIAN BBQ joint so it literally looked like they haven't cleaned it for a month.  =[ 

The service was quick & fast but definitely would say they could work on smiling a bit?  Ahahahah our server was AWSOME though cuz we also knew her from the sushi resteraunt that we love so much in north Vegas!  (The second time we went the service was definitely slower even though there was no one in the place...  Like asking for water and side dishes multiple time from different people before receiving.  So maybe need a little work on the employees). 

The quality of the meat was SURPRISINGLY good! They are a Korean joint but they have the concept kind of like Japanese BBQ in style of serving.  You get a whole bunch of side dishes like any Korean resteraunt & the side dishes aren't bad at all.  They were a good amount & good quality for the amount of money you pay I would say.  I can't really say the other dishes were that great as for the NORMAL palate....  I would have to say it is a bit on the SALTIER side...  But I LOVED IT.

PRIME GALBI $8.95 - just straight up melts in your damn mouth! 

HARAMI MISO $8.95 - this is out skirt steak & loved the extra miso flavor. 

GARLIC SHRIMP W/ HEAD $5.95 - what a steal. On the price I personally think for jumbo shrimp at only $6 bux & it is lightly seasoned w/ garlic. 

ENOKI W/BACON $4.95 - no difference but you do get a lot of enoki mushrooms which is great & you get 4 pieces. 

ASPARAGUS W/ BACON $4.95
KABOCHA SQUASH $2.95 

BROCCOLI $3.95 - this comes inside a foil already steamed for you to finish off on the grill to give a little char. 

PORK TORO $5.95 - ummmmm my FAVORITE part of the pork & you get it at pretty much a $1 a slice!  Where as most places I have been to it is $2 a slice 

SPICY TUNA KIMBAP $6.95 - this is literally see weed wrapped rice & then tempura battered.  It has the PERFECT chewy texture like mochi & then stopped off w/ spicy Mayo tuna! 

CHILI SPICY WINGS $6.95 - this is what typical Korean wings taste like & I love it. 

SPICY SOFT TOFU SOUP $9.95 - I absolutely CRAVE this damn soup....  I'm sure there is some crack in it...  & doesn't really taste like your typical Korean spicy soft tofu soup but I loved it!
Extremely fast and friendly service! Would definitey recommend the korean kalbi and duckbreast. Wouldngo again

Let me first start out with the fact that I love Korean BBQ and this is no exception. My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this little off the strip hidden gem when we went to try and go off the strip to get an ear piercing. We didn't get the piercing, but we ended up eating a fantastic dinner.

We got there just in time for happy hour so we definitely had to take advantage of this sweet deal. We ordered the Chicken Karaage, Steamed Chili Dumplings, and then the Spicy Pork, Beef Toro, Pork Belly and Bulgogi for the BBQ aspect of it. Since it was so cheap, we ended up ordering about 3 or 4 of each of the meat items.

They also had beers on happy hour too, so we took advantage of those as well. We got a pitcher of beer and a bottled soju. I mean, we were at a Korean restaurant so we had to go with the soju.

The service here is wonderful and the food was awesome. Whenever I am back in Vegas I will be coming here!

FOOD:  overall tasty and fresh with most of the basic side dishes as standard.

SERVICE:  is friendly and professional.  They check in fairly regularly and are responsive to requests.
We ordered both the meat lover and gangnam set and it was fantastic. Great service as well:)
My first time here and It was amazing! Everything is my favorite! Las vhas, gangnam and and meat lovers! Coming back and takingg more friends!

This is such an addicting place. 

I looooove going here, especially for lunch. They have really good deals! I'm one of those girls who can't really eat A LOT so this is the place to go. It's pretty cheap for a la carte especially since I don't eat that much. Their meat is really good quality. Comparing it to other AYCE bbq places is definitely not even close. 

The week that I found out about this place, I went like 4 times again after that. I wanted to bring everyone to it and show them how good it is! I feel like it's definitely hidden, but it's right next to UNLV so it's convenient when I don't know what to eat, I usually suggest here for a quick lunch.

Meat I always order: Bulgolgi, Beef toro, Brisket, and Bacon wrapped Salmon.
I always get their steamed egg too. BEST steamed egg I've ever had in my life!

Their three different sauces are to die for and they're great! They also give you lemon for your beef tongue! Really tasty!

The lunch special comes with rice, miso soup, and salad. The salad is huge! And it's reasonably priced at lunch, so do try to come in for lunch!

Their desserts are SO good too! We've had the green tea and vanilla ice cream. Their sundae's come with little pocky sticks too! MM What a great idea!!!

I definitely recommend this place if you're trying to find some prime meat!

Service is AMAZING. The staff are so friendly and accommodating. 
Most definitely a 5 star place.
First timer to a Korean grill.. Loved the experience.. The jalapeños poppers with salmon was amazing!  If you are in Vegas definitely give it a try

We were there having lunch while in Vegas for our cousin's wedding. Food was amazing and our server BACK was very sweet and friendly, and really made the difference on our experience. MUST VISIT!!!! 
Save room for dessert, cause macaroon Ice Cream is a MUST :)

This place is not as flexible when it comes to AYCE and the seating was very tight. The food was mediocre and the staff was slow. I don't want to go into much detail but the prices are pretty high for the amount of set food served. I will give them 2 stars for trying though and I believe that is pretty generous.

Great lunch, amazing cuts of meats, and very friendly service! I would get the meat lovers combo---6 cuts of really tender meat. My party also ordered a variety of noodle dishes, chicken sukiyaki being the best!
The food here is really good and the service is excellent. Hope to come here again when in Las Vegas!
Great place! They brought us everything on time and had good customer service! The Las Vegas for four people was plenty food with all sides included

First time I came here was with my cousin, and then they already got me hooked on their happy hour menu. Then just yesterday me and my boyfriend came in and we found out happy hour is all day PLUS buy one get one free beer?! Hell yeahhh! (:
We ordered the: salmon carpaccio, korean kalbi, karage, calamari. I highly recommend all of them. 
Owner is nice, server was nice and atmosphere was pretty upbeat. 
Definitely worth the 30 min drive from my house even tho I have a korean bbq 5mins away. 

my new favorite korean bbq

Love this place! The atmosphere is great, love the decor. The BBQ at the table is so fun! All the food they bring out is really fresh and they give you lots of sides and sauces to mix it all with. Really great place for a date or going with friends. It's fun and interactive and the food is delicious! Can't wait to come back!!
Great meal, best Korean bbq in Vegas, - got the meat lovers, highly recommended. Generous portions and quick service.
Food is really really good here. Excellent service and not too far from strip. One of the best korean BBQ I have ever tried, and definitely the best korean BBQ in Las Vegas.
Awesome service, amazing happy hour and great variety of healthy choices!  My favorites are the steak toro, broccoli, corn, mushrooms and free sides!
Best food we've had thus far on our trip to vegas! Better than the Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars. Would not recommend the seafood, but I wouldn't recommend it anywhere in Las Vegas. Really satisfied!

It took me a while to come around and this is specifically a review for their happy hour. The rating makes sense. Especially compared to gyu Kaku, their lunch deal is great but gangnam happy hour is better. And I like that their meats actually come unmarinated. The portion sizes are large for a single person and they actually include the side dishes. So if you somehow are making a choice between here happy hour and gyu Kaku lunch, pick here. Geography might make that a bit of a challenge though.

Loved the spicy chicken option for BBQ. Cream cheese wontons were great. Didn't enjoy the shrimp and calamari as much- bit too bland for my taste. The biggest pro of this place is the free macaron sandwich with yelp check in
This place was super yummy! Kinda reminded me of gyu kaku but the flavor is much better than theirs!! And the macaroon ice cream was yummy in my tummy!!
This place is awesome, my favorite happy hour spot and the staff are very approachable and helpful :)

My family used to live LA and there were so many great KBBQ places in KTown. With that being said, I enjoyed this place so much. They had excellent food and great service! The food is priced very well but the only reason why I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because we asked them to cook our food in the kitchen but they didn't because the kitchen is expected to be very busy. Other than that, I was very impressed with this restaurant!

Found this place based off all the 5 star reviews found on Yelp. I'm sorry, yes I have to give this place 3 stars and not the shiny bright 5 stars that everyone else has provided. Don't get me wrong, the food was absolutely delicious. The pitcher of sangria was absolutely amazing. The price for the amount of food you get when you order off of their combos was definitely decently priced, but the service... my visit was at 1:00PM on a Friday and there was 1 table  with guests dining there. We walked in and kind of stood by the door waiting for someone to come greet us. It seems like the entire staff was on their break or something. Perhaps I am not with the Vegas lifestyle, and people don't come in to eat at 1:00 PM? Maybe we missed the lunch rush? Was no one working? It took a bit for someone to seat us. After we sat down, it was like they forgot we were there. We had to get up and find someone to explain the menu, take our order, change our grill, and re-fill our water. This place is definitely delicious, but service at 1:00 PM was not the fast and friendly service I had read in all these reviews.
First time here and I'm impressed by the price, location, decor and especially the food in a positive way. Great side dishes and awesome early happy hour on drinks.
Food is great and good value for happy hour. Get the fuzu cocktail it's really good. Free macaroon ice cream sandwich if you rate them :)

Woohoo, I never knew there was a Korean BBQ place this close to UNLV. 

The interior is quite authentic with its red walls and wooden window frames. There are both booths and regular tables that fit up to 6 people. The tables are a little wide for my taste, since it puts a big distance between customers sitting across from each other, but over all, it is a comfortable setting. 

My friend and I came in during happy hour. We ordered $16 worth of food, which was more than enough for us. The meat was top-notch quality, and I actually liked all of the the sauces they have here. The side dishes were plentiful. As always, I loved the fish cake. 

The service was fast, attentive, and efficient. I will definitely be back here for Korean BBQ, even though they are not all-you-can-eat.
Best Korean BBQ that I have eaten in Vegas.  We ordered the Gangnam #1 Package.  Highly recommended...
Just got into town and had to try this place. The ambiance is really nice and the food was amazing. Definitely would recommend to friends and family!

Try the top appetizers! 

The pork cheek is really good with the extra topping and lettuce.
The environment in general is very nice and a lot of Asian elements here and there. Not a log distance from the airport and easy accessible!

Took my parents to this place. The restaurant doesn't have very strong smell of bbq which is nice. It's also clean and well-decorated. We ordered the Gangnam combo. The size is perfect for three of us (my mom prefers vegetables so she mostly had appetizers and salad). Will recommend this place to anyone who likes Asian food.
Seriously love this place.  Come here every time I'm in Vegas and it never disappoints.  If you are looking for good eats and a good atmosphere this is your spot.

It's the best Korean place in Las Vegas. The bbq is rly fun and tasty. Also the bibimbap was served by a guy instead of regularly present to you and eat it by yourself. Will come again if come to Vegas.
Great quality meat selections. We selected the Gangnam package and it was plenty for both of us but we devour every bit. Love the mushrooms. Definitely recommended!
Best happy hour! Can't beat the prices for a late night bite. Spicy pork is a must order. The service is quick too.

Yessssssssssssss
This was awesome we got the meat lovers for 4 ppl and it was an awesome experience

Decided to come here on a whim with some friends for lunch, and I'm so glad we did!  We ordered the meat lover's set and a couple of noodle dishes.  The meat was delicious and tender and the spicy seafood ramen was amazing.  Will definitely be back when I'm in the area again!

We chose the Gangnam special for two. It was WAY too much for two people! It was like 6 kinds of meat, three side dishes, and about 6 little sample-sized bowls of seasoned veggies. It also came with a large salad. The environment was fun, you get to cook your food on a grill at the table. I'd say the amount of food for two would be better for 4! We are not from Vegas but I would definitely go back again, but if we did we would probably order off the a la carte menu and pick the meats we really enjoyed like the filet, or the seasoned flank steaks.
First time here and the food was delicious, great service too. Highly recommended. We will be back again soon!
Awesome bbq in las vegas!!! The meat is very fresh! Will come again, again and again!
This place had good Korean barbecue that was in Las Vegas. I liked the food and meat that was served here.

The food is delightful.  I loved the meat and I'm a rather picky eater.  My absolute favorite was the marbled high end meat, Kobe beef, basically everything was fresh cut and I love how the thin meat got somewhat crispy. I would definitely recommend eating it with rice to anyone who is planning on eating here.  There was great service ( kind waiters who check up on how your meal is every once in a while and are not aggressive ) and they had a huge selection of foods to grill / cook. Compared to other restaurants I've eaten at, this restaurant has very quick service which is very convenient because I tend to get hangry ( angry because I'm hungry ). The restaurant was cleaner than a ton of other Asian restaurants. Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining is an overall 5 star restaurant.  I do not eat much most times BUT at this restaurant I ate more than usual and I'm so full I could konk out and fall asleep right where I am.

This was an exceptional good meal. Came here based off fantastic Yelp reviews and Yelpers didn't disappoint! I love the atmosphere and cook it yourself at the table. Ordered a few different things for table and had a blast. Everything was amazing. Cheese wontons and their sweet & sour was out of this world! 

Tried the chicken, beef, bacon asparagus. Fantastic. Worth a stop here if you're in the area.
The chicken fried rice is amazing! Also I recommend the sweet corn as a side. They also bring you several little appetizers that are interesting and tasty.

This place is cool but I wish they could pay more attention to the customer. I understand they are busy, but we had to constantly ask for attention. The food was pretty good and there was a wide variety of different meats. The prices were higher than expected for food we had to cook ourselves. Good place overall.
I used to come here years ago when it was Santoki...now it is even better!! The food was delicious and inventive!! This is my new favorite Korean BBQ and I will be back with all my peeps.
Beef toro is good, especially for kids. And, definitely, we love the free desert. All beef meat are good.
Unreal.  Don't waste your time on the strip at a chain eatery. This place is great!  Trust your servers. They are very knowledgeable.
First visit at this place. All experience is good. Food is great. try their Kobe style beef. Which is very tender and delicious. Also service is very friendly too.
BEST KBBQ IN VEGAS! Quality meat and such a wide variety. I've been to Korea 7 times and I can honestly say this is the best I've had in the United States. Would definitely recommend this place!

Awesome Korean food joint. Service was great, food was great, just be prepared to eat...alot! Jin was especially cool - those ice cream macaroons at the front door were delicious! Big fan, and will come again.

Very close to the University of Nevada, Las Vegas, so it's good for students that are craving for Korean barbecue. But the price is kind of expensive for the amount of meat given. The servers don't really check up on your table so you have to go chasing for the servers to get what you want. Also, when I ordered the fried calamari, you can't really taste or feel the calamari inside. It's more of batter than the squid itself. Lastly, I'm more on the shorter side, so the chairs were kind of too far so I kept having to move forward to reach the table. Since the service we received was not good, we did not leave a tip so while we were waiting for our uber, one of the servers, came outside and asked if service was bad, and we responded by saying "it was alright" and he was like "I was just asking because you guys didn't leave a tip". How rude of him to chase us for a tip when service was bad. NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN.
The miso soup is on point. The soft tofu soup looks like melted cheese. Yum. So good. Get the yuzu soju.

I've come back to Gangham BBQ after a year because it's simply the best Korean BBQ I've ever had!  So much food for the money, and the meat is lean and tasty. I love the filet mignon, and the bulgogi surprised me with how tasty it was!

This is my go-to restaurant whenever I'm in Las Vegas. My kids always beg me to take them here, and we are never disappointed. They are very considerate to my dietary restrictions, and they provide high quality meats and sides for a low price with a radiating ambiance. if you are in the area, make visiting this restaurant a priority.
Amazing food!!!! Fast service great meat loved the Korean Kalbi and bulgogi. Nice atmosphere and pretty good bathroom. One of the best Korean places I've ever been to.  A treasure of Vegas!
Just landed in Vegas and we decided to eat here for lunch. I didn't know what to try but decided on bulgogi.  It was very good!!!
Great customer service, staffs are excellent, place is clean and inviting, easy to find. Many different food selections, lots of food, so be sure to come with an empty stomach.
Delicious,good service,food come fast, hot enough ~I like original bibim,bbq also good!!this restaurant is good value !!

Not even open a week, this restaurant has problems with kitchen efficiency and with service. It's almost like they all just showed up and started doing things without any prior conversation or coordination.

They haven't got a liquor license yet and still they won't allow patrons to bring their own wine! 
Now that's just dumb. Virtually every other restaurant in town, and especially the ones with no liquor license will allow corkage.

I asked if they'll allow corkage once they DO get a license, and the answer was "we'll take it under advisement". 

Well, I've got news for these guys: I'll take it under advisement as to whether I ever return.

Short version: the best korean BBQ in Las Vegas, though not quite as good as Kang Ho Dong in LA (but then again, what is?).

Took my parents here for their anniversary, and again came back a few days ago with my friend. It is very well situated on Paradise and Harmon, in a plaza with lots of parking and easy access. The establishment is clean and well lit, unlike some of the all-you-can-eat korean BBQ's around here. Staff were kind and helpful, and often go out of their way to help you even when times are busy. The grills are also clean, and appear well maintained. The only thing that I wished they did more was that the staff cooked the meats for you, like Kang Ho Dong, so that the meats are perfectly cooked if you're not very experienced in cooking yourself. That being said, our server was kind enough to go out of his way to cook for us several times.

We ordered the premium prix fixe for 4 ($160), which comes with the following:

Starter
Kobe Beef Carpaccio - was absolutely delicious. I'm not usually a fan of carpaccio, but they marinated the meat very well. It was a bit oily I thought, but the flavor was just right. My parents are not crazy about raw meat, so I pretty much finished all of it by myself.

Tuna Poke - standard poke

Fresh Oyster - was surprisingly good. Fresh without hints of fishiness. I didn't get any bits of the shell at all, which is nice because a lot of other places have it. They put some tobiko and small amount of what I think is sriracha on it, which I think really enhances the flavor.

Green Salad - standard salad

Shrimp Bibimbap - standard bibimbap

Miso Soup - standard miso soup

BBQ dishes
Kobe Style Beef - was very good, but I personally don't like my meat this fatty.

Korean Prime Kalbi - The second best after the harami miso. It was very well marinated and the meat was just the right amount of chewiness and texture. I heard the regular prime kalbi (non marinated) is even better, and will have to try it next time I come.

Harami Miso - absolutely fantastic, the best out of the meats I've had. The marinate was perfect, not too salty. The meat was amazing, a perfect combination of meat and fat. It will just melt in your mouth, then allow you to roll your eyes back and moan.

Filet Mignon - was a good filet, but I thought there were better meats. The cut was kind of large for my liking, which takes awhile to cook. It was very lean but still tender.

Scallop - typical scallop

Shrimp - typical shrimp. I was kind of surprised that they have shrimp here, but I'm guessing they're trying to do the "surf and turf" thing with their meats.

Asparagus/mushrooms - the enoki mushroom was actually very good. They come precooked inside a wrapped foil, but you can heat it up some more on top of the grill. It was a bit too much butter for my own taste.

Since the table is not setup with ssamjang (korean spicey dipping sauce), and gireumjang (sesame and salt dipping sauce) I recommend that you ask for it. The standard 3 flavors they set up for you is good, but I thought the ssamjang and gireumjang brought out the meat's flavor more.

We also got the macaron ice cream sandwiches at the end, and they were also very good. I liked the vanilla flavor most.

Overall, I was very pleased with my experience. I will never go back to the all-you-can-eat korean BBQ's here in town again after this. It is totally worth the money, and even then it's very fairly priced. Will definitely come back time after time!
Great place for Korean BBQ when visiting Las Vegas. Good value and price. Good service!

This place was great! Had to heck out why the reviews were so high and this place does not disappoint!! We got the Premium for 2 and we're stuffed!!! The skirt steak was incredible when you dip in the sweet sauce your given. The Kobe, albeit good, is not certified as Kobe beef; it is wagyu beef. Other than that, come here if you love food in general! Amazing!!

I was so pleased with their service and attentiveness. Wow! I will definitely come again and even invite my friends.   Let them know its your birthday and they will give you a free plate of prime slice.

Group of six, we got the kangnam combination and it was plentyyyy of food. The bibimbab was delish, the miso soup was really tasty, the meats were well marinated. The oysters were okay. The service is fantastic and attentive.
First time having Korean BBQ, really enjoyed it! Wonderful selection, great service and yummy food. Very highly recommend!!!

I'm really sad I haven't been to this place before! After years of going to UNLV, I've always been going to west side to satisfy my cravings for Asian cuisine.
My group of friends usually like to go to AYCE KBBQ so this was definitely a nice place that gave more quality than quantity.
I'll definitely be back to try their other choices of meats.

I like the spicy Tofu soup best! Others are also good!
Decent and delicious Korean foods!
This place is amazing , I really recommend this joint , quality meats and friendly service , I had the Toro and spicy pork , and the spicy chicken was really good ....

Best Korean BBQ. Thanks to yelp we found this restaurant .we visited and stayed    on the strip but wanted good Korean food
We were not disappointed! Quite te opposite! We ordered a meat lovers meal for 4 people,all meat was delicious,specially the filet,great quality.
Love the for two people combo. The quantity is huge and meat quality is pretty good! We also had the kimchi bibimbap and it was also pretty good. Also I loved the music played here!

Came here on a Saturday night with a party of 6 without a reservation, and was seated within 30 minutes. The host at the front counter was really apologetic, but we were not bothered at all. We did walk  in after all. We went with the a la carte items as there were some items in the set menus that we weren't really interested in. Portions for the a la carte items were a bit small, but it wasn't a huge issue for us as it gave us a chance to try more of the different dishes.

Our favorite meats were the pork belly and beef toro. Actually ended up getting multiple orders of each. Spicy tofu soup was also good with a nice spicy kick.

As for the service, everyone was really friendly and our water was consistently filled. Food came out at a constant pace.

Overall, I would recommend this kbbq joint if you want a break from all the burger and steak joints on the Vegas strip.
Super yummy BBQ! Good mix of Korean and Japanese BBQ flavored. Close proximity to Hard Rock Hotel, will be back on next trip!
Very very delicious bbq place to eat. Both food and service is favorable. highly recommend.

Liked how they were open late and also had happy hour specials after 10 pm. We really liked the bulgogi and Korean prime kalbi. They were marinated very flavorfully. The mushroom medley and sweet corn were also very good. Would definitely keep this place on my list of late night eats or when IIA just craving korean barbecue.
Was craving some Kbbq so we came to check it out~~~ must say one of the best in Vegas so far!!!
Tried prime kalbi and soft tofu soup! Was actually pretty surprised how good they were!  It is definitely one of my favorite asian restaurant in vegas so far!
First time here. Waitresses are really nice. Food is excellent. Definitely will come back

Great food. great service. Friendly environment
Easy reservation
Try try the tuna kimbab. Really great
Also the grilled food is delicious

Mmmm. Very filling & delicious meal before Day 2 of EDC! My group had 5 people, and surprisingly... a 4 person set was almost too much food! Very awesome selection of meats + sides. Highly recommended. :)

Excellent side dishes! Lots of meat when you order the gangnam special! The meat was high quality and the bulgogi is a must! I recommend ordering the shared meats as you will have a variety of choices! 
I would definitely come back here again!
Food was awesome as always and the waiter Back was quick and friendly. He always refilled our drinks and asked if we needed anything. Great place for happy hour!!
Great experience at Gangnam! Excellent food quality, and awesome service. Will definitely be returning!
Delicious. Forgot I was in Vegas and thought I was in ktown Los Angeles for a second (without the long wait). Just wish they had rice paper but over all good food and friendly service

I love the Harami Miso the outside skirt steak. Highly recommended. The others grilled beefs are also delicious. The whole family liked it. I love this place I will definitely go back next time I'm in Vegas!

The food here is fantastic. Despite being awful at using chopsticks/generally not having any sort of understanding of Korean food, I split the meat lovers for two with two other guys and left feeling stuffed. It's absolutely a spot I would come back to if I visit Vegas again.
Delicious food and great service. We got meat lovers for 2 people and it would have been enough to feed 3-4. Would definitely come here again for my next Vegas trip.

Craving for some bbq and found this restaurant on Yelp.  Though I'm accustomed to all you can eat prices, we chose a la carte.  The plates of meat were smaller portions but plenty for me and my husband.  The sides were tasty, the meat tender, and happy hour prices were great.  Loved the fried calamari.  Great location, nice ambiance, and close to the strip.

Great flavor on the meat.  You can tell they definitely use good quality meat.  The Kobe carpaccio was awesome!  Service was spotty at first but then got better.   Ordered a la carte but the sets were definitely cheaper.  Would do that next time. 

They kinda nickel and dime you for stuff like sauces and things that typically go with stuff, but all in all.  Pretty decent.
First time here, after the strip buffet here is a good place to try. Really good meat, we love it!

Food is phenomenal, service is second to none. We feel very lucky that we found this place. We almost made another hotel restaurant mistake.

We had the meat lover sampler for two, it was excellent.
Meats was on point, so tender and flavorful. Premium cuts for 2, but more than enough for 3 of us. Atmosphere is cool and cozy. Very friendly staff. Great meal for lunch.

We're on our way back to San Diego and stopped by to try this restaurant.  We had the Meat Lovers with 2 extra orders of kobe meat.  It was delicious!  Thanks Kristen for the great service ... we'll be back!!!!

Found this place on Yelp and it had really good ratings! I think it def lived up to expectations. We are not from Vegas, but if we ever come back we would for sure revisit! We got two orders of Kalbi short ribs, one order of the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, one order of bulgogi, and one order of pork belly. We were truly stuffed. We would've went with the meat lovers combo or the Las Vegas combo for two, but it would've been way too much for us. 
All in all, great place, good atmosphere, clean and good service.
This place is awesome !!! Happy hour is the beez neez! Awesome service and food. Best experience I have had at a Korean grill!!
Awesome food!! Absolutely loved the uni bibimbap and beef tongue! I've never seen uni bibimbap anywhere. The meat portion is extra generous!
The food was very tasty and decently priced! They have really good service. The staff constantly checks if everything is going okay. It's a clean environment. I'm super full!

Great BBQ. Super tender beef, perfect with beer. 
We ordered meat lover for 4, we were all super full, didn't expect they have this much food.
100% worth to visit. Quick seat, but recommend to make a reservation first.

So glad I tried this place for dinner!  You get a lot of food for what you pay and the service is prompt and courteous. We did the meat lovers for two, and it came with soup, salad, rice and dumplings to start. Then out came 6-7 different types of meat. The spicy pork and pork belly were my favorites!
My favorite restaurant by far. I'm in love with their Spicy Tuna and Bi Bim Bap! I definitely have them at the top of my list of go to places to eat!
Very good food and quality of food. Went with a party of 5, so we split the Gangnam meal meant for 6 people. It was A LOT of food! And definitely worth it. Would recommend to anybody!
One of the best kbbq around! Korean prime Kalbi was amazing!! Sides are great quality. And you can't beat their quick and fast service.

Request Andrew! He answered every question my difficult friend had with a smile, even though we got here 30 minutes before close.

The food was phenomenal, the Kobe steak was well priced and better than the 5 star restaurant I worked at in my home town. Be prepared to grill it yourself!

Food and service was great. Would def recommend it!!
The marinated short ribs and the bulgogi were fantastic.

Friendly servers and great food!

Free dessert if you write a review! ^_^

I'd recommend kimchi soup!
This food was amazing!  Meat, upon meat, upon meat. We definitely could've fed 8 with the 6 person but our eyes were bigger than our stomachs.

They offer free dessert for a review which is, I believe, why it is so highly rated. 

Depends what you are looking for; reasonably priced, tasty food, this is an option. 

Fine dining with ambience; probably not the right place.
