Great meal and service.  Would come again.  Whether it's cold noodle or bbq, it is very good quality.  This is my second visit and this restaurant is the best I've been to in Vegas.  Make sure you stop by this place if you plan on visiting las Vegas.
First time coming here. Highly recommended. Good food, reasonbly priced. Will totally come back here again!!
What a find! Delicious and absolutely filling! A family of 3 shared the Las Vegas and it was more than enough food and fun to cook. We will be back!

I gave this experience five stars. 
It is A really good restaurant. 
The service here is very decent. 
Their location is very close to the hotel area. 
Overall
Excellent meat. Tender juicy. Highly recommend the harami miso and the spicy tofu. For bbq wise sweet corn is also not bad
Ordered the gangnam special for two. It was amazing... love the kobe beef. Service was good and price is reasonable. would recommend this place to my friends and family

Dinner. Table for 4.

Korean BBQ is great for dates, groups of friends or anyone who is NOT in a hurry and loves food. It really forces you to take your time, pace your eating and engage in conversation!

I like when my Korean BBQ spots are dimmed with spot lights at each table. The menu was easy to read and the service was very friendly. They were great with answering questions and once we ordered, food just steadily start coming out. You know it's going to be good when there is a struggle to find space on the table because there is sooooo much goodness.

Along with banchan, we got bibimbap, edamame, miso soup, house salad and dipping sauce. The meats were deliciously marinated and we had a great time.

I love this place! It gets a little pricey if you have a big appetite, but everything was very flavorful and delicious. We weren't sure what to order, so we chose the best sellers or ones that were recommended. My favorite was the chicken with lemon sauce, and either the #1 or #2...can't remember which one was which anymore :(. The salmon carpaccio was really good too! It's pretty much salmon sashimi with ponzu sauce. We also liked the japchae...very flavorful and full of assorted veggies. 

The filet mignon was tough and chewy so we didn't' enjoy it as much. The spicy tuna kimbap was okay...there was too much rice for me. I didn't realize it's just spicy tuna over deep fried rice. We also ordered the yuzu soju, but it tasted watered down. I was kind of skeptical because the menu shows that its yellow...but the one we got was clear (like the lemon soju)

I would definitely come again if I was in Vegas. Our hotel was on the strip, so the cab ride was only about 15 minutes...I think it cost around $13-16.

First of all this place is great for the price. If you want to get away from the strip to enjoy great Korean food you have to try this place! The Meat Lover's meal was super worth it. The service was great! Very attentive!
The ramen here is delicious and the atmosphere is good. Really enjoy eating here. I really hope I could live here. Only cons might be food is a little small in quantity

This place isn't all you can eat, however the serving sizes and the portions are perfect! I went with a party of three and we ordered, prime kalbi, pork belly, filet mignon, bacon wrapped enoki, bulgogi, scallops, beef toro, spicy garlic edamame, oysters, spicy tuna kimbap, Kobe beef carpaccio, salmon carpaccio, seafood pancakes, and steamed egg. Yes all for 3 people and it was perfect. Every order we made, came out to an even split of meats for each of us. The quality of the menu items are superb as well! Great place for go-to KBBQ!

Great BBQ. Service is fast and with a smile.  You get 3 unique sauces for your BBQ.  Set plates are plenty for the number of people you order for.  The place doesn't smoke up so there is good ventilation and a nice environment with plenty of space between tables.  Seats could be comfier though.
Best place ever for Korean barbecue and beer Kobe beef is awesome the service is awesome atmosphere is really good and thank you for the free ice cream

That was the best meal we have had since being in Las Vegas by far!  Strip mall off of the Strip!  The meal for two is way more than two!  It was the best BBQ west of Texas!  Awesome Awesome!  Will be back next time we visit Vegas!

Great service upon entering right up until the very end. It wasn't too busy and we were given a huge table for only the 2 of use pretty soon, the entire table was covered with the complimentary dishes and the rest of our order of:

x SUN DU BU ($9.95 with rice) The best I've ever had and I've had a lot. The calamari was so soft too although there ended up being too much calamari to soup ratio.
x STEAMED EGG ($4.95) this was not very good as it was over-steamed and not silky as it usually is at other restaurants. 
x HARAMI MISO ($8.95) This was really succulent and tasty. Must order!
x KOREAN PRIME KALBI ($8.95) This was tasty although a bit too fatty for my liking. 

The lettuce is $2 but it is so fresh and crispy, it is a must for complimenting the bbq meat.

Rate them on Yelp and you get a free dessert. We got the Mocchi which was OMG.

We were so full at the end but the prices were so reasonable. I would definitely be here more often if I wasn't a tourist.
Great! Food. Yummy... Nom nom nom... Best bacon wrapped asparagus dipped in cheese fondue!!

The first time I have come to this restaurant. It is so impressive and the food is so good for me to eat because I like Korean food. If people want to eat Korean food in Las Vegas, let come to Gangnam Asian BBQ Dinning. They serve our food really well. The servants are really good and lovely. I like this restaurant. The atmosphere in here is really Korea if everyone likes Korea. Just come here and eat.
Came here twice during my trip in Vegas. Love the food，and it's value for money. I also like the service!
Excellent Yakiniku style spot. Meat was super tender and well marinated. Service was fast and friendly. Gangnam style platter was plenty for four guys.

Pay cash! BEWARE of thieves!!!!! Keep your receipt and check the final processed cost... Shame shame shame. I was fooled by appearances. At first what I thought was good friendly service was fake after all. After checking my bank statement, I realized that the waitress decided to give herself an extra tip on top of the tip we wrote on the check. 

Honestly I'm disappointed because the food was good and the service seemed friendly at the time.. It's a shame the waitress is a thief and ruined the experience

Really good Korean bbq at a reasonable price!! Came on a Saturday around 5 pm for happy hour /early dinner. I suggest getting the premium bbq combo for 2 (actually feeds 3 if you had one or two additional items). They have kobe beef!!

Let me start off by saying this is the best Asian bbq place I've ever been to and being from NYC, I've had my share. 
We stumbled upon this place after getting a tattoo at Revolt next door and omg, it was delicious!! We ordered the premium dinner for two and not only did it satisfy my steak craving, we have leftovers to take with us. 

The service was fantastic from the second we walked in until we left and my sister and I totally enjoyed ourselves, I'm just sorry there isn't a place like this back home.

不管是小菜還是主菜口味都很棒!我點的辣雞肉肉質非常鮮嫩，而且醬汁都很合口味，很清爽!
服務生都很和善又服務周到!重點是價格很實惠!
很高興能在拉斯維加斯吃到這樣的餐廳!

This is Korean and Japanese fusion restaurant. I visted during happy hour and beef toro (brisket) and pork belly is only $4. Portion is little bit small but I could try various variety of meat at cheap price.
Great service and great food! We got the #1 best seller Gangnam, strongly recommended! Came during happy hour and ordered more dishes at a discounted price.

All of the side dishes were good alongside with the marinated Korean BBQ.

The service was good, too.

Good quality food. Servers were very nice. 

Chicken with cheese was interesting. Definitely a new concept to me. Very good though

I was very puzzled at how this place can get a 4.5 stars until I saw on the ad on the dining table that you get free desserts if you review on Yelp. That explained the rating well for me.

I would have given it a 2 star if it was located in LA. But I believe different city should have different standards especially with Asian food. 

The food itself wasn't that bad , it was random. The brisket definitely was the worst I ever had in any k bbq place. It was thick and watery.  Steam egg = 1/10.  Fried yakisoba = 2/10 - the noodle was edible , but the beef was not.  However to be fair, the other meat plates were good, especially the prime rib - one of the best I ever had in kbbq. 

Now the service. There was no service. Never refilled our soda, never attempted to change our grill plate despite it being totally unusable, and I saw they saw how dirty it was, but they just passed by! If it was back in LA, the plate would have at least been changed 3-4 times. 
 
So all in all, will never go back , and won't recommend to anyone who truly enjoys kbbq.
Nice ambiance, friendly service, good lunch specials. Reasonable prices, If you leave a Yelp review you get a free dessert. Open late.
My friend took me here while visiting from out of town.  Though the staff was extremely busy, the food was excellent!  They had a good range of meat and veggie options.
Very good authentic Korean food.  Friendly service.  Decent price. Only thing is that your clothes will smell like Korean BBQ for the rest of the night.  Overall, Strongly recommend.
I come here first time so nice atmosphere around restaurant. Food delicious staff was nice. And good happy hours 3pm to 6pm and more.

Our favorite korean bbq restaurant in town! All the servers are very attentive, not once have we ever got bad service! Last time we were here we came in a big group (11 people) and the server even remember us a week after! Would definitely come back and refer to friends!
Loved this place! The food was huge portions, we ordered the meat lover for 4, and it could seriously feed 6. I would definitely recommend.
Found this place for lunch; close to aria. Meat looks great and the yelp reviews for desert was great incentive to post. The wait wasn't bad,  to be expected for a place with good ratings.
We ordered best seller combo and come with Large portions, it's yummy and fresh. Best Korean bbq ever
Best Korean bbq i have had in vegas. The meat is very flavorful. I highly recommend this place.

Back here again and I had an awesome experience! Better than the last one so I had to update my review! Our server was there for everything and they cooked it and cut the meat up most of the time for us! 

The first two sauces are amazing for anti spice people!! The first was more vinegar-y and the second was more BBQ-y ! The third sauce is kinda spicy !!!

Their beef bulgogi and toro are THE BEST! They have happy hour from 3-6pm and 10-close where you can get them for 4 dollars each and it's very filling !  This place is amazing
This is a pretty good Korean bbq restaurant with reasonable price!!! I will definitely come here again!!

everything is perfect!
meat is tender
I love the mushrooms! all the marinated meat are so good!
I liked it here! It is better than Sura's by spring mountain. We got the meat lovers for two and it was a decent amount in there and we are pretty big eaters. Servers were great!

OMG. I went with my boyfriend here and it was AMAZING!!! It was my first time ever having Korean BBQ, and I'm so glad I came here for my first time!!! David, our waiter, was so kind and very helpful. I will definitely come back!
菜的種類很多，味道很夠，服務親切，值得來吃。是朋友聚餐的好地方。而且打卡送馬卡龍冰淇淋，很棒 It's a awesome Korean BBQ place to go, I highly recommended, food is awesome and service is awesome. Everything is superb!!

My favorite place for Korean!  I usually go here for their BBQ, but lately I've been coming here to order off the menu.  They're soups and rice dishes are over-looked because, well of course, they're BBQ is freaking fantastic!  Everything is seasoned and flavored properly.  The service is extraordinary!  Although it's not "all you can eat," they have great packages for an inexpensive price... It divides out evenly the same price as its "AYCE" competitors.  The quality is better than the competitors too!

We ordered everything....
Prime Kalbi
Filet mignon
Beef Toro
Bulgogi
Pork belly
Premium tongue
Bottle of Reisling
And a bottle of Soju
Great time!!! Reminded me of S. Korea. Great service, great prices, overall the best so far stateside!
Thank u!!!
This is now our to go beef place in Vegas.  Their beef section is very good.  We ordered 5 different beef and 4 are just great.  Just skip the Toro, it looks fresh and good but isn't very tasty.
Had a good time here. Food came promptly. Loved their bibimbap and cream cheese wonton.
Clean atmosphere,  convenient location when you have a Korean BBQ craving while traveling to Vegas.
Came here two days in a rOW. Hands dosn best korean food in las vegas. My husband makes me eat pizza allcthe time socit really is a godsnd. Try the kimchi jjigae. It is heaven in a bowl.
Good Korean bbq at reasonable price. Fun experience cooking the meat yourself.

I've been meaning to talk about this place but I live in the bay area and forgot.  It's awesome...and my daughter Danielle likes it so enough said ya'll.  Service is prompt and quality of food is on point!  Small meat portions is a great concept.  We order to our hunger when hungry and often left with food we cannot eat, no matter how good.  This concept, tapas concept, is becoming more familiar everywhere but it's truly perfected here...quality is fantastic!  My second time here and I am more impressed than my first visit.

Awesome food and service. One of the best Korean I've had. I ordered Kalbi and Harami Miso - their #1 and #2 best sellers of BBQ. Having eaten Korean BBQ a lot, I can say that this one will rank in the top. Very tender, rightly spiced/marinated meat. Loved it.

After a long road trip through Utah on MDW, we needed some REAL food. After seeing the reviews on this place we knew we had to give it a try. 

We came here on a Sunday night on Memorial Day weekend around 8pm and waited exactly 45mins. That's not bad at all for a holiday weekend.. Not to mention their cool projector that plays music videos to pass time. 

Now onto the food, we went with the Gangnam combo, and little FYI, if you want to substitute something, as long as it's equal or lesser price.. YOU CAN!! We substituted our bulgogi for beef toro & yuzu for cream cheese wontons. 

Now onto the FOOD! I've been to many Kbbq and AYCE kbbq, I have to say,this place is pretty up there on my kbbq list! The meat quality here is very good, tender and tasty. I also like that it's NOT AYCE, the portions were more than enough and I was able to really enjoy the meats instead of stuff my face cause it's AYCE lol. 

As for service, everyone here moves fast! If I didn't live in CA, I'd definitely be back! 

*tip: write a review and get a free dessert! Win win for everyone!

Great service, great food. Perfect if you're a little buzzed. I think you should go here.

Free dessert!  Holla!  Give me my dessert
It was good. the food tasted good especially the original bibimbap and yukgejang. You get free macaron ice cream when you leave a review.

Just ate here for the first time and the food was pretty good! The portion size is fair, and the dinner for 2 is good enough for 3 people. The quality of meat was great, and once you order the food comes out instantly! Overall a pretty good experience (:
Best Korean bbq on Vegas!! I've had the other places in Vegas, but this place has the best quality meat.

The waiter was superb!!! Jihoon I believe according to the receipt. The food was excellent!!! We ordered the gangnam for 2 for a family of 3 with leftovers to box. Since we came out of town, we asked for a side of kimchi to take back to the hotel and they were more than welcome to do so. They gave us a tub of kimchi and extra utensils to use after. The meat was tender, juicy, and flavorful. They even had brown rice for our little one. But I would say the kimchi was the best part. It's sooooo hard to find authentic fermented kimchi that pairs well with meat. It was fermented to perfection and would've love to have a huge tub to buy to use at home for stews and other Korean recipes. We will come back every visit to LV!!!

This was our second visit in 1 week and again it was quite honestly faultless. On our first visit the we ordered a large bbq set, and this time we got soup and noodles. Both were excellent. Service was attentive, yet personal and really quite delightful that all the ladies here are so lovely. The food was traditional and beautifully cooked and presented. Staff were knowledgeable and rather fun, it's lovely to see people enjoy their job! Food was promptly served and there was plenty of it.
Close to hard rock hotel and it's very good! The flavor is kind of sweet if you like it do try it!-

Went here based on yelp reviews and was not disappointed!

I ordered the Korean style kalbi, duck breast, grilled onion, and broccoli. Then they brought out the panchan (the assorted sides), plus brought two other sides I wanted for free. So good! And such friendly staff!

Excellent
One of the best meals for the year
Multiple small dishes to roast and share
What a variety ! Service great too!
We were stuffed and blessed

Really delicious and very economical. A Wonderful surprise in my first meal in Vegas
.
I had a great time at this restaurant, the food was delicious, I had a blast cocking my food, the service was good and fast, should come, specially for dessert.

First time and it was a great experience.  Tried the meat lovers for two and it provided a large variety of the the meats and sides.  Would definitely come back to try a few of the other items on the menu.  Services was very fast and staff was very attentive.

I really like the atmosphere of this restaurant. The waiter was super friendly and grilled the meat to perfection. Unlike other korean BBQ restaurants where you suffocate from the excessive smoke, the ventilation in this restaurant is top-notch.
The best KBBQ in Vegas~~~!!! Most def a must come when in the need for some Korean food~~~! Will def come again!!!

Best Korean in LV! The best time to go is at 10pm -midnight for happy hour! It is the best value, especially for how much food we got. The food was high quality and the servers were attentive but not too invasive. PLUS THE BANANA TEMPURA WAS REALLY DELICIOUS.
Yum yum yum! First time enjoying Korean bbq and it was delish here! Also Really good vegetarian options and great service! Fun dinner out! Would def come back!
Awesome food!!!Awesome food!!! Its amazing! I love love the happy hour! The hours are great cuz i could still eat after work!!!
The beef is so tasty. Was kinda bummed out about the long wait before getting our food though.
Macaroon ice cream for the win!  Legit bimbimbap served extra crispy in a flat skillet.  Great service, good vibes-will be back next time in town!

This place is simply superb! Probably one of the best Korean joints I've ever been to. The quality of the meats are out of this world. The marinated kalbi and Kobe beef are a must!  Even though the service could need a little improvement, I didn't particularly mind because the waiters were still very attentive.

I was craving for some good Korean food while up in Vegas.  Thankfully through Yelp I was able to find Gangnam Asian BBQ which wasn't too far from our hotel by cab ride.  The place is located in a mall looking area next to a 24 hr nail salon.  I remember this because I was amazed that they had such thing as a 24 hr nail salon.

We came around 11 at night, a pretty late dinner for us.  But we're in Vegas so thankfully there are lots of late night places to eat.  The good thing about arriving here late is that we made it to the late night happy hour.  I definitely recommend ordering from the happy hour menu!  We literally almost ordered everything from it plus a tofu soup that wasn't on their happy hour menu.  I thought it wasn't going to be enough food but boy was I wrong.  It was too much food! Although my bf can eat a lot, we still had leftovers.  All the meats were good!  Also recommend the cheese wontons. We got 2 orders of those cause my bf liked it so much.  The tofu soup had big chunks of tofu sticking out from the soup and was filled with lots of kimchee and meat inside.  They also give a variety of ban chan.  All so yummy!  I was pleasantly surprised by this place and was even happier with the price.  I would compare this place to being like Gyu-kaku but better!  Service was good, fast and food was great.  No complaints here!

For a non all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ, you get a TON of bang for your buck. We opted on a la carte options for happy hour and got beef toro, Korean prime kalbi, pork belly and bulgogi for our meat options. All were delicious and almost as good as my moms! (Just don't tell her.) The banchan (side dishes) are delish, as well! Will definitely be back!

The food was great!! Tons of food for the price, about 4-5 boxes of leftovers for 12 of us. The service was not top notch but still tolerable. Definitely recommend coming here if you want some good food

This place is so much fun and whenever we are in town and want KBBQ this is our spot. Our last couple visits to Vegas we've made it a point to come here. Both times we came for the late night happy hour. The meat and veggies are really good, the staff are friendly and the prices are right. The combos are a good value, we opted to add to it with a couple dishes from the happy hour menu. The side dishes are good and have a good variety. I haven't been to any other KKBQ's in town, but I don't think we need to. They have everything we want and more. Some day we will hopefully be able to bring a few more people with us and really get more meat and veggies so the two of us can try more items. Definitely a must try and fun for the entire family, away from the craziness of the strip if you need that. (Yelp LA Challenge #44 of 100)
Omg it's so good! They give you sliced garlic infused in butter that tastes amazing with all the grilled meats. Service is impeccable. And they play music videos with taeyang

This place is so cool... I've never been to an Asian BBQ restaurant before. Definitely try the duck ( very flavorful). They also brought out sides to go along with what we ordered (which is awesome), but we weren't told what they were:( on the upside you get a free dessert for writing a review on Yelp :) :) so yay!!
Hawaiian know great food !! My hubby is a total grill master & Asian BBQ King & he loved it. Great place for kids too !!! Locals visiting LV eat here ... So Ono Loa!
Very delicious, it's a little pricy, but very worth it, we ordered for 4 people, it will at least feed 8.  All food are really fresh.  It's so far the best Korean restaurant i had in vegas.

Awesome food and ambiance.  Can't be disappoonted!  Unlike normal korean bbq, this restaurant has a lot of veggie options.  The meat quality is better than most ayce.  Service struggled a bit.  Had to repeatedly ask for sesame oil and salt and good luck asking for a knife or scissor.  Good thing I have a pocket knife :)

Great traditional Korean bbq Kimchi Gigae was awesome! They have jinro soju that i haven't had in years!  Really good meats that were marinated well. Took me back to the days of living in the land of the morning calm!

This was your average Korean bbq experience, nothing really special. We ordered the combo for 2 with shrimp,fiet mignon, pork(total of 6 meats). The spicy pork belly was amazing the rest of the food was a little above average. Overall the service here was average nothing to write home about!

New to vegas and we were looking for some awesome kbbq, and with the help of yelp we were able to find this treasure, Gangnam kBBQ is delish! you just have to give them a shot! Good ambience, customer service was on point and price range is not bad at all! Give their Harami Miso ( outside skirt steak ) a try you will not be disappointed!
Great food, nice services. I've been in Vegas for a week and spent like the whole week coming there. You guys should come and try.

I love this BBQ. The food is excellent, so tasty and value for money. Variety is excellent. They have a great happy hour. And best of all, free dessert when you make a review! But seriously, awesome food. I'm always here! X

Great quality meat and a variety of side dishes. The spicy lemon chicken was excellent. Meat was not fatty like other Korean bbq places. The kalbi was excellent. Tofu soup is one of the best in Vegas. Go for happy hour or reverse happy hour.

We came here by recommendation of our valet on the strip. So we left the strip, saved $200 and had a KILLER experience. Not only is the food amazing, but it's an experience in and of itself. We got the $65 combo for two and had about ten dishes brought out to us and had a blast. Great service. You know it's good when Korean people are serving you and when Korean people are filling most of the tables. Love this place. Can't wait to come back.  Ryan and Jieun were our servers and were so serving and helpful. AND GET THE FREAKING LYCHEE MARTINI!!!  OR TEN!!!!  Wow.
I love this place！everything is delicious！we ordered meat lover，and its totally enough for two people！

I ordered the 4 people combo. The food is good. 
 Then they brought out the panchan (the assorted sides), plus brought two other sides I wanted for free.So good!
 And such friendly staff!

Great food and it was fun to cook it.  Definitely try the Korean Prime Kalbi.  We got a little bit of everything.  My brother got the bibimbap and it was the best bibimbap we have ever had.  We will definitely come back.

My first Korean BBQ experience and it was delicious! Got the Gangnam combo. Going to definitely come back. My husband LOVES meat. The fillet mignon was amazing! And it comes with a bunch of sides which are also great. I think it's a great "taster" menu for big groups that have never had it!

This place is the place to go for Korean BBQ in Vegas! The marinated kalbi was high quality and tasty. The pork belly was equally satisfying. Both were absolutely fantastic paired with their house soju. The banchan, unlike other Korean restaurants, is plentiful and the server explains what each one is. 

I'd recommend the dumplings in chili oil, the Japanese peppers and the mushrooms (dip them in the ponzu sauce).

The servers here all appear to be Korean-American which helps with communication. Don't get me wrong, I love an authentic kbbq but ahjummahs are not always known for their friendly customer service.

Even the rice is on point! They offer brown rice for the health conscious but order white rice because it's exceptional.

They have Brick macaron ice cream sandwiches at the front as well as if you needed any more reasons to come here.
my second time coming here and it just keeps getting better. friendly staff and good food. can't wait till next time in vegas.
The BEST Korean BBQ I've had. Clean,top notch service, huge portions and quality food. We ordered the meat lover and it didn't disappoint. We will be back again for sure.
Hands down the best korean BBQ I've ever had. If i live in vegas I would come here at least once a week.

Shady business practice. They advertise a lunch special on their website but when we came it they said they will not honor it and it's not even a holiday it's a Tuesday at lunch. No mention of any restrictions on their website. 

Beware of supporting this business.

Great place. Great food. The meat quality was very good and the sauces were so yummy!! Def a great spot for lunch off the strip. It's not too crowded and reasonably priced for the quality. Will definitely be back again during my next trip!

Gangnam is very close to the strip compared to other Korean BBQ spots, so it was a definite must that I visit during a quick weekend trip. I'm so happy I did, because it was worth every minute I waited (only 30) and every penny I spent. We got the special combination for 4, and it fed all 5 girls in my group with leftovers to spare! 

The service was great, but the food here is truly the star. The cuts of meat are excellent and marinated better than any other Korean restaurant I've been to. Each piece literally melted in my mouth. I can't comment much on the side dishes because I filled up on protein!

The food is amazing and made up for the long wait. This place definitely needs to expand given the high demand. The beef is very well marinated. I will definitely return when I'm back in Vegas visiting.

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas! Good portion and reasonable price. I've had a lot of Korean bbq in New York k-town and I can tell you that this place has more varieties with cheaper price. Definitely will come back again.
This is our first time eating here, and my wife and I loved the all the dishes we tried. If we come back to Vegas, we'll definitely eat here again. Happy hour is a great time to come.
The food here is bomb and if you write a review you get a free desert so here it is baby now it's time to get down on some honey toast.
Amazing food and great service! The ice cream macaroons are the best!! Very friendly and they play a variety of music that everyone can enjoy
BEST Korean food I've ever had. We ordered different dishes and every dish was so delicious, well seasoned and tasty. They served lots of starters. We will definitely come back!!

Very nice ambiance, large table seating just perfect for the restaurant's set menus. We ordered the premium set for 2ppl, $89.95 but it was really worth it. Good meat quality, we are normal size eaters but the portion is enough to serve 3ppl. Definitely will come back and try other items on the menu, a highly recommend new eat out.
The beef was really good but the kimchi was one of the best. We would come back, better than most spots in  Los Angeles. Definitely a place to visit in lv

We came for lunch and we are very impressed! The prime kalbi was amazing. Two of us has bibimbap and the size was bigger than we expected, and very delicious. It had plenty of crispy rice. One had the spicy tofu soup, and it had just the right amount of spice and the tofu was perfectly cooked. I liked that we could order meals and things to bbq. There were many options and we will definitely be eating here again. The staff was polite and attentive and very helpful.
I really love the cheese fondue chicken here. Usually in Vegas they dont have this kind of chicken It is good to have meal and grill together
Food was amazing and the prices are reasonable for a KBB spot. We ordered the meat lover and it was perfect for 5 people. I just wish they gave bigger straws !!
Great atmosphere, great food, and great service! What  more can you ask for? Traditional Korean cuisine at its best.

My wife and I were looking for the best k bbq place in vegas, and I think we found it! This restaurant is full of character and the food is excellent. Located across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel in a strip mall, you walk in and quickly notice the clever design and use of space; modern and quaint. We ordered the "meat lovers" combo and we're not disappointed. Great servers and quality food prepared and presented with taste. I would definitely recommend and will be a repeat customer.
Not just the best Asian BBQ I've ever had. The best meat I've ever had. Off the charts. Nothing else compares.

this is our second time here and we never got disappointed.. foods are always good.. we got the gangnam set and it says for 2 people but i think it was a lot food for two.. lol.. we enjoyed everything though, wish we had enough space for all of it but we were so stuffed and of course we're saving room for dessert.. :-)
The beef is tender and delicious. One of the best  i had. Will go again. Hit up happy hour if you can.

Amazing food...so much fun to cook everything! I can't believe how delicious the meats were!!!! Definitely coming back!! The staff was so helpful and nice! My favorites we're the jalapeño poppers, the spicy tuna kimbap, spicy pork, pork belly, Korean chicken cheese fondue, and the spicy chicken with lemon sauce! Happy hour here is amazing!!

The marinated kalbee is good and the sidedishes as well. the place is nice and clean.  I didn't like the music videos in the front of the restaurant were playing with explicit language but they quickly accommodated us to a table where my kids can be seated far away from it. The service was quick and good too. The mulnyeng myun was bland and tuna kimchi had too much mayo. I would return for the kalbee though...

What an amazing variety of delicious bbq meats, seafood, and vegetables to grill at your table.  The accompaning sauces and condiments enhanced our most memorable meal.  And the marinated meats were outstanding!  Bravo!
Went there a second time..service was great, and we got a lot of side dishes. We ended up getting the same thing...soondubu and galbi.

Just ate at Gangnam BBQ and it was amazing. Had a reservation. Sat inmediately. Service was friendly. Andrew was great. The food came out quickly and all cooked food had great flavors. The beef was perfect and so fun to cook. Would totally recommend getting off the strip and going here.

Reminds me of Gyukaku but better! I love mushrooms and I'm happy that they cook it for you in the foil instead of me cooking it myself and burning it haha. Service was great, very polite and attentive. Love the style of the restaurant, has a lot of character and the projector is cool too. The meat was amazing! I highly recommend the Premium Tongue. Delicious! I love this place!
The best Korean Food is in Vegas! No doubt! Shrimp bibimbap is so different from the others.

Pretty good Korean BBQ. Not a fan of many of the sides but did enjoy the radish, fish cakes, and Mac salad. Meats were really good and flavorful! Definitely a place to try while in Vegas. A far walk from where we stayed but took uber to this place. So fairly close to the strip. 

EDITED: 

Service is not so great. Definitely HELLA slow!!!! We wanted the check and our desserts but they did not bring that out right away. We finally got up and told a waitress but she was slow too. The place was not even packed to have this kind of service at this kind of speed....
Customer service is on point and the good laugh were delicious. We ordered the premium combo for two and the foods were plenty  love!!
Visiting from Texas and we love this place! Room in the back seats 8 people comfortably and the service is quick. The meat lovers for six feeds everyone generously. The corn cheese app is a must try!

My boyfriend was craving Korean BBQ so we relied on Yelp to find us the best option in town, and we were not disappointed! I will say I was a bit hesitant at first since the location is practically on the UNLV campus, but it's pretty easy to get to and we had no trouble parking or getting seated. The bf was hungry so we tried nearly half the menu and all the meat and veggies were fresh (be sure to get the Korean Prime Kalbi & the Japanese Peppers), the sides were flavorful and our waitress was super fast & friendly. Oh and I cannot rave about the coffee macaroon enough!

Great food !! I've been here 3 times and I love the dishes served, mostly sukiyaki noodles. The restaurant has nice and pleasant ambience that kept me active. The sides served are delicious and has wide varieties for vegetarians. Finally, guys you'll like the music played. :D

I was extremly happy with my visit at Gangnam bbq. One of the best korean bbq I visit. The service was exelent and fast.
We had the "meat lover" plate for four people and it was full with starters and lovely meat. 
This is such a nice place to visit when u are tiered of The Strip.
Great quality meat with reasonable price! Highly recommend for meat and BBQ lovers~~~
I love this place. It's the best I have tried. I would definitely come back. The service is perfect. The price is cheap compare to other korean bbq restaurants. Fish cake for side dish is delicious.

I went to Gangnam with my family, 8 people. The staff at us at a nice table in the back. I enjoyed the food a lot. We ordered a lot off the happy hour menu. The happy hour menu has a lot of food on it. We had a very fun time.

good service，nice smell.We came on Wednesday night, it was not too busy so we got our table right away. The service is good, food is awesome. We ordered comb for two but it's good enough for 3 people actually. Anyway, highly recommend !

Great atmosphere. Good food good beer. although I don't like cooking it was an ok experience. We got the two person combo with filet and other good meats. Location across from hard rock so we could go over afterwards.
Awesome experience. The meat was so tasty. Spicy pork is da BOMB!  Service was great as well.

Our first time here and caught the late night happy hour.  Sad that they didn't have sapporo but were nonetheless satisfied with our half off coronas. This place has great, friendly, service with a fun atmosphere that sent me back into fun and memorable  times in korea :)
Not too far away from strip. Good korean bbq and dwenjang jjigae on point. Must visittt!
Food was great! The Las Vegas combo was more then enough for two but if you're still hungry wait for the happy hour to get special deals on extra meat.

Wonderful food and service. There was more than enough food for our entire party of 3 with the Gangnam meal. We also ordered some extras and the bibimbap was a standout. The marinated meats were also exceptional and everything was really fresh. Go and enjoy!

Quality of food is amazing. Their service is first class and everyone is so friendly. I would highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for affordable,great service, and quality Korean bbq in Las Vegas.

Nice place for a first date as the seats are fairly far apart in the booths to allow room for the bbq pit in the middle of the table. A good way to keeps hands busy as well throughout the meal (not a chance of awkward hand holding) but dimly lit enough to make it feel intimate. 

Being overly prepared we called in advance and made a reservation for two along with a toddler requiring a booster seat. Upon arrival right before the dinner rush around 2:45 pm Saturday we were promptly seated and greeted and drinks came out immediately afterwards. Seemed to be the best time to come because it was empty when we first got in and filled right up starting at 3:15. The ice tea was delicious, we had refills. I noticed that the booths basically were benches and were kind of uncomfortable, with a very utilitarian feel that assured me that men probably love flocking here for happy hour with their buddies. I was not wrong once I saw the happy hour menu as it was mostly geared towards beers. We dove right into the menu and ordered pork belly and marinated Kalbi strips to bbq with rice on the side ($1.95) and I ordered the Korean soft tofu soup with seafood. 

Our server was attentive, not overtly friendly but helpful. Since it was just us two girls and we don't eat much we didn't get any appetizers or dessert. The first thing to come out first were the sides, which you get complimentary if you order at least two bbq dishes. There was a variety of them, what I noticed was the pickled vegetables were good, the kimchi was great and the bean sprouts were bland, but that was fine with me. Throwing them in the marinade they provide for dipping might help. Then our meats and my soup arrived. Oh my, delicious. We threw the meats on and I dug into my stew and it was instant love. Although the stone pot it comes in may seem small, the portion was perfect for me. The chef made it perfectly spicy, with a kick of kimchi taste and an egg cracked right in. There was a respectable amount of seafood in there which I appreciated, and the meats, once seared with a nice crust, were super yummy. I only needed half of the large helping of rice that came with my soup before I was full. 

I then turned to the sangria which I order partway through my meal just to try. It was delicious, but made with a dry red wine I didn't love, with blueberries and raspberries floating within. Perfect sweetness though so no complaints, I'm just more of a non-dry white wine person. If you enjoy red, get the sangria. If not, the plum wine might be a better choice as I love Asian plum wines, plus it's cheaper. As a side note, the women's restrooms are well-kept and clean but no place to change your baby so not too friendly for families with babies. 

Overall, thoroughly satisfied with the experience we had there is go back again. The only reason for the one star deduction was that it was a great experience but didn't knock my socks off with value for the price. I would go back though. A definite must for Asian cuisine foodies visiting Vegas!
Another good place to try korean dish....good food...good service...reasonable price..the place is in the right area

Was highly impressed with this place. Super clean and nice, plus the food is amazing! Just wish the booth seats weren't so far from the tables, but besides that I loved it. Would definitely come again.
Very friendly customer service. Felt like the cute girl at the club. Not like the white guy at the Asian table.
Awesome service.  Fun way to experience Korean BBQ. Nice selection of  meat options. Nice restaurant close to the airport.
Awesome happy hour, I mean come on how can you beat 3 dollar bulgogi! Plus I've never seen cheese fondue offered at a kbbq but it was cool and a little different! Tasty dried squid!
Best cook your own meats in the city! Love the cuts of the beef and service was great...Definitely recommend this place for locals and tourist

Great Service. Food was on point. This spot is hot

Must try the unmarinated meat, cheese corn, and steam egg!
Came here with a group of friends after a work conference. Delicious food, friendly staff, and prompt service. We went with the Gangnam set. Definitely was a fan of the bulgolgi and the spicy pork.
Ordered the premium for 6. Was more than plenty enough food for a reasonable price. Definitely recommend the uni bibimbop.

Great food, fast and friendly service.
Modern upbeat decor, privatish booths.

Honey bread took over 20 minutes, but was great - order ahead.

Close to the strip, across from the hard rock hotel and Hofbräuhaus house (and kiss minigolf).

No frills, would be happy to go back anytime.
My expire nice for this restaurant is a 5 star rating because I really like there food- by cristopher

My boyfriend and I have been here more than a few times here. We usually come here after work at night time. Always had a good experience and have nothing to complain. The food is always good. We love their Honey Bread the most for the dessert. The bbq grill options has good amount to share as well and very flavorful. The servers are nice as well. We definitely recommend this place.

We've never trier KBBQ in Las Vegas, so this is a first. The restaurant is in a plaza surrounded with other restaurants as well. Its nice and the staff were friendly. The food is good but can be a bit pricey.
Ate here with my parents. It was their first time at Korean bbq. Everything was delicious and we had a great time. Beautiful decor and awesome staff

Food is outstanding but nothing compared to the customer service!! The varitey of meats, veggie, fried items and desserts is incredible. Service is easy quick but incredibly friendly. Definitely coming back anytime I'm in the Vegas area!
Bbq is great!!! Very fulfilling and nice ambience. Staff are friendly and the food is delicious
We got the Las Vegas special which was a good amount (shared with 3) we did order some extra meets but over all good taste! And great customer service!!

First time my boyfriend and I had Korean BBQ together and it was awesome.  We found the restaurant on Yelp as we were looking for something different and yummy off the strip.  It was a 5 minute drive from the strip and well worth it.  Super flavorful, tons of food and a fair price for all that you got.  We had to wait about 30-45 minutes for our table, but well worth it and the wait staff kept checking on us.  Highly, highly recommend and be sure to bring your appetite!
Great place for great food! Join us! This is a great place to meet friends too! The meat lovers meal for two is a great item to order. Fillet mignon is awesome!
Delicious meal! The Korean prime kalbi was delicious, as were all of the sides and the bibimbap. Tons of food for under $15 each and good service. I highly recommend!

Best Tempura Udon ever. Seriously.  So good!
Korean Prime Kalbi and Bulgogi - to die for!
Very cute place. We will def' be back.
Steam dumplings are a must have to.
Food was awesome and service was excellent! I would most definitely come back here again!  Make sure to ask for Ryan.
Found this on Yelp when we flew into Las Vegas. Lord of positive reviews and was worth the wait!!!  Meat was fresh and tasty!
One of the best Korean BBQ places I've ever been to. Very delicious. Short rib was great. Wish the table was bigger. Wish the grill was bigger. Overall good quality meat selection and service

The restaurant is located about 10 minutes from the strip.The price is really reasonable and the food is nice and decent. If you want some decent Asian food in Vegas I highly recommend the restaurant.
The food was great. The bulgogi bibimbap was delicious. And the ice cream sandwiches are amazing.
Meat lovers course is set to feed two, we were able to devour the entire thing but a third person would definitely help. Delicious and quality meat, would definitely come back again.
This was. So. Good. I'm all about kbbq so am very picky but this place lived up to the legends :)
So much meat! We got the Gangnam for 6 (combo meal) and were stuffed. Quite a good deal for the quality meats we got. Everything was delicious!! My brother who is a carnivore, was actually satiated.

前菜豐盛可以續，牛肉很嫩很好吃醃的很入味，套餐很划算份量很足，四個女生點兩人份就吃得很飽
店員服務態度很好，會不斷關心我們需要什麼或是換網子，整體消費體驗很好！
（但是店裡油煙味有點重，唯一的小缺點）
好吃！Delicious! おいしい！très délicieux!齁甲！

Came in with no reservation but still got sitted down right away on a Saturday night. The athmosphere is great. Really clean, there's music, but not too loud, just right.

The menu is extensive and it's a la carte  style. The prices are worth it. The meat is very high quality compared to some of the all you can eat kbbq  places.
There's also a drink and spirits menu.

I recommend the marinated kalbi  steak, it's very tender and juicy. Also, try the bacon  wrapped sparagus, it's crunchy and crispy at the same time.

Very appropriate place for a date or a group gathering. Not recommended if you're single haha

The service was great, atleast 5 people came by multiple times to make sure that we were properly serviced. The staff was also friendly and easy to talk to and they explain the menu.
Great food and service! Meat marinated well and many side dishes came with the BbQ. Fun experience too for those who've never cooked Korean BBQ style.
Best korean bbq on vegas! Will comeback again definitely & I will recommend it to my family & network of friends. Fast & friendly service as well. The location is convenient too.

Great service, good quality food! I had never had Korean BBQ before and was super scared! Thankfully I had a veteran with me and he ordered. Everything was super fresh and delish, I loved the entire experience. The best part was the meat of course and it was super tender. I would recommend this place to anyone new or old to the Korean BBQ game.
The best food I've had in Vegas on any of my trips. It's completely worth it. Its a lot of food so come hungry. The service is great. I would definitely come back.
First time here, awesome meal, thank you. Meat lover is a good choice. Perfect for 2 to 4 people.

So glad we decided to eat here instead of some overpriced place on the strip lmao. Really good variety of meats for the bbq, awesome side dishes. I couldn't find a single thing I didn't like. There was a bit of a wait, but the staff was friendly and helpful, so that more than make up for it. Do yourself a favor and try this place! I would definitely go again.

First thing when you walk in, you smell how good the food is, second is the service (which is friendly and helpful (she asked us before she left if we wanted anything to drink).

Restaurant was nicely packed, but wasn't overcrowded. Loved the K-Pop music videos playing on the TV projector.

Food was great and came very quickly. Loved the free dishes of appetizers and the steamed egg was tasty. 

Overall, I would definitely come back when I'm in Vegas again.

Simply Awesome. You will not be disappointed.  The bbq was fresh and well marinated. I had the bulgogi and pork belly. Also i had the tukbokki-this was the best ive had, very similar to ones i had in Korea Priced very fairly.
Super pretty cozy quiet place, well decorated. Love the service! The food was very good and authentic. The price is very reasonable especially the set menus. Highly recommend this !

Simply put- the best meal I've had in years.  Service was excellent.  Bulgogi was the best. Side condiments were soooo good.  Poki salad was unbelievably fresh.  The spicy edamame were very tasty.  Korean prime Kolbi was also super tasty.
Good food with good variety to choose from!  Definitely would come back here again! We ordered the meat lovers and definitely try the Korean chicken with the cheese sauce!

It took a long time to get seated but it was well worth it. Server explained everything, it was our first time at this specific restaurant. Very accommodating with the little ones. We got Gangnam package for two and it was way too much food for my husband and I plus our 2 toddlers.
Definitely a restaurant that knows how to cook. Really good quality meat. Best Korean food we've had in America, and we've lived here for 14 years.
Good food and fun atmosphere. The tuna seaweed app was delicious. Wish the wine list had more options.

Been here twice and don't like the service but food was ok, a little on the sweet side and way too much ponzu sauce with every dish. It wasn't a wow factor for me. I was just disappointed at the service mostly. They don't come by to check on us and most of the time we needed water to be filled, and see lots useless of waiters standing around. When we ordered food, they all came out at once which was overwhelming. Salad or appetizers should come first but all in awkward order...I am not liking the way this restaurant runs...will not be back!

Excellent Korean BBQ not far from the strip. Beef carpaccio and marinated spare ribs are stand out. Nice sides and good Thai iced tea. Friendly and helpful servers. If this is your thing, you can't go wrong.

Omg me and my partner loved this place! The service was excellent as well! The staff knows how to treat the customer! I recommend this place to all who love Korean BBQ! This place is perfect for a date or with a group of friends! Very pleasurable dining experience. Would definitely come again when visiting Vegas! Kudos to the staff
Our new favorite place to eat in Vegas!  Great food, great service, great prices, good ambiance! What more can you ask for! Definitely coming back again.

This Korean restaurant is fancy!  The decor is super contemporary with spacious seatings. Even the waiting area is spacious. 

I like the fact that the meat and veggies are tapas style. However, when we flipped over the menu, we quickly decided on the meat lover, $55.95 for two, and an order of pork toro. 

Everything was delicious, but if I had to chose, the pork cheeks were our favorite. So juicy and tender melt in your mouth! 

Service was wonderful as well.
Loved the food!! The meat lovers was enough to feed 3 adults so fed recommend that for the price.

This place was recommended to us by our Airbnb host and I'm so glad we followed up and went! We went at 5pm on Sunday, so during happy and whoa was that an awesome surprise when we got the bill. We got three meats, sides, two rice, two veggies and an appetizer all for under $25 (not including tip). The meat was marinated and had plenty of flavor. The rice was a heaping portion. Our broccoli came ore cooked and a little burnt but whatever. Overall, food was great, staff attentive and we left with our bellies and wallets full.

This is how Korean BBQ is meant to be. 

Hidden behind the Strip, in the heart of Vegas, is the best Korean BBQ in the area. As soon as you walk through the doors, the wonderful aroma of charred marinated meat will tell you, you're in the right place. 

Me and a friend came here and between the two of us, we went with the "Gangnam" set which includes a soup, rice, side dishes, and a variety of meats. Don't let anyone tell you the filet is the best, or the miso is the best... Hands down, the prime rib galbi is worth a second dish - and that's exactly what we ordered. 

Oh yeah and we're writing this for the free ice cream macaroon :)
Great dining experience! Everything was delicious, especially the Harami Miso Beef. Definitely stop in if you are looking for something different for dinner.
Love this place!! Amazing food! Must try! Good atmosphere! Must visit during your trip to Vegas. Unbeatable
Place is open late which is always nice in Vegas. The food was good and they have so many meat options to try. They offer small portions but are reasonably priced so try and try and try.

Easy, fun and fabulous atmosphere. 

Great for a date night, working lunch or with the kids!!

Pick your meat and veggies and they arrive raw. You cook them on your table top grill. Fun way to get the kids cooking. And the prices are Great!!

Ill be back for sure. Good music as well as a tv playing sports!! Great selection of sake too!!
Great fast service, delicious food and great atmosphere! 10/10 would come back! Also, you get a free dessert for posting a review!

Excellent Korean BBQ just a short walk from the Strip. Delicious food (particularly the bulgogi) and reasonable prices make this place one I'll be sure to visit again the next time I'm visiting Las Vegas.

This is the first place my husband and I tried upon arriving at Las Vegas and it was . We ordered the Gangnam combo for 2 and it was definitely more than enough food: side dishes, oysters, corn, salad, two miso soups, bibimbop and 5 types of meat. Everything was very good! We checked in on Yelp and got some free macaron ice cream sandwich. We got the green tea one and that was yummy too (but nothing spectacular). We would definitely recommend this place!

Awesome place! Super friendly staff and very fair happy hour price! Come before 6 pm. A great difference from all the fatty food around. Food was delicious and in big portions. I used the happy hour menu and was even able to take some home for lunch tomorrow. When I'm back in the area I'll come again.

The food was amazing! I loved the flavor of the meat and the sides were great too. The service was fast and I didn't have to wait forever before I got seated. There's a nice comfortable vibe in this place as well that makes me feel right at home.

Enjoyed the food very much. Reminded me so much of Korea. 

Its just like the traditional korean bbq where you cook on the grill in front of you. Ordered the marinated kalbi, bulgogi, duck, and steam egg. Will definitely come back and bring more friends.
Amazing customer service. Great music and vibes. My boyfriend and I enjoyed our experience. Ashley was awesome. The gentleman serving us was great too

This restaurant was very good. I enjoyed the customer service even more so portions of the food. I typically get AYCE Korean barbecue so I got satisfied by this. And even more so than worthwhile of a five star review.
their chicken is very good！！ server are very nice  too. this is second time come here and sure gonna come back soon！！

It is my second time here and my first Yelp review! Before coming here my favorite Asian bbq place was Gyu Kaku. Like I was their biggest fan nothing was above it. One of my friends wanted to take me to Gangnam and told me that it's better and more flavorful than Gyu. I'm like nooo way! But I went and tried it. I was blown away. It was AMAZING! And you got so much food for your money, especially with the COMPLIMENTARY sides!! And the food and meat is just bursting with flavor. My favorite things to get are the bulgogi bimbimbap, salmon carpaccio, hirami miso steak, and the bacon asparagus. But honestly EVERYTHING is good down to the water. It's not your typical tap water. And let's not forget the dipping sauce, it just takes the meat over the top. If this place was closer to me I would spend all my money eating here. Also the service was above and beyond. FIVE STARS!!!!!
One of my favorite resturant. Delicious food, yummy salad and good desert. But long waiting time around 30 mins with very very good services. Will come to have lunch next time
The marinated short ribs were amazing! The waiters were kind, and they were very quick to serve us. I recommend the in kitchen cooking if you are on a time crunch.

From the smell when you entered the restaurant, you can tell that this Korean bbq is goood. Their specialty is harami miso, Korean prime kalbi, prime kalbi that you definitely should try, it is mouth watering.

We ordered the gangnam combo for 2 and a couple of happy hour specials. Service is fast 
Beef toro and prok belly are decent 
Mushroom medley is cooked already 
Korean choke ken cheese fondue is very tender

Combo for 2 can feed more than 2 by the way
A lot of the meat are in the sweeter side though

THIS PLACE IS FRICKIN BOMB.

My family expressed their doubts about going KBBQ in Las Vegas, but I'm glad I dragged them in. We ordered the original bibimbap, Korean beef kalbi, tofu stew, and an appetizer the waiter recommended (fried sushi!?), and we cleared it all. The kalbi was kinda small, but it was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. The tofu stew was explosively spicy and a fam-pleaser.

Too bad we're only passing through, otherwise we'd probably be regulars.

This place is a bit tucked away in an unexpected plaza away from Korea town but it worth the trip! Great quality meat, delicious sides, great ambiance, and amazing customer service. Definitely worth the drive & must try restaurant.

Had an absolutely great time at the Gangnam Asian BBQ.  Food was plentiful and tasted great.  My wife and her family (all from Korea) loved the place.  Our waiters did a great job taking care of our group and really seemed to enjoy working there.  We will definitely be back!
This Korean bbq place is the best I have try so far. Very good and fast service . You also have free lava cake if u write a review
The BBQ here is really really great!! We tried the 2 ppl Meat Lover combo, and it feeds 3 ppl lol.

I'm very picky about Korean food given that my mother is Korean. Gangnam was excellent and far exceeded my expectations. It was refreshing to go to a Korean restaurant that has reasonable prices. Highly recommended.

Best kbqq in town.

Tried some others near chinatown and they sucked.

This place costs a bit more but it's worth it.

Will come again!

Amazing food and great service! We have a friend that works here and recommended trying it out. We usually go to hwaro or hobak, but this is our new favorite kbbq spot :) delicious quality meat and the variety of appetizers and side dishes are incomparable :)
This place got me like a happy girl with a satisfied stomach, and I'd like to come back again. Love the service, love the food and drinks here. Highly recommended!

First time trying this place. My friends loved it. It was an ok experience for me. The bulgogi was really amazing and well flavored. The other meat was ok. Overall if you love Korean BBQ with a bunch of different meats and vegetables this place is definitely for you.
Very good Korean BBQ. Much better service, shorter wait time than restaurants on the strip and more importantly better food. Would definitely come back.
Great happy hour and reverse happy hour! Delicious Korean BBQ with kimchee, macaroni, pickles for sides.
Got the meat lovers for 4 and it was more than enough for 5 with leftovers! The waiter Dave was super nice and helpful! Would def come back!

Was here with friend for late lunch, amazingly the food came out fast and .... very tasty. Variety of side dishes. Refill right after the side dishes half down. 
Our server was Beck ( if I remember it right ) - super nice, friendly, and anticipated. 
Definitely coming back next time.
Good ambiance, great food.. We had the meat lover's combo and enjoyed every juicy bite. The servers are all attentive and efficient. Definitely worth a try if you love Korean/ Japanese BBQ!

The food is great! I liked the side dishes and the meat is very good quality.
The beef bulgogi is great and the beef brisket is good. 
I like the look Olof the restaurant and the service is good!

Korean BBQ spot with premium meats. Definitely get what you paid for. You can order A La Carte or they also have set packages if you don't know what to get. I ordered A La Carte and the price was good. They have packages for 2 people and up to 6 people. A must try in Vegas

All the meats had great flavor and came in great portions.  All so succulent and juicy.  My mom also had the spicu seafood soup, and it was some of the best soup she's ever had.  I was also greatly impressed by their stellar bibimbap.  Delicious all around - a must eat restaurant when in Vegas.

wonderful dining experience. if you like Korean BBQ you will really be impressed by this place. The four of us ordered the Gangnam special for four and it was enough food for 6 people. the meat was fresh and a the marinade delicious. the side salads were very good especially the cucumber and cabage kimchis. bulgogi rice rocked!
best Korean BBQ i've ever had  &service here is also great .if you gonna go to restaurant with friends it will be your best choice to make

Delicious food. 

Decent prices.

Will come back next time in Vegas.

Make sure to try the appetizer with the Spicy Tuna.

The meat was delicious, fresh and tender. The sides were also good.  We had the Meat Lovers set and loved everything on it. Wish we had one of these in Toledo. Highly recommend, cool experience cooking the meat ourselves and eating it sizzling straight from the grill.

This place is very good with the choice meats that they have. We decided not to get the package deals... not much for the starters each one had. We ended up getting all three of the "must try juicy cuts," which was very flavorful. I ordered a spicy seafood noodle dish, which was amazing. Even though it's NOT an AYCE, I will come back again!
We had beck as a server and he was absolutely great. This is my third Korean bbq experience in Las Vegas and so far this is my favorite

I recently went here for a birthday dinner. We arrived around 5PM and the restaurant was only maybe 1/3 full.

We decided to order the Gangnam special for 4 people. The meal included salad, raw oysters, shishito peppers, corn, mushrooms, miso soup, several kinds of meat, and bulgogi bibimbop. There was also the standard kimchi and other appetizers you get at almost every Korean restaurant. We were there for Happy Hour so we also got a pitcher of beer for half-off.

Overall, everything tasted fairly standard to me. Nothing really stood out as amazing. I felt the salad lacked much flavor at all and the miso was just standard miso. The bibimbap had no chili paste or veggies and was pre-made when it arrived. It was more like just straight Korea style fried rice with some bulgogi inside.

I guess having been to Korea, nothing ever is quite the same; however, I have had other places that are much better than Gangnam. 

My biggest issue with the place was the speed in which they serve you. It was way too fast! Within minutes of ordering you have everything you ordered on the table. We didn't have time to finish a single appetizer before the next thing came out. At one point our table was so full there was literally zero room for anything else. I really felt like they were just trying to rush us out. 

I have to say that I don't think I will return here next time I am in Vegas.
Long wait on Labor Day weekend but amazing food! :D lots of side dishes that were delicious and free refills!
The food was good and the portions were good. Very friendly staff. I prefer white rice over bimbipbap

Good food , enough food portion , I always bring my out town guest here .
Sunday special is the best.

Great place! The line was long even at night, but it was worth the wait. Food was amazing. My favorites were the pork belly, miso beef, and bibimbap. 

Service was prompt and everything was very well-priced for the quality. I would definitely come back!

Amazing service! 
The happy hour phenomenal!!! $3/$4 meats, 1/2 off drinks and more. Everything on happy hour is $2-4!
The service was perfect and the food was perfect as well. 
Will definitely go back for my next Vegas adventure!

I came on a Saturday night, and it was pretty busy. I had a party of 5 and only had to wait about 10 minutes for a table, and it was well worth it. You have to try the spicy pork and the bulgogi beef! I would recommend this to anyone!
Glad we found an Asian food, needed a break from the food from the strip. Great food and service.

This is my favorite Korean restaurant. I used to come here every Monday while attending UNLV. 
The food is excellent and so is the service. I can't say what is the best dish because everything is delicious.
We came here for my birthday last year and it feels good to be back
Beef tongue is awesome. marinated prime beef is really good as well. Spicy tofu soup is one of my favorite as well.

First time at Gangnam Asian BBQ, I have to say  its so delicious!! I love the fact that you can experience to cook your own food, the meat is full of flavor & so tasty, the servers r great and have great service

Seems family owned. Not very attentive wait staff. Came here late for dinner. I wasn't impressed with how little meat they provided. Mainly rice... I found that to be cheap. My biblogi or whatever was too sweet and as I mentioned lacking on the steak/meat that I wanted. Just a bunch of sweet rice. Will not be returning.

Our group got the meat lovers. It comes with a variety of good marinated pork and beef. Comes with 3 sauces, but wish it would include the sesame oil with salt.  Also comes with salad soup rice and seaweed salad .

Great customer service, very friendly and welcoming!! Definitely one of the best Korean Bbq places I have been at in Las Vegas. I love the spicy tuna sushi and Korean prime Kalbi I get that all the time along with the beef torro. Coming here again!!!!
This place is great! Service was really nice and the food quality was really fresh. We order the meat lover for 6 and there were 7 of us which was more than enough. We had leftovers to take home too.
Came here with my fam, and we loved the bbq beef and spicy chicken! The food came really fast and we didn't really have to wait for a table.
Good food with good service. Recommended to all Korean BBQ lovers. Plus they open till 1am, so if you arrive late, there is still a place for good food instead of fast food.

Super fun and delicious.   

Even though I'm a vegetarian, there was plenty on the menu for me. 

I especially liked the spicy garlic edamame and mushroom medley. 

The one downside is you leave smelling like food, so I'd scheduled an outfit change between eating here and almost any other activities.

This is my very first Yelp review.  Yes, I found a restaurant bad enough to inspire me to write a review.  
We were drawn to this restaurant because of all of the positive reviews on Yelp.  I was surprised by the volume of reviews for such a small restaurant.  Because of this, I had high expectations for my meal and was extremely  disappointed.  The food was terrible and low quality.  Luckily, the food was so bad we only ate a small portion of the meal.  Yes, we were lucky because we returned home to stomach pains.
So how does the restaurant get so many good reviews? Each table has a sign that says you will get a free desert if you show your Yelp review to a server.  No, I did not get a free desert for writing this.  If the quality of their desserts matches the quality of the meal, I have no interest in trying anything else from the menu.  
I am writing this review from the comfort of my own home where I am recovering from my dinner and wishing that I had spent my money elsewhere.

Ho-lee-crap. 

Amazing food, service and ambiance. Great prices and amazing selection of food made this a fantastic choice for our large group. 

We will be back.
OMG the best bbq in town !! Great food and outstanding service. Everyone was very helpful and respectful. I had a wonderful time. Highly recommended!
Best Korean BBQ I have ever had. The quality of the meat was A1. The Kobe meat melts in your mouth like butter

Coming from Hawaii... We hVe so many yakiniku places in our state but since we are sick of eating breakfast American food and buffets. We need to try something new and we found this place. Oh boy it was Amazing!!! Everything taste super good!! I am surprise of how good it is. All the meats is flavorful and delicious. We went on Christmas Day and they made all my family members super happy. My brother and sister are picky with there food. The wait was a little long because they are pack but the food is worth it.

Once again, Yelp! provided an awesome assist in finding somewhere to eat that would satisfy our cravings. Las Vegas is ever changing; the Korean eatery we used to patronize seemed to lose its luster in service & food quality. Having confidence in our Yelp!ers, I went with this place.

Food = yum! Portions = great! Service = on point.  Restrooms = clean. Parking = free.

Only concern? Our grill kept flaring up & scaring not only is, but the neighboring patrons as well. We laughed it off--nervously--and the wait staff quickly came to our aid. They had to change/fix our grill three times! 

In the end, we would come back again. We know we just experienced a glitch and was glad no one was hurt.

Got the meat lovers, great selection  of multiple diffrent meats and spicyness. Banchan  was good all very tasty.included sea weed salad and green salad and miso soup .  Delicious all together could have used a bit more grilled vegetables(should have ordered that side) but usually when you think of kbbq  it's for the meat anyways!!! Got some happy hour drinks flavored soju  my sister got the ginger I got the green apple. Ginger was delicious! Green apple 2 as very green apple-ey ; P place is good food for decent prices!!! Great service and located not far from the strip stop in and nom nom nom!!!

This is probably my favorite restaurant off the strip. Typically I only do KBBQ when I'm in LA so I wanted to try it here in Vegas  

Definitely worth it. We tried the Gangnam special for 6 with only 5 people and it was a ton of food. Price was definitely reasonable for the amount of food. I dig it. You should try it.

So glad we decided to make a stop here for lunch. We were getting really tired of buffers and decided Korean would be a good option. One of the best Korean places ever. I always try finding a good Korean place everywhere I travel to. One of the best! The music is a little off and kind of kills the atmosphere as it is extremely loud and the music ranges from rap to random Christmas music. But will definitely come again.

Korean BBQ at its finest! Me and my boyfriend came for a late valentines dinner, first thing is it is a beautiful atmosphere defintley romantic and intimate not overbearing like most places. We ordered the meat lovers and because It was happy hour we got a pitcher of beer for 8.50! Stealll! The quality of food here was amazing I felt at it was all top quality ! For two people and 56.00 you get a ton of food that you won't be able to finish! I love this place and I will b coming back with more people this is my new favorite spot! Spot on service and spot on food!
great service! And great food! The prime Kaibi is really juicy and sweet! Recommend the Ganam style
Ordered the bulgogi bimbimpap (sp) and it was so good! Also had a side of the mixed tempura and it was cooked to perfection. So awesome. 5 stars.
Perfect taste&service, would suggest this to friends. Close location to westgate hotel. The waiting time is quite long during the peak hours.
The atmosphere is nice and the staff is very attentive. They have great meat and the Kobe carpaccio is awesome.
Amazing service!!! Ashely has been a great witness and Andrew was a great host! Amazing job!
Good food, good service...Fun experience. A variety of meats, veggies and side dishes--something for everyone. A little loud, but not quite to an annoying level. Will come back
Great food, atmosphere, variety, customer service. Reasonable prices for filling portions  (we ordered 5 meat dishes for 2 ppl & one white rice each. Filling!). Cant ask for much more
The bulgogi was good, the kalbi was a little plain. The ambiance was very good and the staff was very friendly. The have pretty good lunch specials as well.
Loved this place! Modern Korean BBQ joint. Second time I've come in one week! Good portion size and quality meat. Desserts were yummy too, especially the macaroon ice cream!
The food was really good, we got the Las Vegas and it was more than enough for 2 people! I recommend this place!

Awesome experience! This place was recommended to me by my friend, and she was spot on. Definitely try the spicy tuna kimbap! Super tasty and filling. The harami miso was tender and seasoned right. Grill changes in between are always a good thing. Come after 10pm and you can get Happy Hour!! We will definitely be back on our next trip to Vegas.

Came with a group of 8 friends. We had the gangnam meal for 6 and it was more than enough food for 6 people. Meats were delicious and tender. Experience and quality were above par. Highly recommend this place for Korean bbq.
The food was excellent! Staff was helpful and the food came quickly! Some of the beef may be a little chewy, but the texture is still very nice.
I love coming to gangnam after I finish work! They're always so friendly and the food is amazing!! Prime Kalbi on fleek!

You really do get to play with your food. Reminded me that I need to get out and eat out. Korean BBQ, especially here, is an experience that even the pickiest eater needs to try. The true gourmet will probably move closer to the restaurant or just live in the parking lot. I would eat more kimchi but my date won't let me; its that good.

Very authentic Korean bbq. The Kobe beef is awesome! The bibimbop is great too. 

It is close to the strip.

This based on entrance, service, and appetizers thus far. Everything has been smooth. I'm writing this for the free dessert, but this review will be continued and updated for my final decision on entree and rest of the night service.,
It's wonderful, food is great and the employees are wonderful the survice is great and it's clean and it was the first time coming here and I want to back back again next time and the prices are good

It was great.... more to come

Ordered the Harami Miso, bulgogi, pork bulgogi, and pork belly for bbq and the Daenjang Stew and Kobe Beef Carpaccio on the side.

Tired of spending excessive amounts of money eating in Las Vegas? Well you have found a goldmine in this place. We came for the happy hour and we definitely left happy and full. The food is delicious, reasonably priced, and varied. We definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Las Vegas and need a break from the strip.

Absolutely incredible Korean barbecue right off the strip. 
Bulgogi- very juicy and tender!
Lemon chicken- YUMMY 
everything was excellent! The restaurant is nice and clean, has good music, and is a really great experience with friends :)
The happy hour menu was excellent -- we ordered nearly everything off the menu! Order the BBQ meats -- they were tasty. Great service!

Husband and I tried the Gangnam set for 2 and it was more than enough food. All the cuts of meat were delicious!! I really like the ambience and decor as well. Service was pretty good when we finally sat down (we waited a half hour, not too bad). As our meal went along our server became a little more scarce.
Everything here is so good! We were served by calvin this time but usually our server jin takes care of us. They both were so friendly and cute!
the atmosphere and set up was very nice. food was satisfying especially their pork belly. i also highly recommend their chicken cheese fondue plates. will come back!
First place to eat on our first visit to Las Vegas :) Got Gangnam combo for 4 people. Taste so great! Love it! ;)
Food is excellent, service is awesome. One of the better Korean BBQ places in Vegas. Also, the ambience is good.

Very good Korean bbq. Much better quality, good serving size and more reasonably priced than eating on the strip. A bit odd that they charge separately for lettuce to wrap the meats - not common at a Korean restaurant. Anyway, good food and would definitely come back again.

Back is an awesome server!!! Food is always great and always leave satisfied! !!! Free dessert with review. conveniently located next to unlv since I am a student so it's always a great experience with friends!!

Very satisfied!!!
Happy tummies
Great that it's open late. Portions were decent!
Didn't like that the mushrooms came late...

Will be back!
This is the first time I tried the soft tofu spicy soup here. It taste really good! Very good restaurant!!

Open late and away from the hustle and bustle of the strip. Two thumbs up for late night happy hour. Lots of choices & really good quality meat. They also have soup, bibimbap, appetizer, and vegetable choices. 

Try: 

Meat items: harami miso, rib eye, beef bulgogi, spicy pork, toro beef, & bacon wrapped scallops! 

Appetizers: poke, spicy tuna kimbap


The servers are all really friendly & accommodating. We were the only party there around 11pm but it worked out since our party had 15 people.

We love this place great food and great service!! There was a little bit of a wait but it was so worth it. The make up for the wait with quick service. Also everything is super fresh and the sides are complementary.
Good service. Good food. Sides dishes were getting refilled pretty quickly. Thought the plates would be bigger.

Every item we ordered was amazing! Our favorites were the jalapeno salmon poppers( best ever!), also the bacon wrapped salmon was super good!! The sweet cream corn was delicious!! And let's not forget the coffee macaroon for dessert!! We ordered a total of 10 items!!! and there was just two of us!! We're so happy, and can't wait to come back! Service is excellent and fast, so was the food!
It was delicious here !!  Everything was perfect but I don't like corn cheese for the appetizer cuz the small it very bad for the some seafood in there and taste aren't like cheese also.
Upon entering we were greeted right away . Staff is very nice and polite. Nice ambiance  food was delicious

Between the strip and the airport - this is some awesome KBBQ that won't break your wallet. Service is great and it makes me feel like I'm back in Santa Clara's Ktown area. It's surprising and relieving to find some tasty food off the strip. I'm sure Vegas has a ton of it - I just never get to venture out as much and I'm glad to have found this spot.
