They've got combo options that breaks everything into sets for a group which makes things easy. There were so many side dishes, we barely had room on the table for everything!

Clutch spot if you're hungover from partying and looking for some KBBQ to help ease the pain.
First time here!!!! Service is is way better then other places!!!!!!we had plenty of food and the most important thing is relaxing.!!! Love it!!
Very authentic Korean food.  The staff was friendly and although they were extremely busy our experience was very good.  Great food
Second time I have visited this restaurant, it is really quite good. Chicken with lemon juice is a personal favorite. Service is prompt and professional, a Las Vegas favorite.
nice service and nice little dishes. The combo is good for 2 people. But u still need to wait for 15 mins up even on Monday night after 9pm. must be a popular place.
Delicious!!!!!The meat is fresh. We tried the meat lover combo. I love it!!! I would recommend it to my friends. The best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas!
We came here on New Years and he wait was oretty long but understandable. Amazing kimchi jjigae. Seriously perfectly balanced. Great Galbi. Sam gyup was alright. Overall everything was good.
Good food nice service. The price is a bit cheap compae to other Korean. The late night happy hours is a real deal. You get a bit more discount after 10 pm. I will be back for sure .

Very quality meat, delivered on both of the meat ordered by ways of taste and price. Befall a great meal with good, efficient service. Would suggest to any interested in an inexpensive, delicious meal in Las Vegas
Great customer service! Food came very fast and The food was delicious! We will come back in the future.

Great service, delicious and fresh food (e.g. the squid in seafood pancake was supreme tender and fresh).would definitely return,but come earlier or.later to avoid the prime time. Only 11 regular tables so easy to end up with an hour wait. Totally yummy and worth it though!

First time eating Korean BBQ in Vegas and this place was conveniently located right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel.  I ordered the Spicy Ramen with Egg which was especially flavorful with just the right amount of spicy.  The wife ordered the Bibimbap original which was a little on the bland side but nothing a little salt and hot sauce can't fix.  The kids enjoyed grilling the bulgogi beef and it came out sweet and tasty.  Overall just really good food and the servers were quick.  Would definitely recommend.
Good food and good service . One of this best Korean bbq joints I have ever tried in Las Vegas .

Had the meat lover's for two tonight and it was really nice. The meat were sliced neatly and in appropriate portions. Ours included 6 different types of meat and personally I liked the garlic beef ones and fillet mignon! Well, there were side dishes included too and they were tasty as well. Love the seaweed salad! The staff were very friendly and conducted their business properly. They made sure that our drinks were filled and they constantly asked how things were. I just wish that they would play KPOP songs too :) Will definitely come back for more meat!

Great Korean BBQ ever! Meat lover with Macaron ice cream is soooo good. The seafood, especially shrimp, is fresh and delicious. If you are in Las Vegas and a BBQ lover, you should go and taste. The service attitude is also great.

Fantabulous (tm). 

Food was great and the happy hour specials are a great deal. The combo platters are very filling.
Great quality of meats! Service is really good. Hostess and Wait Staff very attentive! Can't wait to go back

The food here was great. It was definitely one of the better Korean foods that I have had so far. The customer service was top notch and were very friendly. I would definitely recommend people to come try this place out!!

good taste and a lot of choice for meat meat.
I like the beef tongue a lot. But all the sauces are sweet
First time here and we loved it!!! Everything is delicious. Marinated beef with miso is a must have. We liked the kimchi pancakes too. Will definitely come back to next time in Vegas.

everything from the food to the service was AMAZING! definitely a better alternative to ayce bbq. 

my boyfriend and I ordered a lot of food but our favorites were the pork belly and the Korean prime kalbi. the complimentary sides were so yummy too, I would be ok just eating that! haha

all in all, this place is great. I would definitely come again

Omg food was amazing! Loved the coconut sake! I wish that the kalbi was on the bone but other than that everything was amazing!!! Will definitely be here again when I visit for business. Oh and you MUST get the original bibimbop!!!!!  left my tummy satisfied and mouth watering! Lol

I will definitely be coming back here again. Aside from a delicious selection of meat, they also have scrumptious sides. Their macaroni salad and fish cakes are great. Location is good as it is close to UNLV and it is just right outside the Strip, so if you feel like Asian bbq and you're in town for a visit, come here. It is definitely worth it!

Bulgolgi Bimbap IS the bomb!

Like the aura of the place. Food is flavorful and light. Not too heavy. 

Definitely bring your family and significant other.

We came during EDC weekend on a Sunday evening without a reservation and thought that we would have to wait long, but surprisingly, the wait was only about 15 minutes. 

We ordered a la carte because we wanted to try everything, and ended up getting mostly meat dishes. The meat dishes were good, but not as flavorful as I would have liked. However, they were still good. The beef carpaccio was AMAZING and highly suggested. The vegetable dishes were meh, and took forever to come. 

I like this place because of the value and the fact that the food was pretty good. Also, that it's an authentic Korean restaurant run by Korean people. The service was attentive and efficient. I recommend this place if you're looking to get your Korean bbq fix :)
Great food with along of really tasty dishes. We had the lunch special the backyard grill taste is definitely there at this restraint. Would definitely recommend trying them out!
Great food and an experience. Fun and delicious! Highly recommend! Get the tteokbokki you won't regret it. After you're done with it you have a delicious sauce for your rice.

Fancy and clean place but not for Japanese food and also original Korean food. This place is only for Korean fusion food and BBQ. The BBQ is really good but not Korean people because of fusion style.  So many black pepper with meats and salty side dishes. Additionally,  the small quantity lettuce (kind of romaine) is truly more expensive than single order of pork belly. If you are rich, you can go there and enjoy their great foods. I hope they would be considered price such as volume sales at a low unit margin of profit.

Got the meat lover special today. Soooooooooo goooood! My favorite part was the filet mignon  it was so juicy, tender, and flavorful! I couldn't get enough! The sides are of course important as well! Kimchi, bean sprouts, cucumbers, fish cake, macaroni salad, and squid! One of he best things, the fresh oysterssss!!!! My absolute favorite part of the meal! I would come back here in an instant if I wasn't so full from this amazing food!

Gangnam is the bomb, soo good! Awesome happy hour prices! Most deff recommend it! I reserved the room for my birthday with friends, all my friends who were newbies loved it! Spicy ramen is my favorite!

Great Korean food in Las Vegas! I got the 2 person Gangnam meal with my teenage son, who was starving! Thus the food better be plentiful and spectacular. It came with an assortment of meats and appetizers. All the meats were tender, flavorful and the filet mignon was melt-in-your mouth good! The miso soup that came with the food package was too salty and the bulgulgi bib bim pap was too sweet for my palate. So I got the plain white rice. 

The service was decent, but they were very rushed around because of the flood of people that came in. They could have used one or two more service people. 

We'll be back!

Cute and convenient place for any college student who dorms at UNLV that crave Korean BBQ, it's just across the campus. Friendly staff, our waitress continuously check up on us asking if we were okay. The quality of the food was great and the desserts was very appealing. Plus if you rate them on YELP you get a free dessert! (Saves you about $4-$7!)
Went for happy hour and it was all very yummy!! The staff were all great and very helpful, brining everything to the table super fast.
Nice authentic Korean BBQ. We, a group of five, visited this store on Monday night and it was as busy as weekend's night. The food was really good and stuffs were very nice.

Great selection of other dishes beside meat. My boyfriend and I were craving Korean BBQ and this place definitely delivered. Good service and awesome variety.

Highly recommend the kalbi and mushroom medley. I came in during happy hour and they had great deals on there too.
We booked almost one month ago . When we come to the restaurant, the waiter tell us they cannot find our reservation! It is thx giving!! Bad reception,suck!!!!
Excellent BBQ.... Long waiting but worth to^^ . Pork and beef are great!!! Not too expensive. We ordered a set of meat lover which is enough for three of us!

One of the worker will stop by to get your name on a list when you walk in. The wait was about 20 mins for 2 of us (There were 4 parties ahead of us) We got sat on a huge table towers the back. We decided to order individual items since I didn't like everything I saw in the combos. It was a great choice because we got to try everything we wanted. Nothing went to waste. 
Our favorites: beef bulgogi, spicy pork, enoki bacon.
The flat iron garlic was good, meat was very tender but lack in flavor. They do give you 3 dipping sauces for your meats. 
We also got the Korean marinated short rib. Flavor is similar to the beef bulgogi, meat was tender. 
For the price difference I would just stick with beef bulgogi at $3.95 instead of the other two mentioned above that cost $8.95. 
Sides included: cucumber, Kim chi, sweet onion/daikon, weird spicy noodle dish (not our fave), Mac and cheese salad.
Husband ordered the steamed egg, it looks really big but not as fluffy and airy like the one from Tofu Hut. 
I ordered the house salad. I liked the variety of mixed greens and cherry tomatoes, Lao came with an egg cut in half. The dressing sauce had a hint of orange citrus flavor, yummy. 
Service was decent. They switched the grill out as soon as it was black. 

Stick with the marinated items if you like flavor in your meats. 

Our total came out to be $58. 

Will definitely return.

Great place if you are looking for BBQ korean food where you cook it yourself. I live near the strip and have been to Kimchi before, and this place is way better. Great service, excellent food and reasonably priced. Only problem is getting a parking space.

Food was great 2nd time here but this time around the service was a joke. Never did I see my server  she literally cane to take my order and that's only cus I had to go get someone, I ended up ordering 2 waters that I never got I ended up having to ask a different server. I was never even asked how everything was. Service was better my first time around . Hopefully next time they improve

This is not an all-you-can-eat Korean BBQ place.  However, the quality and service makes it a much better deal than the AYCE places.  Quality, customer service, and location makes this a highly recommend restaurant

This is a great place for a group! The food come right out to be able to start grilling. The servers are very attentive, answer any questions, and help you with what you need. Will be coming back no doubt!!!

Very clean and good ambience. We ordered the best seller miso beef, pork belly, spicy calamari, steamed egg and chili dumplings. All with good quality and very enough for two people. The sauce that comes with the meat was really great too, and they also offer complimentary side dishes. The side dishes were all delicious. Among all side dishes, I like the fish cake the most:) such a pity that's not on the menu though. Overall, me and my friend are definitely coming back again!

We tried GangNam after looking at the Many Yelp reviews. We made it just in time for the 3-6pm happy hour. We ordered a lot off of the happy hour menu. We ordered wontons, edemame, chicken garaage, pork belly, corn, and more. Everything was delicious! Service was good, but the staff was certainly very busy! The decor is very nice. The restaurant is painted a nice deep red. Overall is really good experience!
Good food, chill environment and free ice cream maccrroon. Greatness!! Waters was hawt
It's really good overall,  I like their appetizers and beef. I used to love beef tongues, but their beef tongues are too thick for me.

Excellent prices with good quality meats. Try the soups too cuz it's delish!!! There is a happy hour from 3pm to 6pm and from 10pm to close. The prices are very reasonable and a great value. You can try a bunch of different meats. The ban chan is tasty as well. For example, pork belly order is only $5. Prime kalbi is $9.95. 

Service is efficient and courteous. One of my favorites in Vegas. Opens late too!!!

Awesome happy hour from 3-6pm and 10pm-close. We ordered 4 items for $13 total - great value for your money. Note: To get the sides, there's a minimum of 2 BBQ items per person.
-Beef bulgogi: tender meat, good flavor
-Spicy chicken with lemon sauce: tender and really tasty
-Mushroom medley: pretty good
-Beef toro: tough, wouldn't recommend

Also, leave a Yelp review and get free dessert.
deliiiiiiiiiiiiiiicious！Best Korean restaurant I had in Las Vegas. Oyster so fresh. Mushroom testes great. Calamari sooo good.
food is good. I love it. The happy hour beer is good too and the price is acceptable. Nice restaurant and nice meat. Love Vegas.
nice service nice atmosphere here. had an awesome night. definitely come again in the future. recommended.
It was very good! Especially I like Korean chicken cheese fondueI wanna come back again!!
Fast service. Great food. Good prices. Convenient location. Delicious and would recommend!

Been going to different Korean restaurants throughout the Valley and may I say, they have good food, decent amount of meat BUT bad customer service! I was still looking at their menu and our hostess snatched the menu book from my hand, didn't even apologize  also, my sangria drink not even half full when it was served.
Great foods and services!!! The capacious is amazingly delicious! My daughter loves the lemon sauce!

Came in for lunch we were the first ones there so we we're quickly seated. We both got the lunch set which comes with rice, miso soup and a salad. We chose to do the al la carte option because we weren't too hungry. We got the marinated Kali, bacon wrapped asparagus, the spicy tuna something appetizer and the spicy garlic sauce. We ordered the green tea mango cheese cake with mango ice cream for dessert. The portions we're small but we weren't very hungry and we're full. Our bill was $35. I liked that we had the option to either cook it ourselves on the grill or have the kitchen cook it. Everything was delicious will definitely come here again

Had a chance this past weekend to visit this KBBQ location. Although it was not all you can eat the amount of food that was received was more than enough. I went with two of my buddies and it was our first time there. We were greeted and seated promptly. Little did we know but we arrived during happy hour. 50% off pitchers and some of the dishes were priced at or around $4.00.

We advised the waitress that this was our first time and she recommended that we do the special for two people(+15% off for happy hour) and if we wanted to order some additional sides. I believe we ended up ordering the #1 with all the different beef options and also two sides of toro. The amount of food that came out was really overwhelming. As with any KBBQ spot the side dishes arrived (kimchi, Mac salad, salad, and some other items) along with the sides came 4 oysters, bibimap(fried rice), mushrooms and I believe that was all. If you have a chance definitely stop in because the food was great. With the three of us the bill came out to around $34/ea.

Pretty ok. Ordered the beef toro which is just a fancy way of saying cha dol. galbi and Kobe beef. All just ok. But really doing this review for the free macaron ice cream!!! The coffee macaron was so good.
Good quality food with excellent service. Wide variety of meats. Tables are widely spaced apart so comfortable away from others.

Wow! I should be eating here once a week!
The hubster and I just had a BIG dinner with a large bottle of sake to boot and our bill was only $25.91! Can't be at that!
We got there at 5:30pm, so it was HAPPY HOUR. We got corn, broccoli, dumplings, wontons, bulgogi, rice, spicy garlic edamame and all the kimchi sides.
It was all good. Was it the best I've ever had? No. But we really enjoyed it anyways.
The wontons are all cream cheese and the sweet and sour sauce is watery. That's my only complaint about the food.
The service was friendly and quick.
Next time we will try a dessert, for sure!
Nice place! Tasty and authentic Korean BBQ! Must try pork belly! Side dishes are also good? Tried too soups, delicious!

Be prepared to wait on weekends. Hostess said 30 mins. but ended up waiting over an hour. But once you sit down, food comes out super fast.  We ordered the gungnam set for two and it was a lot for two people. So come hungry!

Really cool atmosphere with good music. The service was excellent and they were pretty friendly. We got the 2 person combo for 55. Must have was the spicy pork! Also the strawberry mochi was super delish at the end and a great pallete cleanser
This place is amazing.  The meats are top notch and all the small complimentary dishes are great.  Very good friendly service too, highly recommend it if you are visiting Vegas!

The environment is very nice and modern. Our waiter was attentive to us. The Korean prime kalbi was delicious as well as the flat iron garlic beef. The spicy edamame was very satisfying.  The restaurant is kept very clean. 

We are happy customers.
Great food. Quick service. Happy hour was on point. Very recommendable place. I would definitely come here again when passing by Las Vegas. Top notch.
Good Korean food is hard to find in Vegas, but that is no longer the case.  Good food, good service!

Meat lover is valuable. It's way enough for two adults and one kid. Anyway, you get to cook your own meat. Plus, if you can't eat every thing you can just pack everything you can't eat. The most important thing is that it's delicious!!!
Enjoyed a lunch here. Liked the meat here very much! Located near the university, convenient place to have a meal.
Love prime kalbi tried filet mignon hirame miso pork toro  but didnt like the hirame miso !
Food is delicious. Portion for 2 is enough for 4 person. We order a BBQ set for 2 but end up we have 8 person eating it with 2 more tofu soup. Yummy.
Super yummy food!! Friends and I came for happy hour and your selections come with side dishes it was a lot kid fun to cook your own food. Nice environment; Back was our server he was awesome!
This place is super friendly and everything is super yummy. A must try-uni bowl. All the meat items are tender and well seasoned.
Amazing meat and seafood selections. Great staff with happy friendly environment. Definitely recommend this place.
Good food.  Long wait though. Comfy seating inside as it is not crowded.  Meat was good quality.

Off the strip, but worth the trip! So delicious! Our group ordered the gangnam share plate for two and it was more than enough for our party of four, along with a great happy hour appetizers (chicken and cheese plate was fantastic). Service was great, and food was yummy. I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!
Great quality meat and very friendly service.I highly recommend this place. I love being able to cook my own food. The waiters are really nice.
Good Korean bbq for very reasonable prices. The best is that this restaurant is right across the street from Hard Rock Hotel where I stayed, and opens until 1am.
great bbq！we came here for lunch and found the food awesome!!! Will definitely come back again :)
Hit the spot... Best beef ever.. tore it up like there was no tomorrow...definitely comeback when I'm in Vegas again... They need to open one in Dallas...

So, we came here on a whim, having resolved to try all the various places in the area.  We walked in at 6:30 PM on a Saturday, and the place was a ghost town.  One other couple at a table.  The cheerful staff seated us promptly, and equipped us with menus.  

The usual suspects on the beer list, plus a few oddballs which made for nice variety, and also a choice of sakes and other asian alcoholic beverages.

For those of you unfamiliar with the asian BBQ style of dining (as I was) each table has a small gas grill set in its center (and exhaust hoods with fire extinguisers set above them).  Each place setting comes equipped with a pair of tongs.  You order off the menus small (4 oz) batches of raw meat, and then grill them at the table.  It is not quite like Benihana, in that 1) there is not a chef doing entertainment-cooking in front of you, and 2) you are not in a mixed party.  Our waitress did come by from time to time to flip the meat , and to cut it with scissors so that it could be eaten with chopsticks.

The service was quite prompt and pleasant.  The interior of the restaurant was nicely finished, although the 2-person bench seats on each side of the table are so heavy that it makes it difficult to manhandle them into a comfortable position.  

The grilled dumplings were tasty; but oddly my girlfriend's less expensive beef tasted markedly superior to my pricer order.  

One thing that was irksome were the televisions.  They were showing women's college softball on ESPN 8 or something, and it was just annoying and distracting, cheapening the feel of what was otherwise a refined restaurant.  Why anyone installs TV's in restaurants other than sports bars is beyond me.  

The food was ok without being great.  Nothing that made me say "we HAVE to come here again!"  Prices seemed fair ($50 for the 2 of us, including tip, and we ate pretty well).  I admit I am terrible at using chopsticks, and so getting food into my mouth without making a mess is a challenge.  I didn't ask if they had forks, knives, spoons, but I was thinking about it.

When we left, we were the only patrons.  I wonder if Gangnam BBQ will be able to dial up their food to match the good service and beautiful interior.  I will be rooting for them, but don't know how soon I will be rushing back.
Great Korean bbq  definitely would come back here again!! I'm from Arizona and I love this place so much!!! The gangnam plate will fill you up either for 4 or 6 people

The worst experience in Vegas. According to my own experience, the yelp rate of this restaurant is fake.

We waited for one hour to get a table. The room was freezing. The waitress was very rude. It took forever to get the menu and wait for your order. The restaurant is obviously incapable to handle those many guests. The waitress ignored us for several times and when we stopped her, she told us she is so tired and worked for more than 10 hours. Maybe this is another consequence after they faked the rate here.
This place is great! Warm atmosphere, friendly staff,  and great food, especially the bimbimbap with beef. I will definitely tell people about this place and I will definitely be back.

Recommended by a friend and it lived up to the hype!!! This is one of the best Asian bbq places I have been to! Will be back and being a foodie I will recommend this place to my many friends who follow my eating!

It smells great in here if you like food. You can't help but get hungrier when you walk in. The servers were helpful about recommending what's good. The food was really good too. I had the steamed galbi and the marinated beef on the mist try menu. I would definitely come back here when I'm in Vegas.
So much yummy food!! Wait is very long, but worth it~ their most popular the gangnam style.
Service was good, great value and great food. Ambiance was clean, nice and appealing. I will definitely come back again!

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. It is not all you can eat which always means better quality of food. All the meat choices we had were very good and high quality. 

The soups and and all the side dishes are very authentic and had great flavors. The honey toast as dessert was amazing. 

All the staff was very nice and professional service was amazing as well.
Side dishes and bulgogi are delish. Must try if your around las vegas and craving for bbq!
Very good Korean BBQ, highly recommend! This is the third time we ate here.Almost tried all kind of the meat, I love the beef toro and Korean prime rib best!!!
Excellent food and some of the fastest, most attentive service I received while in Vegas. The Kobe Beef Carpaccio was absolutely to die for!
First tine here and food taste great and excellent service. I highly recomment to everyone to try...

One of the best Korean BBQ places I have ever been. The meat is delightfully delicious and chewy. When I entered the restaurant, the smell of BBQ was amazing. Side dishes are really well and tastefully prepared and staffs are very kind. I highly recommend this place if you are visiting Las Vegas. I also strongly recommend to go for Kangnam set menu - delicious dinner at affordable price!

My company and I was in town for a convention and decided to eat Kbbq and chose this restaurant. Well this restaurant was an absolute shame. The quality of meats and the service from our server was horrendous. I just don't understand what all the fellow yelpers are praising. Coming from all the great Kbbq LA has to provide this place was such a disappointment. 
On top of the horrible service they charged us an automatic 18% surcharge. We Complained to the manager and nothing was done. Never again am i eating korean food in Las Vegas.
BEST reverse happy hour for Asian BBQ in Vegas!  We will definitely be returning. I'm already addicted.

The food here is really good for its price, and the atmosphere is pleasant. Went with a group of 5 and had plenty of food to share with everyone. Everyone has their own pair of tongs, so cooking and serving comes by fast. Y'all know how long it takes to pass around food with KBBQ... But this went by very smoothly. Really recommend getting the combo deals if you go!

This place is not "cc", but the quality was so good.  Service was also exceptional. 

If you can, ask for the rear private room for six or more.  The privacy made the meal a fantastic feast.

Do try to made it here before 5:30 and take advantage of the lower prices.
Excellent!!!! K-BBQ.  Great service and very clean and super atmosphere.  One word sums it up #DELICIOUS

Definitely the best Korean Bbq place not only in Las Vegas but outside of Nevada. Servers are great and courteous. Price is fair for the type and quality of the meat they serve. So awesome! Bibimbap so tasty. They also have filet mignon which is rare to find in other Korean Bbq places. A must place to go to if you're craving for Korean food when you're in town.

Very excellent value!  We ordered the gangnam set for two people and the three of us could not finish. But better yet the six marinated meats inclusion filet mignonette and prime were especially excellent. Comes with bibimbap topped with bulgogie. 

Only little thing was some of the marinade and bibimbap were a little in the sweet side. 




Also excellent service:)
This place was highly rated.. but I am not sure why. The food was too expensive and just okay.
Great Value. Great service. Everything taste great.  A must go if you're in Vegas and want to save money and eat off the strip.
We order the gangnam bbq for two, the kobe beef with prepared sauce is my favorite. Also like the banana tempura, very special
Nice service. It's a cool place. It through me off when I saw we had to cook our food though! It was a fun experience and will come again
Great food especially the filet minion steaks.  Good calamari too.  Best to come during happy hour.

Gangnam is my go to spot!!! It's so good from the starting salads to the dessert! We come here and get the steaks and bulgogi. The prices can't be beat for the quality. You can't compare this place to an ayce place because they definitely succeed in the flavor factor!!! Come during their happy hour for even better unbeatable prices. Their staff is amazing and always tend to our needs. They are super friendly and do their absolute best to get what you need and fast! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants Asian food. YUMMMMMMM!!!!!!!!

First time at a KBBQ style restaurant. I thought it was super fun and entertaining paying to cook my own food. Meats and sides were delicious. The sushi and jalapeño poppers were soooo good! Ill be back again when i come to Vegas.

Walked in and saw the decor, it's very different looking. 
The bar area looked boring, but the seating area looked modern.

The food was mediocre, but in the end there was a lot left over. 

I didn't order any meal plan, I just went in and ordered a bunch of things.  I was surprised to see macaroni salad as a side dish. 

Overall it was good,  until next time in vegas I'll stop by again.
Such a great end of my long work day.. Great service and bomb ass food! Decent price and free desserts if you rate then.. Hence why I am writing a review!
Great food... great tasting beef, friendly staff. Clean restaurants great location. Would definitely recommend and come back again! For sure would come back when in Las Vegas.

We came in during happy hour and tried salmon jalapeño poppers and seafood pancake appetizers.  The poppers were awesome!! The pancakes were good.  Be sure to have the shrimp along with the bulgogi it was the our fave of the beef.  We also had the toro and kalbi.  Happy hour prices are definitely worth the trip!

Check this place, it's so much fun grilling your beef at the table.

Very friendly staff and everything tasted greaat!

GANGNAM! My first time here and I'm counting the days til I get back here again... 

Happy hour fried Calamari and Bulgogi is BOMB. 

My spicy calamari was just right for my #preggocravings too.
Yummy, good quality food for a good price. Good service, my water cup was never low. Jin was an awesome server!!!
Great place for Korean bbq :) filet minion is amazing and selections are great... Service is great and just a nice clean and cozy place to eat
Really good food and a fun experience. Make a reservation or prepare to wait a long time.

This place is so good! The staff there were really nice and the food was really good. I shared the GANGNAM combo and it was so much food. The meat was pretty good quality & was a well balanced meal. The side dishes were yummy too !

The GANGNAM combo came with 5 cuts of meat & lots of side dishes. Too bad salad wasn't refillable but it was good. There was also an kimchi tofu and bulgogi bibimbap. 

The meat was so good and we were so full after!

Best BBQ ever! Try the gangnam set!!!
Great night with the family!!!
Lots of beer too
If you're getting tired of Vegas's buffet. Come here for something different.  Great foods, good service, lots of items to choose from.

$45.95 for 2people BBQ.  Las Vegas 
Not worth the money.    
Better go buffet in Vegas next time

Service was excellent.

Meat quality was great.

Sides were good but not amazing.  Improve your sides a bit!  The salad was really good though.

Dinner can be a bit pricey ~$32+ a person.

Lunch can be from $15-20.

Recommended.
Food and service was great here.  Got the gangnam set and the uni bim bim bap, both of which very good!  Will be back for sure...

Very good value and good tasting food! Would definitely recommend this for any Korean bbq lovers out there

:)
Great Korean bbq in Vegas with a very good happy hour for food and drinks. The Toro and bulgogy were really tasty and the complementary sides are great.
We had a reservation at 9. I heard they might not accept walk in customers sometimes. It's better to reserve online! Great BBQ experience! Recommend steak! The environment was good!
Yummy and fun concept! Highly recommend. The chicken with cheese fondue was excellent. We came around 1:30 pm on a Thursday and there was no wait.
The service was great. The food was delivered quickly. Overall it was a great experience.
One of the best Korean bbq in Las Vegas. Highly recommend. I would eat here again. Oyster was a little fishy but everything else was good.
Portion size good and great service all around. Food and side dishes was very well done matching Los Angeles Koreantown

The first japanese + korean combination BBQ I ever have!!  it was defiantly the most wonderful experience I have today! We had the "Meat lovers!" And of course like it named! For people's that love meat meat MEAT!! Love the taste of the meat and very juicy tender! The sauces was great! $$ is reasonable and most of all got us full! Gangnam BBQ is defiantly a must try place to come if you want experience some korean and japanese food!  :D

We came during happy hour which was a good idea. Everything is fairly cheap and quite delicious. We hd the Beef Toro, Bulgogi, and Korean Chicken Fondue. The dipping sauce is what gave the food so much flavor. Also comes with the sides to include cucumber kimchee, kimchee, macaroni salad and bamboo shoots. Also when you review the restaurant it comes with free dessert! Choices are banana tempura or a macaroon!

Wow, been to GyuKaku but this place blows it out of the water. You get calamari, oysters, and shishito peppers as appetizers with the Gangnam package. Every meat dish was on point. We're from LA, and definitely would come back again. Service was great--everyone was nice. Just wish I could've eaten more!
Great expereince, good eats, fast and excellent customer service, friendly staff, all the food was amazing will be back soon

Pricey. 

Meat was all tender and well flavored. Definitely recommend ordering some lettuce to cut some of the meat flavor. 

Ordered the harami miso, Korean prime kalbi, filet mignon (oh so tender), flat iron garlic, beef toro, enoki with bacon (interesting)

Service is kind of slow.

Awesome flavor and very spicy!! Always a good meal here. Good place to bring a group of to bbq or just to get noodles. I love the spicy tuna kimbapp but maybe it has a bit too much mayonnaise in the sauce.

Service: friendly and attentive. Our server was very patient and answered all of our questions.

Food: ordered the meat lover for 2 people, which was enough for our party of 4. The bulgogi meat was one of the best I've tried, and the banchans were delish! We also ordered the seafood tofu soup which was pretty average. 

Overall a pretty good experience!

Good quality of meat. But the service is terrible. Doesnt give all the food listed in combo menu. Hard to grab servers. All marinated meat are extremely sweet. Even with the burn stains, doesnt change the grill at all. I asked it to be changed and the server was dumbfounded. 

Just order non marinated meat if you can handle their rip off price and terrible service.

Great place, yummy food, nice atmosphere. Kids really liked it, plenty of food - the macaron ice cream made it a 5 star for the kids xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx
Great BBQ dining experience. I highly recommend this place. The food and service was awesome.
Excellent assortment of delicious food. Great service too. Love the variety. Tasty meats and sides. The dessert macaroons are my favorite!

Very good food and service! We ordered meat lover combo, we got a lot of meat indeed. The beef is really good. But some of the meat is too sweat for my taste. Dumplings are good, and I also liked the sea weed salad.

The meat quality was excellent!! Better quality than the all you can eat Korean BBQ. One of the best Korean BBQ in Vegas in my opinion. We ordered the gangnam for 2, and we were so stuff. The servers were super nice. I would definitely come back over and over again.
Great bulgogi! Came in for happy hour! Quick, courteous service...lots of side dishes and good food! Recommend coming in for the happy hour specials

We had our valentines dinner tonight and everything we ordered was awesome.  Their premium dinner package consisted of high quality meats and seafoods.  My husband enjoyed his seafood ramen and will be ordering it again.  Everybody loved their dinner tonight and we made a good choice in coming here.  We will definitely be back.
Ahhhhmazing!! Food was plentiful, service was on point, and overall I'm stuffed!!! Definitely a place to frequent for all occasions and one of my new favorite spots. Love it!
First time here. The food was good! I would recommend it to others. Got the premium combo. It fed our group of four people. I normally don't have Korean food but I really enjoyed the food here.
Food was amazing and the waiters is very accommodating .  A must go place for BBQ cravings.

Awesome, especially during happy hour! Best value meats (everything $4 and under) and unlimited banchan. 

We really liked the bulgogi and pork belly. It was the first time I've tried chicken cheese fondue and that was great too. 

Would definitely come here again. It's off the strip but right next to the Hard Rock and such great value.

This place is amazing! We got the gangnam special and it had such a great assortment of food (I'm stuffed). You get standard korean banchan with several appetizers and meats. Particularly delish were the chili steamed dumplings, bulgogi, hamasi miso, and kim chi bibambap. But ALL of it was so good--I don't think I've ever been to korean bbq where I like EVERYTHING. And our server, Calvin, was very attentive and helpful in explaining and recommending dishes!! Highly recommended.

It smell delicious even before you enter. You are in for a food ride. The teriyaki chicken and the bulgogi were my favorite proteins. However, you cant go wrong with what you order. The dumplings were perfectly cooked and that cake they have, is a must try. it not, you will regret it. As with all the Korean BBQs, $$ can add up quick but they have reasonable prices. 

Since people seat and order a little at a time and then cook it yourself, you might have to wait once you get to the restaurant. 

Service was efficient and the proteins would come out rather quick.

Wow! This place really lives up to all its great reviews. Fun concept of grilling all your own goodies. We got the meat lovers. Everything tasted great. HUGE portions! The two of us definitely could not finish it all. Also feel free so swap out and meats or appetizers. They are so flexible and all the staff was very friendly. Also, if you write a review you get a free dessert ;)

Amazing food. Almost too much to eat it all. We ordered a meal for 6 and were a party of 8 and we still couldn't finish it all. Highly recommend this Korean BBQ. You'll leave full and satisfied. The Macaron Ice Cream is worth every penny too!
Great place good service good meat could bone up a little more on panchan but the meat quality more than makes up for it
Great Korean BBQ place!!!! I had Meat Lover, and all the food was delicious. Portion was enough.
Food was great especially the Bulgogi and the jalapeño poppers.  Service was good and the 1/2 off Sapporo beer at happy hour was a bargain.  We will be back.
Its like Oasis in the city. Those who crave for a spicy Korean food in the middle of your gambling days will be saved ;)

I'm a big fan of Korean food and this place was awesome. Our first time and it did not disappoint!   Very high quality meats...especially the Kalbi and bulgogi.  The bulgogi was actually the most tender and tasty I ever had!
food is great!! I love the prime kalvin and bibimbap. Pickled jalapeño slices is the best I've ever had.

We loved all the meats  and mushroom dishes. We would come back again. Last year when we came with a group of 8 we ordered the different dinners for 2. This time we ordered a LA cart and it was perfect for the 5 of us.
Awesome service, awesome food. Brought out food quickly.  The Beef was fresh and juicy!!!
Great food, cool set up to grill up your own meal. Good lunch special, would definitely come here again!

Bad, waited for 45min to be seated. When they said half an hour wait. Sat down and ordered oolong tea and they gave us warmed tea. So they said they are still boiling the water....waited 30mins then asked for sugar waited another 30mins...the waitress was very rude!!!!! Then the gratuity is already included? For 4people,  1toddler and a baby? And cooked our own food?...when it was really really bad service! We couldn't find anybody to help us. Never ever coming back here again or will recommend this place!

So 4th time here and still coming back :)


Okay yelpers here's my review. We ordered the following:

1. Harami miso
2. Korean prime Kalbi 
3. Prime Kalbi
4. Kobe Ssam (Uni dish)
5. Uni Bibimbap
6. Spicy soft tofu soup
7. Side of white rice 

Total bill came out to $78.52 for 2 of us before tax  so $90ish after 15% tip. 

I would say the food was 3/4 Korean and 1/4 Japanese style bbq. Korean sides are free and unlimited and if u "volunteer" writing a yelp review u get a free dessert  not the reason I am writing one but hey free is free...

Overall value & price I would say 4.5 out of 5 but with the good customer service it bumps to a 5! Would come back here next time I'm in town! :)


Update:
Came back a 2nd time in 3 days and got the bulgolgi beef bowl to go! :)
Wonderful gem in the Vegas town. The meat is super fresh and great service. Will recommend all who loves Korean BBQ.
My Fave kbbq in town, friendly service, top grade meat with great sauces. A must go to place when on this side of town.

Great food ,, great atmosphere and I love that they let you take the food home ! I am from California and the bbq places I have been to never let you take the food home so that is a plus in my book! The 2 for 45 package could actually feed 3 people ,, it's a lot of food they give you! Very nice staff and very good service
My first time at Gangnam Asian BBQ is spectacular time. I like the environment is very cozy and relax .Food and sevice is very nice..This is an another fevorite spot for me. Thank you.
This place is amazing and they gave us so much food. We ordered a two people gangnam dinner and definitely fed the three of us and we were super full! We will come back again!

Should not give any star. Last night around 9pm I ate at this restaurant. This morning starting 2-3AM, I had very serious diarrheas and vomiting.  Even right now, still having watering diarrhea and yellow vomiting. I  never had such  bad food poison before in my entire life. We ordered some Korean traditional rib and raw osyter. I guess raw osyter probably imported from Japan or bad sources.  US Government already baned importing from Japan because of    a lot of Japanese food contaminated from radiation.

Great korean bbq in a cozy atmosphere! We ordered the meat lover menu for 4 persons which was more than enough. The quality especially of the Kobe style beef was excellent! Attentive and friendly service.

It's my first time here and the reviews said it all, definitely coming back here. Try the spicy tuna kimbap and the cream cheese wonton.  The restaurant also gives you an option to cook your bbq or to have the kitchen grill it for you.
I love this place.  This is my favorite place in Vegas.  Great food and bread service.

This place is the korean version of Gyu Kaku. We got the meatlovers set and it was all pretty tasty! Their beef dishes were super tender which is a plus. Def try the beef toro and garlic flat iron if you were to order individually. Its better than gyu kaku because there's ban chan. The service was friendly and they were super attentive. Our waiter in particular was super sweet and funny. We'll be back Gangnam, Thanks!

Found this place on yelp and it was the perfect meal for dinner!  

Service: the service was awesome .. All the waiters/waitresses were so attentive and asked if we needed anything. Refilled our drinks, we didn't even have to ask!! 

Food: we got the "gangam" which was the #1 best rated. And it definitely didn't disappoint. All the meats were tender & soft. Lots of side dishes to choose from. We really loved the bulgogi fried rice. Extra bonus was the free dessert but you gotta write a review. 

Price: It depends on which meals you get but it can be $$ or $$$. 

Will definitely come back

Great foods and awesome customer service!! Recommend anything with Kobe beef in it, will not disappoint. Ordered for 6 and we could not finish all the foods. Our waiter is Back, yep, back for more foods. Great service from him and his associates. They were very friendly and enthusiastic. Would come back to this place again.

Second time visit this place! Food is good, services also pretty nice. Must visited place in Vegas! Meat dish around $7-8, and roughly 6-8 slices per dish, and the best here I think Korean Prime Kalbi and Fresh Oyster

I was very disappointed. I had high expectations due to the rave reviews. Too much sauce. We hardly finished dinner and had to leave due to bad head from the smoke. Need a better ventilation system. Won't go back. However service was good and that is why I'm giving 3 stars.
Very good place!! So many exciting choicesnot to mention they have coffee ice cream macarons
Delicious food and great service, definitely recommend this. The premium cuts for 6 was the best decision

As usual I discovered this place on the go. Didn't read any reviews but I was looking for some ethnic food and saw the sign. 
When I pulled up it wasn't quite open for lunch but the people waiting outside said it was well worth the few minute wait for the doors to open.  
Once inside, the decor was traditional for Asian cuisine. There was also a projection screen playing a combination of Asian and American pop videos which was pretty amusing.  
There was a variety of menus options which was typical for Korean BBQ.  So if you've ever been to one of these places, the food is as good as you cook it.  I was surprised by the edamame...a buttery garlic delight. The green tea cheese cake was much better than expected. 
The bottom line is that this place is pretty good and I would definitely come here again when in the mood for #cookedbyme cuisine.

Food:3.5 stars little salty for authentic Korean BBQ. But decent overall. Very similar to Gyu-Kaku BBQ taste and menu. Set menus are great for people who are fairly new to Korean BBQ.

Interior: 4.5 stars. Fairly clean for Korean BBQ.
Price: 5 stars very good.
Service: 4.5 stars. 

3-6 pm Happy hour seems like a great deal.

Had the prime Kalbi, pork belly and harami miso.

Great food and good service... I'll come back when I'm in town.

The food was great! This is one of the best Korean places in Vegas for sure! Definitely recommend the spicy chicken, it's the most tender chicken you'll ever have. Prices are pretty reasonable too for the portion size.
Food was great. Meat was tender and juicy. Portions of the meat were good too. If you rate them you get free dessert

The happy hour menu was the bomb dot com. This is what I call a happy meal for three!! We ordered at least 10 orders of $4 meat and it was all worth it!! The service is amazing!! We got what we needed and had no complaints!! I highly recommend this place for fine Korean dining!! :)

The place is really nice and warm and the food is great! Love their spicy pork, pork belly and kimchi fried rice. The only thing is that they don't have a lot of staff which makes the service kinda slow. But the rest is great. Would recommend for friends to come at a not too busy time.
This place is awesome!! Lots of free dishes given. We order the meat lover for 2 and it was definitely worth it!

I got here at 9pm on a Saturday and the wait for 2 people was only 15 minutes. Super cute place with a great authentic Korean atmosphere! 
We ordered the harami miso, the Korean prime kalbi, the beef toro, and the bulgogi. Everything was great but my absolute favorites were the Korean kalbi and beef toro!!! Next time I want to order two of these! Haha. The portions were decent and the food came out fast! The service was good and very attentive, the waiters all spoke English super well so there wasn't a language barrier like other Korean places. And I love that this place wasn't ayce since I usually don't go to ayce bc I can't eat that much and it's not worth the cost hahaha but here you can order as you please! :) I left here feeling full & satisfied but not stuffed and gross like I do after ayce!

P.S. i'm use to eating kbbq back in ktown in LA and this hands down is wayyyyy better than any other place (including non-AYCE places). I wish this was closer to home, i would be going here every weekend! This is as good as it gets!
Great price for the amount of food you receive if you get their dinner for 2. The amount of food was just asinine and the meats were very flavorful and each had a different and delicious seasoning.
Late night Korean bbq cravings and happened to drop by during happy hour! Love their happy menu must try the chicken karaage and bulgogi!

I like to come here whenever I am in town, it is conveniently located near the Red Roof Inn if you drive in from the back on Swenson.
 
Very yummy as always. The prices are reasonable as well. I had the bugolgi, beef toro, and harami miso.

On my previous visits I let them cook it for me. This time I cooked it myself.

UPDATED: updated after I ate my free yummy banana tempura. I got it free for posting a review.

Service was really slow.

MEAT LOVER MEAL for two

STARTERS:

Banchon x 7
Steamed Chili Dumplings
Seaweed Salad
Green Salad
Miso Soup x 2
White Rice x 2

BBQ  DISHES

Spicy Pork
Bulgogi 
Beef Toro
Flat Iron Garlic
Pork Belly
Filet Mignon

Essentially a Korean bbq restaurant and not a buffet.  Just north of McCarran and most convenient to the Strip by cab ride.  Ambiance is strikingly pleasant with wooden booths mimicking old style Korea with lipstick red sexy shiny tables.  Offering a sense of privacy and  focus. Black garb waitstaff are all Korean and most pleasant. Just sit there and let everything come to you.  Wouldn't recommend this venue for the heavy duty Korean buffet junkie. Perfect for someone who misses the bbq but not the madness of a smoky buffet.
Fresh ingredients. Friendly service. Always a fun dining experience. The bulgogi, spicy chicken with lemon and spicy pork are all on the Happy hour menu and their sweet chili dumplings are delicious.

Stopped in for a late night dinner after work and so happy we did. We are often hesitant about Korean bbq places but we have finally found our favorite! We got the most popular dinner set option "gangnam" which consisted of a variety of appetizers and meats. Of the appetizers my personal favorite was the house salad, which had an amazing dressing and different veggies and an egg. My boyfriends favorite was the miso soup! It also came with fresh oyster which had a great sauce! The meats were AMAZING great quality and awesome marinade. My personal favorite of the meat was the filet mignon! Everything was so good, and well worth the money. We will definitely be coming back..

Great food and environment! The prices are reasonable, especially happy hour. We loved the kalbi and bulgogi, and the service was excellent. The spicy sauce is also delicious. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone!

Very good food and great service!They have good combination bbq meals to share,but we decided to just choose off the menu and it was cheaper with more varities. Wish they had more side dishes(bean sprouts,and veggie options)

This is a really good korean bbq place.
I recommend coming during lunch because there is almost no wait! Gotta try the korean prime galbi, that is the best dish in here!
Also better know a little about korean bbq because you will do almost everything by yourselves.
Only 4.5 stars? This place deserves 5 stars! Great service and excellent food! Coming back here again!

Solid service and good quality food, will visit again.

The food selection was good and the equipments are new.

Salad was very impressive. One of the pepper was extremely hot, every other one was normal.

Meat was good quality.
Really tasty and fun.  Cook yourself,  very reasonably priced and a bunch of authentic Korean side dishes.

So Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining has been opened for awhile, but I only just noticed it very recently.  It is a Japanese and Korean DIY BBQ restaurant, where you can order items a la carte or from one of their many preset combinations.  It is a similar concept to Yagu (on the West side) and many other J or KBBQ restaurants in California.

Based on reading the past reviews (very helpful in convincing me to drive to this side of town for just a meal and go then back) and the photos posted for this business and comparing it to my first hand experience here, I can deduced that the restaurant has experimented with various promotions before settling on their current all day Happy Hour promotion.  Gone are their lunch special menu or previous versions of their HH menu.  Now you get 1/2 off selected beverage items and discounted menu items.

The food I was served was good and tasted even better when cooked properly and to the exact doneness that I want.  And since it was not AYCE, I did not felt subconsciously compelled to overindulge during the meal with the final destination dangerously close to meat coma station.  Price was reasonable, not cheap when you add everything up, but you get good quality for the price.

The server was very friendly and helpful, as was the owner or the restaurant manager/model (yeah, she definitely exudes the essence of Gangnam style). The restaurant itself looks very nice (posh with well executed design and decoration).

Suggested party size for dining here is up to 4 per table, as you have to share the grill built into the table.  Don't wear anything that you don't want smelling like it was generously sprayed with the delicious smell of sweet BBQ smoke after you leave or have a change of cloth for going back to work. Best time to come is after work so you can take advantage of their HH drink specials without having to feel like an alcoholic for the 2nd part of your work day.

Bulgogi, Korean Prime Short Rib and the Kurobuta (Japanese Pork) Sausage was what I ordered to be grilled and is what I would recommend to others trying out this restaurant.  No free banchan here, but you can order their Kimchee and Pickles (both are $0.00) to compliment your meal.

Solid 4 stars experience based on the service, food, atmosphere and price to value.

Awesome place....I recommend this place to bring on a date or with family and friends
Excellent service and our server Kristin was amazing! She was very attentive and genuine!
Best Korean BBQ I have ever had!!! Everything we ordered was delicious. Furthermore the service was top notch as it was fast and all the servers were kind. Truly a great place to eat
Great service and food.  Spicy pork, ribeye and sweet n chicken very good. If you looking to eat at reasonable price near the Vegas strip this is the place to eat .

Glad I took my husband's lead and try this new place out despite my craving for Chinese food. The 3k ++ reviews are not a hype and this place is indeed worth the try. Food quality (both meat, sides and apps) exceed expectation. We had:

Chicken Fondue
Calamari (nothing extraordinary but the dipping sauce is good)
Beef Toro
Pork Belly
Steamed Chili Dumplings
Sweet Corn
Chili Garlic Wings
Mushroom Medley

None of them did disappoint.
The service was excellent....the kalbi was even better! If you're passing through Vegas and tired of the buffet....come get some BBQ here.
Good value and surprisingly good service for a Korean restaurant.  The food quality is very good. Decor is modern and airy.  Will come back again for sure.

The Gangnam #1 is a meal fit for king. The marinated meats. And sides are delicious.  The music is a little distorted and annoying, but the food is devine. More than two hungry people can eat. I will come again on my next trip to sin city!
Our first time here. Gangnam have the best BBQ in the house. I recommend this place. All employee are so nice and friendly.

Went here for dinner tonight. Since I was alone, they asked me if I would like to sit at the bar and like a fool I said Yes, not realizing that it meant not getting to grill my own meat. Oh Well... You live, you learn.(I wish they had told me that though).

They started me off with a plethora of side dishes and accompaniments which all eventually went really well with the meats and a bowl of white rice; everything except a random macaroni salad that is which I didn't quite understand being there. 
I ordered the Kobe Beef which was the main reason I went here and the Garlic Calamari which they recommended. They serve 6 pieces of beef and some sea salt which you absolutely must sprinkle on. It enhances the flavor exponentially. This was my first time eating Kobe Beef and I now understand what all the hype is about. It was just juicy, so flavorful, so amazingly tender. Without a shadow of a  doubt the best quality beef I've ever had.  They did overcook it a tad and it was medium-well which is maybe how they do it, but for such a cut I would most certainly have preferred a mid-rare. Very highly recommended, even though it's ridiculously pricey.
The Garlic Calamari was a huge fail. They were cooked well and tender but had no flavor at all and I had to douse them in hot sauce and soy to finish them.

Overall this was an awesome meal. I would definitely love to go back here and try some more cuts and also grill them myself this time by getting a table instead of sitting at the bar. It's actually pretty reasonable(except the Kobe obviously) considering how much meat they serve. Definitely recommended.

Everything was excellent. I got the Filet Minion, Garlic Shrimp, Fried Calamari, and everything was cooked perfectly, and tasted clean. There were 7 small traditional sides included and I liked a few, I don't like spicy things but they had a variety of options for me.
Their happy hour specials are great! Good food and nice ambiance. Definitely worth trying!
Great service! Very friendly people! The beef toro is my fav!!! Good eats!! Will def come back when im in vegas!!
Good food for great price. Atmosphere is very modern and not loud as one would expect for a bbq at the table.. would eat here again.
Amazing food!! We ordered the MEAT LOVERS for two. It was well worth it for the price. I'll definitely come back here with more people next time.

It wasn't bad at all. I had kimchi soup and there were 3 pork meats in it. Food is eatable but nothing special. Their side dishes are VERY EFFORTLESS and Flavorless. For Korean, if you are craving spicy korean food, that will be the only reason you will go to this place.
This Korean restaurant is the best in Vegas for bbq. Loved the beef and scallop and the oysters. It's all fresh and yummy. The staffs were very nice. It made my night in Vegas! :-)

I came here because I saw the high reviews on Yelp. I can be honest that the food was good but the service is just not good. We came in at 11:40 on a Sunday. We waited till 12:15 and our food finally arrived. Then, I asked for more side dishes to every server. They didn't bring refill of side dishes till the end of the meal. It was not pleasant experience. I liked the tall male server who took our order in the beginning. The rest of the ladies are idk. And the restaurant itself if u guys know you guys will be busy. Then it should be well prepared before opening. It was ridiculous how long we had to wait for uncooked food and we walked in when it opened.
Food was delicious and filling! The wait wasn't too long and the food didn't long to come out as well! Their beef and pork cheek is top choice to pick! I recommend to come here!!!

Usually I really don't like Korean bbq, but this place is amazing! We ate some filet mignon, spicy soft tofu, and pork belly. Along with these delicious dishes we got some surprisingly new sauces and sides. I will definitely come back on my family's next visit to Vegas!!!

This restaurant was way way better than i expected. Premium quality meat, excellent services, and reasonable prices. The atmosphere is nice & cozy. I would definitely come back for more bbq when i visit las vegas again.
Very good food. We got the Gangnam combo for 4 of us. Delicious. Would definitely come back again.
Great atmosphere. Got the gangnam special for 2, everything amazing especially the prime steak. Service was excellent. Definitely coming back again!

Comming in on a bad day i guess. Restaurant does not have people to server everyone. People were cutting in front of us and got themselves seated. Waited a very long time for food. 40 min or more. One star so owner hire more people.

Free desert for honest review.

Omg to die for!  Everything that my family and i tried was phenomenal! This is such a fun happy atmosphere!  Plus the waiters and waitresses are super nice! FIVE STARS! GO HERE PEOPLE! I promise You won't regret it!

Great food, great service. Please make a trip here while your in Vegas..
John the Manager gave great service.

Our favorite spot for Korean BBQ! We come every time we are in Vegas. The food is excellent. We always get Korean Kalbi, Bulgogi and pork belly plus a tone of sides. The broccoli and cheese is a must. Don't forget the miso soup. Best I've ever had?

By far the best Korean BBQ I had for a while. I'm from Kansas, this place literally destroys the one in Kansas. Excellent staff and excellent food. Everyone wanting Korean BBQ in Vegas needs to stop here!
We come here all the time when we visit las vegas. The quality of meat is always top quality and we always visit several times if we stay for a week. One of the best korean bbq in town.
Food is fantastic. The shrimp fried rice is a must. Korean bbq is really good. Order the sweet corn if you want vegetables and the dynamite shrimp is a little spicy but sweet and delicious.

The female servers were so friendly. The male server who took our order was lazy. We got there at 11:30 when they opened and didnt leave until 1. We ordered veggie bibimbap, scallops, calamari, shrimp, mushrooms, onions, dynamite shrimp appetizer, asparagus, and king oyster mushroom. Also, hirami steak for me. Mainly seafood & veg bc my husband doesn't eat meat. The dynamite shrimp didnt come out until halfway through our meal. It was supposed to be appetizer. I think the server forgot to put it in bc he didnt write our order down. I think he got offended that I asked if he was going to write anything down. Oh well. Food was ok. I prefer gyu kaku. Faster service & better taste imo. We ordered the honey toast & it took fooorreever. Literally 20 min. The girl asked us twice what flavor icecream and she still gave us the wrong ones. If you've had honey toast in Hawaii, you know that the bread inside is usually hollowed out, cut into cubes & toasted with butter & drizzled with honey. This place did neither of those things. They left the bread inside whole & scooped icream on top. It was so hard to eat. We tried cutting it but it became a disaster & was so messy. We took a few bites & left it. The lazy male server was busy talking to another female server and left another female to clean off 2 of his tables & ours. He just kept yapping & didnt lift one finger to help clean off his own table. Unbelievable. The tip should go to the girls who helped us & kept checking on us but im sure they share tips. Would not come again.

In A Nutshell:

-We had an urge for Korean food after watching Anthony Bourdain eat galbi jim on TV in the hotel the previous night and Yelped "korean" spots in Vegas (surprisingly there were A LOT of choices)
-As you guessed it correctly Gangnam Asian BBQ was our pick.
-We came at lunch and it was easy to find.  It's located in a shopping plaza next to a tattoo parlor.
-They have a nice selection of combos and tapas.  We went w/ the Gangnam combo which in the end was too much food (and I hate wasting food, but didnt want to walk around with a backpack smelling of KBBQ).  I think the bill came out to around $75 including the tip.

Overall, its a nice restaurant with nice servers and you definitely will be full :)

We are from out of town and we will definitely coming back. The food was delicious, plentiful, and reasonably priced. Plus the service was responsive and everyone was very helpful and sweet.  It's a young staff and the music was good...So it made for a relaxed and fun environment.
One of the best spots for korean BBQ.  When we visit vegas this is the SPOT.  meats are premium and service is awesome.
Great value, great quality, lots of food. Will come here whenever visiting Vegas. Get off the strip and check it out.

Trust Yelp and try this place.  Similar in style to gyu-kaku but much higher quality.   We did the 55$ meat lover for 2 and it's probably good for 3 people. They are very generous with their portions including the salad and rice. The meat is super tender and the side dishes are very good. 

Ambience 4/5:
Nice tables and cool wooden benches. It has a Japanese feel but modern. Music is low so you can carry a conversation.  The tables are large so it can be hard to reach all the side dishes. 


Food 5/5
Good: filet mignon, beef toro, pork belly, prime kalbi, garlic flat iron

Average: spicy pork, beef bulgogi 

Service 4/5:
Attentive and friendly.  Most of the servers had a smile.  It doesn't look like they have individual assignments or sections because they all help each other out. That makes service quick.

We were at UNLV for the day and wanted to grab something to eat. I haven't had Korean Barbecue in a long time but this was a great re-introduction to Korean cuisine. I had bulgogi and fried dumplings, which were both great. The serving size was perhaps a little small, so just be sure to order enough food. The service was also pretty good as we were well attended through our time here.
Beef toro is amazing! Whats more, u must come here at HAPPY HOUR! the beer is only half price.

Wow.  Wow!  Wow!!!
My friend took me here - she's been a few times, and thought I'd enjoy it because of the type of diet I am on for a while.
I think this restaurant is in my top 5 of all time.
Basically, you select your meats and seafoods and they bring them to your table - portions are similar to what you'd get at a Tapas place.  You grill the foods at your table.  Some of the dishes are cooked in the kitchen, but pretty much the meats are all grilled by you, at your table.
This food was absolutely some of the most delicious food I've ever eaten!  Anywhere!
The quality was outstanding.
I almost can't wait to get to Las Vegas a year from now, just to go back to this place.
:-)

Nice food. Great bbq, recommend this restaurant.
The meat is the sweet style, and the desert was delicious.

The food was great. The service was fantastic. The server came in and out of our table to make sure we were doing okay. I would highly recommend this place to friends who come to Vegas for the weekend  

- Jay Dela Rea
We got the "Las Vegas", it's for two people ! This is the BEST place in town! ! It's close to the strip for the tourist

Very good foood, must try the pork toro, so tender and juicy when cooked good! And their kimchi is also amazing, mush try. The place takes a lil longer for wait time due to popularity, but nothing sitting at a bar to wait can't help time to fly by faster, some soju and hite is recommended. Back, our server is also really good at accommodating us, not often that we get good service at an Asian restaurant. Food in Vegas is everywhere, but go where you can experience good food, and a unique experience of a Korean BBQ!

My girlfreind and I came in here after searching on google for korean bbq place near the strip and we found this place. We are from la and we have gyu-kaku which is very similar to this place. The parking is very convinient and easy to fins. The food was delicious. We ordered chicken karrage which was actually better than gyu-kaku so thats a huge plus! The harami miso melts in the mouth so that's another plus! The service was quick and everyone here has a smile on their face. 5 stars hands down. Definitely a place to check out if your craving korean/japaneese style food. 

Tip to the owner: advertise on the strip and you will get way more customers, because this place is awesome!! 

Food: 5 stars
Service: 5 stars
Service is great and the food is on point. We love the Kalbi and bulgogi. Delicious as always.
If your craving Korean, Gangnam is the best Korean bbq I had in Las Vegas. Food is delicious with lots of flavor.

Love this place! Come here at least once a month :)
I have introduced it to many people and they too, end up loving this place! Great atmosphere! Great prices. Perfect central location. Staff is outstanding and the food in PRIME. Now if I could just perfect my chop stick skills ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
Service was quick and very friendly. Accommodated our group when we had too many people for their back room. Food was delicious!

First time here and everyone are so nice  we ordered the meat lover and i added some duck breast i like how the tables and chairs and the ambience of the restaurant definitely will come back here again

clean area good portion of food. Very close to UNLV campus. will come again.
This was my first time here, and it was so good! We ordered the beef toro, the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, bacon wrapped asparagus, and premium combo. It was bomb. We also ordered the kimchi soup. Loved it. Great friendly service, hot waiter. Sounds good to me :)

The food was great! The quality of meat was beyond expectation even in lower end meat.
Our server Dong-gi fantastic, very knowledgeable and friendly. Definitely recommended

Definitely my go-to Korean BBQ restaurant here around Las Vegas. As a party of 4, we ordered the Gangnam package for 2 and the additional portions on the front pages of the menu. My most favorite meat is ultimately the Korean BBQ beef!
First time to eat at this location.. Tried Premium set for 2.. All foods were great... Service was also good...
Great food. Fresh meats. Awesome side dishes (panchan) Excellent value! Come during happy hour for even more savings.

Tourists and locals: save your money and go somewhere in China town. It's easy to find a place with the same or better food with the same atmosphere for way cheaper. 
Food was average and the service was less then average.
Unique place.  Must visit when in Vegas! A little confusing at first but friendly staff is nearby to help out.

The biggest problem with Gangnam is the the portions are bigger than they look!  The highlights were the kalbi and the mushroom pack.  The bulgogi was good value.  Stay away from the squash.  Very good overall.

I LOVE this place! We got the meat lovers for 4. Came with lots of meat plus i ordered kobe beef and my party ordered chicken wings, fried oysters, and raw oysters also. The kobe beef was super super soft and buttery. Everything else was good. I loved the seaweed salad that came with. The rice was super fluffy and light. Side dishes were bombin'! The raw oysters...OMG...words can NOT describe the raw oysters. It was so good! The fried oysters were good too. I love the pork belly the best. There was 3 different sauces that came with our food. All three was so good. I would come here again whenever im in town. The food and service was GREAT! cute waiters too!
Been so many places, and this is the best Korean / Japanese BBQ in Vegas! Awesome service, and super cute waitress who gave us free macoron :-)
Best Korean BBQ in town hands down. The quality of meat was exceptional!! Great dining experience and beautiful restaurant. Will spread the word and be back :)
We asked for marinated meat but regretted it. All the meat was too sweet. It tasted like all the meat was marinated with the same sauce. The service was good though.

Trying a new Korean BBQ restaurant in Vegas.  We've gone to Ginseng in the past, but it's gotten quite expensive, so we decided to try Gangnam off the strip.  The decor is modern and well laid out, esp. if your group is larger than 6-7.  Ginseng can be tight for bigger groups.  We ordered the "Meat Lover"s" for 6 people and added a couple of additional appetizers and dishes for our group of 7, and there was plenty of food.  Service was fast, friendly, and all of the dishes tasted excellent.  Well worth the trip off strip if you're in the mood for tasty Korean!
We get meat lover and beef tongue today. Those are really good, I really recommend to come here for Korean bbq.

Amazing Korean BBQ! Meat was so tender!
I do not normally eat beef but when I do, I have high expectation. The meat quality and taste is definitely delicious and perfect! We enjoyed it so much, although far from home, we will come back the next time we visit Las Vegas!

This place is awesome!! The staff is very friendly, the service is on point and the food is always fresh and very tasty! 

I highly recommend this place to anyone that asked for a good place to eat in Las Vegas.

I've been to several Korean BBQ places and Gangnam is definitely at the top of my list.  Even though the layout is more for the modern hipster crowd our kids still had a good time cooking their own food on the grill.  Both me and my wife had the spicy ramen with egg which came out piping hot and had a nice kick to it.  The kids had rice and bulgogi was sweet and very tender.  The restaurant itself feels very upscale but the prices are reasonable.  Only gripe is there were 7 groups ahead of us which is not really their fault and they were still able to seat us in 25 minutes.  All in all good food and would definitely come again.
My very first meal in Vegas. We got a table full of dishes and all was very tasty and authentic. Worth the money!
The food is very good! We would definitely comeback. Their lunch special is amazing! The Beef bulgogi is tasty. I like the nice lady who kept refilling my beverage! Lots of Love!
First time to try Korean BBQ in LV. We ordered the Gangnam set and it is a lot for two ppl
Love here so much! The food quality is good, and the waitress are very nice, will definitely come back again :D

I always come to this place because it's location happens to be near my house and the food is yummy. U order the food a la carte but still fills me up and is kept in my budget. I like to come here with my girlfriend because the booths make me feel like I'm in a private place. The restaurant looks like it is brand new and I enjoy the music videos that they play on their projection which is a mix of Korean, American Pop, and some funny ones like Boy Dance Party from SNL. If you get Kristin as a server, you're in great hands! She is very helpful at suggesting food items and checks on our table at a consistent rate. She actually looks like she enjoys her job and enjoys serving you . The staff has always been attentive with my water also as I am a fast drinker. Their servers speak fluent English too 

My usual order consists of brown rice, kimchi (free), salmon jalapeño poppers (sooo good), 2 orders of toro beef and 2 orders of pork belly. The owner is friendly, and willing to help out with anything . 

This is my favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas , check it out!

First time doing Asian BBQ and we're definitely not disappointed! Started off with the calimari and wontons which are probably the best wontons I've had. The chicken fried rice has huge chunks of chicken which was nice to see. 

Thanks to the happy hour menu we tried the Bulgogi which was marinated to perfection and the waiter helped us cook it. Also had the garlic shrimp which was good. I've always been nervous about he little side dishes you receive but everything was so good! Minus the pasta salad thing which didn't seem to fit.

Probably the most perfect end to our Vegas vacation!
________________________________________________

After submitting my review we were ignored for a good half hour. Our waiter was too busy being FED by a friend across the restaurant. Really? I get if you're friends come in to eat and you want to say hi or chit chat for a few minutes, but to completely abandon your table? That's rediculous. Actually nobody checked on us during that time, we had to flag a waitress down who really didn't seem to care. Finally a second waitress stopped by and asked how we were doing. They were having a promotion if you wrote a Yelp review your got a free dessert, so we showed our reviews and then waited and waited and waited for dessert. The waitress was very apologetic and even gave us macaroon ice cream for free, on top of our 2 free desserts. The only reason this isn't a 1 star reviews is because the food was amazing and the last waitress to help us was very nice and helpful.

Love this place! You would think in Vegas you can get a decent meal any time of the day but not so! This place is open until 1am and the food is delicious and extremely reasonable for Vegas. The service was fast and efficient! It is popular and wait was a bit long on the weekend (45min) and they don't take reservations. Full disclosure, restaurant offers free dessert in exchange for Yelp review.

Food was great but they need more servers... especially during busy hours.
We ordered the bbq, kimchi chiggae, and bibimbap. The bbq portions were small but they were delicious. Kimchi chiggae was a good size and it was tasty. Bibimbap was also delicious.

A really cool, modern, comfortable BBQ Place!

I would give this place a 5 star, if their banchan selection was more extensive.  However, for the location, the food and the service, I will definitely be coming to this place, again and again...

A.  Location - Harmon, Swenson, Paradise.  There is a small strip mall there that has plenty of food choices and this location is perfect for so many.  Right across from Hard Rock....

B.  The Service - extremely efficient and pleasant. I came here for lunch and while it was not terribly busy, the server was just right in being very efficient, always there when you wanted her, very nice and top notch.

C.  The Menu - Loved the menu.  The cuts here are smaller in size and also more reasonable in portion and pricing. You can order a huge variety of different meats, seafood and veggies all ranging in prices form 3.00 to 12.00 per plate.  I loved the mix and match. IF I brought my glasses and had more time, I would have done this.  Instead, I turned over the menu to the combo page and pre-ordered one of the combos to make it easier for me.

D.  The Food- 

a.  Miso Soup - OK, so we are in a Korean restaurant and they serve Miso soup. I find that odd, and at same time I really cannot complain since it was tasty.  However, when I am eating BBQ, I like the real basic soup that is plain and simple.

b.  The meats - 

Chicken Tender Cheese Fondue -   OK, I am not a huge non traditional foodie, but man, this was really cool and tasty.

Bulgogi - Wow was that really fast and the sauce was PERFECT.

Filet Mignon - So tender and juicy...

Shrimp Garlic - Would have preferred Shrimp PRAWN, but these tiny morsels were okay.
