Harami Miso - Man was this steak just right. Never had it before and I really enjoyed it.

Assorted Veggies - Cool. Normal stuff. but those corn on the cob were awesome.

c.The appetizers - Again, miso soup, rice, salad and some kind of cream cheese wonton thing.  Different, okay. I prefer banchan.

E.  Come back factor - This is one cool place, the food is good, the portions are manageable so you can try different things for sure.  For business lunch, hanging out, this is a really nice restaurant and I do plan to come back.  If I am focused only on the bbq, I may try Tofu Hut or other places DJK, but I really enjoyed this Gangnam BBQ.

GK says, check it out.
Great food, good price. Amazing people working here. Their music sends an amazing vibe throughout the place. Also #freedessertswithyelpreview

I really enjoyed Gangnam Asian BBQ, went for lunch with 3 coworkers and we split the meat lovers special which came with enough food to feed all four of us! My personal favorite meat was the prime rib but the Bulgogi was a very close second. Ambiance is cool and location is pretty good! Will be coming back!!
Great food, fun atmosphere, excellent value! Meat is excellent quality and sides are endless

食物好 服務態度不錯! It seemed like it's really like a restaurant in Chicago called guy Kaku! So if you like Japanese BBQ and Korean BBQ together, it's a good fit for you! Tried the oysters and it is so fresh! Enjoyed it and the sauces are great
A good Korean bbq restaurant. The service is good and fast. The food is delicious, and I like the beef very much . I would highly recommend this restaurant if you go for a tour in Las Vegas.
My first time here and so far so good.  Would definitely come back and recommend this plc.
Love their tempura udon. Best Korean bbq I have ever had outside LA. We also got BBQ dishes. The meat quality is good and very tender. Nicely seasoned beef!

This is the best Korean BBQ that I always love to go when I am in Vegas :)
Coming to try them by yourself and hope you will agree with me about their 
delicious food and friendly services!

Enjoy!


Annie
First time here... it was an awesome experience!  Great food and our server was super friendly.  Left full and satisfied.
First time having Korean BBQ and what a treat! Great food, great service, and the portions are plentiful. You won't be disappointed!

This place is so good. Great food, fair price, and good ambience. Highly recommend.

It is my favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas. I would strongly suggest getting the Meat Lovers prepackaged meal. Great combination of good and so much meat!!!
Literally best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! Worth to try! It's kind of far from Strip, but it also avoid big traffics!
Would definitely recommend the combo choices. The meat was fresh and well marinated. The service was very friendly.
Delicious!!! Good food and great service!! Lots of sides, decent price.... Family friendly.. no wait...

Amazing experiences with the bulgogi. The taste was fabulous. I love the broccoli with cheese, and the beef toro
The staffs were very nice and helpful.
My favorite is the bulgogi.
The food was amazing and very fulfilling.  I got the meat lovers deal and the service was on point!

This is my first time here and it is very comparable to gyukaku back home in Hawaii. I would definitely come back here when I come back to Vegas. Their portions were good and the service was great. My favorite was the beef toro but everything else was great as well. Overall this is a place I would recommend for people to try.
Really nice place.! Had a lot of fun and a great staff...! Especially Ryan was super nice and welcoming...!
Everything was bomb!! Happy hour has some good items on the menu as well! Holler at the dessert
Absolutely the best Korean bbq in town. Nice food low price and many choices! Will come back for more food.

Good quality meat and a lot of food, but they need to tone down their use of sugar 

Got the Gangnam for 2:

4 out of 5 of the meats were marintated in so much sugar that I was done after eating one of them

The only non sweet meat was the miso steak, and I thought it was extremely salty.

Bulgogi rice - also too sweet

Come if you are hungry! Fun atmosphere. Won't come back though, unless I am craving sugar
Awesome restaurant!!! Best Korean BBQ in town! The Bulgogi and Spicy Pork were to die for!
One of the best dining experiences. More than just food and service. This place does it all right!

Delicious! Favorite was korean prime Kalbi. We also tried prime Kalbi, harami miso, pork toro, pork belly, steamed egg, steamed dumplings, kimchi tofu. Service was prompt. They could have been better with refilling our water and small side dishes. Pork belly was a little tough, but the toro (cheek) was tender. You can always get a free dessert when you submit a Yelp review!
Best bulgogi outside of San Diego. The meat was flavorful and so tender. We were craving Korean bbq and this place did not dissapoint.  A must try while in Vegas.
This was the best decision Ive made since coming to Vegas. Everything else is best left for the cops to uncover.

Excellent Korean style bbq. Service is friendly and efficient.  All meats were delicious.  I liked it even better than Gen!  $2 for a bowl of rice is a bit ridiculous, but otherwise price is reasonable.  Kids loved it too. Will definitely be back!

This was my first Korean Barbecue experience. The food was absolutely delicious.  I'm relying on memory. I believe it was the Las Vegas meal. There was bulgogi bimibab (Korean fried rice with barbecue steak), garlic shrimp, spicy marinated chicken, brisket, sweet marinated chicken, and we ordered short ribs on the side. Everything on it was delicious. 

My only complaint was that, once we were served, the server completely forgot about us. Not one drink refill. When we were finished, we waited and finally got up and went to the hostess for boxes (there's a lot of food) and the bill.

Still, the food was very worth it.
Lots of fun for a group or just dinner. Good happy hour prices and the grilling is enjoyable. I've had bbq Korean in Korea and this is just as good...but understandably without charcoal.
Fresh meat, great service and environment. Definitely recommend for Asian stomaches. My 3-year old also enjoyed his meal.

I have been here for three times now and I believe that this is the best korean food in Vegas! I ordered pork belly and korean prime Kalbi every time! My friends loves the sukiyaki noodles a lot. We never have something similar. It's amazing.
I want to try more vegetables in the future.

Gangnam's Korean BBQ meat is both flavorful and fresh. Customer service is good. Service is usually very quick. The food is given to us very fast. Even though it's not all-you-can-eat, the pricing is reasonable and the food taste very good. Compared to other Korean BBQ restaurants I've been to where it feels like they leave their food out, I think Gangnam does not do that. I really like this place for good Korean BBQ.
Good portions for the package combos. And the side dishes were great too. Recommend for anyone itching for some Asian now!!
Excellent food and excellent service recommended. Choice of small portion of Korean BBQ. Happy hour half price on drinks and discounted BBQ meats.
Food is good and meat is fresh love the Korean short ribs. Place is busy. Luckily only a short wait for us

Great good and service! Portions are just right. No rice paper though :(

They also add 18% gratuity for large parties

Great menu selection for the price. Very filling menu items for 2 or 4. The dinner combos makes it easy to select. Comes with rice, appetizers, meat and other veggies. 

We tried thr gangnam combo and it had oyster calamari. The filet was very good as well.

Going to do a more updated review later. This review comes with a dessert

Fresh oyster
Soft meat 
Kkbq ready to eat
Free macaroon
Servers are fast and friendly

We came on Father's Day so I'd understand the delays and misunderstandings 
Any way... We walked in and was told to wait since we had a 7 people party which meant our wait was going to be longer than the shorter parties 
After what seemed for a eternity (40mins) we were finally sat down and ordered our food 
Everything tastes great and was priced very reasonable the servers kept coming in with our orders and taking our requests for water.

All in all the only thing that keeps me from giving it 5 stars was the fact that the front seems to have a AC issue since is pretty warm in the front which can get annoying and it you have to wait it might incline you to walk out. But if you stick through it you'll enjoy your time here

I have been here twice, and will definitely be back.  Best K-BBQ I've had.

Everthing has such great flavor, and is a really fun night out with friends or family.

See ya next time!

Great food, I especially loved the grilled beef and broccoli cheese fondue! This was our first time here and we will be coming back when we visit Vegas. Although the restaurant is not located centrally on the Strip, it's worth making the trip (by cab) out to Paradise Road just to go to Gangnam Korean BBQ.  If you're looking for authentic food instead of your typical chain restaurants located on the Strip, eat here!
Amazing spot for dinner! Had the "Meat Lover" for 4. Lots of food. Ambience was good and trendy. Great place for Korean BBQ!
I liked their lunch special and their a la carte menu. Happy hours from 3 to 6 are really good. Thanks!!

Outstanding lunch...service excellent...very unique lunch..will come again for sure 
Waitress very friendly and ...extremely helpful with order and very efficient quick service..Her name MAM

I came here because i was staying at vegas for 4 days and i have to eat korean food at least every other day :D They have really good quality korean food and all the banchans were good! I would definitly come back!

Wow. Happy hour 52$ for 3 of us. Mo
re food than we could eat. 2.50$ Sapporo. Try everything. Loved it.

good place to have a late dinner. fresh food and nice stuff. good to try. the kobe beef is very juicy. the appetizer is a lot. i like the calamari. always seafood go first to me. every kind of beef has its own taste. thats very nice.

Great service! My family and I were greeted by a server and were seated at a table with the open stove in front of us. My kids enjoy watching their food being made so this was a good thing and one way to keep them calm around the stove/bbq pit. My husband and I got a drink or two and it was the great 50% off deal during happy hour so we had quite a fun time. We got the bugolgi BBQ and everything was quite tasty and delicious. The service was dandy, the staff is friendly. Good place for lunch with friends or family.

Came here for the reviews and stayed for the amazing food! Everything meet expectations in flavor and service. They play music and portray the music video on the wall. The grill isn't like other typical Korean BBQ which gets dirty quickly and provides a nice even hot plate for the food to cook. Loved the side dishes. The salmon poppers were great. Scallops were tasty and the meat was succulent.
Been coming here to Gangnam to bring our clients for dinner every LDI, NAB, & Infocomm tradeshow. Hands down the best food & service every time!

Very horrible service. We want add something, call waiter about three times. I'm allergic to onion. Order told him "we every food no onions" but still had Onions inside, The waiter like didn't hear.  
We come here for the first time a good time. We order the combo, it's a good deal. This is the second time come here to eat with friends. The same order, of all the food are reduced.
The service also very poor. Two waiters in flirting and chating, didn't listen to the guest's calling. Empty plate on the table and no one clean. I never come again.
Great service！ The food was great. We had the bulgogi bibimbap, spicy seafood noodle, and spicy ramen and they were all great. Yummy dessert to top it.. Nom nom :D

Big portions at reasonable prices.
If you miss steam white rice, highly recommend this place!
Great food at reasonable price!非常好吃的烤肉，还有马卡龙做甜点，份量也很足。能在las vegas吃到这么正宗的韩国烧烤是旅行中的惊喜，环境也很好，从big bang的歌放到少女时代，边听边吃，相当满足

High quality meat, extremely rich in flavor, great service, & a cute ambience. What more can you ask for? Our server suggested we try the gangnam style BBQ for our first time. From the starters to the dishes, you will not be disappointed! At the end of our meal, we still managed to squeeze in dessert, which was just as good. From the mochi ice cream to the lava cake to honey toast, everything here was on point. Definitely set the standards for Korean BBQ for me.

Great service, great food! 
Server Hyelin was so nice and friendly. Servers Raeyong and Yohan were informative and provided fast service. 
What I love about the most is that they surely dont joke around with their portions.

Coming from an experienced La Korean BBQ vet, it's hard to be compared to anywhere else. Gangnam Asian BBQ is no exception. I ordered the bulgogi bibimbap, and was sadly disappointed with the selection. It was rice and bulgogi....that was it. The waitress came by and she even look as displeased at me. What was surprising was that she didn't do anything about it, which was saddening. I can't say that it was their fault, since that's what I ordered, but if a customer looks dissatisfied it should raise an alarm to do something about it! Learn from this, the restaurant has potential.

This is probably the best Korean bbq I've had in Vegas to date. Good prices, great variety of sides, good quality of meat. Service was a little slow but not terrible. They were just quick to leave before everyone could get a request in. A little hard to find off the strip. Overall good experience.

Great cuts of meat.  Fast and attentive service without hovering or being annoying.  Korean food served by an all Korean staff.  Had a great dining experience with my friends.   I'll definitely be back.
Great restaurant and friendly staff. The meat is really flavorful and tender! Love it and will come back again
Outstanding service and excellent food. Top rated.  Great staff.
Best Korean BBQ I have had in a long long time! Everyone at our table enjoyed every bite!

Great service. Great food. Really like grilling our meat at the table.
Got the lunch special w/ Bulgogi and dumplings. Delicious
Since we discovered this place last month, we ate here 5x already. love the Happy Hour choices. My kids love the Kalbi soup, Sukiyaki noodles. The staff are very friendly also.
Meat Lover platter, The best!!!!! It gives you a taste of lots of different  meats, I recommend this if you want to give everything a try. Great service. A fun family experience!!!!!

Ambiance and service were phenomenal.  I will definenatly be back. Now for the bad.  They don't carry side dishes which is my favorite part of a Korean meal.  So I will still make a 20 minute drive out to Soyo because of their high quality kimchi side dishes and complimentary barley tea.
Delicious Korean BBQ. One of the better Korean restaurants in Vegas. Meat was good and well marinated. Side dishes were also great. Good service.
Surprisingly good Korean food with a large variety here in Vegas.  Only wish the filet was sliced more uniformly.

our first time here, we was craving some good korean grinds and this restaurant has excellent Korean food, service was great, my husband and i loved it!!! if you are looking for tasty korean food as good as you get in Hawaii then this is the place for you!! they also offer FREE dessert with your review, now thats a bonus!

The smell is really good here and you should DEFINITELY visit here! It smells like steak! :-) The place is great, too. If you rate on this app (yelp) you get FREE DESSERT! The waiters are really nice :-D

I can't say anything bad about this place. Went here two days in a row for their lunch special it was so good. Their Bulgogi is marinated perfectly. The staff is so friendly, make you feel welcome and that they appreciate your business. The number of great reviews on here is completely justified

In town for the weekend and decided to try this place out. Great choice! It was delicious! I we ended up ordering seconds because it was so good. The service was great as well! They were all friendly and very fast. If we are ever back in town, we will definitely be back!
yo! Definitely come back for Honey Bread next time! I ordered Bulgogi Bipimpap and that was a bomb! !
Very good juicy meat! The appetizers are pretty good too. Love the place, very fashion and stylish decoration.  Definitely suggest try it! Irene
Bring your appetite! Great food,  good service.  We just stumbled upon this place and we will be back!

We got the Las Vegas combo split between four people and it was really good. The pricing is good for the amount you get. All four of us are leaving feeling full and the meat was very good. I definitely recommend eating here.

Pretty positive experience overall. Great ambiance, relatively private dining area with tall dividers in between booths along the wall. Always enjoyed the concept of korean BBQ and this place did not disappoint
The food was excellent here! I had the tofu soup and it was delicious! We also shared some meat and all types of meat were high quality! Even the salad was tasty! I highly recommend this place!
Got the "Vegas" and it was just right filling for the two of us. The food was amazing and getting to cook the meats was quite a fun experience.
Good food great atmosphere and the fiod is awesome. Definitely a place to try if nearby

After a hard night out on the Strip, Korean BBQ is the go to hangover cure for us. Gangnam is everything we could've asked for--- reasonable prices for a huge BBQ set, including short ribs, steak cubes, marinated beef, bi bim bap, steamed corn, buttery mushrooms, and a plethora of other small side dishes. Service was great, and the interior was modern and clean. Huge thumbs up from us.
Great spot in Vegas! Not too expensive and you get a ton of food! Service was superb!

Great atmosphere and the staff was really nice and helpful. Very populated which reassured me of my choice having been out from of town. The food choices were numerous. Three of us shared the gangnam combo and LOVED it!

This place is amazing 
Great service and delicious food! Not to mention, the price is reasonable! Definitely feeds more than 2 people :-) will be coming back again soon!

Nice decor...loved the grills..not as smokey as the normal korean bbq places. The meats were good quality. Nice change of pace compared to the all you can korean bbq places. The waiters were very helpful and attentive. when I lived in the OC. I would have korean bbq once a week in Korea town. Gangnam reminds me of the good old days. The bulgogi was tasty. The fried calamari was perfect. The Kolbi is superb, but the filet mignon was orgasmic.

First time here and it was amazing! The service was fast, the food was excellent and the people who worked there were really nice. The meat was so fresh and the sides were so tasty and the macaroon ice cream sandwich was the icing on the cake. Will recommend this place to everyone and bring my family who'll be visiting next week
Great food, nice service. Best Korean bbq at Vegas. There is waiting line so you have to get there early
Everything was bomb!!!! All the beef was tender and awesome! Service was great! The beef soup was so yummy and soft. Ramen was great, a++. Im so stuffed right now.
Came in for the lunch special. Best kalbi and spicy pork!! Great food and service! A must try if you're in Vegas.
Wonderful food and great atmosphere. Recommend it for large gatherings! We ordered the meat lovers and it was plenty of food. You can't go wrong coming here.
The food here is delicious. The meats are of good quality and I will definitely be back here when I come visit Vegas. It's a good spot to get away from eating at the strip.

This is the perfect spot to take friends who are unfamiliar with Korean cuisine.

The menu covers appetizers, some fusion (Korean-Japanese) dishes as well as traditional Korean BBQ meats.

The restaurant is nice and clean and there is a grill in the center of each table to cook the meat.

We had a party of six and two of our guests had no previous Korean dining experience.
They liked the fact that we prepared our own food. They even had forks for these poor souls.

The outcome was that everyone had a great time and wanted to come back again when we return to Las Vegas for next year's convention.

All the items are per portion so I imagine it might take a visit or two to get the quantities right.

The server was very friendly and hip and ready to assist all the various levels of guests entering Gangnam.
This place is really fantastic. The service is great and the food is above par for sure. Absolutely recommend!
Love this place! Great quality meat and amazing service! I'm definitely coming back and would highly recommend! :)
great Korean style bbq in Las Vegas！great beef with sauce and side dishes. Steamed egg is perfect! But the digging sources are a little bit salty.
Yum! Everything was delicious and waiters were attentive. Not too much seating so the wait can be long but it's worth it!
This restaurant is amazing! The bbq meats were well seasoned and tasty. Service was excellent. By far the best Korean bbq restaurant in Vegas! I highly recommend dining here!

Awesome service as I went in! The waiters are funny with great recommendations. I mean free dessert at the end so why not? They didn't change the grill that often. We ordered some green tea and it seemed like they didn't want  to give us water. I guess it depends on the waiter. I got really after two dishes so order accordingly.
Food is really good. Meats are really tender and juicy. Great service too. Will definitely come back for more..

We ordered the meat lovers combo. Lots of food for 5 adults and 3 kids. Fun experience. The desserts were not impressive. The lava cake was not worth paying $5 and the banana tempura was way too hard. One of the severs was not very nice to us, so that's why I gave them 3 stars.
Very good BBQ atmosphere and excellent Sause with meat!

Really nice place, food was pretty good. Bolgogi had really good flavor. The grill-it-yourself concept is pretty cool as well. Although I do wish they'd give a guide on how long to cook the meats. The appetizers were good as well, and the complimentary side dishes were a nice touch.

Outstanding place! The food, the service and environment are just great! And it's cheap. If you love korean or seafood then you must go to the place. It's only 5min from the Strip street by car. Unfortunately, there is no affordable Korean restaurants on the main street. Good place for 4-6 people.

This is our 3rd time here and by far is one of the most delicious restaurants in Las Vegas we truly recommend this place. The food taste so good at a reasonable price. The staff is also friendly. Their combo dishes are worth the price. Come on in and try it you won't regret it is too good to pass up
I think I just ate my own body weight in meat. That was delicious! I will definitely be back. This place has a killer happy hour menu and I promise you'll be stuffed! YUM!
First time here.  Food was great!.  Good service. Very nice location. Will definitely come back when I'm in town.
First time coming here and it's great! I mean cooking your own food right in front of you?! Gotta love it!
I love the spicy tuna kimbap appetizer. They even let me tweek one of my orders. The service was friendly. I always come to this spot when I'm in Vegas.
Came on a Tues night...fast service, great food (meat lovers combo).  Wish we had this in Phoenix!
First legit Korean BBQ I've been to and it was great! Great staff. Great food. Great atmosphere. We ordered the meat lover for 6. There are 7 of us and we were all very full.
Glad we stumbled across this on Yelp. Food was yummy and service was fast. Spicy Tuna Kimbap and Chicken Karage was our favorite but everything was really good.

Delicious food! Pricey but worth. Coming Again soon!
Would recommend the beef Toro and spicy chicken!! Fast and good service.
David was amazing. The food was great.  Everything in this place is incredible. We ordered the gangnam and it was really good.

Visiting vegas for the first time and read amazing reviews for this place and I can honestly say I'm not disappointed! Food and service was amazing and free desert! Premium for 6 people and it was more than enough food for everyone. Kobe beef and kalbi was amazing but was not a fan of the poke (still semi frozen) or the oysters. Overall very happy.

I'm pretty sure that this is not the best Korean bbq place in town, but yelpers love it here! We came on a weekend and the restaurant didn't seem too busy on a Saturday night around 9p but we still had to wait for a table. 

The three of us ordered bulgogi, kalbi, japche, and dynamite shrimp. The food wasn't bad and I enjoyed it but the service was non-existent and the vents over our heads was leaking water, which kind of turned me off. A drop of water even hit my head so I moved spots. 

Our bill came to around $50 which is normal at a Korean restaurant. I'm not sure if I'll be back, but the food did hit the spot.

Great quality food.
Cool Happy Hour deals.
Well ventilated dining room.
Good service.
Must get onion side.

We've been here twice now and both times it's been great. The meat is marinated perfectly and if you get the "Gangnam" choose the bibimbap because that crispy rice is the shit! The grills are clean and cook the meat just to our liking. If you stop by late go for the happy hour for some cheaper appetizers and drinks to go with your meal. Great spot for a group or just a cute date to burn your food while you make out. You decide!
First time at Korean BBQ so don't have much to compare it to but the food was amazing! The mango kochi desert was the best I've had. Highly recommend.

Tasty meats, good sides,  good service, large menu,  free dessert with review if you show the waiter.  A little pricier than Chinatown, but that's to be expected.  Surprisingly not saturated with obnoxious tourists even though it's right next to the strip.

Good food, particularly the spicy tuna kimbap and the house salad. However, service during happy hour starting 10 pm needs a lot of improvement. First, 2 servers are not enough for 10 tables and a line of people waiting to be seated. The staff was working hard, but I must suggest a major improvement on friendliness and appreciating their customers (instead of tossing our bill on the table).
Place was great. Very friendly waiters. The food was delicious. Great sake. Haramae miso is a must. This was my first time here and i am definitely coming back when I am in sin city.

It's a nice Korean BBQ food restaurant . Very Great food!
But there are so many people, to have better dining experience, it would be perfect to reserve a table beforehand.
We just had lunch here, the meats tasty and tender and the banchan were terrific. Everything was well prepared. Expect a wait as it seems to be busy any time of day.
My phone screen is covered with savory kalbi and bulgogi juice as it was sitting too close to the grill. I'll probably be licking the screen clean later this evening.  Awesome Korean BBQ!
Amazing food and great service!   Enjoyed Korean prime rib kalbi.   A must try if you are in the Las Vegas area.
Excellent service here, staff are extremely friendly and attentive. I love love love love love love love love love love love love love their filet mignon! request calvin, best server there!
Hands down the best Korean BBQ I've ever had.  Great service, excellent meat and the price is affordable.

Complicated and unusual. No indication of oils or additives.

This place really is for locals or people that are really into this kind of food. I was a victim of the advertising and i spent too much and left hungry.

Great menu, including happy hour menu! My favorites were the kalbi and bulgogi. I'm also a sucker for noodles so got ramen and cold noodles, yum. Loved the sesame oil w/ sea salt and cheese fondue sauces. Also get free macaron ice cream w/ review. Definitely worth getting off the Strip for good, affordable kbbq!

This place serves both Korean and Japanese bbq. it does get crowded on the weekends, but the staff works very hard to get everyone seated and service here has always been gret. The food is fantastic (love the unlimited aide diahes)! Overall a Great place, good sized portions, and we love coming here when we're in Vegas

The dipping sauces for the grilled meat were great! Highly recommend the happy hour. I had the spicy chicken with lemon sauce, broccoli, and the mushroom medley on brown rice. Definitely a good place if you're trying to eat healthy and on the cheap in Vegas.

The experience is probably heightened because of the crazy wait time. We showed up as a party of three at 4 in the afternoon and still had to wait over an hour to be seated. The experience is fairly authentic but the amount of food for the price is wanting. The side dishes are also underwhelming. The deokbokki was perfectly al dente though, and the kalbi was also super tender. The food comes out fairly quickly and the staff was very pleasant. The bill came out to be about $35 a person. However,  compared to other korean BBQ places I've been to for the same price the offering tends toward measly.

Food was excellent and. More excited about the desert, I took my parents here and they loved it my dad had the soup and we ordered from r happy hour and it came out to be extremely cheap and the quality was great. Plus if your rate them in yelp you get free desert

The food here is fantastic. Did not disappoint. The kimchi tasted home made, it reminded me of my mother's. My 7 and 5 year olds pretty much finished off a bowl of nengmyun on their own.

The meat quality was very fresh and tasty.  It was firm without being chewy and not overly marinated.
前菜超正. 就係kimchi有d辣. 而且燒烤時無咩煙. 最鍾意哩樣. 前菜係日韓合併. 即適合鍾意吃辣又適合唔吃的辣噶人. 一流啊
I love. Gang am. Just had the las vegas table bbq. Excellent quality and flavor.  The servers are very friendly. And I love the bibimap
Coming from ktown, this is the best korean BBQ ever!!! The meat so tender, bursting with flavor... oh, I wish it were closer to home. Like tapan dishes, must get the combo meal!

I was actually really impressed with this place . The ambiance is nice and so was everything else ! The desert display in the front caught my attention. Who doesn't like ice cream macaroons?! 
We needed up choosing the gangnam style platter and it was a lot lol I had no idea it would fill me up like it did and for a little girl, I can eat ! Great portions ! Definitely will come back !

Came by on a Friday night. First time here. Ordered the gangnam portion for 6 people and it fed all of us. There was even left overs. Definitely would recommend this place. Salad was a bit on the weak side. The dressing could have been stronger. It tasted like oils and nothing else. The bimbim rice was so good and went well with all the meats. The karaage was a bit plain. Needed a bit more flavor though. Service was nice. But could have been more faster at serving our drinks. Kept asking for refills every time. But other than that, would definitely come back.

Best BBQ in town! The kalbi soup, seafood tofu soup, and the chicken fried rice were the best! Others, like the miso soup, the bulgogi beef, and appetizers were also delicious. The side dishes were tasty as well!

We got the Gangnam dinner which was a lot of food and all very delicious.

Good diversity of different meats, and the sides were also very good.

This was one of the best Korean BBQ places I've ever tried. Their lunch special has a large amount of food for such a decent price. I tried the Korean chicken and bulgogi.....both were amazing. 

The service was great.....we were never looking around for our waitress. 

If I'm back in Vegas this will be a spot I must revisit.
Came here two times on my Las Vegas trip. Food here is awesome and prices ate reasonable
Food was good and the location is good; many of students come to here. Servers respond quickly and service is pretty well above the average.

One of my favorite kbbq. We ordered a gangnam combo and some single dishes. The food are well marinated and fresh. They also have happy hour and desserts. Servers are very friendly. Highly recommended.

Awesome Korean BBQ place! We wanted to try something different from the normal Vegas strip so we searched and found this GEM great food service is excellent and desert is great! A must when visiting Vegas

Delicious!!!!! So decisions!! And the staffs are sooooooooooooo nice! Had an awesome experience! The food came not only fast but beautifully and tasted so good! I recommend this place to anyone wanting to eat fabulous food while in Vegas!

Btw the meat and everything are fresh and the you get to cook them in front of you and it's a fun experience!!

I came to Vegas for vacation and decided to check out this Korean barbecue place.  We picked the Meat Lover deal and it was great!  The interior was really nice and the service was great.  I'll be back.

This place rocks! We're from out of town and come here every time we go to Vegas, sometimes multiple times. Happy hour is great because it's the same meat we already order, only cheaper. The kids love the pork belly and we love the toro and bulgogi. Refillable side dishes are delish. The enoki mushroom is really fresh tasting and healthy so it offsets all the meat you're about to devour. The steamed egg looks just like the picture! My only wish is that they served rice paper with the meat. It would make the meal over the top! The restaurant is really nice and the bathrooms are clean. Overall a great, well-rounded experience!

Great varieties of choices! Definitely try the Meat lover combo, if you are into different kinds of meats!
Service is also great! 

Updates 6/7
---------------
Return couple weeks later, good as always!
Tried the Calamari, it was unexpected awesome! :)
Definitely will be back again!
Best Korean bbq I've tried.  The food is super filling, and our waiter was so nice and helpful!!! Definitely coming here again when in vegas.
Excellent food and service! We had the bulgogi bibimbap and kalbi and everything was delish. Will be back

Best and hip Korean bbq

Happy is the bomb.  Love the per plate price and extensive menu

Great service..... Cute guys according to my daughters
You guys are awesome. Thanks for great customer service and quality cultural food. Second to none!
We had bbq combo. It comes lots food all over the table.We definitely will come again this bbq place. It's so yummy
I was in for a quick lunch.  Food is great!  I've never done bbq like this, but I figured it out.  It is fun!
It's really good, very interesting place for American ppl because there's no much place like this in here.. Very nice visit and experience, nice service, friendly employees.
Money!!! Best Korean BBQ I ever had. Meat was tender and flavorful. Service was excellent.

Great bbq place near the strip. Good quality meat of an a la carte place and huge quantity given for the price. We got the Gangnam for 2 and it was more than enough to feed the 3 of us. Would definitely come back again!

The side dishes and meats are good! Nice place and nice service. I liked it!

The meats are juicy! The food is a lot also, so be careful. They have happy hour from 3pm-6pm. The beer is good. Cool people, cool service!

being a Korean from Atlanta, I've had my share of Korean food. however, even when I'm traveling I have to have it! I'll say that the food here is top notch- both taste and quality. even the atmosphere is pleasant, which can't always be found for an authentic Korean food experience. the best thing by far though is the service. all the waiters and waitresses are extremely attentive and generous. the price comparatively is steep but probably not by Vegas standards. overall, a total must try! definitely making it back here someday soon.

We got the premium for 6 ppl and it was sooo much food!! Great cuts of galbi! The seafood bibimbap was amazing!  Really wish I had more room to eat everything.  Asparagus was good too...oysters and poke were meh.
Fun experience grilling your own meat in front of you. The combos for 2 people is a ton of food and everything was really tasty. Great service, kind employees.
The udon and the sukiyaki were outstanding. The meat dishes were all delicious. Service was very good. The fried rice was even good.
Great food. Easy for a group. Really good vibe. Only a few tables for big parties, so plan for that if you've got more than 4.

I was visiting Vegas and felt like taking my parents out for a fun Korean BBQ night. This place was awesome. Great value and wonderful staff. Got the Vegas special for 4 and it was plenty of food for 4 of us. They do it better than my favorite place back home.
Quality cuts of meat and fresh vegetables. We ordered the bulgogi, pork belly, mushrooms, and broccoli all at happy hour prices. It was delicious, and we will be returning again.
Food was great, and there was a ton of it. Went with a picky eater and three foodies, everyone left happy! Great meats, beef carpaccio was a huge hit - will totally go again.

My 9 year old daughter says every time we come to Vegas we have to come here at least once. Her favorite is the beef toro. My husband likes the bulgogi and I favored the Korean Prime Kalbi. We made it in time for HH. Service is great and the food is delicious. A great change from the over priced strip restaurants.

Came here for New Year's Day dinner. The wait wasn't bad and service was good for it being busy. We ordered the premium for 2 people. Plenty of food and sides but we added pork belly as well. Kobe beef stole the show but the premium galbi was good as well. We ordered a side of lettuce to wrap the pork belly. We'll be back when we're in town again.

We came here for a late lunch on Saturday. We were pleasantly surprised by how quick and efficient the service was. The marinated kalbi was perfect and the portions were decently generous. The only issue was the side dishes, which I didn't think were great. Most of the pickled items seemed a little dry, and the overall selection/variety of the banchan was mediocre. I guess I'm used to Korea, where the side dishes are as important as part of the meal. I was also not impressed with the chicken karaage which they used chicken breast for (made it dry).

This review is too long over due, this restaurant is how do you say Awesome!!! from the time you walk in and is greeted by the hostess which is a good looking, sexy , hot Filipino lady, the second thing that came to my mind was order your food,the Interior and ambiance was definitely up to par,there is a flat screen TV that was showing Asian news and a large projection screen  TV that was showing a Asian dance videos, teppan style tables,also a sushi bar area in the rear,you can have your photo taken and place on the wall with the others 50 plus there.I had the make your own lunch set, fire cracker chicken, spicy cucumber, chicken basil, rice, and miso soup,the food was season very well and delicious,buy one beer or sake you get one free (Sapporo, Asahi, Hite, Soju, Sake..cold or hot) happy hour is all day long the menu has a lot of tasty Item to offer,Hard Rock Hotel to the west and UNLV is the the east......Recommended.
Meat are so tender and well flavored. We ordered "meat lover" dinner set. There were tons of food and very yummy!!!! It's a good place to hang out with friends and families. We really enjoyed.

Food was really good.  We came with friends and ordered the Gangham special.  Lots of meat that you cook at the table plus soup, house salad and several sides.  Great place for date night and going out with friends.

Customer service here is not so great, but the food is bomb! 
The server didn't bring us out beer, he was rude, snatched the menus from us after ordering. We didn't tip him because he was a jerk!
We however did tip another server personally for bringing us our beer and checking on us. 

The 4 's is only for the food!
Customer service is -4 .
Great food! It's not AYCE but you honestly don't need to stuff yourself to the point where you can't breath. We split the Gangnam meal for 2 across 4 people and it filled us up!
Definitely one of my top Korean BBQ experiences - including in Korea Town in LA. Hugely recommend bulgogi and short rib!
went there 3 weeks ago... good food... good place to hang out .. try out all that fresh sushi..!!! little expensive but got to pay what you you get
Delicious meats, reasonable price and suoer quick and friendlu service. What else needs? I gave firm 5 stars.

I just finished eating at this Korean restaurant and it was delicious! The moment I walked in it was very clean and eye opening. It is centrally located so it is perfect for anyone looking for a good BBQ place. Even though there were only two servers tonight they did a pretty good job overall. It started to get packed as the evening went on so I knew that this place was good. I tried a lot of things actually: prime kalbi, bulgogi, pork belly, oysters, miso soup, and even dessert. I wish I could have tried everything but I will save that for the next time I will be there. I even have a feeling that the owner/manager was out and about seating customers, smiling, and making people feel comfortable and right at home. To top it off, they have a projector screen on the wall to provide a little entertainment while you are cooking or enjoying your food. My server, Kristin, was very nice, polite, and outgoing. She really took care of me, always asked if everything was okay, and making sure I was never thirsty. How can you get better than that? I would recommend Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining to anyone who wishes to have great food, great service, and very reasonable prices.
A great selection of meats and dishes. I'm so glad we stumbled onto this place. Great service.
Great food and service! Make sure to try poppers and bulgogi. Fun to cook your own food too.

Great food. Excelent!! 
We were waiting before we got our table, but as soon as we sat, they took our order.
The meat is so juicy n full of flavor.
But the only problem is a lil pricey for local people.
Anyway we Definitely will come back!
Bomb dotcom bulgogi. I'm from Cali and this was some good k-bbq. A definite must go for the happy hour

We ordered the meat lovers combo for 2, serving was good enough and a lot of the side dishes, definitely a must try! Bulgogi was just ok, not a big fan of it and the taste taste a little bit burned, overall customer service and food was ok.
We ordered the meat lovers for 2 people. Tons of food for a great price. Great restaurant off of the busy strip. The service is great and very helpful.

Our first Korean BBQ meal in Vegas, found it in Yelp rated almost five star. The place looks very clean, and the waitress is so nice! We ordered beef tongue, pork belly and other meat. The meat tasted awesome!!!!

Great service and great food. Came here right at the lunch hour and we got our seats right away. The best part, to avoid smelling like Korean BBQ all day, they can cook the meat for you. No lunch special menu during the weekends tho.
The food was amazing as well as the customer service. The wait was so worth it. I'd come back everyday if I could!
Ordered a spicy tofu soup. Tastes great! The side dishes before entree are also great! Staff are friendly! Definitely recommend!

This place is awesome! We made a same day reservation and they were able to give us a 14 people reservation! They had good service and good food! The condiments were really good with the bbq. The waiters were great as they were kind and willing to serve us!! I will come back!!
Overall great experience... Clean environment..make sure you come during happy hour between 3-6pm...
Great fantastic Loren food. The place we must come every time we are in Las Vegas. Get a seat in advance if possible, because it is so popular! I love it!
The food was great, and the lunch special is a great value! I had the Beef and the Chicken. The Cream Cheese Wontons are to die for!!
Best meat NA. Faker ain't got shit on this place. Happy hour deals are really really awesomely good. Will come back again.

Great  food. Good service. We did lunch menu and we are stuffed!!!!
Gotta try this place.
I gave 4 stars because I still need to try the all you can eat.
Bulgogi is very tasty.
Good but slightly pricey. What we liked was the fish cakes and the sweet onion. The Kobe style beef was pricey and not really worth it. Try to miso beef instead.
Very good and fresh food. The service is very friendly and the prices are good. I can recommend the seaweed salad. Very very good.
Great food and awesome atmosphere! It seems like a lot of food but once you start cooking, it makes your meal more entertaining and fun! Amazing experience!
First time here! Great services and food! We tried few other different Korean restaurants before every time we re here in Vegas. Will come again!
Great food and service! Will be back for more. The oysters were delicious. And Prime Kalbi was very good. Can't wait to come back for more soon.

We ordered the Gangnam Style for 6 people. Plenty of food (fed 8 people) and we also order extra appetizers on the side. Everything we had was pretty good. The spicy tuna kimbap is highly recommended. Chicken wings were tiny (size of my fingers) but overall I would recommend this place.
Great food and service, fair price. Highly recommended! Only thing could done better is the ventilation.

Just ate here the other day. I've been wanting to eat here a long time and when I finally did I was kicking myself for not coming sooner. The food was amazing, our waitress was smoking hot. Well done!!!

I was in the mood for Japanese bbq so I randomly yelped this place.  So happy I found it!

I called for reservation for 03.21.16 (Monday) but the lady who answered said "is your party more than 8 people?" I said "no 5.  I wanted to make reservations for tonight at 10". She was like "oh no reservation. Just walk in"

That was weird. Are you not able to make reservations for under 8 people or what??  Any who I got there at 10pm and there was a 30 minute wait. We were able to sit down around 1040ish and by that time the restaurant was half empty.  

TIP:  make sure you talk to a competent hostess who is able to make reservations because I've read the reviews and you're able to.  Or else go after 11pm so there's no wait.

- Kobe style beef
- prime kalbi
- flat iron garlic
- premium tongue
- pork toro

All of the meat was very very good and tender.  I recommend them all!

When we came the line is not long at all. There is only one group of ppl in front of us. We wait 30min. Maybe because they have too little tables.. And then finally we got table. When we follow the waiter walking to the table. He didn't let us sit down. We saw there are ppl chatting and standing right next to the table. But our waiter didn't say excuse me or anything. So I guess is that his boss?? And then the waiter just asked us to wait. And then he left. We were like standing middle of the restaurant don't know what the hack is going on... After a while, nobody is going to do anything for us. We asked the chatting ppl by ourselves if so we can sit. And then the order was fine. When the food come, the waitress needs to mix the food. And food jump out of the bowl right on my purse. I saw she saw it, but she did not say a word.. I am not sure how service here should be. I'm not quiet happy with it. 
For the food, it is just so so. I guess because I had too many good food in LA. Here doesn't taste like Asian food for me at all. But if ppl love American Asian food. Then here is the right place. Probably not coming back here.

Great service, great food! A must place to come. I love the marinated short rib, and their original bibimbap rice.
I love their macaron ice cream desert.

Visited Gangnam on a random night in Vegas to get my KBBQ fix on. This location is just off the strip or about a $12 cab ride off the strip. 

I went during their night happy hour and they actually had some pretty good deals. We weren't too crazy hungry so we ordered a few a la carte meats. The portion of the meat was pretty small but the quality made it worth it! They also had some pretty decent side dishes as well!
the environment is friendly and cozy. the waitress is really nice and helpful. I would definitely come back to this plcr next time when I come to Las Vegas, NV again.      .    .        .      !:)

Perfect portions. Great quality. Would come here again for sure. This place is awesome for my Paleo-ish diet. Happy hour after 10pm.. What??? Had to order a few more things. And how could you not go for that Macaroon ice cream sandwich they tease you with at the door.

Awesome.  I'm from LA and transplanted out here, I have been looking for a comparable place having tried all the good stuff and this place happily delivered. 

The bolgogi was awesome me and my gf confirmed. Can also suggest calamari.  Korean prime was good but little chewy as its thicker and took longer to cook.  All in all very good and will def be back.

I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It is tastefully done inside, the staff was very friendly and the food was very good.  I had a Tina Poki which was excellent, bulgogi and marinated Korean short ribs.  The tuna was excellent, the bulgogi was nearly as good and the short ribs were good.  I would definitely return.  It was about $25 plus tip per person.  Not bad!
It's really tasty and delicious for the bbq meat and appetizer! Also love the attitude and service here
Awesome food! Everything from the side dishes, bibimbap, and bulgogi were tasty. I would definitely come back again I'm in the area.

This is the best Korean BBQ I've ever had. AMAZING. If you're in Vegas, do it. We got the Gangnam combo for 6 people and it fed 7 of us (4 girls and 3 guys.) Make sure you make it to this place. Just Uber/Lyft your butt over here!

Had to try this place once I saw that it had more than 3000 good reviews. The last time I was here the wait time was more than 2 hours, so I had to pass on it, this time there was no wait time. Score! The food was really good but the service was above and beyond.  The waiter took his time to cook and cut up our meat, which was amazing bc we didn't even ask.  Everyone there was super friendly and attentive.  I would definitely come back again.
This is the greatest Korean BBQ we have in Las Vegas! The meat lover combo can satisfy any need of you. The beef steak and pork belly are so yummy and juicy

Amazing. Selection and bombardment of dishes were almost numbing. By numbing mean pleasing to my stomach. Flavors of meats, side dishes and selected appetizers were spot on. And quick. We're they quick with the food. If you were hungry like we were, come sit down and before you take your second sip of one of their signature soju cocktails (yuzu for us) or my favorite Korean food compliment, Hite, the food starts to come and it's time to feast. Cheers to good food and good friends and enjoy your meal. Great stuff here. Must come again during my next visit.
I love food here! And also I love K pop they play here! And the place is good!  Recommend BBQ and original bibimbap ！

As a non-meat person (I like my veggies a lot) this was a really great Korean bbq place to eat. The service was great and the people were super nice. Shoutout to Kristin our waitress! My friend and I (both of us eat an average amount) came for a later lunch and had decently fast service. We got the meat lovers deal and had almost enough food for two meals so definitely be prepared to eat or to take something home.

My wife was looking to experience some of the foods (and ideally environent) from her favorites Korean TV shows. We had a great experience. I'm no expert on Korean foods but it was delicious and felt authentic. 

We decided to skip cooking our own meats on our tabes (yes thats an option) and had them done in the kitchen instead. It would have been an added experience come to think of it.

Meesun was such a delight! The experience was amazing and the selection is huge. I had one martini and I had a little buzz, that's a rare thing!  The food, drinks, atmosphere and service wereall excellent! Making our Vegas trip even better!

This place is incredibly good. And the serving size they provide you with is huge, enough to feed several people. They provide an assortment of appetizers along with the main meats. You have several options to choose from and a must is their bulgogi fried rice!
Love the food. So inexpensive, and the portions are fair. Interior is nice and atmosphere is chill
Went here with some friends. Great service. I love this place. Look forward to coming here again!!!
Great meat cuts , super friendly staff . Noise level was laid but I think it might have been because it was Friday . Great place
Good food, good service, clean facility, and no long wait! Meat was very tender. Must try steamed egg!

Wonderful food and service. This is about my 32 time here great value for your money 
I recommend this restaurant to everyone i know and meet
Awesome place!  My son loves to cook his own steak. Celebrating my nieces birthday. Perfect portions and excellent service!!

This place always has good food, and it's a classier place to eat if you're going to be near UNLV. They don't have an AYCE option, but everything is reasonably priced. At a table with four of us in total, we ordered the following:

Steamed chili dumplings
Peach saketini
Fried meat dumplings
Miso soup        
Fried calamari w/spicy sauce
Fresh oysters
Prime kalbi (short rib without bone)
Beef Toro (brisket) 
Kobe style beef
Salmon Basil
Green tea cheesecake

You can also either choose to grill the food yourself or ask your server to have it cooked before bringing it to your table.
Best Korean BBQ restaurant I've ever been to. Prices are reasonable and the service is amazing. I'm definitely coming back to this place the next time I come to Vegas.
Great food and service. Had the Las Vegas for 2 - enough food for 4. Recommend the spicy tuna. We ended up taking half of our meal home. Looking forward to enjoying it for lunch tomorrow.
Took us 30 minutes to get a table despite having a reservation. Other than that the service was good after we got the table and the food was very good
Great service and delicious food. The Harami  Miso and Korean Chicken Fondue was amazing!

Really good stuff.  We had the meat lover special for 4 people and they were helpful enough to change us the spicy pork for a chicken.

Great ambiance.  A bit far from the strip, but totally worth it!
I had Harami Miso. Korean Prime Kalbi. Bulgogi. Pork belly. and mushroom medley. They're tasty and fresh. Service is good as well.

Amazing everything! Even my daughter is addicted! I just didn't remind her she was eating dried squid and fish cake til after the 'YUM'! Wonderful service, wonderful food, and the prices were a dream! Puts most Strip fare to shame!
If youre in the mood for korean bbq then this is the place for you. Even on a sunday night i didnt have to wait long. I tried mpatly marinated meat and was npt disappointed.

Will never go to all you can eat KBBQ again. The meat and even the side dishes are much better quality than any all you can eat joint here in Vegas. Service was very nice and attentive. Plus if you post a review you get a free dessert

Ok....so I come to Vegas once or twice a year....mainly for my nieces basketball tournaments...we stay away from the strip, I don't gamble or drink - but I am a foodie.....

The last couple visits I've notice some Korean food spots open up...being an army brat and having an aunt who is from Seoul...(we're talking growing up seeing clay pots of veggies go underground to ferment) I have a pretty set idea of what Korean food should taste like. This place has it down! When I tried the bulgogi my eyes lit up! It's saltier than Kalbi as it should be (some places make it super sweet, albeit delicious - it's not the way I remember it)

Fish cake on point, Kalbi just sweet enough and all pieces of meat were very tender and high quality.

Gangnam set was more than enough to for the two of us. Meat was very good quality and the side dishes was good too. They let us change the side dishes to a different one since we don't enjoy oysters. Would come again and recommend to a friend. Only downfall was that we needed to purchase garlic and lettuce.

over all food is mediocre and very over priced. Service was also mediocre at best. They never came around unless we seeked them out even though we had a large group. Meat quality was below average. Meat was very tough to chew. And they charge for each side items. Tvs are also small and it's non HD. Even for Las Vegas standards the meet quality was sub par. Compared to LA/oc, this was a 1 star.
Love it here! Ordered the meat lovers for 2 with a side of the original bibinpop. Excellent!!!! A bottle of coconut nigori and now ready for dessert :)

First time here. This place has good quality meat. I especially like the short ribs. Also got the japchae and bibimbap and both were quite good as well. I recommend this place for groups. It's reasonably priced and sadly not all you can eat but I left feeling full and satisfied. My friend got kimchi tofu soup and she seemed to like it. 

Recommended!

This was my first Korean style barbecue place where you grille the meet yourself. For $70 bucks they bring a lot of sides and great prime cuts of beef and marinated pork. Service was friendly and grilling your food was fun. I ordered some spicy beef soup which I've had much better in Baltimore. The stock lacked the strong beef flavor which is signature to this soup. Other than that, I will recommend this place.
We love this place we came here for 6 ppl first time and server were so helpful! I came back for the second time! Price are reasonable !
An awesome place for Korean BBQ. Took my fiend here n we both love it! We finished everything. The duck is really good! Recommended!

We just finished the Gangnam special. WOW finished it all it was great and worth the wait.

We will be back for sure.

As someone who eats at gyu-kaku pretty often I can say this place is very very good. Only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the happy hour isn't as strong as gyu-kaku , I wasn't offered a grill change and there is no loyalty program.
This place was awesome. The tongue was really good and the fresh oysters were good as well !!!! I'm definitely coming back.

We went to a concert at the hard Rock hotel and we're looking for a bite to eat late at night. This place is right across the street. We have never had Korean  BBQ before, were very hesitant, but gave it a try. So glad we did! This place is amazing! We did the Las Vegas grill for 2 people and it was more than enough food. Also added in a side of the filet mignon. Everything was so delicous. Jin and Jon were so helpful, considering we were rookies at the grill. We will definitely be back and will recommend it to others. Thanks for the great experience!
Great decor and delicious food. Got the Las Vegas for 2 deal at $45, and it was so much food. Could have fed 4 easily. Love everything about this place.
The service is good, the food is fabulous and there is enough to satisfy anyone. All I can say is: Delicious!
Here with family, enjoying great kbbq.  We ordered 4 people bbq set for the 5 of us.  Server was kind and considerate. Food tasted great and the portion was adequate.

Came here because of the amazing yelp reviews and they were right! The portion was generous for 7 people and the food quality was pretty good! Over all, the service was great. Don't forget to yelp them for a free dessert! Love it! Highly recommend!
Hands down the best korean bbq i have had in my city food was great and the customer service was excellent andrew our server treated us like vip's. We will definitely be coming here again.
Great food, awesome people! We walked here from the hard Rock hotel. Will come for sure any time I come to vegas! The bokogi was amazing. Good prices too!
Fantastic service. Staff was very outgoing and helpful with the process. Great experience and would love to come back next time I'm in town! Dynamite shrimp was my favorite dish.
very good Korean food and nice service. I love the prime kaibi best. Seafood pancake is just soak, but You should check it out !
This place is excellent. Generous amount of food along with delicious side dishes. Would come again and gladly recommend to friends.

Coming from LA where KBBQ is everywhere and amazing, this was a disappointment. 

My friends and I came in late on a Friday night after a long drive to Vegas. We were stoked to find a KBBQ so close to the strip! Got there around 11pm as they close around 1am. The restaurant was pretty empty. We were seated quickly and told it was happy hour! Score! Here's what we ordered: 

- fried calamari, 2/5
- chicken karaage, 4/5
- beef toro, 3/5
- pork belly, 3/5
- beef bulgogi, 3/5

Everything was mediocre. Nothing out of the ordinary and pricey for the size of the portions. We ended up ordering 3 orders of the beef toro! What really gave this place low stars was the service. They were nice and all but seriously nowhere to be found whenever we needed anything. Our orders too on forever to come out and after the long drive, we just wanted to eat! Also, our grill was literally on fire until someone casually came out and changed it. Our server also made weird, awkward, borderline inappropriate jokes and just gave the whole experience a weird vibe. 

Don't think I'll be back. So many other places to hit up that's ten times better!

Food was awesome! Had a big group so we decided the gangnam feast. Definitely a lot of food. Unlimited Kim chi plates. Six plates of flavorful meat. And good mini starters. Definitely recommend if your with a big group!

My team and I were starving from a 10 hour drive to Vegas. We wanted to find something different and good but with a lot of food. We hit the jackpot with Gangnam!!! It was such fast service and the food was amazing! Too fun to be able to cook the meat at the table and it was delicious! Thanks, Gangnam!

oh so Ono!  tried many korean BBQ places and this one is by far the best.  it's new, clean, and not on spring mountain, bc traffic can be a pain. I love that they have specials that serve seafood with the meat combos and also incorporate dol sot bibimbap with the combos.  
only downfall... they don't serve bachan...  to me that's the first thing I crave when I think korean food?
I  Korean BBQ! & this is one of the best in LV! Staff is super friendly and the choices of meats are top notch!
The meat lovers was awesome, spicy pork was our favorite. The fried rice was amazing, overall great experience!
Great service and really fresh and tasty korean BBQ. Better than the other korean options if you are looking for korean food in Vegas.
Stopped by for the first time with friends. We all had appetizers and loved it. I especially liked the Dynamite Shrimp.
High quality Korean bbq and good service as well! We have been waiting 40 minutes for the table. But the food is well worth the waiting time in the end. We will definitely come back again.
Everything  was yummy  in my tummy! The variety  was good. Good meat selection.. chose the premium  meal set. It had a good combination  of seafood  and meat. Awesome  free dessert  with yelp

Everything was bomb! Good quality meat and the restaurant is clean. The pork belly and the bulgogi were my faves. My daughter loved the miso soup, the seaweed salad and the pot stickers. Can't wait to come back!
C'est incroyable! Les poullete epice est tres bonne! Lovely atmosphere and friendly wait staff, but the food here is the shining star!
This is an awesome Korean bbq place affordable and the food is really good! I'll definitely  come back!
Fun atmosphere and great food. Felt a little pricey for what you got though. Definitely take advantage of the happy hour special (3-6, 10-1am) if possible.

Quality:5
Service:4
One of the best bbq in vegas. Definitely will be back. The food is amazing. The beef is highly recommended and so many side dishes.

This place is solid. The meat is a good quality, and the salad was fresh, we liked the mushrooms they gave us to grill in a foil pack, and the corn.  

We ordered the Gangnam special for 2 people, and a side dish of corn cheese. I have had different type of corn cheese in la, so this one was just ok to me.. maybe a little too creamy? and it didn't get really burned on the bottom of the cast iron dish it was, (neither did the bulgogi bibimbap, but it was still tasty).  Ended up paying around $90 including tip for 2 people, and we did not have any drinks, just water.

Overall I would say that the quality and taste of this place is pretty good, however it is a little pricy if you are expecting typical korean bbq stuff. For example, the Gangnam didn't include Brisket, or Pork belly, which is usually one of our staples for korean bbq. It did however include some oysters, which was nice (although I don't like oysters too much myself).  We are used to korean bbq in california, where you can get AYCE ranging as low as $9.99-$30 per person, and I'm also used to wrapping my korean bbq in radish and rice paper and a plethora of sesame oil plus salt and pepper sauce, and lots of sliced green onion.

You can order meat ala carte, so they do have a customizable menu based on how much you want to try/order....

The side dishes were pretty good, I liked the fish cake, etc.
This korean restaurant was AHMazing. Best kk bbq in vegas! If your looking for delicious meat and good vibes here is the place.

Eating here for the first time today and I love it! I go to school at UNLV and I never knew this spot was so convenient, I'll definitely be visiting more often. We ordered the Gangnam meal today and the food was brought out very quickly and the workers are very attentive and clear about their variety of food items.

Excellent! Came here on a Saturday night during EDC weekend. Wait only took 10 minutes and our server was very responsive and polite! Yuuuuuup! (Seriously, his name was Yup!) He made great suggestions for us on the menu and they turned out fantastic! 

We were a group of 4 and we ordered a meat lovers for 2 and a gangnam for 2. Plenty of variety and certainly filling. Price was reasonable compared to other BBQ places. I would definitely come here again

We came on a Saturday night and the restaurant was not busy at all. It has a cute asian decor and very nice ambiance. Patrick the server came and acknowledged us and seat us right away. Since nobody was there at that time he let us chose our own table. He was very friendly and answered all our questions about the menu. He recommended the bulgogi bibimbap to my husband and it was so good! I had the beef kalbi and beef belly. Loved the kalbi but not the belly. After dinner we had dessert. I ordered the friend banana tempura with strawberry ice cream and Man oh Man! Their banana tempura is the best of its kind! Better than PF Changs banana spring rolls. It's worth every calories! I'll probably come back just to order this. :)

We came in on New Year's Day and thus had a wait of about 40 mins but the food and efficiency of the servers made it totally worth it. This is one of the best Korean bbq's that I have been to in the US! We ordered the 2 most popular  bbq dishes along with several sides including the Korean pancakes, miso soup, edamame, etc. It was all spot on delicious. Highly recommend this restaurant to even the pickiest eater!

My first experience with Korean BBQ. I was a bit intimidated at first. The place was busy and my rookie flag was flapping wildly. I was able to get through the ordering process with the help of a super friendly waitress that set me at ease from word go.  Happy hour prices made my experience even more palatable.
The chicken sukiyaki noodles were only $9.95 and they were so good that I'd order it again. The only thing is that it stays incredibly hot for about 5 minutes, so be careful not to burn yourself.
Excellent! ! All around!  Great FAST friendly service!  Recommend and will be back for more!

Amazing food! Our table ordered the gangnam for 4 and everything was delicious! The meat was perfect! Great variety of options! It was more than enough food for 4!  Our waiter was extremely nice and helpful! Will definitely come back to eat here.
I love this restaurant so much. Their beef BBQ and kimji were awesome. I will be back again for sure.
Like the little dishes! So good.  Price is reasonable. The kobe beef is soooooooo good!!! Miso beef is good too especial with such cheap price.
Good food and fun atmosphere.  The free dessert is awesome.  A bit off the strip but still worth the extra walk or short drive.
Ordered the gangnam combo for 2 and it was extremely good! it was a lot better than I expected and I would definitely come back here again.

Awesome Korean bbq place. We had the prime Kalbi, beef toro, and garlic shrimp. All really good. The spicy seafood soup is fireeee! It's hot & spicy and comes to your table in a clay pot. Tastes so good! We had the macaroon ice cream sandwiches. My tastes a little stale but over all everything we had was great. Atmosphere is nice. Will be back again!

A cool experience for Westerns who lack experience of authentic Korean fare and seek a hip introduction, but way too sweet in terms of sugar in the beef, sugar in the rice, sugar in the kimchi and other banchan.

JJANG! 
Best Korean food in Vegas!
I'll definitely be back!

Must get:
Pork belly
Soju

The Late night Happy Hour is one of the best deals you'll ever find in Vegas. Located relatively near to the strip, but directly adjacent to UNLV, Gangnam offers meals in the $2-5 range, with 50% off drinks. This is unreal in the area. Our total meal, with 4 separate dishes and 2 large sakis, came out to $20 without tax. The BBQ was great, the Saki nice and alcoholic, and the overall experience top notch. There might be a wait, but go to Gangnam for sure if Happy Hour is available.

This place puts other korean bbq places to shame. Quality food quality drinks big seating very American friendly. Ask for help cooking it if needed. They have Desert which I am waiting for as I write this. Mochi time!
Great food, great service, reasonably priced, nice atmosphere and covenient location. Highly recommend.
Amazing food, our server Jin was on point. Fast, friendly, efficient service. Lots of side dishes and we got the Gangnam combo for our party of 6
Simply AMAZING! All the food we had was fantastic! We shared the meal for four and my friends and I have a big appetite, but it defeated us. I think the meal for four is really for six.
Came here for the first time, we got the Gangnam bbq meal for 2 people, it was delicious and tasty, will come back again! Great service and not far away from the Vegas strip!
Atmosphere is amazing! Our server was the best! Prices are defiantly reasonable compared to everything else and food was to die for  ... Defiantly will be coming back next time I'm in Vegas.
Very good service and food. We recommend the filet mignon and the miso beef. The sukiyaki veggie noodles are delicious as well! Enjoy

Came here with my bf on a Thursday nite... It wasnt crowded but the service was kinda slow. Our waitress brought out all the meat before the banchans even came. Matter of fact, I had to ask for the banchans which should have already been at our table before our meats came out. We ordered the prime kalbi and it was sooooo chewy. i never had kalbi like that before .. Maybe becuz im from LA. We also ordered the steamed egg.. But it was like a souffle..  They must have used some kinda leavening agent to make it puff up ... But sadly to say.. It was super BLAND.
Don't know if I'll come back.. But if i do... Only for happy hour.

Arrived in Vegas around 8-9 PM so we decided to come here since it was open late. Started out with Spicy Tuna Kimbap which was pretty tasty. If you never had it before it was just tempura fried sushi rolled topped with spicy tuna. We also had the fried calamari, I thought their tempura batter was one of the best I've had in a long time. We didn't pick any of their packages since there were some items we did not want. We had prime Kalbi (decent but I've had much better in KC and LA), pork belly, beef Toro, Tongue, and mushroom medley (this comes out cooked already for you). All in all the service was excellent, food was great but I think we had better in LA and Kansas City. I thought the best cut of meats was way better in Kansas City. Maybe the mid-west have better cuts of meat??? Since we got there after 10 PM it was happy hour so a lot of our items were priced lower than usual so that was a big plus. We both had all the food for about $40. For the price and great service,  I would still recommend this place and I would come back again soon.

Average food, abrupt service. I'm from La so I guess after eating Korean BBQ there our expectations were high after seeing how many ppl reviewed this place an average 4.5 star. But I guess when you bribe your customers with a free 3.50$ macaroon ice cream sandwich for each "check-in" you're bound to be high on the rating scale! All in all it was below average experience. Don't think we'll be coming back any time soon.

Visited here while we were in Las Vegas from Boston , was really impressed with food and service! The bbq is Gyu-gaku style but more korean flavored.  The portion is huge and side dishes keep on coming!  Service was prompt and friendly. Really glad we got to find a great bbq place in vegas!

The atmosphere itself was cozy. It has a great ambiance for its location. When we came in we were told that there were other groups, 3 groups before us but they were so quick on seating us. 

We decided to order from menu that's marked "Must try".. the spicy tuna kimbap and calamari garlic. The kimbap was really good, it was melting in my mouth. The calamari was just a blah. Nothing special - I cannot taste the garlic. 

We also had the prime kalbi which was very tasty and the dumpling soup. 

Please avoid ordering the ramen. The quality and texture tastes like instant maruchan. 

Overall the service was good even they forgot my soju but delivered attention after that.
The best Korean restaurant in Las Vegas. Sure will come again on next  time. Highly recommend for who want to have good Korean food in Las Vegas.

I had a great time here! The people serving are very nice, even offering to cut the meat for us. They checked in occasionally, but did not bother us with with constant questions of the quality.
The food was very savory and the side orders were great.

A Korean / Japanese barbecue mix. Gangnam is trying to be both, however Korean Influence is stronger - K-pop was constantly streamed through the TVs.

Their barbecue items were decent, but when I ordered bulgogi bibimbap for lunch, it didn't come with a bunch of side dishes like most Korean restaurants. None, in fact. That made me feel like they are a cheapskate and the prices started to feel pricier.

They should research on what Yagyu offers for lunch... Yagyu is much better in all aspects - food quality, portion and prices. While what Gangnam offers is decent, I fail to find a reason to go back. Also, Gyu-kaku is getting ready for lunch... watch out!
Great environment to eat. Great customer service. This will be a great place for a date too.

Great service and food. 
Bbq is amazing and they have great service.
I visited Vegas and was craving for Korean food badly. They have a shuttle direct from the strip.
Decent atmosphere, reasonable price and great meat! This will be a great place to escape from "expensive" buffet in strip. :p

I'm from Atlanta,GA and I must say, the food and service were amazing! I love the small portion per person and the reasonable price! I'll definitely come back here bag I an the next time I visit las Vegas!

Best korean BBQ I've ever had in Vegas. First time trying the calamari not fried. The beef brisket is awesome as usual. The chef was excellent at looking after at table and so as the other 2 servers. Would recommend this to friends.

Great food and good services! 
The tofu soup and meat lover for 2 ppl are especially good. 
Definitely recommend going!
Awesome experience for the entire family!. The Kobe beef was amazing.  The place gets packed for dinner so come early.  Last, the service was fantastic!!!

Great food and reasonable prices- menu has a wide variety of options to please any palate. I definitely recommend beef toro. And while you wait for your order to cook, they bring out small side dishes for snacking. I definitely will be coming back!
Lots of food, high quality, worth. Came here with a party of 3 and the premium meant for 2 served us well!

My boyfriend and I stopped here when we were passing through Vegas on our cross country road trip. We made it with 10 minutes to spare to get happy hour prices and I have to agree with other reviews that you really do get a good amount of food for the price here. We ordered 2 types of kalbi, happy hour pork belly and bulgogi and happy hour edamame and seaweed salad. Our total was only $46 including tip (which is a great deal for 2 people when you're used to LA prices). The food was good quality and they give you plenty of side dishes. We didn't even really need the edamame and seaweed salad so we probably could have gotten away with spending under $40 for 2 people. Granted, this obviously isn't the best BBQ I've had, but it is a great value. I would come back here if I was ever in Vegas with a car again.

If you are looking for a Korean BBQ place to eat at, you should definitely try Gangnam Asian BBQ. Everything I tried was delicious. My friend and I ordered Korean prime Kali, beef toro, bulgogi, and pork belly, As well as the spicy tofu soup.

For my second time here, I am significantly more full than the first time I came here.  The food was delicious and the meat was well prepared to be grilled.  I also ordered the ramen, and the noodles were made to perfection.  I only wish that there were more vegetarian options available.
Got the Gangnam Menu for 6 people and it is definitely a lot of food. Good meat, service can be friendlier.
Amazing food and service that they gave us today.!!! Pretty much love to go back again next time here and shared it to my family & friend.

Delicious Korean BBQ in a beautiful place. Service is good and food is plenty and tasteful. We had the filet mignon, short beef and pork belly. All super good. For appetizers we had the cream cheese wonton (I loved it, my husband didn't because it was too creamy for him) and the spicy tuna. The tuna came was like a tempura with a sauce on top. Delicious but a little too spicy for me. For my husband, it was he best dish we had. For sides, we had asparagus and zucchini. Simple but good.
It was a good meal, meat quality was really good, and they made the taste sweat and spicy. For me that's perfect, I will highly recommend this place!

This is my favorite Korean restaurant in Vegas! Definitely get the Korean Prime Kalbi you won't be disappointed! Great price for the amount of food we get! Service is fast & they have different things to entertain you while you eat !

It was messy the order they brought in the food. I paid fu%#^*+ $66.00 for the 2 person Gangnam special and they brought out the bi bim Bab(item with rice) last!
