You don't bring that when the meat is all done eating. We didn't get our drinks til half way through dinner. Other waiters kept coming by and asking if we got so and so. They basically don't have a tracking system of what you got. I will never waste money here again. Overpriced for what you get. It's not all you can eat. The meat trays are so small.

They have a nice atmosphere and good food for the price. We chose our own meats instead of doing the pre-set options. This allowed us to get more of why we wanted and less of what we didn't, as we didn't care for the soups or wontons.

They bait you to write a review on here to get free dessert (only 2 options).

Was here with my friends post basketball. Didnt know it was happy hour and the offer was so good to refuse. We ordered the porkbelly and bulgogi. Also the original bibimbap. Was a lot of food and serve it on a sizzling plate. Was very satisfied. Def coming back.

Service was very good and the food was delicious.  This place was more of a fusion between American Japanese and Korean style BBQ.  The reason I say American Japanese, was because most of the marinated dishes was generally sweeter than the traditional Japanese meat marinates.  Overall it was a great experience.  Yummy
The BBQ is yummy, and the soup is delicious. BTW the waiter and waitress are friendly. I'll definitely come again.

I order Vegas set for four people that so biggggg very tasty I really like them food!
 Don't missed! 
they staff very kindness too.

Excellent Korean BBQ for outside of NY and CA. Good varieties of meat, seafood and veggies for very reasonable price. You can try a mix of different things without spending a lot. Great with family and friends. Good decor and ambiance. Will definitely return next time in Vegas.

Intrigued by all these yelp reviews, I decided to come forward and see what the hype was all about. I love korean bbq, I love japenese bbq, but I've never tried both at the same time. Where to start?

Staff was nice, only took about 7 1/2 minutes in between to refill my water from when it was empty and full. Ordered that $70 combo meal with a side of pork belly.

Sauces came out and dropped off with no description, but thank god for having taste buds I were able to figure out what each sauce was.

Meats came out before all the appetizers, and I guess raw oysters were to serve as my dessert? Lol.. The filet mignon did not go well with my raw oysters, as well as my super sweet and sauced up bibimbap. Teriyaki sauce galore I guess.

Meat quality was probably close to tofu hut which would of been nice if they had a $10 AYCE.


House salad was meh, soup was meh meh, everything meh. Granite the staff was nice and lagged on getting stuff for us, like water, dropped chopsticks, and napkins and all that. No biggie I'm asian, I'm use to eating with my hands.

I normally don't like to bash on businesses but I feel like this place has gotten way more love than they should. All the 4 or 5 star ratings might have come from drunks or people with no taste buds. Best of luck to this place, yelp you failed me.
Food is well-seasoned and well-prepared. Pretty delicious and came in good portions. Very full and satisfied!
This place is still as good as ever! I recommend their harami miso and beef brisket. The servers are always so accommodating and helpful. Definitely will be back in a few weeks!

clean and Kind!! I like the employees. They are so kind when I choose the menu. Their recommendations was definitely right!!! I love it!^^ Compare with other korean BBQ like jinseng or kimchi near strip. This is the best!!
First time here and I'm impressed. The overall vibe of the restaurant is great and the staff is very friendly. Most definitely will recommend to friends!

We ordered the premium menu for 4, it was amazing the amount of side dishes and the quality of the meat is out of this world....the kobe beef and especially the filet mignon was the most tender juicy melt in your mouth meats that I have had except for the kobe beef I had in japan. You must try this place.
Decided to stop by on a whim and boy was  surprised. Great food for the happy hour special would eat again
Amazing！It's my best ever in Las Vegas！The design，BBQ and service....... Oh,man everything is awesome!

5 stars 5 stars.  This place was delicious.  They have a nice grill in the middle to grill some yummy meat and tons of sides.  Everything we tried was good and large portions.  If I lived in vegas I would come here every Sunday and eat like a pig!
The  was good and the service was great! Also love the music they play, it's a mix of Korean and American.

The wait was a little long. The wait for food, for service... The food was delicious! I got the korean prime rib and the garlic chicken with cheese fondu and filet mignon and garlic squid. We also got the spicy tuna kimbab which was AMAZING. And some fried calamari. This place was nice but only one girl served us well. The others were very busy, didn't teach us how to grill or put oil in the grill or get us drinks but the one girl did.

This place is so delicious!  I love how helpful the staff is as well.  We ordered the Las Vegas Special which was 45.00 and served 2 people with all the wonderful sides and still had food left over. Looking forward to bringing my family and friends to come back.
Excellent customer service! Great food! Went for early dinner on a Saturday night and the place was not that packed.

Very good K-BBQ spot. 

Would order every time:
Unmarinaded Kalbi-so tender and fatty, almost melts in your mouth
Beef Tongue-served with a lemon dipping sauce that really completes the dish 
King Oyster Mushroom-I love mushrooms, so this was a must for me

Would order again:
Marinated Kalbi-seasoned very well, beef is tender (I like the unmarinaded better just because you can the taste of their high quality beef isn't masked by the marinade)
Pork Belly-fairly standard K BBQ pork belly

Would skip:
Filet mignon: meat quality was just not that great
Macaroni banchan: this one we didn't order, just came with a bunch of other side dishes, but it was a really nasty macaroni salad that tasted like it was slathered in butter
Excellent korean BBQ for a great price. It was a long wait, aside from that it was amazing.
Love this place! Quality meat here is incomparable. Their service was superb and I was very impress with their menu. It's not AYCE but it's well worth it. Would definitely come back again!

First time having Korean BBQ and definitely won't be my last! My wife and I ordered the Las Vegas combo which was plenty of food and delicious. We also ordered the spicy tuna kimbap which I highly recommend. Service was great and they had no issues explaining how to cook everything since it was our first time. Looking forward to going back soon!
It is always good to have Japanese bbq in town Las Vegas. Side dishes are delicious ! Beef is must try . Pork is very tasty

This place is really good. I really recommend going. 2nd time this week. We love it.  Get the Harami Miso.  Bulgogi. 
I enjoyed the Beef tongue. Maybe not for everyone. Made the wife try it. Little on the chewy side.
Fried calamari was so good.

So good!  Food is great, great for families and so many great dessert choices!  Remember that they don't take same day reservations and only take reservations for parties of 8 or more. If you are craving some really great Korean BBQ with some great ambiance... This is the spot on the strip!
Absolutely love this place! Whenever I have friends in town we go here. You can cook the food yourself or they will.

Really good korean bbq!
The food was awesome and the service is very friendly and  helpfull.

Food was super tasty. Loved everything and we ordered a lot for 4 girls. The Kobe beef wasn't soft and tender like it should be. I probably wouldn't order that next time here but everything else was delicious. Soup was real good as well. Seafood pancake is a must. They put lots in it.
Great food! Love the kimchi bibimbap! Awesome bbq.. And lemonade soju!!! Great place to hang out..

The odds are 100% you will love this fine authentic Korean restaurant. My wife and I have had great Korean in NYC where we live....now we have to come to Vegas to get the BEST! I promise you will not be disappointed!
Really enjoyed eating here! Very peaceful and very good! I'll definitely bring friends from out of town here!

Tried this shop just on a chance and was completely blown away. Great experience with the grill, pleasant atmosphere, clean, great ingredients, and all at a reasonable price.  I definitely plan to come back.

This place is pretty money's worth. I enjoyed eating the "meat lover". They gave a lot of meat to the point where we had some left overs and I was forcing myself to eat. The seasoning is delicious for all the meats especially my all time favorite pork meat with the right amount of skin on it.

One of my go to places for Korean bbq because of its convenient location next to the university. The service is fairly fast due to it not being constantly busy. They have a variety of meat and appetizers to choose from. I always leave satisfied with the food.
Super good.  Best asian bbq in town.  Great service, full belly. Go gor the bulgogi, spicy pork and duck.  Pork belly if your feeling piggy. ;)
This place is great! Will come back here again!! Kim chi is great. Service is outstanding. Coming back for happy hour.
Love this place definitely worth coming back!! Great service and great ambience, they even keep an eye on your food to make sure you don't burn it lol!!

This is our first experience with eating Korean barbecue with the actual grill the table. They were very patient, and the food is delicious. Side dishes are yummy, portions are good, prices are totally reasonable, restaurant is beautiful, and the bulgogi bibimbap is my favorite. My kids also loved it; pretty sure my 8-year-old ate three bowls of fish cake. The $45 Las Vegas combo was plenty for all four of us!

This place is amazing. It's located off the strip in a quiet plaza. We went here on our last night and we are so glad we did! 

The food is fresh and very good. You sit at a table with a grill in the middle so you can cook everything you order yourself, or if you would like you can ask them to cook it in the kitchen out back. However, I recommend cooking it yourself, that's all part of the fun! 

The staff was friendly and attentive. And if you get distracted like I did and over cook some of the meat, no worries, they come and replace your grill cover with a clean one! 

My husband started with the fried calamari (cooked outback) and I had miso soup (also cooked out back) and then we ended up sharing some spicy chicken, pork, and two different beefs! 

Total worth it and highly recommended. This is great food, for a great price compared to the strip.

It was ok. We were in Vegas for the long weekend and thought we can try this place since reviews are good. We chose Gangnam grill, it came with bunch of side dishes, big bowl of salad, 2 soups, beef bulgogi, mushrooms, corns and variety of grill meats. Definitely a lot of foods for 2 adults. However I feel like the meats were rather bland, not marinated enough. Price is on a higher range, but service was great and the place is clean. Not sure if we are going back next time, maybe I'll compare it to Hobak next.

Nice place! Super cool that you cook by your own, and waitress helps you.
And very tasty meat! Melting in your mouth. Great for parties, dates and just tasty dinner. Stuff is very kind and smiling

We tried GangNam after looking at the Many Yelp reviews. We made it just in time for the 3-6pm happy hour. We ordered a lot off of the happy hour menu. We ordered wontons, edemame, chicken garaage, pork belly, corn, and more. Everything was delicious! Service was good, but the staff was certainly very busy! The decor is very nice. The restaurant is painted a nice deep red. Overall is really good experience!

Food was great! The portions are enormous. We got the Gangnam set and came with lots of starters, meats and sides. Our favorite was the Korean Prime Kalbi. I would definitely come back here and recommend to friends. The free Macaron ice cream doesn't hurt either :).
it's a really good place to eat, I have a great time here. I found this place by Yelp, there are many good reviews for this restaurant

Food is good. We came in during happy hour, ordered the steamed dumplings with spicy sauce..delicious.. the calamari was good too... Ordered the steamed eggs for my son and he loved it... That's all that matters... Bimbibap was good according to my hubs... We're still here waiting for the chicken karage and spicy egg ramen..

Actually the food was much better than I expected. I eat Korean food a lot since there are so many choices around NJ/NY area. So I wasn't expecting to get something as good as that. We had a BBQ set for two people and then ordered couple more dishes. Everything was really good. The rice and noodle dishes which are usually just normal stuff but they were tasty here. We also like the best two appetizers on their menu, one uni and one beef thing. BBQ are good.
Came by Yelp Reviews. The food is phenomenal. Service was great and fast. The wait was not long for the food. A nice place to have a wonderful family dinner.
Amazing food!! The service was great and speedy as well. We ordered the Meat Lovers for 2. The meat is all top notch. This will definitely be a regular spot of ours!!

My husband and I came here after choosing a random Asian restaurant in Las Vegas. We left fat and happy. It has to be one of our top all time meals. The atmosphere was fun, the food delicious, and we wish we had one near us at home!

First time coming here, great taste and I love me pork belly. Get in my belly piggy.

I enjoyed the big screen MVs playing on the wall. Need more Korean MVs :D

Amazing fun and a very nice atmosphere. Enjoyed the food and staff was excellent :)

Would definitely go here again..... And recommend it. Even if you can't cook, still a great experience.
This place is the best Korean bbq in Las Vegas! It's not all you can eat, but you can tell in the quality of the meats here. No cheap stuff. Staff is awesome too!
Very great! I like this Korean BBQ! The tofu soup is very delicious! The Kobe style beef is wonderful!

Really fun Korean BBQ place with a grill inset into the table. Tender well-marinated beef will lots of flavor. We got the Gangnam set meal for two and loved every of bit. Just seared the meat a little bit and ate it all up!

So glad we decided to come out to Gangnam for my birthday. We had a party of 8 and we were seated in the private room. Supa legit meats, marinades, spicy ahi salad, veggies. Food & customer service  everything was awesome! Jin is the best and he didn't miss a beat. Definitely returning!

Went here yesterday for dinner with (6) guys and all had meat lover menu. All the food was excellent. Only thing we didn't like was that we had to cook it ourselves. My friend and I went back there today for lunch and we had the bugogi special for $5 and japchae for $10. Both were excellent. This time we were able to get the kitchen to cook food. Will go back here next time we visit Vegas. 

Here again yesterday for dinner and today for lunch. Still consistently excellent with generous portions. Will come here again with my friend before we depart LV next week.

It was much better than expected. The service was fast and the food is delicious!!! The place was clean and nice. All their portions of meat were generous. I would definitely come back :-)  server back was awesome!!!!!!!!!
Best Korean bbq in Vegas. We ordered the Kangnam combo for 2, really a lot of food for two people, great quality and great price! We'll definitely come back next time when we are in town:-)
Great service! They stayed open late for a large group! Great music, vibe, tasty food!

Always good food and service whenever we are in Vegas and stop by for our Korean BBQ fix.  Just wish they had more tables as it can be popular on the weekends.   Really enjoy the variety of gogi and other options.
We went for the happy hours, you cannot beat the price, food is good and portion is decent, I love the spicy pork, one of the best!
Free desert with writing a review! Service was amazing. The meats were awesome. Comes with complimentary sides as well. Decided to go here instead of gyu kaku, n didn't regret it!
Came here for the second time and fell in love with this place again. The staff is nice and friendly and the side dishes are amazing.

Good quality meats and a fun experience. However, slightly slow service even during a less busy period.
I ordered the mushroom medley as a side and, despite enquiring as to its whereabouts twice, it turned up quite a while after I had already finished my meal without an apology from our server, Li.
My favourite dish was the Bulgogi sliced ribeye and I really enjoyed the fishtail complimentary side. The rest were not anything special but I liked that they were unlimited.
When we went, they were offering free dessert in exchange for a Yelp! review so it would have been rude not to. You get to choose between a free plate of banana tempura with ice cream or a macaron ice cream sandwich (only coffee flavour was left and I'm glad we never paid for it).

Cons: Been here yesterday and today and both times it was 1.5-2 hour wait. Yesterday we ended up leaving and eating else where since we were starving and we were 33 on the wait list :(  Agree with another poster that the meat can be more fresh. Oysters not all fresh either.
Pros: excellent service and food was good. Overall will come back again probably during happy hour when the wait isn't crazy long :)
This restaurant deserves more recognition because it's one of the best places I've ever eaten at. It has excellent food and the customer service is outstanding!

Visiting from California and saw this place on yelp! It lived up to its hype! Excellent food and excellent service.  The lunch special is alot of food and you leave filling full! The spicy chicken is superb and the wontons the best ive ever tasted.  I definaltely will come back here when visiting again.

Decided to try this place because of all the reviews on here. I love Korean bqq a lot and normally go to Sura but wanted a change. Came here, and instantly liked the atmosphere. Experience was not good at all. 

The food is good. We got their number one seller Gangnam combo. Which would've been perfect but we never got our sides that came out with it. It says you get complimentary sides, and they just never came. We also ordered an extra side of rice, again never came. Basically when ever we ordered things, it either came out super late or not at all. Service is also slow and not attentive at all. I guess we made it inbetween shifts because near the end, we didn't see our waitress at all and a new server took the rest of our order. It wouldn't have been bad, but it would've been considerate to just let us know. We waited way too long for everything. 

I will not be coming back purely because of the experience. Food was decent, but nothing to make me want to come back.

Stay away... The people are so rude!!! We just got up and left as all the tables that came in after us were being served.  The gentleman finally took notice that we were standing at the register to find out why we weren't being served.  His excuse was that they just forgot about us!!!  What 2 people sitting in the middle of the dining room with tables all around us being served and us just sitting there!!  Get your act together!!  I would not recommend this place to my enemy!!  Kind of odd that we were the only Caucasians in there and every other table in there there were Asian,  they certainly were being catered to!!!  Very disappointing!!
Very nice bbq. Everything is super. Kobe beef was indeed very good and worth the price! Servers are great too.

Must try ....
Stayed at Rumor boutique hotel and today ate dinner at Gangnam asian bbq near the hotel. 
Ordered Korean steamed beef short ribs, fried dumplings and a Korean bean soup. Taste was good enough ^ ^
Great bugolgi, spicy garlic edamame, banchan, sauces. Recommend the jalapeño poppers!

Bomb.com easily. Fresh meat, perfectly marinated and seasoned. Bulgogi and prime kalbi was my favorite for sure. Great service and ambiance too. Imma go back and eat my food. Doing this review at the same time. Peace.

Second time visit. The food is so yummy and the environment is enjoyable. As a Asian who likes Korean BBQ a lot, I would say the food here is authentic. We came at around 5pm which is a happy hour surprisingly so we ordered 6 dishes for 2 people. Our favorite one is spicy pork. Would definitely come here again!

The food is so great and the service is perfect.
I really recommend others come to this place when they are in las vegas.

Very good food and service. Got the gangnam bbq dish and were very satisfied.

Also got the macaroon ice cream sandwich, which came in many different flavor a--strawberry, vanilla, mango, green tea, etc. The restaurant is a little ways outside of the strip, so you don't get the same sense of crowdedness and frustration that you'd get closer to the hotels.

Wow! We finally found our new KBBQ spot! My family and I ended up getting the "Gangnam" it came with fresh oysters, soft tofu kimchi, sishito pepper yuzo, green salad, bulgogi bimbimbap/white rice, miso soup, mushroom medly and for the MEATS... Harami miso, prime kalbi, flat iron garlic, filet mignon, bulgogi (All beef). Plus all the banchan. Waaaaaay too much food for us but super yummy. Everything was fresh and everyone was super attentive even though they were very busy. Inside the restaurant is super clean and nicely decorated. Definitely will be coming back!

This place is da bomb.com. The portion is huge!!! I mean their 2 servings probably could feed 4 people. And the meats were delicious. We had the las vegas set and i felt like i was going to explode. The chickens were so tender and juicy and seasoned just right and sauce was just the right amount of spicy. The service was pretty awesome too. I would totally come back again.

Does anyone want to eat dinner with me at 10pm? Because the reverse happy hour is amazing. 

Pork belly, filet mignon, and bulgogi--oh my. Just get a good group, fire up a table, and order a million little plates off the reverse happy hour menu. Even if something dissapoints you, I guarantee there is another little plate that could make you happy. Which is why you should come here with a small group. You can share the items and then cook it to your own preference. Because there are always those philistines that like meat cooked super well done. Or sometimes you just start talking and get distracted and over-cook your food. No matter what, you can't blame the cooks here for that. 

Service is always pretty good and beer is frosty. Definitely one of my favorite places.
The Service and Servers are awesome. Food was spot on. The KimChi was slightly under cook, but everything else was awesome.

Wow! This place was delicious! Glad we got out of the strip for this. We made it to their happy hour. Great proportions, nice servers, good music. Overall, great experience. Next time I'm in Vegas, I'll be sure to make another trip out to Gangnam!

Everything was delicious! I have Korean BBQ a lot in China, and I have been told it's very authentic. This place is much better, great flavors and excellent quality. All the meats and seafood were very fresh

Ordered the meat lovers for two and a steamed egg and was very happy with everything. Had a great selection of meat and wasn't disappointed by anything- all was good quality. The bulgogi was my favorite. 
I recommend the steamed egg, it was one of the best I've had. The combination also comes with a large salad which was nice. Only thing I would improve is the cucumber kimchi, which was too sweet.
AMAZING food!!! Venture the 2 minutes off the strip to come here - you will be hooked!

Considering the quality of other restaurants with the same price level in Las Vegas, this one is great! Their BBQ tastes so good. Service is a average. Remember to come this place early to reduce your waiting time.

Non-stop k-pop baby... If you're into that kind of thing. Despite being Asian, I happen to not like it, but I am mesmerized by it very much the same way sirens draws in weary sailors lost at sea. 

That's literally all I can remember, while Ryan recalls some deliciousness that fails to stick in my mind. I have the impression that the food isn't bad and very reasonably priced. I would go back again.

We were 2 adults and 3 kids and ordered the Gangnam for 2, our waitress recommended it to us and it filled all of us up! We were also able to sub some of the starters for dumplings instead which the kids loved! The food was delicious and the banchan were average but good! ur family really enjoyed dining here for lunch.The staff was very friendly and accommodating and our lunch was affordable. Our family really enjoyed eating here we will definitely come back.
Good good beef. Bad bibimbap tho. But overall really good
I like the atmosphere of this restaurant. Servers are nice. The food is also delicious. I love the spicy pork sooo much.
Food was delicious, the service is very attentive! Perfect experience! Donkey was friendly.
I came here the other night with family and really enjoyed their kalbi. So here I am eating here again today.

So good! Best Asian Bbq ever! The sauce is sooooo good. Beef sashimi is the best!

Kobe beef is not good, but others are so good, hot sake is amazing btw.
Love the service here!! Got the Meat Lover and the portion was more than enough for two people. The servers here are very responsive. I would definitely come back again :)
Friendly helpful service. Great food! Open til 1am. Love the brisket, chicken lettuce wraps, noodles & the broccoli! Always come here when I'm in Vegas!

Came here over 4th of July weekend. Most of the meat was excellent and well flavored including the marinated Kalbi. The brisket (beef toro) was only alright. Most of the staff was friendly although it took awhile for anyone to notice we were there and seat us. Overall I will probably come back eventually.
Wow. The food was great, but the waiters rarely came back to our table. But when they did, they were extremely nice. Overall, great experience.

Went here for late lunch and was promptly seated. They had fixed menus but we opted to order ala carte. We got the Kobe Ssam for appetizer. It was okay, but will probably not order it again. We got the japchae and we loved it. As for the bbq items, we ordered the bulgogi, salmon with bacon and spicy pork. Loved the bulgogi, salmon with bacon was good too. Spice pork was okay. Service was good and food came out in a timely manner. Btw, free dessert when you write a review!
Food is delicious. This is the second time coming here and we were seated right away.  Side dishes were good too.

Awesome kbbq!
Must try the Korean Style Kalbi :)
Veggie grill dish are also good. Fun and delicious place. Highly recommend!!!

Service here was awesome again thanks to Andrew. He made sure everything was great making sure lemonade was topped and grill was just the right heat. This is family fav spot will for sure be coming here again and again. Thanks Andrew and the rest of the crew at Gagnum.

The place is not all you can eat. The portion sizes are fair for the price. Between three people we split the gangnam set. We also were not very hungry though. So keep that in mind if you're really hungry. Service was diligent and kind. Thank you!

When I first saw this place on yelp, I was pretty ecstatic. Who can beat four thousand reviews and 4.5 star rating? 

The servers here seem to be pretty nice and the customer service is pretty good. I didn't have any issues with ordering food or having things come out too late. 

The meat quality is alright. I ordered the Korean Prime Kalbi, Prime Kalbi, and Harami Miso which looked amazing, but it was the ultimate blue ball. They were well marbled which I loved, but it was surprisingly tough... what a disappointment. The beef looked to be on par with that of Magal Korean BBQ, but when you bite into it, you can tell that there is a huge difference in quality. The banchan here was surprisingly good, but the bibim nangmyun was not quite where I wanted it to be. They need to put less chilled broth in it because it was almost indistinguishable from mul nangmyun. 

The only redeeming quality of this place is the price. I ordered 3 plates of beef and an order of Bibim Nangmyun and it came out to roughly $50 with tax and tip. If I were to order the same stuff at Magal, it would be roughly $80 to $90.

All in all, this is a so-so korean bbq spot that made me reminiscent of home, but it was nothing spectacular. The service is good, but the beef quality is forgettable. After my experience here, I was wondering how so many people could think this place is so damn amazing, but then I saw a little sign on our table. They offer free macaron ice cream for every review that is written. They pretty much bribe people into writing good reviews for a free dessert. 

If you come here looking for Korean BBQ nirvana, keep on looking. If you want a moderately priced and decent quality BBQ joint, this may be for you. Just don't expect amazing things from here.

The best Japanese bbq restaurant in Vegas I think. Great service and food^^ love the beef tongue and tofu soup. Btw the side dishes are also great!Good service.very delicious bbq, the spicy tofu soup is awesome, too! Nice interior and convenient location. Recommend the beef tounge and chicken fried rice. One of the best BBQ restaurant I'be had in Las Vegas.
Best BBQ in Las Vegas!  Good service and reasonable price. Happy hour is a killer deal. PS: free dessert if you post a review!  But it is a truly 5 stars location.
Came with group of my friends. Place has good variety of food. Great to come for happy hour.

I like the food, it was really fresh. The service was also on point and it was a full house. The beef is really good, any of them. The fried rice feeds about 3 ppl. I love this place, I come here often. And always bring ppl here who come to Vegas to visit, they all love it. The price is also very reasonable. For 2 ppl I usually spend about $40 but leave STUFFED.

Good quality meats and a great assortment of side dishes.  We had the Gangnam and there was more than enough meat for the two of us.  The oysters were also very delicious.  We came during happy hour so our sake was half off too.  Great value!

We'll be back for sure!

Favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas! FYI - it's not AYCE, but it ends up coming out to ~$30/person anyway (unless you have a huge appetite) so comparable in price. Quality of meat, variety of offerings, and service are all better than what you receive at AYCE joints. Also nice, central location away from all other Spring Mtn spots. Highly recommended!

Great service,  great food.
We are really enjoy it.
Specially, all combo is enough to 2 person. 
We love it

my girl had to work NYE and we wanted to have a nice meal close to the Strip, but not too close.  a quick search on Yelp and decided on Gangnam.

Great decision Yelpers!  you can order everything a la carte or order one of their combo specials for two.  We did the Paradise A combo ($56 for two ppl).  our server said it was the most popular choice.

there was easily enough food for 3 people!  everything was tasty!  Five starters and five dishes to BBQ. I especially liked the spicy dumplings from the starters, and all the meat was top quality.

Service was very helpful and attentive, without being annoying.  Great place for date night (slightly romantic, but more hip and cool).  we will definitely be back!!
Loved the filet mignon, calamari, and mushrooms. K-pop music was an added bonus!! Service was excellent .  Highly recommend this place.
Nice place for hanging out with meat lover friends，整體不錯，價位稍高，為了免費甜點打卡，哈哈哈哈
Delicious! Enjoyed the food and the venue!! Everything tastes very good! I recommend this place ! I'm from Cali, first time here! You gotta come try this food!

OMG the best ever..Better than tofu hut hands down.
Delish. ..It's my first time and it was great.The service is great, fast and effecient. I'm sure I'll be back.

Excellent quality meats. I've been to many Korean BBQ in different states, but this by far the best Korean BBQ. Not to mention their prices are very reasonable compare to other Korean BBQ I've been to.

Definitely will be coming back here again and again.
Very good. Had the Las Vegas and meat lovers between 4  people. Plenty of food. Wait staff was great.

This place is clean and looks modern and hip. First trying out a new place in LV and instead of going to a buffet, wanted to try a new place. The food looks amazing and not to mention FRESH! Definitely recommend and will be coming back.
Had the prime kalbi! The best kbbq place I've been to so far in town. The kimchi is to die for!
Wonderful ambience, food, & service. We came here for happy hour, and it is great quality for the price you pay for!! Two thumbs up!

On a Saturday night, this back of the strip mall restaurant provided an enjoyable time and good food (that you cook at your own pace). The place was 50% full when we went there round 8pm. However, I think this place draws a late crowd as it is open until 2 am. Attractive staff and modern style furnished the space. 

Be aware when sitting down. Check for water from the exhaust hood above. As Korean BBQ gets hot and the ac runs cold to keep it cool, condensation builds and can drip on to the table or seat. The underside of my shorts got wet when I slid into the bench style seat. (-1 star).

This place is good for 2-4, and larger tables of 8 are in the back. Super fast service! Don't be shy to flag the servers down. 3 people ran the front of the house. All 3 were at out table at some point.

We ordered a set combination of things and every bit was great. They prepared bibimbap table side and opened our mushroom foil pouch too. The grill didn't get too hot but would try this place in the winter time.

The good was of high quality and at some point, thought it may be too much. Food, 4 beers, house sake = $85 before tip. Not bad!
Didn't expect any good BBQ place in Vegas but this one is awesome. I went with my friends and we have party of 6. So they have as two separate table. Good value and good food. Yummy!!!
This is a fantastic place for bbq and amazing Korean food.Taste good and price is also reasonable.  We love it.

Sooo loved!! From the ambiance to the food..def be back. It had a fun atmosphere/feel to it. Music vids playing while ESPN highlights (for the bf) played! And the food was amazing. Got the paradise meal and it came with everything..appetizers, soup, rice (bulgogie rice was super good), and meats & veggies! Can't wait to go back!!

As far as Korean bbq places, this is probably not the best place. Meat is lacking in flavor and is pricey unless you come during happy hour. Better off going to AYCE at Tofu Hut and deal with the wait. It's also always strange to me when they don't give rice at start and you have to request it as extra.

Hands down - the best Korean BBQ I have ever had. Everything was so fresh, and flavorful. We ordered Bulgogi, Korean spare ribs, pork belly, and pork toro. We ate every single bite. Such a fun atmosphere, and service was great.

Gangnam is a pretty good place to go if your looking for a fusion of Korean and Japanese BBQ. I'm a big fan of the both so when I saw there was a restaurant incorporating the two I had to try it. Plus seeing has 4 1/2 that made me feel sure the food might be good. I ordered the special combo for 2 people. Lots of good choices and the price was good for the amount you get. The miso and sides were yum and the meats well marinated. Definitely would come back!  It was a good place to end an EDC weekend meal:)
The server Jay was good! She took care of us when we didn't know what to order. I highly recommend going here if you're eating Korean food for the first time.
First time here and food was real great. Atmosphere is good, server was on point and she's really beauitiful
Excellent all round. The waitresses very friendly. The wait was a little long . The meat was well seasoned and the atmosphere was excellent
Holy cow,  this is good.  One of the party said this was what they would have for their last meal.  I agree! This place is amazing.  Great flavor and lots of choices. Fun too cook for your self.

Food is delicious. The set of 4 fed our party of 4 adults and 3 kids well. They are generous w their serving and side dishes. To top it all, the people are very honest and understanding. I left a great amount of money on the table in a a bag. Only discovered it an hour later, yet the whole amount was intact. Good job. U have won a faithful customer.

Good Korean BBQ. Ordered the Gangnam combo and it was very good. Meats were tender and flavorful. I tried the coffee and mango ice cream macaroons and they were delicious, but I like the coffee one better. Great service and it was fast too. Will definitely eat here again on my next visit.

Always on the hunt for a new Korean BBQ spot, I'm not sure how I missed this place over the last few searches. Off the sometimes blurring beaten path of Chinatown, GangNam is right across from the Hard Rock hotel on Paradise. We came based on the Yelp reviews and shared a "Meat Lover" (hey now). The presentation was great, and everything tasted very fresh. Free sides and great quality meats for sure. The two pre marinated meats were great, but my personal preference is to cook the meat dry and use the dipping sauces. The "Macaron" ice cream sandwiches are awesome too. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back to check out happy hour and some of the other unique menu items. Ps: come get your free dessert!
First time coming to a Korean bbq.. & really enjoyed it ! Awesome service and atmosphere. Such a fun experience :)

Came to Las Vegas For EDC! Great event by the way. Anyways, it's our last day here and was craving Korean BBQ/Yakiniku. Happy hour is 10pm to closing. Came at 12, instantly got greeted and seated. Service was fast, great and friendly. The happy hour had a variety of good choices. Definitely a must go to restaurant! *****
Great food and great service! Combos are the best! Enjoy the meal! Excellent sevice! Recommended to everyone coming to Las Vegas for a great Korean meal
Delicious! Fun environment, great price.  Got the meat lovers and it was amazing! Enough for 2 people, but realistically feeds 3 to perfection?

Very trendy place to eat Korean bbq. We ordered the gangnam setting for 2 people. Couldn't finish all of it. The meat was good. I really liked the bi-bim-bap. There was a variety of vegetables. They ran out of oysters but I had a choice to pick something else. I got the salmon.  Bruno Mars was playing on the big screen in the back. I'd def come back here again. Very good!
Great place to try. Perfect customer service and food. Worth the wait. Will be here every time I'll be back to Las Vegas.

This was my first Korean BBQ experience, and I have to say, yum! In love with the concept of cooking your own food at the table. Not to mention the happy hour is amazing! Bulgogi is a must try. So satisfied.

Get the meat lover! It comes with a ton of side dishes and a good variety of meets. The filet mignon was my favorite. The pork and the beef come seasoned with the right amount of salt and pepper. My only complaint is that I wish it came with lettuce wraps for the meat. It also came with a miso soup! 
It's good ambiance and plays good music.

Reasonably priced for a non-AYCE dinner. You do still get good portion. Below are the items we've ordered/gotten:

Mango Saketini and Peach Saketini - alcoholic drinks, they taste like what their names are: mango and peach. LOL.

Appetizers: 
Steamed Dumplings
Fried Dumplings
Miso Soup
Seaweed Salad with shredded radish

Post appetizer/pre main course:
Fried calamari w/spicy sauce
Fresh oysters

Main course:
Prime Kalbi
Beef Toro
Kobe Style Beef

Desert:
Green tea cheesecake
Fried Banana with Ice Cream

Service was good. Checked up on us one in a while to make sure everything was okay. 

This establishment is near the strip and UNLV. So if you're around the area, a must stop!

Would come back here and try out their HH.

Excellent service and food. I can't believe we didn't know about this place..Good quality and affordable.   See you again soon..It turns out we went during their 2nd Happy hour, so i was amazed how inexpensive our total bill was.  John and Rebeca.

Some people like their meat rare, some like it well done. Me? I like it Oppa Gangnam Style!

In all seriousness, this is the go-to Korean place of my Korean Vegas local friend so what more do you need?

Delicious, great food, great service, best lunch deal in town! Id definitely recommend it. 3 course Lunch for $14 with tip, just enough food to be satisfied and you don't feel like you've over eaten either!
Second visit within 2 months. Really satisfied. Should definitely try the mango ice cream! (=

Oh my. This place is hidden gem in Las Vegas. I love Asian dining esp Korean. I love the side dishes. I ordered steamed dumpling and bulgogi I bibimbap. It was served on a sizzling plate and it was warm for the rest of the meal. So worth it and def coming back.

Took my wife here after a long day at a convention. A co-worker had eaten there the night before and wouldn't shut up about it. Now I know why: It's incredible! We got a variety of meats, and we should have shared, because we didn't even come close to eating it all. But it was so good, I tried my hardest (read: too hard) and ended up paying for it with a bloated, full belly. But the smile on my face was worth it. I was even pretty drunk by the time we got there, and the memory still stands out clear as day. Don't miss!

A belly busting, jolly good time! 

We cruised over on a sunny Sunday for happy hour. My party of 3 was famished so we went to town on the happy hour menu; available everyday 3pm-6pm and again at 10pm-12:45am) - the HH menu isn't huge, but it had a good variety so we stuck to it. 

They only offer complimentary side dishes (banchan) with a minimum of 2 BBQ dishes per person, but we had no problem meeting that quota. All of the sides offered were fresh and flavorful - we also enjoyed extra rounds. Also, they offered 3 dipping sauces light, medium, and a dark one. They were all tasty but my favorite was definitely the darkest one - it was salty, sweet and a bit spicy. 

HH items we tried:
Cream cheese wontons - 4/5
Sweet corn - 5/5 (very sweet and buttery but tiny)
Mushroom medley with butter - 4/5
Garlic in butter - 5/5
Jalapeno poppers - 5/5 (delicious)
Korean chicken cheese fondue - 3/5
Spicy pork - 4/5
Pork belly - 5/5 (we loved this the most!)
Bulgogi - 3/5

When dining outside of happy hour, the regular menu is massive so I'm sure you will be able to find something, even for the the pickiest of eaters. Also, pricing seemed fairly competitive with Gyu-Kaku (their direct competitor.) The grill tops and ventilation setup at each table worked very well; they conveniently changed out our charred grill per our request and the restaurant wasn't smokey or smelly.

After the feast you know we all needed a cup of caffeine to snap us out of the food coma.

Good times!
This is the best Korean BBQ that I've had in Las Vegas to date.  The servers were very attentive and the food excellent; and I'm already looking forward to my next visit.

Excellent Korean BBQ!  

In fact, the best I've ever had--and I've had quite a bit all over the US and Asia.  First off, the location is convenient and not too far off the strip right across from the Hard Rock Hotel.  

The strip mall. It's in is clean and the interior of the restaurant is modern and tastefully decorated--and again; CLEAN.  It is open until 1 am and we arrived about 11:45 pm.  Although it was late and near closing, we still received excellent and friendly service without ever feeling like being rushed.

We ordered the most popular meal package: The Gangnam which came with a variety of meat cuts and marinades, rice bimibap and assorted dishes like Kim chee and what have you.  They also brought out fresh oysters as well as steamed mushrooms.  Again, everything was super fresh and absolutely delicious!

Highly recommended!
Nice place, excellent service. This is first time in town and try this place. We order love combo 55$ good due and good food.
Ive been in vegas for 5 years..by far the best k bbq spot in sin city!so satisfying.....the gangnam portion is soooo bomb!great atmosphere and great employees...thank u

Friendly staffs, nice interior, good atmosphere but not the best bang for a buck. Decent place though. 

P.S.
Steamed Kalbi is waaaaaaay tooooo salty and sweet.. Ask them if they could make it any less sodium and sweetness.

My boyfriend and I always look for Korean BBQ when we go out of town since we don't have many options back home. This popped up on my radar with all the many good reviews so we decided to check it out. We decided to get the premium menu for two which included all of the higher cuts of meats and side dishes. Let me just say the food was never ending it seemed! It was delicious and we managed to finish a good portion of all the food we got (which was A LOT!) Service was fast and friendly. Definitely would come back next time we are in the area!
Needed BBQ fix while visting Las Vegas and did not disappoint. Hopefully we'll be back soon for more.
This place is awesome.  Reminded me of home while visiting in Vegas. I would recommended grilling the meats definitely a bonding experience and even great for first dates.

As a Korean person coming to a Korean restaurant in Vegas, I didn't expect much. But I was wrong, overall it was good food and big portions. Would recommend the Yuke Jang but not the Bibimpap. It was too sweet for what it should be. 

Overall, I had a super nice and friendly server and the experience was nice. Good lighting and music too.

The service was really good and fast. The staff was friendly. We ordered the beef tongue, toro beef, pork belly, spicy tuna kimbap, and the seafood pancake and they were all pretty good. We had a good amount of sides compared to other Korean restaurants. I would come eat here again when I'm back in Vegas.

With close to 3K reviews it's easy to get carried away with the crowd. It's a good Korean restaurant but would not fall as best for me. They've updated their service and I can say their staff are very friendly and service oriented. They have fast service and their meats are great. However, the taste is somewhat so-so and came across as the same on their variety of meats - sweet.

Maybe we should have ordered the cooked bulgogi instead of the set menu Gangnam BBQ that we have to grill ourselves. I would probably return just to try out their cooked dishes, but will definitely check out other KBBQ resto first whenever we visit LV.
Good food! Lotsa side dish! Bulgogis are awesome... Friendly people.... Comfy ambience and clean surroundings. Happy hour with low prices.3pm - 6pm. Recommended!
Awesome happy hour!! Spicy lemon chicken was delicious. Service was great. Definitely recommend.

This place is a hidden gem! The food is top notch. Remember to cook a single piece of meat at a time so that each bite and be fresh off the grill and perfect in taste and texture. 

Try to see if you can get Kristin as your server and ask her about her dessert specials! ;)
Came here for happy hour. Prices were pretty good. Try the beef kalbi, so tender. The service was great. Will definitely come back.
Great service - always checking to see if you need anything else. Must get the Harami Miso bbq!
I love this place! I come here often and alway enjoy myself. The staff is so nice and the food is great! The friendliest staff I've met!
Nice atmosphere,  contemporary. Reasonably good food and price. Look out for daily happy hour deals.

Gangnam is bomb. Good prices, fast service, nice staff. 

Tucked into the corner of a shopping center across from hard rock, this place is solid 7 nights a week. 

2 happy hours a day! 1/2 price beers and drinks. 

Good packages for bbq - easy to choose. 

I recommend!
The service was excellent. ...we didn't know what we were doing and Soo   was amazing  at explaining the process. ...dinner was a wonderful  experience.

It's really taste great!

 And the food very fresh. I love it. Will come again. 
  
I come from az,hope they can open one in az.
First time in this place for Father's Day! And it was really good!!  looking forward on coming back!
The restaurant was easy to find and the food  was great. Had the scallops, kalbi and pork belly. So yummy and the service excellent
Fantastic Korean BBQ.  The food quality is among the best of the best that I've had.

The meat was nicely seasoned and tasted great! The side dishes and sauces for the BBQ tasted good as well. Service staff was polite and quick. I would say my first time here was an excellent experience. Thanks!

Long wait but it's pretty worth it. 
Great service and food. 

Loved the bacon & scallop!

Amazing restaurant! Everyone is very nice and helpful! My friends can't stop talking about this great Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas. So we went everywhere till we found the place and "super worth the wait"... Nice to treat your whole family.

Wow! First time trying korean bbq, and it was great! Got the Las Vegas grill and didn't realize how much food there was. Come verrrryy hungry. The meats were well marinated and the sides were all different from each other. I would definitely come back, but i would come back with a bigger group.
Running to the airport and they were very quick! Glad I stopped. Plus, get a free macaron ice cream with a review!
Their food is really great especially the seafood tofu, they also have a very fast service. The atmosphere inside is also very comfortable and relaxing!!
Great place for Korean bbq.  Food is fresh and tasty.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Clean and pleasant atmosphere.
Delicious food and good service. The beef is fresh and high quality. Side dishes are very good also, especially the cucumber one.

This place is a little out of the way locals but I think it's pretty good. First of all they give a bunch of side dishes that were all pretty good except for the macaroni, it tasted like it was full of butter. 

We got prime Kalbi, both marinated and not marinated. The not marinated one was the best thing I had this meal. The beef tongue was aight. If it was sliced a bit thinner or a bit thicker it would've been great. Pork belly was typical pork belly. We cooked it to crispy. The filet mignon was meh. Would skip. We also got the king oyster mushroom. It was aight. 

Get the prime kalbi. So good. So fat. So worth. 

Also get the sesame oil with sea salt. It's well worth the one dollar. Adds a lot of flavor to the meats. 


Also free dessert if you do Yelp reviews rn. ;D
Korean Prime Rib, Spicy Tuna Kimbap is delicious!  Love the atmosphere and the big TV screen that plays music videos. I also like that you can cook the food right at your table.

Food was pretty amazing. I ordered their bulgogi, spicy chicken, spicy pork, spicy squid, spicy chicken karage, fried calamari, and pork belly. The bulgogi and spicy pork had the best flavor and were my favorite, but everything was good. I suggest eating when they have happy hour. You get a ton of food for a decent price. Service was great as well. They were very friendly and always made sure everything was okay. I would definitely come back again.

The service is ok in the beginning, but I don't know why they changed a waitress for us and she was too slow with everything. Food is too salty with so-so flavor. I tried more delicious BBQ in California. Vegas has no good BBQ. 5 star for the first service, 2 star for the food, 1 star for the later service. So total is 2 stars.
Fantastic high quality food and even better service, get the filet. Try the combo meals. Cook your food right at the table.  Better than any other place I've had in vegas. Yum!

Pork cheeks. Not the butt cheeks turned into pasty ham. Pork cheeks off of the pig's head. Deliciously fatty, marbled meat. Like bacon on crack. Grill it. Eat it. Rinse it with a pitcher of Sapporo beer. Repeat.

Yummy BBQ. Friendly service, meat was Juicy and delicious. Happy Hour has good choices. I loved the Filet Mignon and the mushroom medley. Prices r ok. Its off the Strip but only 5 min by car. We will Come back asap. 
Only neg. U will smell After your Food.  Keep that in mind when u choose to eat here. It was worth it

Best Korean food in Vegas....PSY would agree!!!
My brother and I ordered the Meat Lover and a side of romain lettuce...we are both big eaters and still had food left over!!  Free dessert was a bonus!!  Make rezzies as we waited 1.5 hours on a Wednesday!  Worth the wait though!!

We had no idea that we would be cooking our own food on a grill that is at your table. It was so awesome and definitely a unique dining experience! The food is amazing. Especially the spicy chicken. That was my favorite. Looking for amazing Asian food and an awesome dining experience? Then you should definitely come to GangNam!!
The food is pretty good and the waiters and waitresses are pretty nice too! The price isn't  pricy! It is really worth it to go!
Great place for Korean BBQ, meat quality is good, good flavours and they also serve food with all the side dishes!
The meats are really tender, great sides. Overall great experience. Nice, clean place

My husband and I have had korean bbq many times before but this place is by far my favorite! Best korean food I've ever had!!! Great atmosphere and service was great!!! Definitely will comeback again.

One of the best KBBQ places in town. It's pretty far from where we live, but worth the commute. The combos and al a carte options are both reasonably priced and the Korean/Japanese restaurant vibe is awesome. There is K-Pop playing overhead keeping the place upbeat. 
We ordered the Kobe-style beef, brisket, pork belly, and bulgogi (of course!). It's self-cook entirely which is sometimes hard to keep up with, but love the control so the temp is always to your liking.
The waiters are very nice.  Happy hour is awesome. We do enjoy dining here. We have a party of 8 ppl.
Great food. Great service. All the meat is mouthwatering, the kimchi is really good, so much food, my kind of place.

We were a little skeptical when we walked in because it wasn't too crowded. It started to fill in after awhile. We got the Gangnam set dinner and everything was really tasty.  Service was fast and friendly.  I wasn't sure it was going to be enough food for us, but we're going to leave with a happy, full tummy.
Our first time here and oh wow..... Everything is on point! The servers were all very nice, friendly and very attentive. We'll definitely return on our future trips back to Vegas.

I'm a lover of all things Korean BBQ so I've had my eye on the place for a while due to the high reviews and I must say, they didn't disappoint! Excellent quality of meats and banchans were delicious as well (I couldn't stop eating the kimchi!). However, it was my second time here and unfortunately the service was way better the first time. During my first visit they were very attentive and accommodating to all our requests. However, the second time they barely came around and we had to ask for more food to random servers that passed us by. They didn't fill our water once or ask us if we wanted another serving and it took them forever to even give us the check. Maybe it was an off night, but there wasn't a lot of people so it couldn't have been because they were busy. Hopefully third times a charm!

This restaurant was good. The meat was pretty good and the service was also good. The food arrived at our table pretty fast and the environment is also very clean and well kept. Definitely recommend this place!

Their kimchi complementary side dish was better than any other kbbq's. They serve a unique pickled cucumber that no other kbbq place serves. We ordered bulgolgi, prime koren kalbi, pork belly, spicy chicken with lemon sauce, spicy tuna, and kimchi pancakes. Everything was A1!! That lemon chicken hit the spot! And I've always wanted to try Korean pancakes, it was so worth it. Service was pretty good. This is the go to spot for Korean bbq in Vegas!!

So I'm so used to all you can eat kbbq so I wasn't sure if the food was actually gonna fill me up. Especially since it's a bit on the pricey side for two people. But, I have to say I'm a extremely satisfied! Everything was delicious! I especially liked the filet migon and beef toro.

don't order the kara age, but order everything else on the menu. this gem next to hard rock hotel has high-grade meats and a great selection of endless traditional korean side dishes. the ambiance is very nice even though it's in a strip mall. and don't worry about the lack of AYCE, the portions are plenty and will leave you stuffed and wishing you didn't eat this much before your drunken night on the strip.
This place is really good! The bulgogi and the flat iron garlic lived up to they hype! The staff and the general atmosphere are awesome. I would recommend this place to anyone!
One of the best Korean bbq places I've ever been to. The beef kalbi was our favorite. So juicy and tender.
Delicious and great prices! The staff is very friendly and it's a fun atmosphere. I recommend the bulgogi. Everything is great. It's really nice because you can order a la carte.
My first time here, everything was very good. The rib eye steak with uni melts in your mouth. We will definitely come back. I give it 5 stars, very very satisfied!

Good food decent prices, would have gave 5 stars but they charge for some sides that I believe should come with at a Korean BBQ. Like the rice and lettuces being extra was little much but other wise good food, good prices
The food was awesome and the selection of side dishes was great! Best meal in Vegas! No issues finding parking as well.

My husband and I found this place while we were visiting Las Vegas. The reviews were very positive, and so we tried it. Never again. Very pricey compared to the quality that was prepared. The staff was nice and offered good service. The restaurant decor was great. The quality of meat was poor considering we paid a lot for a small amount. We walked in excited, but left disappointed.
First time eating at this place and it's really good! You even get a free dessert if you rate them! :)
Great food variety. Took a star for the difficulty getting non water refills. The sauce tray to dip my food into was a nice touch
Awesome Korean BBQ in Vegas, a must try! Great food and atmosphere but a little far from the strip

the taste is very good，i like this restuarant design. the service is good too！
i recommend Kobe style beef that is amazing！
Great food & great service! The food comes in large portions and is worth the price. Joseph was a great server.

The food is awesome. My fave food is the kobe beef, its so tender and juicy. We definitely want to eat here again. Friendly staffs, they are attentive to your needs. My grill were changed three times, as soon as it turn black. Come here if u go to vegas.
The food was so delicious. Definitely be back for the bulgogi, spicy pork and torso.  I also enjoyed their dessert the ice cream macaroons.  The service was great as well.

That's place is perfect! Great service coupled with delicious food. The atmosphere is open and inviting, the decor is a mix of modern and traditional 


This is the place where I'm taking all my friends that visit vegas
I rarely eat korean bbq but this place does not disappoint. Soju ginger drink was superb. Much love!
Best kbbq spot in Las Vegas  letsCook!!! Great service  great waiter   They fixed us a nice table for our party of 7

No wait for lunch. Happy hour 50% off alchy. 
Beef tongue, Kalbi, uni bimbimbap!!! Hella
Bomb! 
Free dessert with check in :)

The food here is delicious! A great place to enjoy Korean BBQ. The service was attentive, friendly and helpful. The choice of meats was excellent as was the quality. I can say without a doubt that this is as good if not better than some of the places I have eaten at in Korea Town in NYC. The fact that this place is off the strip makes it even better as most people who frequent it are avid fans of Korean cuisine rather than a bunch of tourists.
It wss great!!!!!!! Clean place and delicious food! Best Korean bbq food I had in Las vegas

We went in hungry,  got the gangnam set for 2 and it was ag great choice.  The marinated meats were my favorite part of the meal.  The raw oysters was a good start for the meal.  We had enough food to fill us up and take home for a snack later too, Definitely was worth the trip while in vegas!
When you're feeling Korean bbq this is where you go. Tried Kobe beef, it was juicy and delicious!
The food was soooo good. Defintiely worth the stop. Happy hour prices are unbeatable. Overall, great experience.

The atmosphere here is very cool. Food is awesome. Their portion sizes were pretty generous. We ordered the Gangnam combo for 4 and it fed our party of 6 very well. The fresh oyster is a must! VERY refreshing. Definitely coming back the next time we're in Vegas.

Just wow! Some of the best Korean I have ever had... And I've been to Seoul! The portions are just right and so is the price so you can eat everything you want! My fav? Pork toro and pork belly :) the green tea ice cream is also amazing. Just try it- well worth the trip off the Strip.
Good food, the prime kalbi never fail you, also the corn cheese as appetizer is a bomb, if u want liitle bit kick in ur tongue order the sisito pepper is good and spicy of course!
This is a great restaurant. We ordered the Las Vegas for 4 and it was so much food we couldn't finish it all, but it was really good. You really get more what you pay for in my opinion.

Such an amazing place! Even though the place looks small on the outside, they make up for it in food. My sisters & I visited them during happy hour, so we were able to order meats off the HH menu which was so cheap! We had the spicy pork (loved it), spicy chicken (it's okay), pork belly (bland but still yummy), kalbi (so juicy!) and bulgogi (eh it's okay). The spicy tofu soup was delicious as well! We really enjoyed the soup and ate all of it. This place is a hidden gem.
Awesome authentic Korean BBQ! Great place for large groups and lots of conversation. Bulgogi is a must try!

Great food! Great service. We picked this spot based on the rave reviews and it did not disappoint. I think this is the best Korean bbq in Vegas that I've been too. Great selection of macaron ice cream as well 



***Update***
2nd time being here and the food still tastes great! I love all the little side dishes especially the ones with the jalapeños  lemon chicken and garlic shrimp
Amazing food! The Harami Miso, Korean Chicken Cheese Fondue and Salmon with bacon were fantastic. Will definitely visit again!

Happy hour is good &' so is desert . A definite go to while in Vegas. Serving is fast and welcoming . The ambiance is clean &' fancy . We did happy hour and got ; 2 beef toro ( $8 )  , garlic chili wings ($4 ), fried calamari!!!!
This place is very good. It has a nice a very nice environment and also very clean. Not to mention they have the best Korean BBQ in town.
Good panchans. Great sauces. Lots of variety. Fresh fish. Clean decor and good ventilation. Non charcoal grill. No ayce option.

I decided to try this place out just because of the high rating and sheer number of reviews and I have to say I was not disappointed. From the moment I entered the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. And the experience was amazing. The atmosphere was very inviting as well. And the food Mmm. I give this place a 5 out of 5.

Best Korean/ Japanese bbq place in LV! This was my first time here and the food and customer service was amazing! Very friendly workers they actually checked up on us even if they were busy! Definitely coming back here again!

We did not get to cook our food but we did order the ramen egg soup and the vegetarian fried rice which were delicious. The spicy tuna appetizer was very fresh. Overall, good service and good price :)

Pretty awesome off the strip joint for your BBQ needs. Delicious and awesome. Right next to where sausage works.

Girlfriend loves the shrimp, like a good BBQ.

The food was amazing and the service was even better! We had the "Las Vegas" meal special for 4 people and it was delicious. They give you generous amounts of meats (garlic chicken, spicy chicken, flank, and shrimp) and 2 bowls of bulgogi bibimbap.  The bibimbap is the best I've ever had! We also tried the sweet corn cheese appetizer which goes perfectly with the grilled meats.  Would come back again 100%!

Awesome. Great selection of meats and very tasty. We ended up ordering a double order because it was so good. Surprisingly, Rice was not included in the meal so we had to ask for it. not that big of a deal.
Beautiful ambience and very fast service! Loved the chives and the Meat Lovers option. It is definitely enough to feed 3 people!

Right at the E Harman entrance of UNLV at the corner of a strip mall is this hidden gem.  Nice interior and chic decor.  Ordered the Las Vegas (of course) and added beef brisket and bacon wrapped salmon.  If everything is fresh and With u cooking ur own food, how can u go wrong?  Nice variety of ingredients and apps.
We shares the gangnam #1 between 3 ppl and it was really good.  The sauses were nice.  Kimchi and everything was good.
Amazing fd! Wonderful atmosphere and friendly staff! Will Definately come back. Simply amazing

Super friendly staff, ambiance is warm and hip. Chicken Karage was perfect, ordered marinated spare ribs, pork belly, beef toro and bulgogi. All was amazing!! They play music videos on a big screen on the wall and it's just the right volume and a great choice of music. 

Happy hour is 3pm-6pm and 10pm- close. Ordered broccoli, asparagus, and sweet corn. Perfect amount for 4 people. 

Would definitely eat here again when we come back to visit from the Bay!!
Really good place, it's like tapas style, lots of options and lots of sides. Very good place for Korean bbq. And the price was not bad at all, especially during happy hour deals

Pretty good food, excellent service!
Good ambience but construction going on near by.
A great new hidden find in vegas! Their lunch happy hour is amazing prices and food is actually better than most in china town. Dynamite shrimp is a hit!
Had some sushi here with friends while staying at hotel.  Everything was great!  Server was fabulous, checking on us frequently. Food was also excellent!  I highly recommend this restaurant.

Surprises to find good Korean food in Vegas. 
Good decoration and clean. 
Number 1, 2, 3 meat are must try.
Love the small dishes and 
all little complimentary dishes are tasty~~
Banana tempura is great!!
I love this place! Second visit. Favorite is Kobe beef. Good price with good quality.
好吃，好吃，yummy，yummy，量足。服务员超级帅 某美女都不想走了。环境不错，服务员小哥超级帅，韩国欧巴哗哗哗，明天还要来。very delicious! And the Korean waiter is so handsome!
Very delicious. Please coming and taste it. The Bbq is so great! The Bbq is from Korean and I like it very much. It is traditional Korean style and better that others. Great taste if you come here.

Nice ambience once you get inside. Good customer service especially Kristin (server)  who is very accommodating and I feel relax while eating. When it comes to food it's taste good! I like there Kalbi, garlic shrimp and harami miso

This place is absolutely amazing! The bulgogi here is to die for, I can't get enough of it. I'm not ashamed to say I've been here multiple times a week and have enjoyed it every time without a complaint.
Food was great and the service was even better. Affordable prices for good quality food. Back was an awesome server, definitely recommend sitting in his section. Will be back!
Exceptional food, service and ambiance. I recommend all the meats as they are melt in the mouth tender!
Super awesome happy hour. Service was quick and very attentive. A bit of a walk from the strip but definitely worth the excursion. Can't really find anything wrong with this place. 5 stars.

After hiking at the National Parks in Utah, this was just what we needed. We came during happy hour and received 50% off of our cocktails. The meat was flavorful and we received large portions. The side dishes were also delicious!

Walked in on a Friday night at 10 and we had a short wait. Our party of 5 probably waited like 10 minutes before we got sat but it was fast nonetheless! 

First thing I gotta say is that the interior was pretty nice. Every booth looks like there's a window from an old Korean palace haha. Modern interior though. The grills were great and kept the heat even and cooked everything nicely. 
The food was also really good. Our party ordered the meat lover set ($99) for 4 people but trust it was a lot of food. They brought out soup and salad which was also included. Side dishes were on the better side when coming to a Korean BBQ place as well. All in all this place is worth a try!

Came by for linner (lunch and dinner, 2PM) with three other friends. 

Ordered the "Meat Lovers" for 4, and everything that came with it was excellent. Miso soup was great, all of the meats were fresh and well-seasoned with generous portions, and the seaweed salad and kimchi really stood out as exceptional among the side dishes. 

My only issue was that the staff came by and turned down the heat on the grill after spending a healthy amount of time on the restaurant, and the grill wasn't hot enough to start, so it made the cooking time exponentially longer. We had time to spare, but the grill just bottlenecked our dining experience.

All in all, a very good KBBQ experience.

Best KBBQ in town!
Ordered the bulgogi, beef toro, flat iron garlic and prime kalbi. My bf likes the pork belly and broccoli cheese fondue. First time here and didn't get to try any seafood. 
If I'm ever on this side of town again I'll definitely come back to try other things.
This is my gfs go to for KBBQ and I'm glad we came here for lunch!
Free dessert with review!!

Good food! Service was pretty good. 

Personally, I don't like the marinated meat as much.

Loved the fliet mignon and flat iron steak!
Gangnam has clean and valuable atmosphere and especially they have some specials we can join. Most of all, their service is really attentive, of course the meats they serve is maximal!!

My wife & I stopped by for dinner on a Tuesday night. There was a decent crowd. Unlike other Korean restaurant, this one did not have the overwhelming smell of grease & grilled meat.  

We had a spicy tuna kimbap, prime kalbi (beef), spicy chicken w/ lemon, & asparagus. All items were very good. The beef & chicken were grilled at the table. They were nicely seasoned. Right portions for us. 

The spicy tuna kimbap was chunks of tuna in mayonnaise laced with sriracha sauce, served over rice balls wrapped in nori, lightly battered and deep fried. It was very tasty. 

Pieces of prime kalbi were tender & very good. I preferred them grilled rare. The spicy chicken pieces were well marinated and tasted real good when lightly dipped in lime juice. The asparagus was cooked yet lightly crunchy, the way I liked. Every thing went well with the Sapporo beer on draft. 

We finished our meal with banana tempura served with vanilla ice cream, topped with whipped cream. I wished I ordered a cup of black coffee to go with it. 

Our server was professional & friendly. She was running a bit ragged because she had many tables to attend to. 

We will definitely return to this restaurant the next time we are in Las Vegas, NV.
The best Korean BBQ in vegas! Be warned the portion size for 4 ppl will easily feed 5 ppl.
Kimchi was alright. I tried their kimchi bibimbap and it was fairly good. Atmosphere is cool. They were quick to seat us and they give a free dessert for writing a review!!!
Loved the place. Food is great, service was excellent and environment was very cool. Very clean and hip place to try Korean dishes.
My date and I went with the Gangnam Grill for 2 and is was more than enough food! The food was excellent and service was A++. Can't wait to come back!!
YELP review for dessert. awesome food and nice service. even though its located at the corner of the plaza, not easy to find. good experience.
We ordered Las Vegas set. Beef is delicious and small sides are very nice! Enjoyed a great dinner!
I didnt think id be eating Korean food in las vegas.  Glad to have tried this place (found it via yelp).  The food was great and the side dishes were also great.  This place is authentic Korean.

Great quality of meat, great service, great side dishes
Really felt like home food away from home
Definitely hidden gem

Came to celebrate double birthdays.  Good food... Lots of food.  We ordered two of the premium sets of food.  They allowed appetizer substitution  That was nice.  Great friendly service! Wasnt that hard to get to even with NFR right next door.  Free dessert birthday!! Will definitely recommend and come back.

Got there early for lunch - ordered the popular Gangnam meal for 2 - diff types of protein.

PROS: variety of salads and apps served first, multiple cuts of meat + shishito peppers, crab wontons were delish. favorite salad was the tofu and the pasta salad. 

CONS: not enough servers for lunch on a Sunday, certain requests had to be made twice, low on water refills, staff spread way too thin, bibimbap was not good at all, did not have that crispy layer and there was no fried egg. The NY strip was flavorless.
My friend and I went down here to try out their Korean BBQ, it was great! We got the Las Vegas for two and couldn't finish it! Very yummy and filling

First time here. Good service. Love the pork belly and the scallop bacon wrap. 
Will come again next time visit to L.V
Super friendly staff, decent meat and you get free dessert for a yelp review! Definitely recommend for a visit :D

This is by far one of the best Korean BBQ I've had. I live in LA and we have lots of good Korean food and this place tops them all. The staff is very friendly, courteous and they take the time to explain the food. I enjoyed the Gangnam special where you get to try a variety of meats and side dishes. Their Bi Bim Bap is 2nd to none. I throughly enjoyed my experience and will definitely come back. As a bonus, this great good is affordable.

Best korean bbq I've ever had! Way better than anything you can get from houston. Meat is high quality and very delicious. I would recommend the Korean prime kalbi and sukiyaki noodles and bulgolgi. Those were the best, but even then, the rest of the meats were really good too! Place to go to satisfy korean bbq cravings.

I'm from San Diego it is my first time have Korean food in LV. The meat was So good! And the service is good also. They said that we need to wait more than 30 min, but no more than 10 min we go in there. Foods are good, even the side dishes are delicious! Liked it here!

The best KBBQ in Vegas. Literally my first stop every time I visit Las Vegas. 

The portion size is quite large for kbbq. You really get the most for your money here. The grill isn't sticky like other places I've been and it isn't smokey. 

My favorite dish is the Korean galbi. It's not too salty and has a nice marbling of fat without being fatty. The combination of sweet meats with enoki mushrooms coupled with a sweet onion and perfectly steamed rice keeps me coming back time and time again. 

When you've had enough of the overpriced food from the overhyped restaurants on the strip, hop over to gangnam for a great meal the whole family will enjoy at a price that will keep you at the poker table a little longer.

The reason they got so many reviews is probably because they offer free dessert if customers show them they have submitted reviews after the meal. 
Food-wise i would give them 4 stars especially on BBQ meat but a 3 stars for service. Don't get me wrong the servers have been doing their best to serve / attentive and quick to respond , it is just that the service level has fallen behind a typical Korean BBQ restaurants . For instance, the extractor fan was not on (or was not working) all time it was hot by then and our clothes were left super delicious; they never bothered to change the burnt charred black grill, and  unlike many other Korean BBQ when meats arrived they never cut it into smaller size for you to grill.

Solid food, free dessert. I really like the beef noodles.

They have a great atmosphere and nice food. Service was fast. Great selection of k-pop.

Very good.  Didn't give it 5 stars because the kalbi was fatty and the bulgogi was very very sweet.  That said, this place was better than Hobak.  The kalbi and japchae were flavorful and very good. The side dishes/banchan could use more variety, but service was great. And you save a lot of money during happy hour.

Pro: food is great and price is great
Con: terrible service, took them forever to ask what i wanted to drink and appetizer , then i waited about 20-30mins till they asked if i wanted food. They didnt ask if i want another drink after i finished my first and then i asked for another drink and they also gave me my check andsaid i had to pay cause they were closing or something to get ready for dinner, and i never got my next drink, so i left.  I wouldve gave 2 star if the food hadnt been at least very good
Outstanding service. Great food and atmosphere!  Great value if you try the Gangnam combo, we did it for two people and we had plenty of food.
Tried this place during a working trip to Vegas. I can't disagree wih the other reviewers: The meat is to die for! Great place for lunch and/or dinner.

The best Korean BBQ place in town!!! I will never go to another BBQ place ever. Bulgogi was my favorite dish. I am definitely going to go back and try all of the other food that they offer! Good place to go for dates, or with a group of people. Service is very fast, and the quality of the food is really good! Ask for John, he is very helpful!
I wasn't really expecting anything great but it was so good! And the food there was so much food! But I will definitely come here agai.

Wow! A must in Las Vegas. Best Asian BBQ I have ever eaten! Service is amazing and super friendly as well.
Thank you to our server Back and the host Jin.
I can not give this place enough stars.

Amazing!  Very fresh food and excellent service! 
Very good Miso soup.
Appetizers are great, especially the cream cheese wontons!

It is my first time to Vegas. I really do not like the buffet here because they almost have the same taste. But this new gives me another feeling and the taste here is really great. Strongly recommend.

Excellent food, excellent service. The waiters were handsome to boot  We came during the rush on Thanksgiving and even then the wait was only 15 minutes. I never had to wait for my drink to be refilled and we weren't harassed by the staff at all. My mom is a born and raised Korean and she has nothing but great things to say about the quality of the food. The location is walking distance from UNLV and only a 5 minute drive from the strip, check it out!
