Good food and service indeed. We decided to get the meat lovers for two and it was superb. It came with a lot of sides and it satisfied our meat craving for sure. will definitely coming back to this place. If your in town make sure to stop by!
I've never been to this place before. Amazing service! Food was delicious ! The vibe is super chill!

The food are delicious ! Had a great time here ! Will come back again ! We didn't order the set cause we don't think we will finish it all, so we order individually. The Kalbi and the calamari garlic were my favorite ! The waiters are cute and handsome ! Loved this place !

Wir waren heute auf unserem Tripp nach Las Vegas hier beim Abendessen. Sehr freundliches Personal. Umfangreiches Menü das Geschmacklich sehr umfangreich war. Falls wir mal wieder in der Ecke sind kommen wir gerne wieder. Sehr empfehlenswert.

Great place however I would hav e love for it to be all you can eat being that it's korean bbq spot but none the less it's a great spot all they need a bigger menu to chose from and the service is a little on the slow side but it's a calm atmosphere

2nd time back to this place..  it did not disappoint again!  This time I came back with 5 friends and we had the 2-person portion of the meat lovers and the gang nam and it was perfect portioning for all of us. Highly recommend this place.  Atmosphere and food was great!
Korean Toasted Seaweed the best!!!  Hite beer awesome... Favorite meat: korean prime kalbi.... All around good late nite eatery!!!!

I usually cringe at the cost of a restaurant where you cook your own food but Gangnam is surprisingly affordable, especially if you take my advice and order the combos for your group. The menu says they are for 2 people but we had a group of 4 and the combo filled us all.  You can always add one or two items a la carte if you are still hungry.

The meat is surprisingly well marbled and tender and fresh.  The sauces are perfect compliments to the meet.

I thought the salad was a little bit of an afterthought as it was mostly lettuce but we still ate it.
Our favorite was the bulgogi bibambap.

The service felt a little off as they had a difficult time understanding and we were very conscious that they were watching us the whole time.  I understand it is your job to clear our table as we finish a plate but there are ways to be less intrusive about it. Also, they were fixing a light in the restaurant while we were all there.  Still, this place is very enjoyable and reasonably priced.

We visited Las Vegas and came in for Christmas Eve dinner, and there are packed of people, this is a really popular place, because they have delicious food! We order the #1 seller for the meal/BBQ combination for two, plus tempura udon and spicy soft tofu soup. The combination meal has decent amount and kids enjoying the grill of variety of marinated-well meats. Fried squid sauce is very good too. Our spicy soft tofu soup is very good, and my kid likes her udon tempura. Overall it was a very good dinner pleasant experience for our Christmas Eve food adventure!

And and my friend went here for dinner and were very Impressed. It was delicious and the wait staff is super helpful and answered any questions we had about the menu. All the food is amazing. And the prices are very reasonable. The atmosphere is beautiful. Will be returning soon.

This is the first time I visited it and I like this restaurant as it offers fine quality of meat. I could easily tell the tenderness of its meat. The restaurant is also very clean. The server was also very attentive during entire lunch time. Great service!! The only thing I think could possibly improve more is its side dishes. The selections could be mixed with different type of veggies instead of all looking orange colored.
Love this place! I will come here every time I come out to Vegas even just for their dessert.

I am a big Korean BBQ kind of guy and I have tried pretty much all of the Korean BBQ in Vegas, from all you can eat to pay per dishes and whatnot. And this is hand down the Best Korean BBQ I have been to so far in Vegas. It can be a little pricey but it's totally worth it. You gotta try the Kobe beef and the Kobe carpaccio. It is so flavorful and just melts in your mouth. Services are wonderful. You gotta try this place.
first time here & I like it. Customer service is great. I would come here again. got a free desert for rating them on Yelp
Fantastic food, good service and an amazing ambience! Especially love having music videos to view while dining. Chicken with cheese fondue is a must try!!
This is the best Korean BBQ place in town it's food is amazing and the service is great!!!
I had a great experience here. Everyone was friendly and inviting. There is a wide selection of food on the menu. The ambience is a cozy feel for late night dinning. Would come here again.
Great food and great atmosphere and ambiance. Server Andrew is friendly and on top of things. A must place to try.

It was like eating a very delicious dinner. The service was great and the workers there are very kind. But the meat is the best!! Although some of them might be a little too spicy, it was great. The side dishes were so good!! Especially the kimchi. It is well flavored. Our children enjoyed it and overall, it was a very good and memorable meal.
Came and had meat lover special for lunch. Quality of meat was all so very good!! Will be back when we're back in las vegas!!
Delicious!! Great bilgogi and side dishes. Get a side of lettuce and wrap the meat in the lettuce and dip into the bean sauce. So good!
Good Korean fusion food.  There was a wide variety of dishes offered.  We ordered the premium combination.

One of the best Korean BBQ I've ever had! We came with a party of 7 and got seated immediately. We ordered the meat lovers combo, Korean prime kalbi, original bibimbap, and the spicy soft tofu chigae. Everything tasted really good! My favorite was the bibimbap.

To top it off, Calvin, our waiter was amazing! He was really attentive, efficient, and nice. 

Overall an excellent experience :) can't wait to be back!
It is a good place and it has very delicious food there！Bibimbap tastes really good，what I love most is the Beef and pork BBQ，the waiter and waitress are nice and cute

We live on the other side of town and this is our favorite Korean bbq place to eat at. Our family from California came to town and we decided to take them here to have a good dinner. The servers are always consistent and friendly. We came in with a party of 12 and as soon as we walked in, Jin greeted us and sat us right away. He was very, very nice and kept checking up on us to make sure everything was alright. We love this place and don't mind driving across town to have a good dinner and great service.

Highly recommend - it's a great experience! We chose the "Las Vegas" option - so much variety and so much food!  We might have been better off choosing individual items but we wouldn't have gotten to try everything we did!  The miso soup was one of the best I've had, very flavorful.  The cream cheese wontons and edamame were good, as expected.  The 8 side dishes were a nice touch.  The shrimp were excellent, as was the korean chicken; the spicy chicken was too spicy for me so husband had that to himself.  Alternatively, I had the beef toro to myself; it was very fatty, in fact tasted like the fat on a grilled steak which I love but husband doesn't eat fat on purpose...(!) Get the bulgogi bibimbap instead of white rice; it's a more interesting rice dish with beef in it. Only had 1 piece of the broccoli cheese fondue, was just so much food something had to give!  The salad we didn't even touch until the end of the meal; we were pretty full but it had a nice light dressing that was a good ending.

So one might say Korean BBQ isn't the best EDC-recovery food but we were around the area and decided to check this place out due to the raving reviews (and also because we were tired of paying $$$ for mediocre Asian food on the strip).

The wait was around 15 minutes at 1:30pm on a Monday (although the lady on the phone gave us an hour wait on the phone just 10 minutes before we arrived). We ordered spicy ramen with Japanese sausages, marinated Kalbi, Bulgogi, and thinly sliced toro. All were super delicious!

Overall, very impressed by the quality of this Las Vegas Korean restaurant, I think we'll definitely be back if we're staying on the strip again. My only complaint was that it was 110 degrees outside and either the AC was broken or wasn't on strong enough but we were sweating through the meal ):
Best bbq spot in Vegas, especially the deserts it's a must try if never been here before
So so good. All the meat was tender and delicious!! And if you rate them, they give you a free dessert. Can't wait to try it haha!

Excellent BBQ Korean restaurant.   Must try.

Went with 3 other families,  and everyone enjoyed it.

Best beef, very tender.
Friendly staff, clean and good was pretty amazing.  The price was also pretty cheap in comparison to other Korean bbq

Great selection of meats, veggies, and seafood here! We came here for late night happy hour and service was pretty good. The appetizers we order was the chili dumplings and steamed egg. Both were delicious! As for the grill meats everything was flavorable. My favorite was the pork belly and beef tongue. Would come back again next time!
First time eating here at Gangnam. Really great service and food here is 10/10. Im for sure going to come back here in the future. Really like this place.

Great food... Quality of meat is Top notch. Service is fast and friendly. Great layout for hanging out with friends.  The ventilation is well done here and you won't leave smelling like bbq. 

The steam egg is spot on. And the sides are all good. Perfect way to end a night of drinking. Open late so there isn't an excuse to not come by and try it out. 

Pricing is very reasonable for the quality of food. Try it for yourself!

Server told us to hurry up just as we were finish eating because there was a reservation. That's not our problem. That's very rude whether you are a server or not. Never coming here again and telling everyone about this bad service

I absolutely loved the food here! The food wasn't too expensive and it's great if your on a budget and your not trying to spend to much !! It's a great place to come with your friends , family or even your dates !! I will definitely be coming back!
Tried the gangnam course. Comes with oysters and pretty good variety of meat!!!! Would recommend
Great, quick service. Excellent food. Really good prices. This place definitely does not disappoint!

Got to Vegas late and decided to Uber there based on the high Yelp reviews.  Got there close to 10pm and the place is rather empty.  Overall is a okay meal.  Nothing seems to be memorable.  The kimchi  rice is NOT kimchi fried rice at all.  It tastes more like teriyake fried rice.  My kids love it.  It's nothing compared to K-Town bbq down in LA.  I would think Vegas would have better Korean BBQ than this.  If you are close-by, it's worth for a meal.  But if you need to Uber there, it's not worth the trip.  There are plenty other options on the Strip.
For my first experience I really enjoyed it.. Happy hour pricing is great and if you go with dessert, try the tempura banana.. You will definitely enjoy it..

First time in Las Vegas. Yelp recommended I try this restaurant because of the many reviews and positive feedback. 

The server sat us down and automatically spoke to us in Korean assuming we were Korean. He was very short with his words and seemed very unhappy to be at work.. 

We ordered prime rib Kalbi and another Kalbi and pork belly. Holy crap.... Pork belly isn't worth .70cents a piece. Kalbi was okay. Meat was tough but marinade was good.

I am actually writing this review as we sit at this table and await our server to come by to ask if we need anything for once. Sat here for about 30 min without a single visit..... LOUSY SERVICE. 

I defintely won't be coming back to this place. Total rip off. Every thing you order on the side is extra so be careful!

A Japanese restaurant in Korean BBQ clothing. First off all the 5 star ratings are rigged as they "Bribe" you with free dessert for a review and must see it. I will pay for my own dessert thank you very much(Best thing on the menu btw).

I live in OC and close to Ktown so I guess you can say I'm spoiled but when you ask for Korean radish and they have no idea what you're taking about and everything is in Japanese something is a miss. In looking around it was brilliant as there are many sushi restaurants in LV and 2 in the same shopping center as Gangnam (btw really I should have known better) so the owner thought hey we can serve Korean and then bribe yelpers with free dessert for the 2k worth of reviews. For all you yelpers that sold out for dessert SHAME.....ding ding.......SHAME!!!!!

It's not the worst place if you don't know better and could get 3 stars tops but I feel duped as I fell for the 2 thousand plus reviews. 

Anyway do your homework and look for authentic KBBQ .

I'm from SoCal, so finding good Korean bbq anywhere else is a nightmare. We'd been to one other Korean bbq since moving to Las Vegas and that was disastrous. Anyway, my husband and I went there for our long awaited date night and we were blown away. Our waitress was very helpful with her suggestions (which were delicious, btw) and she was always available to help even before we knew we needed help. The restaurant isn't buffet style like we're used to but their dinner options were so huge that the servers were constantly bringing new dishes before we can so much as say "too bad it's not buffet". Everything was perfect but my official favorite is the bulgogi fried rice. Gangnam, you've found two new fans! We'll be back! And we'll definitely be bringing friends and family next time. :D
Had the Dynamite Shrimp. Amazing food. When I make another trip to Vegas this will 100% be on my stops. Would recommend & return for sure.

This was the best Korean bbq that I've had in a very long time! The prices were very reasonable and the marinated Kalbi was excellent! This will be my regular stop when I'm in Vegas. This is a must try if you're in town. We came at about 4:30pm on a weekday to avoid the crowd. Yelpers were right about this place.
This is the best Korean BBQ place in Vegas.  Quality of meat is superb.  This place utterly represents the best value in town.

Today is the second time I have come to Gangnam Asian BBQ, and I absolutely love this place. Granted, both times have been during a week day and lunchtime, but, the service was prompt and friendly. The food is amazing! The decor is lovely. I like the low key music video playing on the large screen you can choose to ignore or enjoy. 

As for the food, the Tuna Poki was fantastic - not fishy at all and the combo of tuna, seaweed and radish was fab. The spicy edamame - awesome. Lastly, the Fire Cracker Shrimp was no joke. It is not for the faint of heart, but if you love spicy food like I do, you will love the combination of crunch, spice and a bit of sweet. It was really tasty.

Would definitely come back again,
This was a great experience , the food was outstanding and I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking Korean BBQ - 5 stars from me
Reminds me of one restaurant back home in Cupertino. It is similiar and very tasty. I definitely recommend. (-:

This Korean BBQ was delicious and each piece was marinated to perfection! Not only was the bbq meat awesome but also bet on other dishes to be superb! Bibimbap was also better than most that I have ever eaten from other places like in New York! Service was also quick and efficient so no need to wait to be served.
Food was excellent. We got the Gangnam Special $65 for 2 people.   There was a 45 minutes wait on a Tuesday night.  So make sure you call ahead.

My family and I had a wonderful experience at this delicious Korean bbq. Fun music videos playing on the side, very kind & respectful staff, & every choice on the menu was oh, so tasty! Would definitely come back again next time we visit LV. Skip the buffet and all the extra calories. This place is fantastic.
The rice and noodles are delicious.Service is great,too.The pickled vegetables are really good.
This place is a great spot for meat lovers and we happened to order meat lovers for two, but shared it amongst three people.  The portions were just the right amount and servers were frieny.

First time visit after viewing high reviews.
Clean and good menu for lunch before leaving Vegas.
Less than 10 min from the strip.

Appetizer, ddukboki, was very delicious. 
Other food we ordered were pretty good, too. 
Portions are smaller than other restaurants though. 

We will definitely come back!
I really enjoyed my time at gangnam bbq,they have a great happy hour special that I recommend to my friends.
We loved the beef toro and the chicken karaage. Come during their happy hour drinks are 50% off!
Simply impressive!  Korean tapas. Our family really enjoyed the food. Good Korean food away from CA. I strongly recommend my friends to try this place when you're in LV. :-)
Kobe Beef a must and very tender. #2 Marinated short ribs Kalbi nice and sweet. Calimari good.  Bacon rapped Scallops!!!
This place is awesome .. great costumer service great family envirment. It was our first time here but definitely not our last!

Today was my first time coming to Gangnam and trust me, it won't be my last. I've been trying to find a good asian BBQ place since I've gotten out to Vegas and I think I found my go-to. The place has a great, welcoming vibe and ambience. Really friendly and efficient service also! My two friends and I got the meat lovers combo for two and added some items off a la carte and we left so satisfied. Definitely recommend to all!

Amazing! That's all I can say. If you're in Vegas looking for some great Japanese BBQ, then look no further! It's a lot of food and the combos are a great deal. Definitely come hungry if you're getting any of the combo deals!

I can see why he this place has hundreds of positive reviews!  I'm a Bay Area Asian who has grown up eating in the Bay Area and SoCal Cali. Food is on par, but it's the Service that I feel that sets them apart.

John and Ashley's service are impeccable, and should be emulated by all.  I'm big on customer service, but Its John's service and mannerism that made me write this review. His professionalism and hand gestures are old school classics, and is a dying trait.   If I ever had a business John would be my GM, and Ashley would be running the floor. 

I don't write 5stars much, but place deserves it!

My bestfriend and I came to this BBQ place after we've gone to a Korean Spa. We thought it would be good bec. of how good the reviews seem to be... however, just like most Yelp Reviews... it was all hype. (I'm starting to think that the reviews are mostly fake). 

First off, the host told us that we had about 35-45 min. of wait. So, my bestfriend and I decided we could wait for it. An hour passed, after checking in with the host, he now tells us that reservations come in first, before we get to sit. Since we've already waited for so long... my bestfriend didn't want to leave. So we waited another hour, for a total of TWO HOURS! 

When we were finally sat on our table, we thought, Finally!!! Guess what? We had to wait an extra 30 min for a waiter/waitress to take our order and we weren't even in a hidden area!!! The person who were in line  five people after us even got their food first!!! 

So I finally asked the host for help and he took our order and checked up on us. I don't know who our designated waiter/waitress was but there was this girl waitress who was giving us an attitude, slamming the lettuce order we've ordered on the table. We were just too hungry and to even bother paying attention to her. 

The food was just like any other BBQ place. You cook your own food. As usual, they didn't marinate the shrimp and squid long enough for the flavor to cling when barbequed. The food wasn't worth the inconveniece. 

I understand the long wait in line to be seated. I also would have understood if it would take a few minutes for food to get ready. However, it is absolutely not understandable when the waiter/waitress would ignore you completely; taking 30 minutes to take your order... when you were sat first. Then, needing to flag someone to take your order.

I actually felt bad for the host because he took our orders and was acting like our waiter... when that's really not his job to do. So we decided to give him the tip. (HOWEVER, upon giving him the tip he said he was actually the manager). Thus, I felt irritated all the way home.

As the manager it was his responsibility to ensure that guests are all attended to. I will never go back to this place again and I will advise other family members, group of friends, other government co-workers to completely skip this one. It's not worth the wait. Not worth the trouble. Food places are meant to be fun, relaxing, not troublesome.
Great service, amazing stuff and the most important thing: fabulous food! They tought us how to cook lol

Drinks are definitely worth the trip off the strip...cool vibe nice and attentive staff.  Jay was awesome best Service we had our whole trip. Food is delicious and man do you get a lot of good stuff to go along with it. Very fun and recommend it very highly
This is the best Korean BBQ restaurant I have ever tried in Las Vegas. Staffs are nice and the food is very delicious! Love it^^
Great food and great service. Strongly recommend! They have happy hour in the late night. Cheap and delicious!

Just got into Vegas for business and we were in need of some good ethnic food. All of my co-workers are Korean (I am the honorary Korean) and they decided on KBBQ. I love KBBQ so the search was on. We landed on this place and decided to give it a shot.

Luckily we stopped in right about 10:00pm on a Tuesday night which meant we were able to take advantage of happy hour. Beef toro was $4 and I think we got 4 orders of this. Honestly, everything was great. The spicy chicken, the creamed corn, the jalapeño poppers, you name it. But that beef toro? Fantastic. Highly recommend it. Make sure to eat it with some lightly grilled kimchi and sesame oil and you'll be in heaven.

Lastly, service staff was great. Friendly, attentive, and informative.

I definitely recommend this spot.

Clean and modern. Not very busy late nite off the strip easy parking in strip mall toward back. Good smells. Half price menu after 10pm. No Korean barley tea. Pork overdone in kitchen tried to spare the servers of cleanup for one person. Beef also cool ok marinade. Kimchi excellent as were the other Namul. Cukes, chili and radish,shredded dried fish, bean sprout, fish cake. Chap chae was quite good. Paid bill. Came back in one hour because my cousin was hungry so I brought him here. Happy hour continues. Noticed a note the new table offering dessert for a Yelp review. I had already done one. Waiter kindly offered dessert of fried banana and ice cream. Cousin enjoyed sukiyaki. It smelled good. He also ordered chicken salad. He was too full to try it. Overall good experience but just not the "best" in the Korean experience. I would still recommend for price point, happy hour, and location and parking. Not a bad thing.
Food was amazing, love the filet mignon and the spicy pork, overall good quality of meats, and staff was friendly, will definitely be returning!!

So delicious! The food here phenomenal. The best kbbq I've had. Had the premium dinner package, best cut of meat ever! So many see dishes with unlimited refill. Will definitely be back and I'm from San Diego.

fantastic !!!
i ate spicy tofu soup.
My GF ate spicy chicken with lemon sauce
Both taste very good.

I will definitely  come back this place again!!

I saw a bad review but my experiece was totally different. My visit day is just weekday night but many people were waiting and so did I.
However waitresses were very kind and nice and we didn't wait for food so long. The interior was so clean and food quality was great.
I ordered Gang nam grill, I could taste the variety of beef. I love Korean bbq sauce!

I am so happy this gem is not on the strip, could you imagine how over priced it would be? Came here on a Saturday night for a 7PM dinner, and the place was dead. But that was okay because my party had an entire back room to ourselves.

The service was stellar, and i'm sure most readers understand the premise of the place. You get a lot of pre-marinated meats/veggies/etc brought out to you and you cook it yourself on the mini-grill. It's so easy a 7 year old could do it (or my older brother who hardly gets credit for cracking an egg).

I recommend you get one of the pre-designed samplers. We opted for The paradise A  and we got more than enough food for two.  The Harami Miso, prime kalbi, and calimari were all yummy.

I would recommend this to anyone who is staying in Las Vegas. It is located right across the street from the Hard Rock Casino, but worth the cab ride if you are staying on the strip and to lazy to walk.
Amazing!!!!! My best friend and I are here from Miami and we need this place to come to Miami asap it's good quality food at an amazing price!!!!
Great place to go to when in Vegas! Inexpensive and food is great!!! Must try!!! Awesome experience! Fast service and nice servers!

We had a pretty good dining experience here. Dining atmosphere is great and food looks good too. We ordered Gangnam for two ppl. Everything is perfect except ... almost everything is too sweet for me. Meat is sweet and complementary appetizers are sweet too. I expect to get various flavors. Anyway, great experience.
tried meat lover combo, really filled me up. First meal this trip in Vegas, not a bad start

really good to eat
very enjoyable 
希望下次有機會一定要再來一次
實在好吃啊
尤其是金針菇

Wonderful environment, tasty food and good services. This is the best Korean BBQ I have been in US. The kalbi bibibam is strongly recommended. I tried the original bibibam and meat lover, they are good.
Best Korean bbq in Vegas :) went there with my friend. It was his first time having Korean food. He was amazed
First time here and loved it! Good amount of food and the quality was superb. Definitely recommend this place!!

Hit and miss.   :( We were really in the mood for Korean and had high hopes for this place. 

The good: The seafood tofu soup had great flavor but it was seriously the smallest portion I've ever seen in any Korean restaurant.  The original bibimbap was yummy (nothing extraordinary but solid and at least normal portion size).  The chocolate lava cake was delicious.  Warm and gooey. 

The not so good: side dishes were icky.  So sad because half the fun of Korean food are the yummy side dishes.  The seafood pancake was tiny and for $9.50, so not worth it.   We are normally huge fans of seafood pancake but just so tiny here (two small silver dollar pancake size ones and at most places you get one the size of a dinner plate).   The pork belly app was so so.  

Our waitress was really nice though it took a while to get seated and for someone to come and take our order.  

Overall: small portions, pretty good service... But there's gotta be better Korean places in Vegas!
Was here a couple days ago. Their BBQ was good, their oysters were not. Got bad food poisoning.
Great food. Great staff. Reasonable price. Would definitely come here again. Came here from LA and its probably one of the best barbecue places.

Im in love. The food here was so delicious. So many things to try. I recomend the sukiyaki noodles and the spicy chicken with lemon sauce. For dessert tey the honey bread. Its so f···en good. A bit pricey but its worth it. The staff is so friendly, so nice. A must try if your craving korean bbq.

My first review ever on Yelp is dedicated to Gangnam Asian BBQ. We ordered the Gangnam Grill for 2 people and had more than enough for my parents and myself. Fair price and great service! Our waiter checked in with us often and made sure everything was going well. For next time, I will be ordering what I like individually. I only really cared for the bulgogi within the entire order. Leaving the restaurant with a full happy tummy!
So much meat. So much deliciousness. Wear loose fitting clothes. Banchan is on point. Attentive service too!

Picked the perfect time to visit before the dinner rush...no line on a Saturday night. Panchan was more than enough to keep us fed before the food came out. Food was delicious! Can't wait to eat their macaron ice cream and honey bread!
This place is delicious and affordable. Loved how unique it was for us to cook our own food at the table. Must try!

Came here for an early dinner and was also able to catch HH! Tried their spicy garlic edamame, which had a great kick to it - good appetizer. Also got spicy pork, beef toro, and bulgogi from their HH menu. Great deals $3/$4 tapa plates, so you get to try a lot of different dishes. Definitely recommend getting the Korean prime Kalbi!! Would definitely come back again!!

Baek, our server was friendly and incredibly attentive. He was always making sure we were doing ok and that we had everything we needed. Then he made good recommendation on the food and the portion. For a party of three we ordered the Meat Lover for two people but added Korean Prime Kalbi which is my favorite of all the meats. The other meats were great as well but the filet mignon was another great choice. All the side dishes were yummy as well. As far as the place is concern it is clean and beautiful. This is definitely a place that I would come back over and over again and highly recommend it to anyone.

Love love love! I had a really hard day, and this was exactly the dining experience I needed to make the day right again. Food was delicious, everything from the appetizers, soup, to the meat bbq; furthermore the atmosphere was relaxed and fun. My new favorite place in Vegas!
The servers were vey helpful and I'm leaving with a happy tummy!
Gangnam Asian bbq is the best Korean bqq I have ever had! The service was so great and the food was absolutely flawless. I will most definitely be coming back here in the near future!
Great Korean BBQ dinner. Great service. Really liked the bulgogi. Food served quickly.
Great customer service awesome meat ! Went here with a friend and we had a blast (: can't wait to come back with more people the server was super nice
"A must try" when you come to Vegas. Recommend Korean prime kalbi, beef toro, spicy tuna kimbap, and kimchi bibimbap. All great choices!

This place is amazing  ! We had to wait about 45 min (weekend) but it was definitely worth it , wife and I had the marinated kalbi and prime kalbi definitely get the marinated version . We also had bacon asparagus and fondue cheese broccoli as well as 2 other meats we forgot the name of but it was thin sliced ... Amazing. Our food took awhile but they served us extra side dishes !!! Amazing !!!!
The food was great. The serving of the food was a lot. I went here together with my family. We ordered the Meat lovers and it was so delicious. I recommend this place.
Came during happy hour for the food. The portions were good and the food came out very quickly. Love Bulgogi and the seaweed salad. The mushroom medley was awesome too. Will definitely return!

This was an excellent place - really delicious food and great service. It's family style which is pretty nice and you get to grill your own food. Definitely a great spot to go to if you're around Vegas - would highly recommend

Great experience and super friendly service. Came in about an hour before close and got some of the HH specials. Tried the Bibimbap, Poki and fried calamari. Highly recommended a fix of normal Korean cuisine.

It's hard being from LA and trying a Korean bbq outside of Korea town so Gangnam starts at a disadvantage.  First the good:   Fantastic seaweed salad and a very presentable mixed greens salad.  The spicy chicken wings are fantastic.  The sauces are a nice touch. Also the make waiter is great (female not too friendly).  The place seems clean and inviting.  I like the squid banchan but not as good as my daughter's  We got the 4 person meat lover.  It was the size we are used to for two people.  The brisket was tough and the shoulder was good.  The filet was flavorful but a little tough.  The banchan was generous. The pork belly is the thin type which is fine with me because I like it crispy. Asahi dark is a good compliment.  Dweji bul gogi is nice and tender and just the right spice.  Overall a very nice experience
Very disappointing! I think this restaurant is both over-rated and over-priced. Soup they serve is full of msg, not taste from natural ingredients. Not worth to visit again.

Pretty nice place. The happy hour prices are great. Standard Korean BBQ experience - grill in the middle of the table. You have to grill the meats yourself here. Side dishes are complimentary - who does not like kimchi! Good selection of beers for only $2.50 during happy hour.

Pretty impressed with the food here! In Vegas on vacation and craving some Asian food. Definitely satisfied my craving :) it was on par with some bomb Japanese bbq places I go to in SoCal. The service was great too even though I came really late! Plus free dessert with a Yelp review :D
This place seems nice, very dimly lit but flattering light, You get to choose ur own meats to cook at the table, and servers are friendly. Kind of expensive for lunch.
Saw the reviews and had to try it for myself. Yes, this place is great!  Good service, friendly staff, and delicious food. Will definitely come back again.

Visiting from Chicago. Boyfriend wanted some Korean BBQ, this place was amazing. I liked the music they played in the background. The seating was roomy. Service was fast and food was delicious! Meat was high quality. We split the meat lovers meal for 2 people and it was more than enough food for a reasonable price. Go go go!

Great korean bbq, quality, taste, price are just great. We but together our own order which was great as my wife does not eat meat so she chose veggies and seafood which were both great. 
I ordered pork belly, short rib and bugogi which was the best of the 3. highly recommend this place for a great dining experience.

This spot is so good! Everything I've tried was so delicious!  I definitely recommend their salmon jalapeño poppers and their bacon wrapped asparagus! They have a wide variety of  delicious meats and their happy hour menu is def worth checking out! The servers are friendly and the the vibe is real laid back and my overall experience was such a delight! I'm coming back for sure! :)

We went here for happy hour before our flight back home. The food came out quickly and service was great!! The food is very reasonably priced (most items between $2-4, alcohol half price) and everything tasted delicious. I would definitely recommend this place!
2nd time here! This place is by far becoming one of our favorites! Good food and Kristen and get crew are very attentive. Love it here. Our faves are the pork belly,kalbi and calamari. Happy tummy
Very good. Service was great, food was cooked to perfection, obviously cause I cooked it myself. Great little place to swing by for lunch.

This is my favorite place in Las Vegas. 
Filet mignon here is only 8.95 and very delicious. You must try it.
If you like asian food, then try kimchi fried rice here.

i love this place. yummy!!
Great place for lunch or dinner. BBQ dishes are perfectly marinated and  seasoned, great variety of starters. Good service.
Second time in a week at this place and everything was excellent all the food was delicious can't wait to come back here again!

Wow. 
Wow.
Wow.
Gangham is a culinary delight not to be missed. To come to Vegas and not experience a meal here is to miss a true jewel. Words cannot do it justice; you must come and experience it for yourself!

Great food, great prices. Portions are good. Staff are friendly and attentive!

Meats are tender, never chewy. Their happy hour is great, there's an earlier happy hour or a late night one. Half off some alcoholic drinks too, along with half off food items

Great food, good portions, attentive service and very reasonable prices. I recommend ordering the sesame oil & sea salt for added flavor, regardless the BBQ you order. From the Bulgogi to the Bibimbap, it's one of the best meals I've had in Las Vegas.
Well giving the review for free desert. With that being said food is decent. Side dishes are just ok but the meat is the highlight. We ordered the meat lover combo and there is no disappointment
Great food! Music is bomb! Fast service. Must have spicy pork during happy hour. Freakin' dericious

Was a long wait on a Monday night. Was our first time and told the waiter but we got no instructions. I asked for an explanation of the combination meals and all he said was "the meat lovers is our most popular" even though the menu says the Gangnam is the most popular. I inquired about the Gangnam meal and again he said the meat lovers is what we should get. So we ordered the meat lovers for four.

When the food arrived he put it on the table and started to walk away. I asked him what we do with the food and he pointed out the beef and pork dishes and the only instruction was "cook the pork well done" and he walked away.

We each started taking a piece of meat and cooking it and eating it which took a long time. After watching some other tables it was clear we should have cooked lots of food at one time.

While they do have vents, we left not really satisfied and smelling like grilled meat.

Was not bad but definitely not something we'll do again in Vegas.
We just got here from new york. The food tasted amazing and the service was great!! The waiter was really cool. Would love to come back here
This place has a great atmosphere.  Our server is very nice. We ordered the vegas combo.  The food is great!
Fantastic food!! Everything was great,,recommend the Spicy Tuna Kimbap but loved everything we had.

I recommend this place good food and service
Very clean restaurant. Kid friendly my kids enjoyed the place I will be coming back again

We got the 2 person bbq meat lover portion for three ppl. We are all girls and it fed us well. But we had to order one more bowl of rice.

This place is not like other Korean places in the US or maybe just anywhere I've been. They serve chicken to bbq... I thought it was weird and didn't taste so great. Their slices of meat is not......... great quality. 

They don't serve side dishes. Everything else you have to pay for like lettuce and other stuff. Usually are Korean places side dishes are a must and have. But this place charges you for everything. the only side dish that came with it was kinchi and spicy pickled radish. Both was nasty, salty and weird.

I've had amazing kimchi before and this on was not worth touching.

Price st 59.90 ... waste of my money... I could of gotten BOMB Korean bbq with awesome service in chicago for way less.

Quality of the food: 5 stars; service: 5 stars; 
Really enjoyed everything here. Will be back again when we visit vegas!!
Excellent meat marination and portions. We had 2 meat BBQ's between two of us. Recommend the Korean prime kalbi and spicy lemon chicken

The food and service was great! You have to get there early because it is busy and fills up quickly. There were people waiting outside before they opened. :) Despite the amount of people the waiters were very attentive and were always checking to see how we were. Not only that but ALL the waiters came and checked on us! All the food that we had was great (original Bibimbap, fried dumplings, Chicken Karaage, Tteokbokki, Bulgogi, and Korean Prime Kolbi)and easy to enjoy. They had good music playing in the back ground that was not too loud and had a good mix of both Korean pop music and American pop music. An amazing find, thanks fellow Yelpers! :)

Wait one hour to get seated on Christmas Eve. Food tastes really good, probably one of the best taste Korean BBQ I ever had. The only problem is that it seems to be short in hand given the popularity, and it is easy to get lost in dealing with the food even for a Chinese. Anyway definitely worth the money and highly recommended.
Great food. Awesome service! Heard about this place from a few friends and glad I got to try it before leaving Vegas.

I live in LA, so I'm been to my fair share of Korean BBQ restaurants and tasted some great Asian food. This place went beyond my expectations, for flavor, quality, value, and service. Came here for the late night happy hour and I had the most delicious feast, with many BBQ dishes for only 3-4 dollars! Highly recommend.

I really wish it wasn't the holiday season so we could have tried out the lunch specials. Oh well, our loss. On that note: Lunch specials aren't available during the holidays!

Our last meal in Las Vegas was supposed to be Korean bbq. Instead, since we don't eat beef and the bbq options fed 4-6 people, we ordered a-la-cart. No regrets, the food was still delicious! We got an order of the spicy seafood ramen and kimchee bibimbap. I can handle spicy foods really well and enjoy my mouth on fire, but the *spicy* in spicy seafood ramen was no joke! However, the spiciness did not overpower the flavor of the broth. The kimchee bibimbap was amazing! I was happy to see it served in a stone pot to keep the temperatures piping hot. Servings were huge for such a reasonable price. Shout out to the sweetest hostess around too! She gave my mom suggestions on Korean beauty products and tended to us when the waiter was busy with other customers.

I discovered this place recently after walking the areas near unlv for good places to eat and I have to say I'm very satisfied with the food and the customer service and quality of this place. The food doesn't take long to be served once ordered, it tastes good and there are plenty of complementary side dishes served with any order. The quality and quantity of the food are good and reasonable and definitely a place I will be visiting for lunch and dinner. Also my first time trying Korean food was this restaurant and my first impression is definitely good . I'd like to try more different Korean food and possibly from here. Bonus: I got a macaron ice cream after doing a yelp check in and it was delicious!

If you're from the Dallas/Fort Worth area, you already know about the all you-can-eat Korean BBQ: Omi and Jins. But let me just tell you... Although this place isn't like the ones we have back home, this place is a MUST go-to-place if you're in Vegas! They have a wide selection of meats and side dishes that I would've never imagined back home.
Amazing meal. Food is phenomenal. Clean fun atmosphere and friendly wait staff. Authentic. Best Korean BBQ I've ever had.
Fresh meat, nicely cut, good marination, and very reasonable price. I recommend ordering meats separately instead of opting for combos. Service was on point and the environment is cool.

Super busy today and has been every time I've been! Always love the Bulgogi! This is my 3rd time coming here and really enjoy it! 

Great experience for the family to dine.
Great value on their bbq sets! For the price you get an abundant amount of food and side dishes! So full!
First time eating here.. It was a very nice, clean, and pleasant atmosphere.. Food was well prepared and tasted delicious.. The prime kalbi was mouth-watering good!

The food here is great quality and you get a ton of food for your money.  I recommend the set meals with a group of four or more since it comes with appetizers and entrees.  We shared a meal for two and it fed four people!  Great place for group dining and happy hour!  Staples include the pork belly, brisket and kalbi to name a few must haves.  I like mixing it up when I go to gangnam especially during their happy hour after 10 pm.  Make sure to try the broccoli fondue, sweet corn and mushroom medley.  Only issue is the ventilation as I always leave gangnam with a smokey odor on my clothes.  Desserts are quite delicious so make sure to save some room for the decent variety.  Easy location to reach if you're near the strip as it's located across from the hard rock hotel.  Plenty of parking in the shopping center which has many places to check out.
One of the best kbbq around the Las Vegas area. Little bit pricey but definitely delicious

This place was way more than I expected.  We had just arrived in Las Vegas (we drove), and our rooms weren't ready yet at our hotel, so we decided to have a late lunch.  This happened to be the closest to where we were staying at.  We had the Gangnam option for bbq, and man did we have a lot!  We had so many meat options, and all I can say is that the meats were so tender, and even without any dipping sauces, it had so much flavor.  The sides that came with were also super amazing.  The service was excellent.  Our waiter was amazing - he walked us through all the meats, which ones to eat first and last, and really went above and beyond in making sure we were satisfied with our meals.  Will definitely come back here!

We were holed up for too long at the Hard Rock. This place was the perfect place to come.  Great. Great. Great food. Space on the small side, but we only waited 10 minutes. 

Highly recommend. .

Food is great and service is awesome
We will. Come back again for sure
Love the Korean prime kalbi

This place really awesome. Variety and reasonable price. Love it. 5 stars..!!!!
I would be comeback again.
The atmosphere is nice. The meat is a little salty. The pork belly is probably the best

We made a reservation for tonight as we had family in town. They accommodated us and the food was great. We liked beef toro (brisket), flat iron garlic and bacon wrapped scallops. Kimchi was average but overall great experience. Highly recommend!!!

For our kids, this was their first time eating Korean BBQ, and I don't think we could have picked a better place for it. It's well off the strip, and consequently lacks the pretension of many of the more central eateries, which was very welcome.

We picked from then menu rather than going for one of their set menus, but everything was delicious. The meats were all tasty, well-seasoned and mouthwatering. The cheese fondue was surprisingly good for its simplicity and worked better than we expected. The Bibimbap was also tasty, although the presence of my children meant I had to choose a less spicy option than I would normally.

The Korean side dishes were great, although the refills of Kimchi we asked for never materialised. In fact, the slightly chaotic and inattentive service was the only thing that prevents me giving the place the full five.
Excellent Korean and Japanese menu! Really enjoyed my dinner here! I had the spicy tofu soup in a hot pot and it was delicious! Love the side dishes that came with it! Yummy! Will come here again!

One word. Uggghhhhh . . . Spotted this joint after leaving Revolt. Wait wasn't too bad, and other Yelpers had rated it 4.5 stars. Yelpers, you've never lead me astray! My husband and I ordered the Gangnam. How this generally ONLY feeds 2 people blew our minds, and we can put away food! It came with: fresh oyster, fried calamari, shishito pepper yuzu, green salad, bulgogi bibimbap, miso soup, harami miso beef, Korean prime kalbi beef, flat iron garlic beef, filet mignon, bulgogi, and mushroom medley. Needless to say, we went home with 2 meals worth of leftovers. There was not a single dish we didn't like. Favors were all perfect. Staff was super nice and had just the right amount of attentiveness. Once our food triplets digest, we will be back.
The staffs are very friendly. Good food served at a timely manner! Enjoyed my time here very much!
Really good food, best BBQ forever,  really like the beef its so good , hope can come this place again.
Wear your stretchy pants guys ;) you're gunna need em. Too much good stuff to try! Definitely go for the marinated kalbi, and you can't go wrong with a macaroon ice cream sandwich!
All I can say is WOW what great food and great service. If you come away hungry you are a beast!!! Excellent !!!!
Great dinner and service. The pork belly was awesome. Fun place to bring a group. If you like meat this is the place for you.
Bomb.com.  BBQ place that doesn't make you smell like BBQ.  Servers are all awesome.   Toto beef is sooo good.  Nice clean atmosphere.
yummy！bbq warmed me up！the best korean food i have ever tasted in us！very handsome waiters and friendly servise

Absolutely fantastic! If you are in Vegas, this is a must stop for awesome Korean BBQ. All fresh ingredients, friendly service, and a good value despite what seems like expensive initially. 

There are 4 main options ranging from about $45 to $90 for two people. May seem a bit steep, but when you consider that you get appetizers, soup, salad, three to six meats/fish/seafood, and a slew of condiments, it is actually a very good deal. Service was very good, the staff we had was very friendly. Don't let the fact that it is in a strip mall that features several restaurants fool you!
Service was great! We ordered course for two and there were lots of food enough for two ppl. Meat quality was alright but bulgogi? And one of the steak was tender and delicious! Overall loved it! :)
Great kabli, amazing steak. Fresh cold beer and free dessert with a  yelp review! Definitely recommend this spot to anyone visiting or to locals as well
Really good food :-).  The food is authentic and very good. I ordered the spicy yuke jang and it really is spicy! I want to come back and try the soon doo boo chigae.
This is my favorite BBQ restaurant. The beef is fresh with a good price. Definitely a good place to go again.
Ive been coming here 4 times a week. I cant get enough of this korean bbq. Definetely my favorite restraunt right now.

This korean restaurant has the best bulgogi ever! It literally melts in your mouth. The overall price of the menu is so cheap compared to my home town, Houston tx. Very satisfied and will be back if given the chance.

I love a good Korean BBQ, you really never know when you will find good quality food, This wasn't bad but it wasn't great, it was average. The prices were not ridiculous like many other all you can eat Korean BBQ are. The sides were good, the meats were tender but a little in the flavorless side. Clean establishment and good enough  service! We order the meat lover special! It had 5 kind of meats, salad, miso soup, rice and the spicy steam dumpling. In the other side we did enjoy dessert, good ice cream macaroon.
This place is awesome. Great food. Super attentive staff. Macaroon ice cream sandwiches!

Went with the family. This place served a Happy Hour which saved us a fair amount. We spent about $50-60 for four people and left feeling very satisfied.  Meat quality is decent, definitely not the best or worst I've had. Atmosphere and service were great though.

First a disclosure: they have a sign on the table to rate them here on Yelp to get a free dessert.  

We actually waited to finish our food before I wrote this review and we were not disappointed.  It's not AYCE but the items that you get are more than enough to fill you up.  We got the Gangnam combo and everything was delicious. This place is definitely better than the Korean BBQ joint in the Galleria mall. Each item we had was full of flavor and enjoyed each and everyone of them.

Service is excellent and they are there when you need them. Didn't have to flag them down for more water or something

If you've ever been to Gen-Wa in Los Angeles, this place definitely is up to par with them.

After reading all the reviews on here we decided to gave it a try and it was awesome!!! The food was very yummy and the services was super great (shes was a cute little korean girl).  We did the happy hr  menu so for less then $35 for total 3 ppl and we all walked out very happy. I'd definitely coming back as matter of fact we all ready planning on coming back tmo night.

Omg soo amazing!!! All the meats and marinades  are amazing! My fave was the kalbi!! Don't forget to finish your experience with some honey toast and macaroon ice cream! The complimentary small dishes are tasty themselves!!
Great food and variety, along with good service!!   Lot of delicious side dishes too.  The dumpling soup was tasty.
Went aka carte this time, the specials were just too large. All the food was SPECTACULAR.  Miso soup, Karage, all the bubblers, Bugogi Bibambap and traditional Bibambap as well and TREMENDOUS service
When you eat here you must try their cheese sweet corn loved it!! Food was great, clean & friendly staff.
Great delicious food with so many items to choose from.  Reasonable prices and the best happy hour from 3-5pm.
Best BBQ ever, must try their pork belly and beef tongue!  They have a variety selection for dessert! And happy hours! Great deal!

Came around 10 on a Sunday. Had a wait for the booths on the side but nothing too serious. Had a good assortment: kalbi, bulgogi and pork belly. Also got the bibimbop. The bulgogi was some of the best I have ever had anywhere. The kalbi was actually disappointing, it wasn't bad it just wasn't great. Also the kimchi was too sweet for my taste. I assume that number of reviews comes from the fact they give you a free dessert for  a yelp review.
Very good restaurant! Orderrd the meat combo for 4 people. Small dishesb are good. Yelp打分可以换免费甜点哦

First time here and was very impressed with the food, ambience and service. The interior is nicely designed to allow for a very pleasant dining experience. And the servers are very attentive and friendly. 

The food here is delicious. This is what we ordered: 
-spicy tuna kimbap
-spicy soft tofu
-Harami miso
-Korean prime kalbi
-Beef toro 
-Salmon 
-Korean chicken with cheese fondue 
-bibimbap

The beef is very tender and soft. It just melts in your mouth! The beef toro wasn't as tender as if anticipated. The   Korean prime kalbi was delicious but I would have to say that the Harami Miso was my favorite. The spicy tuna kimbap is good but it's very heavy. It'd be wise to take it slow with that!
The chicken was very soft and tender surprisingly, but the cheese part really wasn't for me. The spicy tofu soup was very flavorful and delicious. It definitely helps settle all the bbq that you just ate. 

Overall, quality and and atmosphere are on point here. I would definitely come back here in the future. 

***the amount of food was for a party of 3 and it was more than enough.

We ordered the gangnam style for 2. The meat choices were perfect we also added on a few more meats to our order. The portions for 3 are more than enough,  very filling . Great ambiance,  good quality meats! my husband and I enjoyed our visit . We came for our anniversary.
Experience with this BBQ place is excellent! The beef are very tender. The appetizers are very good.
Amazing and delicious, loved everything, we got the meat lovers. Great experience and would try again
Got the Gangnam combo for two and it filled up the whole family! Food was delicious and service was fast.
We came in and were seated right away. Everyone was nice and very helpful. It was my first time eating here and I enjoyed it. Very great food!! Great service! Fun environment!
The food is amazing,and service is awesome! We ordered the best seller combo and the food are very enough for two person.

Oh my G!  One of the best so far!  Travelled all the way from SoCal to have fun here in Vegas and found this great restaurant!  Meat is tender and flavorful!  Definitely going to come back and recommend to family and friends!  Music is not bad at all!

Wonderful food! I really like the kalbi! It is so delicious. You should try the spicy tuna it is so good! The food is just great. Great service! They play music while eating and I love it they even have a music video monitor on the wall! How cool is that? It stays open until 1am. Great for late dinner. Wait isn't long! 10-15 min and we were in.

I'm a big fan of happy hour so I decided to check it out here. Excellent choice! The food is fantastic and we received superb service the entire time. I will be back! My favorites are the bulgogi, spicy chicken, and ginger cocktail. Wonderful!

This is my first time here with my family and it has been nothing but an amazing experience! The servers here are so sweet and courteous! They have such great deals here, we ate the MEAT LOVERS meal which was around $99 for four people and it was a great deal! There were four of us and we couldn't even finish the plates of meat that were provided! We also ordered the Bulgogi Bibimbap and it was delicious! I can't wait to visit again when I'm back in Vegas! ^_____^

Really great food and friendly service, best KBBQ in Vegas! We ordered the Gangnam set, which was a ton of food and very high quality. We will definitely be eating here again on our next trip to the strip.

What a treat. A fine Korean restaurant that I can walk to from home. Heaven. It has a terrific ambience without being overly expensive. I've met clients here twice and both were very appreciative. (I was glad for the access to WiFi as well as the great food, service and atmosphere)

I did miss getting the free banchan, but the Kimchee is free upon request. Don't forget to ask. And the price is less than I expected so you can still order little side dishes individually. 

Get the Bul-Go-Gi and grill it yourself. 

Oh and they'll play the Gangnam music video for you on the big screen if you ask. :)
Excellent service and great food. The marinated meats were very tasty.The Harami Miso is a must try!

Hands down one of the best KBBQ I've been to.

Service is great. The waitresses are around but not hovering. 

Food.. MMMM! We liked everything we ordered. Spicy Tuna, Kimchi Pancake, Kalbi, Bulgogi, Spicy Chicken with Lemon Sauce, & Pork Belly... Super filling between 3 people! 

And their rice is HUGE! Well worth ~$2! 

Super delish...
Meat quality is great, but be prepared to spend some $$, the individual meats add up. Good place to go with the boys.
Good restaurant！All the foods we ordered are tasty！ Nice survice here and we had a really exciting time！

One of the best korean joint here in the strip. The atmosphere was nice and the service was really good! The servings were ideal; not skimpy. We loved it here! The free dessert when checking-in was worth it!
Really had a good lunch. They offer a lot meat and other dishes. We drove just from Zion and really need a good lunch.
The Bi Bim Bop here is the best I've had--the meat is tender and flavorful. My husband had the lunch special; at $12.95 it's a great deal. We will definitely be coming back here.
Love the food!!! Big portion tender steaks and all the sides dishes were tasty and delicious.  Definitely come back again

I wished this place existed when I attended UNLV. This place carries a lot of value with the amount of different (yet satisfying) portions/packages that even a poor college student can afford.

My friend and I got the most basic Las Vegas package since we're hungry but obviously not capable of eating a feast by ourselves. It was $45/person and the amount of food cannot be more fulfilling. You get the tradition side dishes + a house salad, along with rice, sauces and miso soup to go along with your proteins that includes beef, spicy chicken, garlic shrimp and pork.

You are however required to cook things yourself comparing to places like Honey Pig when a server would occasionally stop by and manage your food. The place wasn't busy at the time we were dining so the servers volunteered to rotate our proteins for us as we were engaged in a deep conversation catching up on life- What a nice touch. 

The ambiance of this place is on the smaller size but comfortable at the least. The service was friendly and attentive and most importantly, the food was amazing for the price that you're paying. I wasn't sure if it was Happy Hour when we dined but when we received our tab, it only came out to be $55. A lot less from what I was expected to pay (hey I'm not complaining) but regardless of it being a mistake or not, I'll happily return.

The food was great! Very generous portions . We had the Las Vegas dinner for 6 ... Could have easily feed 7 or 8 . The sauces are pretty much all the same. The services was good but napkins were not handed out and refills on drinks never came around.
Great place to eat with family and friends. A lot of good quality meats with great service. Although it can get pretty pricey, If you leave a yelp review you also get a free dessert!
This place is by far the best Korean in the LV area we've tried. The customer service is great. The atmosphere is very welcoming. The food is great, very flavorful.
Very pleasant find in las Vegas close to MGM Grand & Hard Rock Cafe. Delicious food and great service. Will definitely be back!

I love korean food; and this is absolutely delicious ! It's a cute little place yet so elegant. The staff is courteous and attentive; and the food; yum! I recommend any one who is in the downtown Las Vegas area to stop by . Either to grill the meat; or just have some yummy tofu soup!

The wait time was very long due to several large parties being ahead of our large party but the staff tried really hard to accommodate us. Aside from that, it's hard to mess up Korean bbq and this was no exception. There food was delicious and came out quickly once we were able to order.
Very good! Good prices and great portions for sharing many different dishes. Def recommend this place instead of going to ayce bbq

The food was amazing and definitely worth the price. We ordered 7 sets of meats individually instead of getting the package and it was still very filling. During the happy hour deal all the meat only came out to $24. The rice and lettuce wrap is extra but I would definitely recommend getting them. 

We had to call over the waiters to ask for more water and such, and overall the service was slow. 

I am also writing this review to get a free dessert so that's a plus.
The food and service are great, but not a completely authentic Korean experience. Would have liked to see the Korean food names on the menu.

The happy hour is bomb.com!
The amount of quality food you get for the price is so worth it.
Ordered the bulgogi (duh), beef toro, stuffed wontons, corn (boring, but good after grilling and adding sauce), broccoli all from the happy hour menu. Also ordered the kimchi chiage (perfect noms for winter). PLUS they came out with the millions of/standard Korean side dishes. Everything was flavorful, and I am craving this place again as I write this post. 
I have also been thinking about the Banana Tempura dessert ever since I finished eating it. Will definitely be back.

Excellent!!! That would be the simplest way to describe this restaurant, passed it up because it was so busy at night but came back the next day for lunch and extremely happy that we came back to try it. Food comes quickly and each dish is delicious, staff works so fast and is very helpful. Do yourself the favor and try this place out.
Awesome Asian BBQ!!! Love this place!!! Got the gangnam special for two and it was wayyy more food than we could eat hahaha great value and quality!  Will be back when in Vegas!

This place offers great service.  The staff is friendly and the food taste wonderful. We had a combo for 2.  The portion is good and it was worth the experience. I would suggest people to come to this place for lunch and dinner.
Soooo good! Fresh delicious food!!! Service can be better. My favorite was bulgogi and spicy beef. Miso soup is legit. Side dishes can use more variety.

The gangnam meat combo was surprisingly filling and the quality of the meat was very lean and good.  the side dishes were diverse. the combo for 2 people was more than enough food.  Recommend  this place for people interested in higher quality korean bbq
Good place to eat Korean bbq! Bad for 3-6pm happy hours you get 50% drinks! Meat lover combo seems great!
Yummy Korean BBQ! Best I have ever had. First time here and I love it I will be back once I come to Vegas again

Awesome place for quality korean BBQ!
Lots of choices for grill and desert is great as well.
Great place to eat. Had happy hour and dishes were definitely affordable. Just wish rice was free.
Wonderful! Even the sides are delicious! They have happy hour from 3-6pm and it's total deals(:

Amazing experience at this place.  The service was great. I found this place by looking for great happy hour spots. They have a late happy hour with great deals. This was first time at a Korean Japanese bbq. The idea of cooking my own food at a restaurant may not appeal to everyone but i loved it. The prices at happy hour was low enough to be able to try a little bit of everything.  After they tske your order. They turn on the grills amd bring out an assortment of sauces and sides....most of which i had no idea what they were but they were good.  We ordered broccoli , chicken cheese fondue, bulgogi, pork belly, spicy chicken, shrimp. Everything was delicious and fun. I can't wait until a place like this comes to my town.  Great food, great time.
In las vegas, this restaurant considerably has much better quality food considering the price. The korean marinated beef was excellent.

Awesome place for Korean BBQ in Las Vegas!!!
I recommend to anybody who is looking for Korean food.
Came during the happy hour and it was thebomb.com.  hella  cheap. We got close to 20 items.

BEST KBBQ IN LAS VEGAS!!  we chose the premium grill meal for two  So much food!!  Our favorite was the Kobe Style Beef.  Everything was full of flavor from the meats down to the miso soup!  We will definitely be visiting again!

Really awesome BBQ place with tons and tons of options. The long wait is well worth it. It's not just Korean bbq but much more because of the price. Super affordable, which allows you to enjoy more things. Highly recommend

I love this food here! The meat is so good and it is the best place to eat in Las Vegas! The dessert is amazing! The bulgogi and the filet mignon are my favorite... Try the macaroon ice cream.. It is to die for
Food was really good. Me and my friend ordered the meat lover set and we loved everything on the set. Great service too. If you are in Las Vegas I highly recommend this place.

If you are hungry at night and looking for a place to come eat, then this is your place. The environment is seen very excellent. Must come for the Chicken Karaage. My first time here I had a sensational experience. The sever are very kind and you don't feel rushed at all, even though it was 12am. Recommend for a crew hang out.
Giving it 4 stars cause it's not all you can eat lol BUT the dishes are A+ and so are the staff :) recommended to eat here if you want high quality bbq.
I like free desert. It is very nice. The spicy chicken is delicious. I like these tasty food.

Meat lovers is a must! Best thing ever. This is our second time here and our friends first and they love it. Definitely try some of the dried squid and the Macaroons are  awesome. Will continue to come here.

I've been to a lot of K-BBQ places in So Cal.  This place is near Hard Rock Cafe.  The food is average and the service is ok but it seems understaffed.  The atmosphere is nice and comfortable.  They play music videos on a large projection screen for a bit of entertainment.  We would stop on again if it was convenient but not make a special trip.

Went here to try it out since it has a really good yelp review. For me, it is too expensive for the service that never came back even when our grill is black burnt. Raw food took 10 minutes when it is not even busy. Alot of korean bbq places out there thats better with average review. It is mediocore at its best. Oh well.

Great food with an authentic Korean taste. Any of their combo meals are a great amount of food for the reccommended servings. You will end up spending about 25 to 35 a person if you purchase around the middle of the price range. They keep your empty dishes cleared and glasses full. Its a delicious meal and lots of fun with a social group for a competitive price. The nature of the meal does make it a bit loud though, so keep that in mind. Location is just 5 minutes from the strip so that's a huge plus

Great food, nice atmosphere, chili dumplings and beef carpaccio are the best!!
Fillet minion is really amazing!
Meat quality is good, also the service! Highly recommended :) we tried the BBQ meat of best seller 1 and best seller 2, also the tofu soup and Japanese ramen.
Yum!! The food was amazing! It was a good start to Vegas.. The customer service was really good!! I totally recommend this place.. Yay!!

Best Korean BBQ I've ever been to. Great experience. Alot of food for a great price! There is alot of variety and deals to choose from. Definitely recommend this place. Will be coming back next time we're in town.

This is a paradise for meat lovers!   So many choice of meat and seafood and veggie to BBQ!  Everything is so well marinated and flavorful.  The two of us opted out of the set menu and chose our own selection of meat.  The spicy chicken and pork have a good kick of spices but not over-the-top spicy.  I especially recommended the Korean style prime and bulgogi....well seasoned and incredibly tender.  All the side dishes are delectable.  Come early!  We came at 6pm on Wednesday and we waited 40 mins!

Love this place. I'm half Korean and I've been to a lot of Korean restaurants and this one is my favorite. I love the portion size of the meat because if your not too hungry just get the one bulgogi for a decent price or if you are get two. The prices aren't bad and the food taste amazing. The service was fast and the restaurant was nice and clean. Most places charge you a ridiculous amount to bbq on the table but this place is more reasonable. I recommend this place to all.

I for one was very excited to visit a Korean restaurant since my best friend and I love Korean BBQ. We were very sad to see limited Korean options in Houston. This is not the case here!! We were able to have a wide selection of BBQ meats and seafoods, wonderful Japanese inspired appetizers. For appetizers I had the tuna poki, seafood pancake, tuna bibimbap, and jalapeño poppers. For main dishes, I was able to order garlic shrimp, and my friend also ordered things like bulgogi and duck breast. I do wish rice came with the meal, looks to me you have to order it separately. The BBQ came with several side dishes including the most delicious Kim chi and fish cakes. Loved it.
My new favorite place! The decor is wonderful and the happy hour is a great value. Our servers are very attentive and friendly. Their menu had a great selection and tastes terrific!
Delicious food and all for a great price! Staff was super accommodating and will definitely be back here again!
I love korean bbq and I'm so happy I found this place. thanks to yelp. :) this place is awesome and price is great specially during happy hour.

We were here on Tuesday evening and were seated within 5 minutes for a party of 5.  We had the Korean Prime Kalbi, Prime Kalbi, Flat Iron Garlic, Beef Toro, Bulgogi, Salmon with Bacon, Enoki with Bacon, and Japche.  Everything was delicious and the meat was very tender.  My kids are picky and they ate almost everything, which was amazing.  Service was very attentive to us.  We will be back the next time we are in Vegas!

Great dishes. Great portion
 Very reasonable price. Great stop before shenanigans. Great customer service as well

It was really good. I took the Las Vegas bbq. It costs $20 per person.

Take the Las Vegas bbq combo

Very nice food and service! 
First time here, I visited here when I am traveling. Good location and easy to park.
Food here is nice and with reasonable price. You should come and check out.

That squid side dish is amazing. I could eat it over rice as a whole meal. The spicy pork was very tasty, and the happy hour specials were legit. We got the green apple soju cooler and it hit the spot. The end.

So I'm giving this place a solid 4/5. One point off because the service was a little spotty near the end. I got the feeling that all the waiters were simply very fast paced and if they thought you didn't need them, they simply scurried about their business. 

We went to Happy Hour right when it started at 3p on a Sunday. The menu is overly large and exciting which made us very indecisive. So we started off ordering only a few things with the plan to order more from there. Here's all of what we ordered and what I thought. 

Bacon-Wrapped Asparagus - pretty simple and hard to mess up. But with all the other exciting options, I'd pass on it next time. 

Sweet Cheese Corn - one of my favorites! It was sweet, but not too sweet. And adding cheese never hurts. I would definitely order this again!

Fried Wontons - This is obviously of staple of just about every Asian menu. They were yummy as always, but not noticeably different from any other place. 

Filet Mignon - Again, very simple. But so enjoyable. Be responsible and don't over-cook it! The meat quality was great and is very tender and delicious when you keep it medium rare. I would order this again. 

Bulgogi - Very easy to over-cook due to the thin slices. But if you watch it, it comes out very tender and the marinade was everything I wanted! I would definitely order this again!

Cream Cheese Wontons - The wonton wrapper was super thin and delicate. It had the perfect light Crunch before breaking through to the cream Cheese. The sweet sauce it came with was great! I would order these again!

Chicken Karrage - I had never had this anywhere. So I was surprised to see that the pieces of fried chicken were cut in all different shapes and sizes. In fact, at first I thought the waiter had brought us the wrong thing. I thought it was fried calamari! The chicken itself didn't have much flavor. But the spicy dipping sauce it came with was great! Not sure I'd bother ordering it again, though....

Korean Chicken Cheese Fondue - I enjoyed this chicken even more than I expected! I loved the Crunch that developed from grilling! While the insides remained tender. The cheese came in a little foil bowl. It was shredded and cold and immediately put of the grill. It tasted like an American cheese. I would get this chicken again. 

Vanilla Ice Cream Macaron Sandwich - the Macaron was purple and I'm not sure what flavor it was meant to be - it simply tasted sweet to me. Even after being frozen, it still had that perfect Macaron chew. And the vanilla ice cream was so creamy and smooth!

We had a great time at this place and will definitely be back to try more!
The meat was very tasty with yummy marinated sauce and the green tea Mochi ice cream is a must try. It was a good value meal. Go with the combo for 2.

Food was good. Service was okay. The bulgolgi is the best meat we had with the meat lovers combo. hella food and I'm full! Next time will only order bulgolgi. Also ordered a side of jap chae noodles they forgot until later. it wasn't very flavorful like most places. All the sides were bomb. seaweed salad is fresh and food here. I'd come back.
Simply put, amazing! Meat lover's does not disappoint. A bit pricey, but very cool authentic Korean BBQ. Very nice atmosphere and friendly staff.
Best kbbq restaurant I've been to so far. Try all the favorites, they're worth it! - miso harami, spicy tuna kimbap, and prime kalbi. 15+ minute wait on the honey toast so order ahead.
Best Korean BBQ in town ! Portions are very generous and side dishes are great . Raw oyster, Kobe beef , and pork belly are must have here .
Loved it here! The food was delicious and the cooking experience was fun and enjoyable! Fun time with friends and the service was quick and friendly. Definitely would come here again!

I've found my new favorite place. Basically, if you ever thought, "I could cook this myself!" well then, you are in heaven. Tons of options and only yourself to blame if it's not cooked right. 

Great appetizers, tons of meats to try, REVERSE HAPPY HOUR 10pm to close. Even if you got something you didn't like (or just messed up cooking it), the prices are great.

Spicy Tuna Kimbap:  awesome as an appetizer to start. The serving is HUGE. You won't feel shorted when you order. You may get scalp sweats, but that's a good thing. 

Chili Garlic Wings: These were fine, not the best wings you've ever had but pack plenty of meat and flavor.

Bulgogi: People seem to love this. It's not great. It's the meat I liked the least. Consistency is gummy. It's a sticky meat. Has a bit of a jerky taste to it. Impossible to really cook on the grill. It's a pass for me. 

Pork Belly: It was good. It wasn't as flavorful as I thought but it melts in your mouth. They do give you plenty of strips so it works out that way. Plenty of trays to dunk it in too.

Filet Mignon: How could you say no to this? Of course, the cuts are tender and succulent. Probably the thing that works against it is that they are THICK cuts. Eating it usually involves putting the WHOLE chunk in your mouth. But it's filet mignon, it is delicious.

Flat Iron Garlic: Great garlic flavor, thinner cuts make cooking and eating this a tad bit easier that the Filet. Plenty of meat to dip too.

But really everything we had was good. Even the Bulgogi wasn't that bad. Seems like you can't go wrong here. That's a sign of a great place to eat.
The service was great! The vegas deal was so delicious and everything came out perfectly timed. Definitely a great place to eat asian barbecue for the first time.

The service is really great! Great for late night groups to have a few drinks and good Asian BBQ.  The price is very reasonable. You can come dressed up on a date or totally casual. I recommend this place for people that wanna have a nice chill spot to eat good Asian BBQ.
Great comfort food, wonderful services and all the server was prompt with our request.

Our table ordered the gangnam combo for 6 and it was delicious. The meats were all very tender and well marinated and the side dishes were good as well. They even let you pick between white rice and bibimbab for the rice option. It was definitely a worthwhile visit.
the food here is amazing!!!!!!!!! from the temperature of the food to the quality to the service... you can't go wrong. but if you do, you probably didn't want the free dessert.

We are from out of town and came due to the number of reviews and ratings. I'm not sure if I like this... despite this I was not disappointed. We just ordered the 5 different meat platters for 6 people. We came in on a Monday afternoon and had to wait for 30min...due to limited large table seating. We just asked to sit in a small booth and squeeze in, which they allowed. Service was okay.

Great dining experience a little ways off the strip! We got the premium dinner and it was plenty of food for 2 adults plus one child. Everything was delicious and the service was great! Will definitely be back on my next visit to Vegas!
Really good/tasty barbecue. Tons of food, well worth the price. Service was excellent! Will definitely be back... :)
The service here is great, they check up on you a lot. The food was even better! You all should consider eating here :D
Staff was friendly and attentive. Vibe was great, place was clean, and food was delicious. I love their pork belly.
We ordered a meat lover set menu, it is really delicious and enough food for two persons, table is clean. And I also liked the side menu which is really good for my taste.
