What else can I say that hasn't been said? A-ma-zing! Get one of the combos to share with a friend.

The best asian bbq we've ever tasted. Tried the korean prime kalbi and steamed eggs both two thumbs up. Our bbq inclusive of side dishes that were too yummy. My husband said the best cream cheese wonton he ever tasted.
arrived at 11PM found still need a little waiting. Price is not too high for each dish so you can taste more. Recommended to my friends!

Came here on Saturday for happy hour, there were a lot of people waiting for a seat.  The hostess was nice and honoured our happy hour even though we got seated a little after six.  They were accommodating which made our party very happy. 

We ordered and tried all the dishes on the happy hour. The beef Toro and pork belly were one of our favourite.  The fondue cheese was interesting to dip the meat in. 

I liked how we each had our own individual sauces, 3 different type.  One was like a pretty ponzu, one was like a teriyaki, and another a spicy teriyaki. 

We tried the premium prime Kalbi and it was really tender.  We had to order another plate so we could each get another bite. 

The waiters are friendly and always around to take orders. 

And best of all, for being a great yelper and doing a review, we got a free macaron.
Best Korean BBQ spot in town.  Haven't had an item on the menu I don't like.  Great service, great food, great experience.  All the thumbs up!
The meats here has good quality and they have a lot of premium options. definitely recommend this place if you like Korean BBQ.
Very clean environment!!! We had a beautiful waitress and the food was seasoned to perfection!
We ordered the gangnam bbq set. It had a good variety of meat and other sides. The staff were helpful in their recommendations and very attentive. Would come again with a large party.
Best Korean restaurant in Vegas. Clean and quiet, good for family. Food is delicious, waiters are polite and responsive. Two days in a row already, definitely will come again.

Really enjoyed the experience here. This was my first time at an establishment like this and it was a blast! We got to choose our meats to cook on the grill. Everything has its own flavor and tasted good! We also had garlic edamame and fried rice which were both outstanding. The service was on point! Everyone was very helpful and checked on us often.
Fun experience (you grill the meats at the table). Food and service were both good. I would recommend the harami miso skirt steak. I'm definitely curious to try a few other meats on the next visit.
The food is great! Definitely one of the better Korean restaurants in town! The price is a bit more expensive but it's make up for in quality

Very good variety of items to choose from and high quality meats. We went a la carte since not all the set menu items were for us. The kimchi pancake was very crispy and yummy. The oysters were fresh and sweet.
Awesome.  Will be back. Got the Gangnam dinner and it was amazing. Service was fast. Bulgogi was juicy and tender.
Best Korean food in Las Vegas! Fresh, clean and presented beautifully. Our waiter was absolutely fabulous! You won't be disappointed!

We are non locals; came here for Happy hour and we stuffed our faces for $36 total. Totally worth it. 
Food: 
Pork belly- flavorless
Bulgogi-good
Spicy Pork-awesome
Complimentary side dishes lacked freshness.
Environment:
Clean and modern
Service:
Dave was an awesome server! We kept ordering more and he was friendly and patient with us.
Service started out a little slow but that changed after we were finally able to get our order placed. Food was terrific...all of it!
Ate here on Valentine's Day with my fiancé and we were amazed on the price and good quality of meats. Great food and great service. A hidden gem off the strip. Worth visiting again.

Having been to Seoul, and experienced firsthand The amazingness of cream barbecue, I can see you this place doesn't quite stand up to the authentic Korean standards.

The meat selection is quite extensive, and the "Kobe style" was actually pretty good. The fried calamari, and marinated short ribs and spicy pork, were actually very tasty.

I would call this upscale and twist, as far as the restaurant very nicely laid out with her every single table in the corner was very clean and atmosphere was very mellow for a New York/Las Vegas style restaurant. I would call this fancy, I wouldn't necessarily call it good for kids, but if you've never been to the Korean barbecue place, The authenticity, and the experience of cooking your own meat in the grill in front of you on the table is very very fun. With over 1200 reviews and many more photographs, and I'm feeling like this place is a hit, even being off the strip. A good place for locals, and definitely a place I'd recommend to those traveling.
Was surprised at how good the food was here. Wasn't expecting much but was blown away by the food. Definitely recommend it here!
Second time here we love the food it is amazing .. It's a Friday night and it is packed the hostess needs major props she was helping everyone !!! She went above an beyond !!!!! Today is March 18th.
Food was excellent.  I did not expect korean food of this quality in Las Vegas.  Their appetizers are plentiful and the 7 of us ordered the premium for 6 people

Love this place, I took my friends and family here many times.  The food is amazing and is probably the best Korean bbq I've had in Vegas. The combo deals give you a lot of servings and it's very affordable.  The meats are marinated nicely and are delicious.

Awesome! Food was amazing, service was awesome... Overall BOMB AF

LIFE-CHANGING CULINARY EXPERIENCE!

... Plus u get a free macaron ice cream if u leave a review... Unbiased, of course
This place is very good. The people are very professional and the meat lovers combo was delicious. Be sure to check it out!

Good Korean flavors. Meats are good and relatively priced ok. May need to up their ban chan cups a little so people don't have to keep asking for Kim chee . Service has been good to average the three times I've been. Overall a good spot for good Korean food. My lady friend loved the free macaroon with the yelp check in.
Great food, great atmosphere, superb service.  Highly recommend the beef toro, short ribs, steamed eggs, and pork belly.
So good!!! Would definitely come back :) Korean chicken was tasty and a great price. The right amount of spicy.

Updated review:  We celebrated my sister-in-law's birthday here last night.  None of us have tried this place.  We were really impressed with the food.  We loved the side dishes, especially the squid. Right behind our booth, someone else was celebrating their birthday and the staff sang a  birthday song and gave him/her a complimentary dessert.  So we had to tell them it was my sister-in-law's birthday also.  Our waiter assured us she would get a dessert too.  On the corner of our booth, I was excited to see that they give a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp  at the time of the visit.  It was a limited time offer so I wanted to take advantage of that. I showed the pictures to my 4 year old nephew and as soon as he saw the colorful macaron ice cream, which he called "ice cream burger", he asked for it right away.  I had to coax him to finish his food first  before we  get him the free ice cream.  He agreed and waited so patiently for it.  While everyone's eating, I downloaded the Yelp app so I could rate the restaurant and get the macaron ice cream for my nephew.  I followed the instructions and gave them a really good rating based on the food itself which was a 5 star for everyone.  I got up to use the restroom and asked my husband to show the review to them (as required). However, when I returned, my sister-in-law's complimentary dessert  was already there.   They didn't sing her a song either. It, unfortunately,  wasn't what my nephew had been waiting for. Our server told us that they would only honor one.  I'm not upset about not getting the free dessert cause we could have bought him one right there instead.  For one, it was already late. I just  didn't want to see my nephew disappointed.  We'll just buy him one in the morning from somewhere else.
High quality food. Plenty of food to go around. Great service. The meats were well seasoned and extremely tender. Would recommend for any occasion.
Staff is friendly, a lot of food. You can check it to get free dessert. Yum yum yum~ recommend for friends but not for dates for the music is a bit loud for easy conversation.

Got there right at opening time and had no problem getting a spot, then it quickly filled up.

This is my first experience at korean bbq-ing and it was-- AMAZING. Service was good, as was food. Wish there was one back in utah!

It was late and all of the good restaurants in our casino was closed.  We looked on Yelp and GangNam came highly rated and was open late.

There wasn't any wait and we were seated immediately.  The server as nice and friendly.  We order the GangNam #1 for 2.  The small sides were good.  I enjoyed the pickled cucumbers and the daikon.  We had 5 meats.  All of them were good.  The Bulgogi was a little too salty, but still decent.  The only downside was that they didn't change our grill.

Overall though, considering the cost, the quality of meat, and the amount of food you get, this is a solid recommendation if you are looking for korean bbq in Vegas.

My goodness, this is the best Korean BBQ restaurant I've ever been!  We happened to drop in during happy hour (3-6 pm) on Saturday.  We ordered 4 happy hour menus, Fried calamari ($4), Chicken Karage($4), Spicy Chicken BBQ with Lemon Source($3), Korean Chicken BBQ Cheese Fondue($3) and Filet Mignon ($8.5) and Sukiyaki, all delicious! Every menu was much bigger portion than we expected, plus endless refillable free 8 side dishes come with meal!  We were sooooo stuffed.  They give you 3 kinds of dipping sauce for the meat besides lemon sauce and cheese we ordered, all tasted excellent. Beer was a half price during happy hour. For all the above tasty meal plus beer, the total was only $37 including tax. Unbelievable!!! We'll come back again!
あちこちの韓国タウンなどで、韓国料理を食べるのが好きなのですが、このレストランはその中でも、１－２を争う満足度でした！お値段はとてもリーズナブルで、つけ汁のお味もすごく美味しいです。特に、3-6時のハッピーアワーはすごくお得です。二人でお腹いっぱい食べて、ビールまで飲んで、合計37ドル。この美味しさと量で、信じられない安さです。ラスベガスに行くときには、毎回立ち寄りたいレストランになりました。
Nice decor and fair price. Love the Korean chicken cheese fundue. The bimbimbap comes with the tow persons conbo is really good.
This was and amazing experience. The food was great delicious the sides were awesome. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I will come to this place again and again and again

First time here! What an awesome place!We got a really nice spacious private room in the back!!perfect for our occasion, since there were 8 of us!
 Decor was really nice and clean,service was excellent and the food was delicious! Our Server, Jin,was very attentive and polite! We were impressed! 
 We brought our daughter here for her birthday  and we all enjoyed it,especially  the bday girl! Lol
 Totally will tell everyone about this place whose wanting quality korean bbq!We will definitely come back!

The food and service were extremely great. Pork belly is excellent. Filet mamignon is the best. Every super yummy.

Friendly and accommodating. 

Love it.

great place highly recommended for korean bbq!
bla bla bla bla its a great place, cheese was good, doing this for the free ice cream macaroon cos u need to review it hahaha so im using up the space, other than that this place is really great! smells awesome, kpop playing with HAWT gals and some lame dudes lol why cant everyone in korea look like that, oh wait they do its cos of plastic surgery ok im going off topic bottomline is the place is great for korean bbq

Got a call from a friend whose birthday venue turned out to be overbooked. She was frantic to find a place that served Asian food, was affordable, but great enough for the dozen of us to enjoy--in  a couple of short hours from her call!  Of course, I turned to Yelpers and the fact that Gangnam had over 2,500 reviews with an average rating of 4.5 stars convinced me this was a safe place to recommend. My friend immediately booked their private room for 7pm.

While the restaurant appeared small from the storefront, it was surprisingly well laid out for groups, couples, and we saw singles dining, too. So don't hesitate to stop in if you're dining solo.  We were seated in a private room toward the back, large enough, yet cozy for 12.

As soon as most of the group were seated, the ban chan was brought in. Large variety of appetizer were laid out, including the requisite kimchi mixes, sprouts, taegu, and more. Our friendly server guided us to the combination selections.  It was unanimous that the Gangnam combo would be the way to go as the more people you have, the better the price per person. The ban chan had the requisite various kimchi, sprouts, and much more.

Onion miso soup, large salad to share, fresh oysters on the  half shell, grilled shishito peppers, mushroom medley, choice of steamed rice or bulgogi bibimbap rice, and beef ... lots and lots of beef ... kalbi, bulgogi,  etc. Food seemed to just keep coming until we were overwhelmed and finally tapped out!

We enjoyed the experience and the food so much, we're planning on heading back with another group of family coming to town in a few weeks.
The food here is really good. Especially the Bulgogi, it is a must get when you come here.

I just order a sea food Ramen because I just need a quick lunch. The food is awesome for me , and service is also better then average. They refilled the sides promptly, so as the food, so I can have the food within 10 minutes.
The food here is amazing! We ordered the premium and it was worth every dollar. The kobe beef was extremely tender. Side dishes were plentiful. Kimchi was delicous. Servers were great.

Who knew Korean BBQ on 4th of July would be the thing I did.  I was glad I did it nevertheless.  The food was pretty good and cost reasonable.  Portions were enough even for a food whore like myself.  

Glad I came and will be going here again.

And the KPop playing on the big screen kept the kids (and wife pretty entertained).
This place is across the street from where I live. The staff is nice enough and the dessert is good.
The food here is delicious! Although the food portions are small, the flavor and amount makes up for it. In addition, the restaurant has attentive service and a beautiful, modern-asian ambiance. :D
Very pleasurable experience! Jin thank you so much you are awesome! Thank you for welcoming us and guiding us step by step since it was my first time here ! Thank you.
Amazing!!! Such a great value! The pork belly was killaz (aka life changing). The Meat Lovers set was so great, and be sure to get the salt and sesame oil dip for the meat! Awesome!
The korean prime kalbi was delicious and you can never go wrong with anything wrapped in bacon!

Not AYCE?! Meh. I'm over stuffing my face with as much food as possible to make it with my money. I'm glad they didn't have the AYCE option. 

For the price, which is quite reasonable, the portions are a good size. We had three meat plates (beef toro, pork belly, prime kalbi) and a few sides (oysters, dumplings, calamari, seaweed salad) , shared between three people. I was stuffed! We also ended up getting banana tempura for dessert. All in all, it was a good meal. My least favorite item probably wouldve been the calamari. But there are so many other items to order, it's not a big deal. It wasn't bad, I just have a high expectation for my calamari. 

As far as service, they were on top of their stuff. Never had to ask for water. They checked on us just enough to not be annoying. 

We went around 530, and we were the only people there, which worried me a bit. But by the time we left, about hour and a half later, the place was packed. So if you don't want to wait, be sure to go early. 

All in all, I definitely will be back.
Really cool concept.  We had a little bit of a wait but had the ice cream cookies which were great during the wait.  Definitely will visit again next time I go to Vegas

Pros: great taste, quality. Good variety, covers all the main korean BBQ favorites that I know. 
Cons: portion size too small for the heavy eater. 

Overall, this place is great! The atmosphere is cool, is not too busy, no reservations needed, and customer service is great! Very quick and responsive refilling water. Also, I mistakenly ordered the regular prime kalbi instead of the Korean kalbi (korean has the sawce) and they swapped it for the Korean one! Only con is the serving size. If they had an all you can eat option, this place would be perfect. Still 5 stars because of everything else.

Ordered the gangnam combo for 2, and it was amazing! Great variety and great cuts of meat. Couldn't even finish it all in one sitting. Appetizers were also plentiful in terms of variety and even got free refills from one of the awesome waiters.

Great food, great service, I highly recommend this place!

I was there last month for year end family trip. It's one WORD for taste was good. We didn't order BBQ that I don't have opinion. We ordered one pot dishes per each family members. The dishes were good tasty and quantity.
THe problem were all about service. The waitress and waiters were all annoying my request. ANd they even forgot the order for my mom(took 30 minutes serve dish). They looks unkind except only one woman who was in reception desk. I think the problem came from service system which was not designate table. That means they may share the tips. 
Frankly, I won't be there again even not quite super tasty. I don't want keep asking and waiting anymore. I will try other Korean restaurant.

Good food! Great happy hour. Glad we decided to try something new in Vegas. Awesome food! That is very unique and delicious. They offer tasty Korean side dishes that will definitely fill you up. Have there green apple soju ... Sooooo 1207 E Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89104
Best place to eat korean bbq. Price is reasonable, servers r reallly nice. I am very happy that i had lunch here. Good place to bring girl,family.

One of my top 3 Korean BBQ spots in the Veg. Prime Korean Kalbi... Everything is fresh and quality. The ahi poke was delicious also. All of the usual accompaniments with Korean style BBQ came with lunch and dinner. The service is also great!
Awesome food, great selection of meats. Second time here and I plan to come every time we visit Vegas!

Great food, fast service, and close to UNLV. 
PS- love the happy hr
I will for sure be coming here more often with friends

Super delicious and would most likely come back again. I would so recommend everyone who's craving korean barbeque to head out here and eat. They are super attentive and even though we had a party of 14, their service continued to be great. Love this place, food, and the people who served us. Would come here everyday if I could.
Fav spot in Vegas for some Asian bbq. My favorite is the spicy pork and dynamite shrimp

Happy hour + hot sake + different food choices = bomb a$$ bbq!!!
Fast and friendly service as well.
Great food, good service. The chicken and shrimp were favorites. The tables are kind of big, which makes it difficult to talk to your dining companion.

Trendy korean Bbq place off the strip, Jin our server was super friendly and smart to put the water in a plastic to go cups for my 3 boys(spill proof) Smart!!! Food came within minutes to our table. Totally recommend!

MMMmmMM. Just touch down in Vegas and this is our first place to visit. The service is excellent. Our waiter explained the menus well.  The food is fantastic. The restaurant ambiance is great.  The price is decent. We can't ask for more. Yes!!! Let's get this party started.

Great place! Food is amazing, no complains. My girlfriend got a vegetarian fried rice with tofu and the flavor was amazing. The restaurants atmosphere is great too, they have a big TV with music videos playing. I will be back again and you should come check it out!

Great food great customer service the food comes out quick. Nice and clean, very good vibe.
Food is really good and made my tummy happy
3rd time fab food excellent service. Food is fresh love the ribeye and asparagus. Definitely will be back locals eat here
We had spicy soon tofu with seafood and it was very good. Great banchan too! We would definitely come back next time we're in vegas
This place is awesome af. Donkey gave us great service and was very friendly. The kalbi and bulgogi were amazing. Definitely can't wait to come back.
Prime meats and intuitive service. Gangnam combination is the best deal for your buck! :)
I've been coming to this place for Korean BBQ for almost 2 years now and their service never let me down. If you come, you must try the "Must Try Juicy Cuts" and the Cheese Fondue~~~
Food was great, price was reasonable quality of meat was very good. No need for a AYCE this fill will still fill you up. Services was attentive and great.

Food was awesome, but some servers' friendliness can be improved. Gangnam set menu was value for money especially for big groups like ours. We ordered for 4 but was enough to feed 5 with some side dishes.

Delicious  food so yummiee, good taste of pork belly , clean place 
I' like it and luv it!!!
Nice place for family's dinner
Good S@!t...liked the meal a lot. A good experience for the taste buds. Macaroon ice cream for dessert is not to be missed.
It is a wonderful place to eat korean BBQ. Clean, good taste and good manner of servers. I strongly recommand here to enjoy korean food!!

I ate here for the first time with my Dad. Our waiter explained everything and we ordered several random dishes to cook ourselves.
Friendly service, great food and a truly unique dining experience!

Very pleased with the high quality of the meats.  We ordered the Prime Kalbi, Korean Prime Kalbi (marinated), Beef Toro (brisket), Flat Iron Garlic steak, Bulgogi, bacon wrapped Enoki mushrooms and Jap Chae.

The meats were fresh and tender.  Brisket had very little fat for a change.

The Jap Chae glass noodles with beef is BIG and delicious.  Good value.
Our first time at an Asian BBQ restaurant and it was great! We got the meat lovers for two which was more than enough food. All the meat was very well flavored and tasty. Recommended!
Very delicious high quality meats! I loved the Kobe ssam topped with uni, perfect combination of flavors. Also got the beef tongue, kalbi, and duck breast which were also good!
Very good service , good food and good Korean style I luv it! Price ok area good overall 5 star !
Great place to go with friends.  Definitely recommend. But there would be lots of people waiting if no reservation.
Good food. I'm been here few times but today, the service seems slow. Either way, I like it here!
Excellent food and excellent service! Especially the bibimbop was really great!! We really enjoyed!!!
初めて行きました！とても親切で、肉やタレの種類から焼き方まで丁寧に教えてくれました。途中から焼いてくれて、とても美味しくたべることができました！このお店は初心者の人でも満足できます
It is great Korean style bbq. Good environment, multiple choices.remember come early, otherwise need to wait for the line.
Pretty clean Korean BBQ restaurant.Small portion plates but good for the price.  "You want White Lice" (rice) lol
Was exceptional! The seafood pancake was bomb!  Definitely a place to eat at while in Vegas
Hands down the best Korean resto I've visited so far! Great food great staff! Oh and free dessert!

Best customer service. Everyone is so polite and genuine. Besides great employees, the food is most definitely amazing and so tasteful.. A place to come back to over and over again multiple times in the same week as some of my friends do.
Good service! Very attentive servers! Good quality cuts of meat.. definitely will come again when in Vegas !

Came in for lunch with my family. We had a party of 10 and we were seated quickly. There is a large party room in the back to accommodate larger parties. The spicey chicken was amazing!! Lived the small plates. The beef short rib was very flavorful. Will cone back again.

Excellent food. Fantastic service. Great for family or a date. Try the meals on the back of the menu. It's a lot of food but a great value.

We will gladly return.

I've had a lot of Korean BBQ and this place is my favorite. I like how you can cook the meat on your own. This means that no meat gets cold and hard cause you're chowing on something else. Also the smaller portions mean you can try different meats without committing to one type. Servers came by and checked on us often, great service.
Excellent service, very helpful server, good food. Will recommend to friends and family parking a issue other than that good. Staff very friendly fresh food . We came from El Paso, Tx.

Came in here for lunch on a Tuesday. Was a little worries when I walked in for lack of people but was quickly greeted and sat. 

This is a very trendy place with good Japanese pop music to go with the theme of this restaurant. 

I ordered beef with a side of broccoli with the add on soup and salad for lunch. Everything I had was amazing. The beef so tender and steamed broccoli right on the grill was great. 

Highly recommend this place.  For the excellent service and phenomenal food.  The only reason for not 5 stars is I want to come back for a second visit soon and make sure today wasn't just a fluke. Once I do that I can hopefully upgrade my rating.

THEY WERE FANTASTIC! 

My best friend and I were in town on business. We got in late and wanted something to eat that was REALLY GOOD but not far from our hotel! 

This place was literally a block from our hotel. 

We were greeted immediately and seated. 

Everything we ordered was so good! We had the Marinated Beef Kolbi, Spicy Tofu Soup, Pork Belly and the Seafood Pancakes.

I love this place, not only because the food was AMAZING but also because it was very cheap! 

KUDOS!!!

The kobe beef here is good. Coming from LA, we usually go to jinseng and kimchi for kbbq, but we came here after seeing the reviews and rating. Ordered the meat lover combo for 6 with an extra order of kobe, and the amount and quality of the food is great for the price.

This is the best korean BBQ we've been to! 
The Kobe beef is awesome and melts in your mouth.
If you are sick of waiting in line for great food at the strip area, you should definitely come here. We were seated right away and the food was amazing. The service was quick and awesome!

My family stopped by for dinner on a Friday night.
We oeder the Meat Lover set menu it was sooo good!
Food excellent...meat so tender...and such great flavor to Everything... Service A+....Friendly... There at every moment of need..Will be back again to try other selections...:))

Awesome tasting food. Marinated kalbi was flavorful. Didnt need the sauces but tried it & it was good. Kimchi was good. Got the kobe appetizer, pork belly & cold noodles.  Everything was good. Came here because of the good ratings & it did live up to the hype. Liked the clean facility & decor.

This was my first experience with Korean BBQ & this place did not disappoint. The customer service was great. The waiters were very helpful and patient. The food was amazing. My wife had Shrimp garlic and I had Harami miso beef. Both were very juicy and flavorful. "Must try appetizer's". We will come back for sure.
Great food and great customer service! Would recommend to anyone in Las Vegas looking for high quality kbbq

This was my second time at a Korean BBQ place, and this place did not disappoint! We ordered quite a few dishes but the stand out one for us was the bulgogi, and maybe the Kalbi, which were succulent and all round tasty! The pork belly was tasty too but a bit too thick for my liking. Overall this was a great meal, pricing was a bit expensive but thats the Vegas norm I guess. Definitely recommend!
Just visiting and came across this place. Service was great considering they were closing soon but we still got great service and yummy food

As soon as I found this restaurant I wanted to try it but don't be fooled by all these reviews and stars on Yelp. The restaurant was freezing cold, the service was awful, the food wasn't very good, and to top it off the server gave us some other person's credit card and ran away before we could tell her it wasn't ours! In no way is that ok. I will never go back to this restaurant again. 

When we got there we were greeted with the most unfriendliest server I have ever seen. She made us feel very unwelcome and as if we did something wrong by coming into the restaurant. 

After we were seated we were ignored for a bit. She never asked us if we had been there before or explained anything to us. After we ordered she gave us some kind of sauce and some side dishes. There was no explanation as to what any of it was. We tried 5 of the 7 side dishes and only one of them tasted like anything and that was cucumber. They were not good and the 2 we didn't try looked really unappetizing. 

When the meat came out again no explanation about how to handle and cook the raw meat so that there is no cross contamination or cooking times to make sure the meat is cooked properly so that we don get food poisoning. Ever other restaurant that has you cook your own meat that I have been to tells you these things. The meat was alright. It was nothing special. For the amount of stars and reviews this restaurant has I expected something better than mediocre.  

When we were finished we had to wait at least 15 minutes to get the check. We noticed that the server kept looking at us but was trying to ignore us. The table next to us who sat down while we were eating got their check before we did. We finally got the check and gave them our card. The sever then brought back the card and basically threw it on the corner of the table and ran away. She had actually  given us the wrong credit card. She ran away so fast we couldn't give it back. Luckily a tall skinny male server came an took it and brought our card.

I really love BBQ and i tried to find the best BBQ so far. Indeed, Gangnam is one of my top 5. My friend and I ordered Gangnam set and Meat lover, and we found that the quality of the food is perfectly satisfy us. Moreover, the quantity of the food is sufficient for 10 people.

I've been to many korean bbq's in town and I have to say this is probably my favorite place.  Their Premium package for two people was enough to fill up a party of three. Its a good thing my girlfriend and I eat like cows! A MUST for kbbq eaters out there!

Excellent!!!
Would highly recommend to my friends and family. A fabulous dining experience.
Not many korean BBQ places in Vegas. This one is decent. Can get crowded though so the earlier you go the better. Or really late

Great food and service. They have packages that are a better value but we just ordered a la carte. The meats aren't very large portions but we ordered 3 choices and had plenty. We also had the beef tongue and spicy tuna kimbap which were both tasty. The service was excellent with multiple individuals checking in on us but remember it is your job to cook the meat. Personally I love this part of Korean BBQ!

Absolutely loved it here! We got the Gangnam combo for 2 people, and it was way more food than we could finish. It's like the amount of food you would feed 2 hungry men. The meats were tender and juicy, and the leftovers that we finished later that night tasted just as good, if not better. 

The service was excellent. Our food came within a blink of an eye. And the dishes just kept coming and coming. They definitely waste no time on keeping things running, since this place gets super busy.

The absolute BEST KBBQ PLACE IVE EVER BEEN TOO!!! I'm so sad because I live in the Bay and now I will always want Gangnam!! I will have to come back every time I go to Vegas. 

*super clean, cute decor with music videos playing on a projector 
*friendly waitresses: explained the menu, refilled water without asking, took away empty plates promptly
*THE FOOD WAS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING. SEASONED DELICIOUSLY. The meat was so flavorful & didn't need any extra sauce, vegis, or seasoning. Absolute perfection!!!

Gangnam BBQ, come to the Bay Area please please please!!
Yup I did it again!! Second time this Trip!! So Awesome and Great Service!! Until next time

In Vegas figuring out what we should have for dinner and started looking through Yelp and found this place. We went In for dinner and this place smelled so good. 

We ordered the meat lovers package and it was AMAZING! Everything was fresh and the presentation was beautiful! The staff was very attentive and friendly. 
We left full and Happy and definitely be back when we are in Vegas.  The best Korean BBQ We've ever had and THUMBS UP from all 10 of us that was there!!

Meat is seasoned to perfection! Sweet and attentive waiters! Came during happy hour and prices are way good. Very cheap actually. Ordered the toro beef, bulgogi, and chicken cheese fondue. They offer three different dipping sauces, all were tasty. Free dessert with each review, ice cream macaroon or banana tempura. We got both since the boyfriend and I each wrote one. Both were delicious. If you're looking to share, the banana tempura portion is large.

Found out about this place on yelp. Glad me & my gf stopped by. We ordered the Las Vegas which was priced at $45.95 for 2, for the money you definitely get what you pay for, good portion sizes, tasteful dishes. We even had to take some of the food home!

I am visiting Vegas for New Year's... Got sick. Like had to go to the ER sick. Finally made it out of bed and looked for a Korean place that had soup. Came upon this gem. Funny how I just drove and pulled into this parking lot to make a Facebook post asking if anyone knew of any ramen or Korean places bc I needed Asian soup to help heal my ailing body. This parking lot was the same parking lot I was at a few trips ago when visiting Azusa Hookah Las Vegas and left my extra set of car keys. So I was destined to get in touch with my Korean roots. It is a perfectly sized place about 14 BBQ tables. I sat at the bar. I ordered the kimchi jigae. Soups are priced about $9.95 comes out in one of the Stone hot boiling pots. Before that came out you also get lucky  #7 banchans and the kimchi was perfectly fermented, stir fried fish cakes, cucumber kimchi, ojingeo muchim, spicy beans sprouts, pickled radish w/jalapeños and the famous pasta salad (or potato salad at other Korean places). I am one happy salty half Asian clam. My body is in sodium hell.... But that is the perils of Korean eats... But that kimchi jigae broth with the pork was making live to every taste bud in my mouth.  I will come back again every time I visit.  and

My boyfriend was craving some Kbbq and we wanted to try something new apart from Sura and Tofu Hut. I found this place on Yelp so we decided to try it.
I wasnt expecting much since yelp stars cant be trusted sometimes.
But OMG just as we walked in..Cute Korean Dudes.. lol. No but seriously, the staff were very accommodating and friendly. The place looked very clean, modern and spacious. We got there around 6pm and the place was packed. We got seated shortly after and Calvin, our waiter was very helpful in deciding what to get. We then ordered their Best Seller: Gangnam for 2, $65.95. We felt that the portions were perfect, mann we were stuffed. Then we had Honey Toast and Lava Cake for dessert..yummy! Apparently if you make a yelp review you get either a Lava Cake or Banana Tempura Ice Cream for free. 
Our first time experience at this place was awesome. It just might be our new go-to place. The food, and the staff was great. I definitely would recommend this place. It is on the pricey side, but definitely worth it.
Food was really good, and the service was great. Really enjoyed every slice of meat that was cooked. The music being played out put me in a good mood too.

Every time we visit Vegas, we make sure to eat at this place. This is the best Korean BBQ restaurant I have been to, and I've been to a lot of them in San Diego and Los Angeles. 

This time, we tried the premium meal for two for $80-$90. Everything was great: the sides, and the variety of dishes from meats (which included Kobe beef) to some seafood. Overall, great value...this order can easily feed 3 hungry people too. 

And service is always really good, no matter how busy this place is. I rarely would give a 5 star review...but this place definitely deserves it.

I don't know many places for kbbq/jbbq in Vegas. But I found this gem thanks to other yelpers. It is in a random plaza behind the strip by Hard Rock.

All I have to say is the next time I'm craving kbbq when I'm in Vegas I know where to go! No wait to get seated. The food is quality and the service is great. 

Another dope thing about this restaurant is that they have happy hour everyday from 3-6 and 10-close. Their happy hour is a great deal and for sure get you full for a cheaper price. 

If you love kbbq, this is heaven. If you haven't tried, this is a great place to start. Definitely coming back again!

Was just driving from CA to CO and found this great place on Yelp!  Omg amazing and fun!  You get to cook your meat at the table, yummy dipping sauces and a bunch of side dishes to try.  
Thank you for a great experience!

This restaurant never fails me. I returned on my subsequent trip to LV because it is that good! I recommend getting the Gangnam meal option...meats are tender as well as the side dishes. Staff are awesome. This is my favorite Korean restaurant!

Delish food! Fun to make you own on the grill. Try to the beef toro and short rib for sure. Service was fun and promt. As a Vegas local I will definitely be back again!! Come for happy hour and you get some really really awesome deals.

We were craving Korean BBQ and stumbled across this place on Yelp. Decided to try it out since we saw good reviews. Don't regret it at all. The meat here is really good and prices are fairly reasonable! Great service and food came out pretty quickly. Would definitely come back here next time I'm in the area!

I've traveled to many places and I'm from the BBQ capital of the world: Texas.  This place is amazing and a staple for anyone yearning a wonderful atmosphere, great food, and exceptional service!

PSY needs to write a song about this GangNam Style!
We came here after a long day of traveling. Ate pretty much one of everything and could not have enjoyed it more! Take a taxi, limo, or just walk to Gangnam. It's delicious!
This place is Awesome! Love the kalbi and the bulgogi. The staff are always checkin if everthing is good.. I would definitely come back.

Went here based on the reviews on yelp. Very different and good. It's a pretty small restaurant across the street from Hard Rock. Customer service was on point. Lots of people there to serve you. Food is served to you raw and you cook on a gas grill in your table. They different items you can choose from Al la carte or as a group special. The specials are for parties of 2 or 4, we had a party of 3 and ordered the Premium and that was plenty of food for us. defiantly worth try.
Great food. Fantastic happy hour and nice atmosphere. Beef choice:bulgogi . aswell as edemame and gyoza. Has a really cool projector that shows the music videos of the songs that are playing

There was a great and friendly service. I loved all the different types of meats and side dishes there are. It's a good place to spend time with family/friends and barbecue together. Had a fun time on my birthday! Would definitely not mind coming back again!

Went straight to this place from the airport, and it did not disappoint! Quick service and pretty much everything from the small dishes to each item in the Gangnam package is exceptionally good. Will come back again in future.
Quick, yummy find in Las Vegas! Ordered bibimbap, steamed egg, and dumpling soup.  Server was pleasant and helpful with questions. Great find.
Service was excellent and the food was orgasmically delicious ! Must try chicken cheese fondue and Kobe beef carpaccio .

The reason why this place has almost 4,000 reviews is because they offer you a free macaroon ice cream sandwich in exchange for a review. Mystery solved. Now on to my actual review. Place is decorated nicely and makes for a great atmosphere. Husband and I decided on the Gagnam Special for Two. We were originally looking for an all you can eat Korean BBQ restaurant; however all the sheer amount of reviews for this place caught our attention and it happens to be a few doors down from one of our favorite sneaker boutiques. The food was good, high quality of meat with pretty good sides (kimchi being my favorite) and you get a LOT of it for what you pay for. I'm taking away a star for service. Our server was quick to drop off our bill when we weren't even halfway through the meal (we hadn't asked for it yet) but not quick to check on us..didn't do so once the entire time. Felt incredibly rushed as it was starting to become busy and you could tell they just wanted as many people in and out as fast as possible. I would come back during a less busy time. Left so much food on the table.
My first but last time here.  I went there because it stayed open late.  Terrible food, very friend staff.  Price not acceptable for what you get.

By far my favorite kbbq place in Vegas. I tried all of them: Hwaro, Tofu Hut, DJK, etc.

Pro: the price for the a la cart menu and the service. Oh and they can cook for you if you don't want to cook.

Con: your shirt will smell, but that's in avoidable if you want kbbq.

Def. recommend it.
Put up a review and get a free macaron ice cream. Food was nothing that you couldn't get elsewhere. Portions were a bit on the small side
My favorite place in Las Vegas. I really like the spicy seafood noodle. Yummy! A great place for friends and families. Definitely come again!
really good bbq in Las vegas！喜欢烤肉的朋友一定要来！两个人吃到撑！肉很嫩、还送马卡龙冰淇淋！服务态度很好！人很多，我们拍了一个小时的队！4点多到的！
Great happy hour menu and awesome service. First time in a Korean BBQ restaurant and the server kindly explained everything. Will definitely come back!
Luv the soup and dishes are so tasty , wanna try there BBQ next time:)) the kimchi was so great! I also like the ramen! It's so delicious! I recommend everyone come and try it out

Takes a while to get seated but that's because the food is so good. Had the Gangman special. Tons of food and the meat is exceptionally high quality and very tender. This is a wonderful place for a family or group.

First time having Korean BBQ and I must say that my wife and I truly had a great experience here. We came in during happy hour and our drinks were 50% off which was a big bonus. Meat and veggies tasted and looked really fresh. Would recommend this place to anyone.
Food is very good and service is amazing! I ordered the gangnam menu and it was very good quality and good food.
excellent service and food. the price is affordable. i like the mv displayed here. its the place to taste the true korean style bbq.
Great service, good food, awesome ambience. Ate and drank so much, we're leaving happy. Will come back!
Good food, & this place is awesome! I will come back here again. This is my 3rd time here. We always come back for the service and Happy Hour specials.
Service was fast and friendly. Our waters were never dry. Food tastes great for a good price. This place is a must try if you like Korean bbq.

Friendly service and delicious food, what more could you ask for? Highly recommend the beef bulgogi and the flat iron garlic. The deals are great for families of 4+ and the appetizers are a tasty way to pass the time while the meats cook. There is also a veggie section for vegetarians. 

Downside is the price. For the same price, you could get unlimited meats at most of the BBQ's in China town.

This was our first time at a Korean BBQ restaurant and it was fantastic. We came with a large group, ordered a variety of things off the menu, and were pleased with it all. I would definitely recommend coming here and will be back!

Everything was delicious! Major yum. We had a range of apps and all were great-- especially the fried calamari!! The dynamite shrimp was just that-- dynamite! And don't even get me started on the macaron ice cream-- mmmmmm!

Ordered a Meat Lovers special for 4 and a Bulgogi bimbimbap, fed enough for 6 people. Service was for the most part good, a little slow due to the Christmas Day lunch rush. But most importantly, food was delicious! I would recommend this place for Korean BBQ around Vegas. 

P.s. Ask for Jin, he's very nice and kind.

I just came first time, food was very quality and clean and excellent service. 
I defiantly come back soon.
Omgggg you get a free dessert if you review on Yelp! I came with my family for my dad's birthday because of the thousands of reviews. This free dessert promotion is probably why they have so many lol

First Time to try out, but korean food never disappoint me! Ordered spicy tofu soup, dumpling and seafood ramen. Good For lunch. So wanna try out the bibambap and the rib, but gonna be too heavy For lunch. Love the foodssss.

Overall, the meat is good, but I got to say it's kind of pricey. I would've prefer to go to a all-you-can-eat Korean bbq place where you would pretty much pay the same amount. I pay about 32 bucks tax and tip included for a meat lover meal shared between 4 people for 99 dollars. Overall, brisket was good.
This place is great! Food is delicious, and the free sides are a great addition to the meal. Has not disappointed ! Great lunch specials as well!

Great place for cusine BBQ
Fresh meats awesome atmosphere and more than enough helpful service.

At our trip to Las Vegas me and my family wanted to eat some korean food.

The meal at Gangnam BBQ was one of the best quality for price meals I have had at a korean restaurants in the states. Not only was the food very good quality but the price was more than reasonable. We had 5 ppl in our party and ordered a meal for 4 which was more than enough food for everyone. I didn't eat any rice and was completely full by the end of the meal. Also for reference I eat A LOT. The service was also very satisfactory with them changing out our bbq plate every few minutes and also serving us as quickly as possible. We also ordered a (Kimchi soup) which was more than tasty. The order included filet mignon, bulgogi, samgyupsal and other types of meat. It also came with dumplings Miso soup and salad. All of them were nice. The side dishes or  were honestly very mediocre except for the Kimchi however it was fine seeing as the main part of the meal was so delicious.

I really enjoyed the meal and I will definitely be back for more!!! 

PEACE!!

This place is amazing!  It's clean and stylish, unlike some of the BBQ I have been.  Now keep in mind they do not have AYCE, which is good because you don't have meat just lying out until it is all gone; quality control is what I would say about their meat!

Now for beginners or people who never been to a Asian BBQ style restaurant like this, I would suggest ordering al la carte first.  I know they offer combo meal but it's a lot of food and you may be gambling with what you "may" like or not like.  You can always order as you cook.  Service is excellent and they check up on you in timely manners.  That was a big plus for me...we all know that server at that restaurant where the server just keeps coming back and interrupting...well that is not the case here.  

As for location, it is situated in a shopping center that offers multiple eatery places, sushi, mexican, etc.  The only thing I would be caution on is that it is located across the street from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.  I can only imagine just how busy they may be during the weekend.  If you don't want to wait or be in a crowded situation, I would suggest going during the week days.  

The thought of them now while writing this review makes my mouth water again!  Hahaha!
Good food and great service. The ambience is modern and not as smelly as other Korean BBQ places. We ordered the miso beef and bulgugi. Must try the steam egg and enoki bacon.

This place is the bomb yo!



Lots of meat for a great price. Drinks are also well priced.

Nice ambiance, nice presentation.

Food is good! It's always warm because of the hot stone. You can even have them cook the meat for you which is convenient. Love the environment. Server was super nice! The food on the menu may look small, but it's shareable. I'd come back.
Was a great brunch! Great food all around with soup, kalbi beef and seafoods. Go gangnam bbq!!!
Service and food were both really good! Would recommend for anyone looking for high quality kbbq in Las Vegas :)
BEST EVER! Can't wait to come here when we are in town. It's a must try! Tuna Kimbop. Yum!! Prime Kalbi. Bulgogi ibis rice thing. Oh man!
First time at Korean BBQ and I loved it! Great food, great service. Highly recommended the spicy pork!

First off I don't like how they make you write a review in exchange for free dessert. This will prob. explain the 4000+ reviews! I feel like its totally unethical, and defeats the purpose of yelp. Anyway, me and a bunch of my friends got the Meat Lovers option and it was really good--my favorite I believe was the Beef Toro and some of the marinated meats. Filet Mignon was a little tough prob. because of how its grilled. Lettuce salad wasn't that great, but I did enjoy the seaweed salad. And the dessert which was a ice cream macroon (mango flavored) was delicious--reminded me of the one's at Trader Joes which I do like. Main bad thing was the location--you have to drive to this location so it's not convenient unless you have a car. Overall, if your craving kkbbq in Vegas-check this place out.
One of the best Korean restaurants I've been to in the US, close to what I had in Korea. Definitely recommended!

This place was wonderful and hit the spot just perfectly .  The desert was so good I had the banana tempura . The bacon wrapped asparagus was yummy and would recommend a marinated meat . Visiting from San Diego

I came here for happy hour (3-6pm, 10pm- close) based on all the great reviews. We called ahead to try to make a reservation, and were told that they don't take same day reservations but they weren't busy at the time so we came in anyways. 

We ordered beef toro, bulgogi, pork belly, and mushroom medley. We also had the chicken wings, fried calamari, and jalapeño poppers for apps. Each dish was $4 with the exception of the mushrooms ($2). The meats were really good quality, and my favorite was the bulgogi which was really tender and had a great marinade. The chicken wings were average, crispy but pretty bland. The poppers were filled with cream cheese and salmon with a tempura batter. The calamari were okay as well, but the breading was disappointingly flavorless, much like the chicken wings. The dipping sauce that came with it added some much needed flavor to the dish.

The service was relatively spotty. We were seated immediately and our waiter took our order quickly. Afterwards however it was kind of difficult to get anyone's attention as the restaurant became more busy, so we had to flag down someone each time we needed something. Our appetizers also came out way after the meats, so we were pretty much done with our food by the time our last appetizer came out.

Also keep in mind rice is not included when you order dishes a la cartel for happy hour. It's $2 for a bowl and 1 bowl is enough for 2 to share.

I must admit though that I think the reviews for this place are somewhat inflated because they give you a free desert if you write and show them a posted Yelp review. To avoid the inevitable awkwardness associated with showing your server an low or average review and the fact that you are getting a free desert, I feel like people naturally give this place a higher review than they normally would. Definitely wouldn't expect this place to be averaging 4.5 stars.

Overall Gangnam Asian BBQ is a solid restaurant for your Asian BBQ fix while in Vegas.

I don't usually give reviews unless it's absolutely bad. This place has horrible service. Asked how long is the wait, the waitress said she has no idea. Very rude. Looked at the food people are eating, average Korean BBQ. Noting fancy. Not worth going.

I enjoyed this place so much last week when I had lunch with friends I decided to come back with my husband today. This place is decorated nicely and food is good too. My favorite is the steamed kalbi.

Delicious, great service, and a sweet environment! Vacation perfect. Enjoyed the time with my friends. The waiters were very attentive, filling out water often and checking on us and the grill. This place is family friendly but could be great for a date night because of the quite low key environment. Food came out quickly and tasted great! Check this great place out next time you're in Las Vegas.

Service was nice. Food also had a lot of flavor and good amount for the price. 

Ordered the bulgogi bibimbap and was very flavorful. Would definitely order again. 

Side dishes were also good, not too spicy. Finally, server was nice and got our order ready quickly.
Food is great! Wait can be a little long if you have a big party (5+) because the building is small so it's best to call ahead. Learned the hard way :/ but overall good experience and ambiance.

Prime kalbi bbq is so good!! 
Bean paste soup is also tasty. 
But kimchi soup is s a little bit sweeter than what I expect. 
If you want to taste real Korean beef bbq flavor, I highly recommend to try Prime kalbi bbq. 
Enjoy!

I happen to be in vegas for a very large convention, and part of the enjoyment in my job is traveling city to city and trying the different restaurants available near my hotel.  After a very long day of setting up a new show I was starving!

I head back to my hotel at the Las Vegas Westgate, and first things first, I really needed to get out of my work clothes shower and just chill for a minute.  My co worker and myself ar both sitting in our hotel room, catching the end of the sunday night football game, smoking marijuana, and discussing what we want to eat.  We decide we are both craving asian (both food and women) and come accross Gangnam Asian BBQ Dining as a close and affordable option not too far from our hotel.  My co- worker and I are still just smoking weed and now were wrapped up in the NFL game (the giants were playing the niners and I have Carlos Hyde on my fantasy team and he got a late TD to make my lead pretty solid heading into MNF) and now its getting late.  We check the hours and are both pleased to see that Gangnam is open untill 1 am, and to top it off they have a late night happy hour starting at 10 pm.  "This is perfect!" Chris, My co-worker, says.  He continues, "We have time to smoke more pot, sit down and just be high for 5 minutes then realize we have to get going."

I thought to myself, "yes this is perfect by the time we get there the munchies should be fully kicking in, and I will have a nice hearty appetite for my meal."

Chris and I show up, looking fresh in our Hawaiian shirts ready to eat.  Our waitress sits us down and immediately recognizes our sweet shirts and asks us if we are from Hawaii.  We tell her "no" although chris is a quarter Hawaiian but we explain to her we are from California and are just visiting for the week.  She then explains to us that she is hawaiian and she just returned from visitng just a couple days prior. Anyways, conversation ensued, our waitress (she was like a solid 7) points out to us some of here favorite things on the menu.  I procede to order appetizers of their Calimari and the spicy tuna Kimbap.  Remember we are now incredibly stoned and I think this would of tasted great sober.  This tuna kimbap appetizer was absolutely fantastic, I highly reccomend!

So now we move on to the entrees.  I order the bacon wrapped scollaps, the Korean Chicken Fondue, and the Prime Kalbi.  My co-worker had also order the the Korean chicken and the kalbi, but his for his third dish he ordered the Harami Miso. Now I loved all tree things I ordered.  I enjoyed the mix i made myself with one beef dish, 1 chicken dish, and 1 seafood dish.  The chicken cheese fondue stood out as my favorite, while chris pointed to the Harami Miso as his favorite.  My only somewhat negative comment would be that the Prime Kalbi cuts I recieved seem to be a little to fatty for my liking making the meat really chewy. We washed our meals down with a pitcher of kirin.

Now after we finished with our meat cuts, it was time to move on to dessert.  I got the cofee flavored Ice cream sandwhich thing, and it was very tasty and was a nice cold snack to end the meal on.  

After dinner chris and I went back to our room to smoke more marijuana and stream Archer on netflix.

TL;DR: Got way too high off gravity bong rips in my hotel. Headed to gangnam and ate a lot of korean bbq. Got a free dessert for writing a review on yelp.
Great menu! The food was delicious. We chose the family portion which was perfect, even comes with soup

Felt like Korean BBQ tonight for belated valentines dinner instead of steak. Saw all the reviews on Yelp and the stars this place got so decided to try it out.
We order the Las Vegas for 2 and they do let you substitute, you just have to pay the difference! So that's a plus.
Overall it's good but I think I still prefer the all you can eat Korean BBQ places.

Food was delicious, lots of side dishes and great quality meat. Made it to late night happy hour from 10 p.m. to close where they have $3, and $4 specials and 50% off drinks

I am visiting from San Diego, and no this is not your traditional all-you-can-eat BBQ, as  they strive on quality and excellent service which I both received period recommended to anyone of any ethnic background

Ryan was also terrific and presented himself with excellent service and expertise.  If y'all haven't tried it you need to!
Very good Korean style BBQ. I like the spicy pork and Kobe style beef. Juicy and fresh.
Really really good korea foods and value for money. The spicy soup（beef）is my favorite，so delicious.
So so so good - the meat was beyond tender, service was great and happy hour prices are amazing!
The bibimbap was good. All the side dishes that comes as standard meal was good. Good bbq atmosphere.
Quick service and great quality for the price, especially during happy hour. Among the best deals of any kbbq place I've been!

Very  enjoyable & perfect service. Loved  the decor, & the videos on the wall in the waiting area was unique.
5 stars!
It's hard finding good food that's reasonably priced in many places, especially in Vegas, this place hits the mark on both!!
I am vegetarian and was skeptical of going to a Korean BBQ restaurant, but there were a lot of good vegetarian options! The service was also excellent.
Delicious food, large portion sizes, friendly service, awesome (kpop) music and ambiance! This place is great.
great location, great food, highly recommended!!来拉斯维加斯第一顿晚餐，十分不错，会再次光顾。

I love Korean food, especially Korean BBQ. Why you asked? Because of the variety of taste as you enjoy eating. I like to roll my meat in either rice paper or radish or both and clear my pallets with the condiments. This place, although the service was good, the food taste was not bad, but the lack of the essential Korean food restaurant experience was a turn down. For example, they don't have rice paper, radish, seaweed etc. Some of you might say that is not for you, understandable but it should be an option for some people. Anyway, if you like a relaxing experience and not picky about the food experience so much, this place maybe for you..
Delicious! Got the premium for 2! It was plenty for 2 people and so good! Definitely recommend and will be back next time we're in town!
Food was good! We ordered the Las Vegas for 2 and we were a Party of 3 and we still didn't finish everything. Lots of yummy sides... Meats were good

The food and service here every time I visit is excellent. The owner Patrick and his staff are awesome and always ready to serve and take care of their customers! I will never stop coming here! Whenever you are in Vegas, you have to stop by and check it out! Love it! :)

Soo worth leaving the strip. 

This was beyond my wildest meat dreams. We got the gangnam special (for 2). delicious af and perfect amount of food. Wish i lived in vegas i would become a regular here.
We ordered KALBI and SOONDUBU and it was delicious. Portions are relatively small and the wait was long but the food was worth the wait.

Arrived in Las Vegas from Los Angeles, got to our hotel and looked for a place to eat... They're the first one to pop up since our hotel is very close to this restaurant. Checked the reviews and decided right away to try the place... And guess what?! EXTREMELY SATISFIED!!! Especially that I am a big Korean Dish Lover!!! I enjoyed my Bulgogi Bibimbap! Really tasty! My family opted for some Bulgogi, Pork Belly and Brisket since they have a HAPPY HOUR SPECIAL!! This is such an awesome spot!! The meats are really tender and juicy! I loved the Pork Belly the most! The environment is really clean and the servers are really friendly and informative! They made sure that we know how the menu works. They also offer some Japanese dishes! But I recommend the Korean dishes more. The side dishes are also amazing, they are honestly to die for! I always go to Koreatown in LA and yes, it has the same quality as it is in KTown! Will definitely come back whenever I visit Las Vegas!!!
Awesome, top notch quality meat, delicious. Would highly recommend to anyone who likes Korean barbeque.

The meats are great and flavorful. The cold noodles and the tofu soup are also really nice. I would recommend it based on the quality of the food. Prices are average but not more expensive than the rest of the city. Maybe lunch specials would be nice as well.
Good food for its price. Everything tastes good. Beef toro is good. Love the corn. Write a review and you will get a free desert :) yummy

Great korean bbq restaurant. I recommend the meat lover combo for the meat lover. We ordered 2 more meat dishes and it was enough for 4 people. Very nice service and good complimentary side dishes. I would recommend the radish and the seaweed.

Stopped by here on our way back from Hoover Dam because it had 3000+ reviews.  It hit the spot, even my 6yr old son who's a picky eater was grubbing and got a kick out of us cooking tabletop.  It's near hard rock hotel in a shopping center with a CVS.
Great Korean BBQ place! Got one Gangnam special and it was awesome! Definitely hit the spot.

Came here yesterday, and the waiting hour was 3 hours! So we decided to come back the next day during happy hour. The wait is a little bit shorter.
Loves the harami miso, it melt in ur mouth. Not too salty or too sweet. Just perfect!
Their sauce is also good. 
The cons is that the waiting for the food to come out is kinda slow. 
But we'll come back again for sure when we visit Vegas!
The atmosphere is amazing and the food is great. Love being able to grill the food myself, it makes a great over all experience. Definitely coming back!

This is my go-to Korean BBQ place. It may not be all-you-can-eat, but it is most definitely worth the money.

I treated my parents and my sister the last time I came here. We got the Premium for 4 people for $160, and it was absolutely delightful. The wagyu beef virtually melted away in our mouths, the beef carpacchio was marinated just right, and the oysters were fresh and slippery. You can tell the meat here is of the highest quality. 

The service was flawless. Our servers were quick to bring our food and refill our drinks and took an extra effort to take pictures of our family on my request.

This place has great food and is just genuinely fun to be at (nice atmosphere plus activity food). I would recommend the bibimbap and the bulgogi (but all the meat was great). Service was great, very quick, and really nice

Whenever I'm in a big enough city, I start craving Korean food.  The GF had heard from some other folks that we should go to Sura, which we had gone to a few weeks earlier.  Sura was fine, but not good/great.

I had flown into Vegas, and per a mutual agreement, had not made any special Valentine's Day plans.  We ended up here for dinner, and there were probably 3 or 4 open tables.  We were quickly seated in the modern looking space.

The menu was interesting - they had the standard combo items, where you get a mix of meat and sides, but apparently when we were there it was happy hour, and they had items that were priced in the $3 to $8 so that you'd order a serving of beef toro, spicy pork, sides, etc  - almost felt like a tapas place, though obviously meat heavy.

Quality of the meat seemed a little better than Sura.  We were a little surprised that the kalbi/short-ribs had the bones removed, but that was fine.  All the meat and sides we had were good, and the gas grill worked fine.  I was also glad to see that they had spicy cucumber as a side, which is one of my favorite forms of kimchi.

The small plate style of ordering probably kept us from over-eating as much as an AYCE joint, but I was feeling nearly as full.

The one miss we had was that we had ordered white rice, but it didn't come out till we were almost done (which had included a second round of ordering).  I had asked about it earlier to one of the staff, and they nodded, and wandered away like they were on it, but didn't bring out any rice.  My guess is that they had gotten slammed at some point, and ran out of rice, so they had to make more, but that's only a guess.  No one said anything, and when they did bring out the rice near the end of the meal.

Overall, our damage with tip was an even $50, which was considerably less than the $72 we had spent at Sura, and I left feeling more satisfied with my meal.
Pretty good! The spicy tuna kimbap is a must try! The waiter was also really friendly as well. Overall I had a great time here!

In search of a nice Korean restaurant near Las Vegas, my family and I stumbled upon this restaurant after asking our tour guide. By far, the best Korean BBQ place we've tried since landing in Vegas. 
The kalbi we had was amazingly tender and the kimchi jigae we had was a lot better than most of the restaurants in NY. At first, all of us were a bit hesitant on whether or not the kimchi jigae would have tasted good, but it came out to be far better. 
We will definitely visit this place more often for more delicious Korean BBQ.
Nice environment, tasty food and delicious dessert. The 2 person combo is good for me and my friends, we love it!
Great service, delicious food. My nail salon expert recommended it, I am so glad he did. I will definitely recommend it to others

WOW. I can safely say we ordered everything on the menu and ATE EVERYTHING! Our favorites were the sukiyaki beef noodles, original bibimbap, spicy pork, squash tempura, and the free side of tofu. Amazing value, and this review got me a free macaroon dessert!
Their food was amazing. This was a spontaneous moment for this type of food and I couldn't have chosen a better spot. Must go.
We arrived around 12 and waited about 30 min! The food is good the environment is great!
Great side dishes! The meat was ehhhh. Great and fast customer service. My server's name was Back and he's extremely nice.

I think this is one of the better kbbq places in town. My first visit was maybe a couple years ago and since then I've tried a handful of places and tonight I realized that this should be my go to spot for Bbq. Service is great the reverse happy hour menu items are reasonable and there is a variety to choose from. 

The set menu options are also great with a variety of meat items and appetizers to choose from. Just seems a little pricey. We ordered the meat lovers for two people and it was more than enough for the three of us. Meat was seasoned perfectly not bland or too salty. And the side dishes are ample. Definitely will be back here more often.

This is my first time at this Korean bbq.  I have to say that it was delicious!!!!  A lot of food for the money but well worth every penny.  I will definitely be coming back to this place the next time I'm in Vegas.

This place was really great. The service was fast, and the food was delicious. My roommate is from Korea, so I've eaten my fair share of authentic Korean BBQ, and I must say, this place sends pretty legit. Definately one of the better Korean BBQ restaurants I've been to.
Awesome. Must try. Definitely worth a try. Korean BBQ!!! Must I say more. If you live for korean food and not go here you're missing out big timeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!
Very good quality K-BBQ.  Ordered "Meat Lover for 2" and was more than enough food to feed the family with a teen Alger and a toddler.  Will definitely visit again the next time in Las Vegas

I had never had Korean BBQ before, and was in Vegas for a conference, so when a co-worker suggested it, I jumped at the chance. Gangnam did not disappoint. The decor was lovely; dark (and blessedly cool!) and nicely appointed. Seats were very comfortable. I had never seen the bbq trays on the table before. 
Fortunately, my co-worker knew what to order, and she made some recommendations that were just fantastic. I had bulgogi (pork) with a mushroom medley that was absolutely delicious. The portions were very generous, too. It was fun cooking the food on the little bbqs.
Service was a bit slow, but the poor waitress was having problems with their cash register; she apologized and explained what the issue was, so we were forgiving of the situation.
The lunch special was very reasonable, considering the amount of food we received and the quality of it. We were extremely happy campers when we left and went back to the conference. I told myself that next time I go to Vegas, I will *definitely* be back to eat here.

BUT.... the REAL gem of this experience occurred two weeks later, when I got back to work and submitted my receipts. I had misplaced the credit card receipt (still had the itemized one) and my work was on my back bugging me for the credit card receipt. I contacted the restaurant with my pathetic request and the gentleman who answered the phone was very understanding, and sent me a reprint that satisfied the dragons in Accounting. So... GREAT food, outstanding portions, good value for the money - and EXCEPTIONAL customer service. Gangnam, I hope you open a restaurant in Ventura, California someday!! I will definitely be back to visit!!
The food is very good at GangNam, I really like their Korean Prime Kalbi, and the price is very valuable. I will totally recommend this place if you are looking to grab some Korean BBQ in Vegas!
Great selections of meat. Best miso of my life(I don't even like miso). P.S. They play a lot of Taylor Swift but that shouldn't stop you from coming and having good Korean bbq. Boom!
Great food at an affordable price. Great atmosphere! Would definitely come back! Excellent place off the strip.

Workers are super friendly. Food is yummy. Service is great. 
Ordered the meat lovers for 2 and everything is delicious. Highly recommend it.
The mushroom medley was a bit to buttery though.
Excellent restaurant. We got the Las Vegas packaged for 6 and it was more than enough for 7 people. We had plenty left over. It was good quality food and great service

This restaurant really satisfied my craving for Korean BBQ. It is more than just BBQ place! My sister also went crazy about how good looking the waiter(s) here. Definitely worth a visit if u want a good korean (asian) bbq experience in Las Vegas!
Fantastic atmosphere and food. We had 20 minutes wait time, but the taste and side dishes were worth it. Would come back again!

Great place and massive portions for the price. The set for two could easily feed three or even four I would think. Don't forget to ask for the sesame oil/salt or gochujang sauces if you prefer those since it's not provided by default.

The service is uber friendly and helpful. Ambiance and decor is stylish and enjoyable. The food is excellent! The filet is wonderful and the bulgogi very tasty. All of the sides make for a real authentic experience. I could have eaten tge pickle all night. A must for excellent off the strip dining.

Came in for a late lunch to a fairly quiet restaurant, with only one server who was hustling his few tables and doing an excellent job juggling them. 

We ordered Bibimbap ($12) and spicy Sukiyaki Noodles ($9), our server tossed the dishes for us on their sizzling hot plates, brought us hot tea and let us eat our enormous portions in quiet recovery (this IS Vegas after all, who isn't having breakfast at early dinner time, and nursing some form of hang over?). 

As the restaurant got busier, our solo server got some help as a new guy started his shift, and we weren't forgotten in the hustle.

The interior of the restaurant is soothing, Asian minimalism, a nice balance between Japanese and Korean stylings, as is the food. I love trying restaurants off the strip in Vegas, as they are SO much better quality and pricing than anything near the touristy parts. 

Gangnam was so much more appetizing than anything we could have hoped for on a post-EDC weekend  ;D

Located in the corner of a mini-mall, if you love legit, delicious, fine Asian dining, you MUST come here!

I've had Korean BBQ before and this by far exceeded my expectations. The staff was exceptionally friendly and honest with their recommendations. I loved the fact that we got to do our own cooking! The meat was well seasoned before hand and the appetizers were great! I would definitely recommend it!
Great food, good taste. Gangnam set is enough for 2 people. Service is ok. Sides arrived right away after we finisshed ordering. Kimchi side dish is fabulous.

Nothing special.. i ordered duck, brisket, pork and some dishes. Side dishes was good but meat wasn't fresh. brisket was too thick and tough duck was like chicken breast. I maybe come back for side dishes but not a bbq.
Dinner was bomb!!! Happy hour & bulgogi style!!! With their delicious calamari. Definitely the perfect dinner! =)
Good food!!! Servers are nice! I reccomend the pork belly and the beef toro. Nice decor/atmosphere

We come here because of my friend's recommendation and their over 2300 reviews on Yelp. Nice and clean. Good food. Serve very fast and the staffs are friendly. 
The reason why I don't give them 5 stars because squid and pork belly are not really fresh.
Great food and great service! The marinated short ribs were amazing :) and I loved their 3 dipping sauces.
Great appetizers, and good pescetarian options, nice value. Plus the deserts are super bomb. Service left something to be desired.

The food is delicious!! But, the service leaves something to be desired. I know the tip was already included because our group was 8 people, but that doesn't mean they could slack off. We literally were clearing our own plates from the table. And when we asked to have the table cleared before dessert, we just received a confused look. They definitely did not deserve the 18% tip.

Saw this restaurant on Yelp and it sure didn't let us down! Servers are super friendly and the food is delicious! I got the kimchi chigae and it was slightly on the sour side, but I loved it. My friend got the soft tofu soup and the soup base was very unique! It didn't taste like it was only cooked with spices. Overall a great restaurant and would definitely come again when I visit next!

Food is phenomenal.  Reminds me of past visits to Korea.   I'd highly recommend this to anyone visiting Las Vegas.  Staff was courteous and very helpful.   You can't go wrong with anything on the menu.
The gangnam restaurant is very good and tasty. the side dishes are really good and I enjoyed the barbeque
Great bbq. Happy hour is the real deal. $4 for pork belly, bulgogi or beef toro. $3 for veggies. And $9 pitcher of Sapporo.

It's a clean contemporary restaurant.  Service is good and the food is really good. Good selections with a large amount of food. It's my second time coming here, and both times were an excellent experience.
First time coming to this place and the Oysters is a must!! Beef very tender. Big portions. Definitely will come back!! Will definitely recommend this place to my friends!

Come here during happy hour this is he best Japanese bbq!!! From the happy hour menu the bulgogi is AMAZING followed by the spicy pork! Can't beat the 8$ pitcher of sapporo;) the jalapeño poppers are great to start of with :)

So much fun! So much food! We had 6 hungry people, and the amount of food brought to our table (we ordered the Premium combo) was enough to feed 10 of us! Everything was delicious. Service was great. It is in a strip mall, so we were hesitant that we were missing out on the typical touristy Vegas experience by choosing this instead. We had a great time and would absolutely recommend it!

The food was really good, the Korean flavour really stood out. The beef was so tender but the pork was the best dish. The sauce was what made it so great. The service was not the best, it was quite slow.
Very tasty and a great value when compared with the overpriced food at the casinos.  Lots of variety.  A good choice for a group of people.
Great restaurant. Great barbecue. This is definitely the best korean bbq in Las Vegas. Great service as well.

The best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas.  We ordered their most important combo for 2 and it was worth every penny.  Kobe beef and Kobe carpaccio was delicious.  Would definitely come back when we are in the mood for Korean food.
Good and lots of food. very good service as well.  got the meat lover and came with 6 different meats, all the sides, salad, miso and rice.
I went to use the ladies' room and had to wait for a very long time. Finally, the person in the restroom came out and it was a MAN! He was an employee of the restaurant and was not apologetic at all.

Food was average at best. The low rating was for the horrendous service and bogus 18% gratuity (for a group of 4) at a restaurant where you cook your own food.  We had to constantly get the attention of our servers because they never checked up on us.  Any request we made had to be asked at least twice before thy actually fulfilled it.  We were finished with our meal for 20 minutes and nobody stopped by until we got the attention of one of the servers and asked for check.  Then after submitting my credit card, I had to wait another 15 minutes to get it back.  I'll reiterate, the service here is awful and I will not return.

Omg! Best Korean I've ever had and prices are fantastic. Adding this to one of the restaurants I will be coming too every Vegas visit. Damn, that bulgoki... Addictive like crack but without the terrible consequences...

We tried meat lover set menu and it was great!
The complimentary side dishes were very tasty as well.
Fresh BBQ meat; other dishes are also fresh and cooked well. Great service; nice, clean and comfortable restaurant to enjoy dinner with a family.

Great location, the ambiance is perfect, the food was amazing, and the service was great!! Extremely accommodating toward our party and very friendly!! I would highly recommend to anyone and can't wait to come again!!
