This place is so close to where I live so I was very excited to check it out with all the good reviews. Came here for their nightly happy hour after 10pm. Ordered cream cheese wonton, mushroom medly, jalapeño poppers, calamari, pork belly, beef toro, spicy pork and Korean chicken cheese fondue.

Cream cheese wonton: All it was is wonton wrapper with literally only cream cheese inside, fried and served with sweet sauce. Pretty bland and disappointing. 1/5

Mushroom medly: Just different types of mushrooms that was mixed with melted butter. 2/5

Jalapeño poppers: Pop of deliciousness! Jalapeño sliced in half stuffed with cream cheese and crab and deep friend drizzle with sweet dressing. 5/5

Calamari: Crispy calamari with the spicy mayo dip sauce, average. 3/5

Pork belly: So good, you can never go wrong with pork belly. Slapped this on the grill and once crispy on both sides... With rice it's amazing. 5/5

Beef toro: Basically brisket... My friend enjoyed this very much. 4/5

Spicy pork: Meh 2/5

Chicken cheese fondue: Grilled the chicken and cheese however once dipped into cheese it was way chunky and not good. Aye the chicken alone. 1/5

Overall the food was ok, but I prefer Korean BBQ at tofu hut. The dipping sauces don't really stand out to me, one was sweet and one  is spicy... But I still love my sesame dipping sauce at tofu hut. The quality of meat is better but as far as the taste, tofu hut is way better. I didn't know during happy hour they don't give you rice? I had to ask for rice for both of us, but my server only came back with one bowl of rice... So we split the rice. 

Overall, this place is good... My first time trying Japanese BBQ.

My sister, cousin and I swung into Gangnam on a Friday around 7pm, famished and ready for meat in our mouths. After being promptly seated and minor hemming and hawing over the menu, we decided to order the meat lover's combo for 2, a hot sake, and beer for sake bombs to start our weekend. Between 3 people, we opted for the combo for 2 because we figured we could always order more and didn't want to get too gluttonous by ordering the combo for 4. 

First came the booze, then the side dishes, then all of the meat. The grill heats up very quickly, however it is only hot in the middle and burns the meat rather quickly. Also, don't bother with the onions and assorted sliced veggies; they will burn too. Those aside, my favorite was the spicy pork. Everything else was decent, but not standout. The side dishes are standard and decent too, but the waiters did not come to refill them until we flagged them down.

Their sound system is not very good. They alternated between old school hip hop/R&B and Kpop, which are both my jam but the low sound quality actually irked me a bit. 

Given the many options for dining in Vegas, I likely wouldn't come back here unless I had a huge hankering for kbbq when in town.

This place blew me away. The server was new but the other staff helped her out and the food was awesome. The Korean BBQ was excellent  and the place was super nice. Eventually I did notice some leftover grease splatters that took away from the ambience, but it was high above the tables.... but don't touch the wall light. It's gross. 


You may need to ask for water refills.

Great for any foodie.

Worst customer service I have ever had. The host does not how to work the waiting list. We were there for 2 hours when they told us it will be an hour waiting in line. There was like 10 people before us, left their name then went off somewhere while we were there for the entire time. They didn't even take out the name of whoever does not show up but keep waiting for that person to come. That is not how customer service work. You will lose more business it is how you decide to run it that way. The worst thing is to let customers who have been waited for a long time to see someone shows up, and claim that its their turn to be seated. It doesn't matter how good your food is, but if the customer has bad experience even before he or she can taste the food the business already fail.

Great food n service! The severs are super attentive and nice. We just got in town and try to make a reservation but they say they don't do same day, only walk ins. I told them it's a large party they say they will give us a call back to let us know if they can or not. They did n made the reservation for us. So glad that we found this place, good deals great food n great service!

Everything was on point here! The steak and bulgogi was amazing! The side dishes were also amazing... Basically everything is amazing... However, the Mac n cheese was the best... I can't even describe the sensation in my mouth!

Amazing food choices. Not all you can eat but feel good after the choices of meats and seafood I made. Good quality and service. Room ambience is nice with new music and good decor/color. Just to share what I ate was beef toro, bulgogi, salmon wrapped in bacon and calamari as an appetizer! Thumbs up to this place
Nice style for decoration. Nice serves.  But all source is all sweet. Meets are good flavor.  They need more serves they are too busy for  us.

great food, great price, great service :)
never have authentic korean before but this one is awesome!

We were looking for a korean restaurant for my MIL's bday.  We didn't want to overpay for crappy food at Ginseng.  So I yelped around and found this gem.  I had no idea what to expect and trusted yelp (like I do most of the time).  I called and made a reservation for 13 on a Saturday night.  The dinner turned out great and I would definitely return. For Vegas standards, this is a good KBBQ place.
Restaurant/Ambiance:  Its located right off the strip (convenient) but towards the back of the lot.  Kinda hard to see.  Restaurant is not a hole-in-the-wall type of place.  Kind of dark with all tables having a BBQ grill top.  We were fortunate enough to be given the private room in the back.  I think it can comfortably seat 15 or so with 2 grills.  It worked out well since we had a couple of small kids.  My only knock was that the table height was kinda high for the chairs.  They had tons of pillows to supplement, but made it just a tad awkward.  The place was initially empty around 5:30pm, but quickly filled up and there was a wait by the time we left around 7pm.  
Service:  Service was ok.  Not up to LA standards but decent.  I thought we would get a dedicated server for our group, but through the evening, the servers would rotate to help us out.  Grills were switched out when asked.  Here they do not cater to you and cook your meat for you (like most of the LA BBQ places).  Food came out quite rapidly.  They didn't clear out our plates, but we had a table on the side that we just set all of the empty dishes.  The banchan was never refilled (we never asked).  Water was refilled when requested.  They had a really nice birthday comp (4-5 ice cream macaroons with candle).  All in all, service was decent.
Food:  In a large group, you have to go with the preset menu.  We opted for the Gangnam BBQ package for 6 (next to highest package).  This came with a lot of appetizers and side dishes and 5 cuts of meat.  The appetizers included: oysters (good size ones and pretty fresh in quality), shishito peppers (really good per one of the guests), fried calamari (crunchy and meaty.  Nice spicy mayo dipping sauce too), miso soup, salad, and bulgogi bibimpap.  I really liked the bulgogi pap.  Basically meat and rice.  The cuts of meat included: bulgogi, kalbi, unmarinated steak, marinated/unmarinated prime steak.  I wished they would have included chadol as one of the selections.  YOu couldn't really substitute anything.  The meat quality was pretty good.  Good amount.  They also included 3 different dipping sauces. 
Value:  If it wasn't for the combo package, I think it could have gotten a tad pricey.  You have to pay for the banchan.  I requested sahm and sahm jang, and they charged me for that.  We did the 6 person combo with 10 adults.  But we ordered a lot of other things on top (udon, 2 different soups, and more rice).

All in all, a great korean BBQ restaurant in Las Vegas.  I would def make reservations ahead of time.

Location is easy to find , close to the strip and near airport in a shopping mall . Our favorite dish was the bi bim bop which was large and served in a good sized round pan instead of a bowl shape so there was a lot of surface area for the rice to get crispy against the iron pan, just how we like it . The bbq at table has good ventilation.  We walked in without reservation and were seated promptly . We enjoyed our dinner here. Even got free dessert with Yelp review... Bonus.
The only complaint is the tables are enormous making it hard to have conversation. But it's a ton of good food for a reasonable price. The chicken was particularly tasty. Nice find off the strip!

This is definitely the best Korean bbq my friends and I have had in a long while. We came in to visit a friend and saw the great reviews so decided to try it. This place far exceeded our expectations! We ordered 8 different meats for the 4 of us, 2 appetizers, and some soup and it was just the right amount of food for us. Each person gets their own set of tongs as well so one person doesn't get stuck cooking the whole time. Also, it's cheaper than most of the places we've been in Arizona and California which is a plus.

Best korean BBQ place in Vegas. After working at the trade show we were pretty hungry around 3pm. So not like the reviews we didn't had to wait for the table. Prime galbi was amazing and the kobe uni was my first time trying and it melt in. Gotta try for sure. They are on top of seaweed paper, sweet galbi with Uni on top.
On vacation here for EDC weekend this was a great dinner to close off our week. The food was great and it was fun cooking my own food.

Great food and service.  

Make sure you don't mind smelling like barbecue when you leave.   You will be Grilling your food.  
They will bring your choice of meat.   All choices are excellent.   
Banana tempurA for desert a no fail choice.
Tasty Korean food with good service. The place is a little smokey but that makes it feel more authentic like a real meat place in Korea.
Food was awesome! Salmon wrapped bacon was the bomb dot com! Services was great too! Ambience was nice as well.

Best korean bbq in vegas!
Good service!
Good interior!
Good food!
Highly recommend for any one.
Kobe beef is so good. And tuna is so good. And u will get free dessert if u rate it on Yelp!

Worst service ever took longer than average. Rice was over cooked as well. Good was subpar. Not going back there again. . Parking and location was fine. Very disorganized crew. Needs to attend better care with customers.
Service here is amazing. The drinks are so cheap. They use high quality meat. This place heaven for meat lovers. Highly recommened!

This is hands down rhe best korean restauraunt in town.. been living in vegas for 5 years i havent seen food quality this good with  variety to pick from bbq to authentic korean cusine. Also the service is one of the best i ve had look for server Jin he makes me want to come back everytime(; overall this is one of the best TASTING and CLEANEST korean bbq ive been to!!!
Best Korean restaurant I have ever been. Super tasty beef with a fair price. By the way, deliver food in 5 minutes, impressive.

Holy moly no wonder there are so many 5 star reviews of this place on Yelp!

If you have time while you're in Vegas and want to get KBBQ, come here! It's not AYCE but the portions for the set menus are more than enough. It's even numbers so 2 or 4 people (or 6). The tables aren't really meant for more than 6 people though it doesn't seem so don't go with too big a party unless you're willing to sit at different tables. 

Otherwise, just go here already. Don't bother reading my review or any of the other 4000+ reviews. Just go and order a set and any other extras you want. You'll be satisfied, guaranteed. Not only is it good, but the price is great considering you don't have to eat on the strip. Just do it.
The meat quality is good and the service is decent.  The steamed egg is bit overcooked.  Other than that the overall experience is great.

We went off the strip for our final meal before leaving Las Vegas on Thanksgiving weekend.  This Korean BBQ restaurant is on Paradise Road just behind the northern strip hotels.  

Although the strip mall it is located in seemed busy, the restaurant itself was pretty vacant for a Sunday night at 6:30PM.  

They gave us a menu with "happy hour" pricing on most of the food packages, which I'm not sure if that is given at all times or not.

Anyway, 4 stars.  The decor is really nice, the service is very attentive, the food was great.  They bring all the food to you. The Miso Soup was delicious. The meats were brought to our table, and they ask if you want assistance in cooking them at your table; however, we declined and cooked them ourselves.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  

Minus one star for one reason only.  I thought the prices were a bit high with the "happy hour" pricing.  If the prices are truly higher during peak hours, I would definitely not come back.  At the "happy hour" prices, I would consider a return, although it is still a bit expensive for what it is.
Love this place. Real surprised at how good Korean bbq could be. This definitely goes down for one of the best meals I've ever experienced. Meat lovers is great! Bibimbap is the best I've ever had!

Came here for the first time. I can say this is one of the best Korean restaurants I've ever been. Service is good, and the food is bomb. But, if you don't like to wait for a long time, I don't suggest you to come during dinner time cuz they get really busy. I came around 5pm to avoid the wait. Would def come back here again

It's Asian/fusion style now where you can pick what kind of meats and dishes you want.  It's not terrible, but I want daenjang jigae not miso soup with my kalbi.  The fried rice thing sounded fun but I wasn't a fan.  Not bad, but definitely disappointing if you want Korean barbeque.
Trying this restaurant for the first time! 7 ban chans offered. Lunch special is reasonable price for the amount you get.

Great food great service and great beer! 
All the the servers were very nice. 
Coming from LA, there aren't many others bow places compared to this one.
Been here a couple times now and I have never left disappointed. Great selection and good quality meat with a cold beer to wash it down makes this gal very happy!

Good vibes, good music. Servers are awesome! The meat is good, considering it's in Vegas. The appetizers aren't as authentic but it's good if you don't look at it culturally. Take advantage of the happy hour and get drinks half off! Booze and fountain drinks are all half off~

This is the best Korean restaurant I've ever been!!!!!!!! The side dishes are great; the appetizers are awesome; the BBQ meat is so fresh and juicy. 

We ordered steamed egg, chicken karage, and tuna kimbap for starters. Omgosh, they were all a fantastic. We ordered scallops, Korean prime kalbi, sweet corn, and enoki with bacon. I have never had such great kalbi before. The meat is so juicy and palatable, and I ate the meat with the sesame veggies in the house... it's like a taste of heaven. 

Recommend recommend recommend!!!!

We came here after reading the reviews and it was amazing! The place is clean. Service was good and quick. But most of all, the food was so flavorful!!! You've got to try this place! Amazing food with a huge menu which we can't wait to try next time.

Service was great and we were glad we can early on. Saturday as the place started to fill up.

Definitely recommended and now a favorite going forward when in Vegas!
Awesome good food but the wait was a bit long so be prepared to wait. Meat was tasty and the kimchee and soybean soup was good.  Side dishes were typical but also tasty.
Food was good and the service was great! Enjoyed the Gangnam for 6 people even though we had 7. I would recommend this place if you're looking for a Korean BBQ place in Vegas.
Very good place. Nice service & great tasty! Cheap price! There are good interior. The foods were very fresh! I like there so much~!
One of the best Korean BBQ places I've ever been to, with great customer services! All the workers are extremely friendly, and the food is bomb!

This is my first review on Yelp. The people were nice and efficient. It was my last meal in Las Vegas. There were 4 of us, so we doubled up on the Gangnam lunch and we ordered the awesome food! Thank you for the tasty food! I would like to come back this restaurant again.:)
The best Korean BBQ place in Vegas, first time we been here and everything was great! Food and customer service is excellent! I highly recommend this place! :)
Third visit here. Attentive, wonderful staff and the most mind blowing bulging and tuna kimbap!
Great Place. Awesome customer service. Delicious Dinner. Excellent BBQ. I came with my sister. She loves this place and I do too.
The food is good, but the service is tooooo slow!!! Not recommend if you are not free for a 2 hour dinner!

I love it here. Expensive but worth it. Service is awesome and quality is amazing. They even gave us ice cream macarons which are heavenly. I would definitely come back and tell all my friends. I was really happy when i left because it was a great experience for us!

First off, the service was great. The waitresses were observant and cared to our every needs and demands. They smiled while they walked and we're all around the perfect waitresses.

The food was amazing. The meat was high-class and the side dishes were great. The meat was marinated to perfection. The spicy tuna kimbap was tasty and an amazing take on Korean-Japanese fusion. The fresh oysters tasted amazing and this is coming from someone who doesn't particularly enjoy oysters. The steamed egg was delicious and filling. 

I definitely recommend this place. It was tasty and not that pricey when compared to the quality of the food. If you're looking for a good Korean/Japanese restaurant, definitely come and enjoy.

Amazing place, the meat is so tender, and the vegetables are delicious. I would recommend getting TWO or Even THREE orders of the mushroom medley, it's spectacular, you won't get enough. Definitely coming back here again on my next trip to Vegas.

Great food. Everyone ahould tried if have chance
Great meat plates and many sides dishes to die for
10/10 would recommend. it's lit. combo for two could feed a party of four. it's hella lit.

Yummy food! The meal sets are large so consider that when ordering. We ordered the Meat Lover set for 6 and we were a party of 10. The restaurant is clean and the employees were polite! Thanks for the quick and attentive service!

Almost no wait! Yeah!!! The line last night was super long with a 2 hour wait! 
We tried our luck again today and waited maybe10 mins:) early dinner at 4:20pm tho!
We ordered the white peach sake. Wow! Do delist! Be prepared, it's the size of a wine bottle!
We love Korean BBQ. And have had the best at Parks in Los Angeles. We ordered the Las Vegas combo for 2. It's a lot of food! Perfect spicy chicken yum!!!
Loved the sides. Attentive staff. Great tasting food. No wonder the wait was 2 hours! We will be back!
Love love love this restaurant. To me the chef still cooks from the heart. Service is fabulous, food so mouth salavating....mmmmmmhmmmmm!!! Sides are on point

Wandered into this place because Ferraro's was closed and I was extremely satisfied. Awesome happy hour with a lot to choose from. Everything here tastes fresh and the service is fast and attentive too. We will be back!

Just walking by to see what Gangnam had to offer when the friendly hostess popped outside and talked us into coming in for dinner. I'm so glad that she did. Second day of being open, and they are killing it! Really fresh decor, SUPER friendly staff, neat concept for dinner. We tried the stir fried sukiyaki veggie udon noodles, spicy garlic edamame, mushroom medley, BBQ rib eye, and the Korean honeyeyed pancake with ice cream.  Everything was so incredibly tasty. The sauce on the udon noodles was so delicious and the veggies were fresh and cooked to perfection. The edamame was the perfect appetizer. I would definitely recommend to give this place a try.   I really hope that they do well- I can't wait to go back!
Happy tummy as always.. steam egg and  chicken karage is another my favourite dishes, evetything is good, the service also good

Excellent service and food! Some of the best Korean BBQ I have had since moving back to America from Korea.

We just enjoyed an amazing lunch here. We ordered Kobe beef carpaccio to start, which really started the lunch off right. It was tender and flavorful... I would definitely recommend it. I would also recommend the pork belly and prime kalbi, but all the meats we tried were delicious!

Oh, and the interior is a plus too. I love the modern look and mix of American and Korean pop music played through music videos on a projector screen. Great place to go with friends!

This place is amazing! Great food, wonderful service, and delicious dessert. 

They have a good variety, there is definitely something for everyone. 

Also, the atmosphere is very comfortable and welcoming.
Awesome food. Quick and friendly service!  We will be back!  We had never been to a BBQ spot like this before. All the staff and food was great.

This place does happy hour on food 7 days a week! Til 5pm then 10-2am.  Really yummy, clean and nice. I don't feel uncomfortable for being a white girl at Korean BBQ like I do at other joints in town. Really friendly guy waiter every time I come here late night. Sapporo on draft too!
Food was awesome, service was very attentive! Great late night dining spot too.  Get the Kobe beef!

Awesome food and great service. Clean and like the atmosphere and ambience. It was a good portion if you're not used to the eat all you can. For a tasting menu type of person that my fiancé and I are, we enjoyed the quality of meat and food amount of food it offered. We enjoyed the Kobe beef. If you are hungry and looking for a hearty meal, go elsewhere. Otherwise, it was good.

Fantastic KBBBQ. Great flavor, the grill is perfectly designed and the rates are decent. Expect to spend 20 per person at the  least. You enter to a nice aroma of the food and you leave with a great taste of meat in your mouth. If you've never tried Korean BBQ before, you owe yourself to experience this self grilling experience!!
Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas! Service is excellent, prices are great and the food is delicious. Will definitely be back again for more!
Its so great and authentic korean food. I would like to go one more time. It is so fantastic food experience.

The service here was exceptional for a korean restaurant!!!!  Definitely recommend to others. Try the pork toro and prime kalbi.. they were two of our favorites! For four people, we ordered the gangnam (for two), the seafood tofu soup, and two orders of pork...plenty of delicious food!
Very delicious and not too expensive! Food taste very good too! I came here about 5 times and i thought it was pretty  cheap for meats.

It was our first time here, not gonna lie; we were kind of worried. However the Korean Prime Kalbi* sold me over! I don't know what kind of sauce they marinated with but it adds great flavor. Definitely coming back here!

Everything about this place lived up to my expectations. My husband and I came for our wedding anniversary. I have been counting the days down until I can indulge into some gangnam style....pause. 

We ordered pork belly, filet mignon, salmon wrapped in bacon, tempura kabocha, oysters, the spicy chicken wings, spicy garlic edamame, and the famous spicy tuna kimbap! First of all, spicy tuna kimbap is mmmmbop good! It's a roll of seaweed with rice in it fried into a tempura with spicy tuna atop. It was deeelish if you are a fan of raw fish, especially the spicy tuna flavor. It is a MUST GET when you come. You failed if you didn't order it to give it a shot. Don't expect the sizes of the meat to be on steroids. The meat are sliced so when you grill it yourself it doesn't take forever to cook. I think the portioning were perfect enough so you could indulge and enjoy whatever other items you ordered; therefore, you weren't meat overload. Unless, you came in with your carnivorous spirit on green.

All the side dishes (banchans) come free with the meal were delicious as well. I don't know if these side dishes are on a daily rotation, but we received 6 different servings of side dishes. These were bean sprouts, kimchi, kimchi like cucumber, Mac salad, radish (daikon) in a pool of some sweet sauce, and cuttlefish. The cuttlefish was so tender. It was my fave out of the banchans. I mean honestly, I don't think I was breathing as I was scarfing my food down. 

We came in on a Tuesday evening. The ambiance was perfect. If you've been following my reviews you'd probably know by now that I come from a family of 6. I'm raising 4 boys and a husband. Lol. So this quiet time, is so much needed! It wasn't overly busy when we walked in. But as the night progressed so did the patrons. On a Tuesday night to have such business tells you something. The servers were great. Checked on us as often enough to not make me start secretly grumbling as a waiter approached. They were very good at clearing your table off of empty dishes so that was great as I dislike clutter. They did seem a little overly eager on certain parts such as the grill being used or not, but hey...I get it. Don't wanna char the grill or waste propane. That'd be equivalent to me telling my kids to turn the light off if no one is in the room. Except, we still had pieces on the grill that still needed grilling. My husband and I did give each other a look after awhile. But no biggy. 

I'd come back over and over until they give me reasons not to. The facility is clean. The colors are very zen like and I love that they have a projector screen of music videos playing. They played a mixture of rap and kpop. 

Good vibe, great food...you won't be disappointed. You do receive a free dessert if you post a yelp review then show to your waiter. So do it! It is a fun experience watching your husband "cook" for you for once! ;)
Good food, fair prices. Need to try the BBQ on my net visit. The Spicy ramen noodles and appetizers were good!
Ive tried many Korean BBQ places and this place ranks up there with the best. Customer service is spot on as well.  Rather than me ranting about this and that i suggest giving it a try.

First time here at Gangnam and definitely impressed. If you believe you're a grill master this is your spot. You get to grill your choice of meat and you cannot go wrong with what you choose. Besides the food being tasty, the employees are friendly and enthusiastic.

So I picked this place on our weekend getaway with the family. This place didn't make any fake reviews after dining here.  Our server Andrew was awesome! It didn't take long for us to be served. He explained the menu clearly. Kids loved the food. Complimentary side of squid was pretty tasty. I just wish they had the rice paper available. All in all it was a nice dining experience.
Went there for happy hour.  Chicken was tender, beef toro was chewy as leather.. But chicken was a good deal and good too.

Gangnam by far is the best Korean BBQ I have ever had!  I have been to many kbq restaurants in Vegas and LA even in ktown! Gangnam is on a league of its own!  The food is top quality flavored and I spent less than what I would spend on an ayce place.  I liked the beef toro, pork belly, and the egg was awesome!  Most of all the service is awesome specifically from our server names donkey!  Donkey was also super cool and it will be very hard for you not to tip him cash because he is very cool and gives you all your requests!

Really accessible from the strip, perhaps a 10 minute ride. Busy during lunch times so remember to come early! Format is very similar to gyukaku except the grill is the Korean BBQ grill. 

Ordered the Gangnam set for 4 when there were five of us girls - more than enough food! Came with miso soup, sweet corn, oysters, shishito peppers, mushroom medley, bibimbaps, and a crap ton of meat!!! Everything was really tasty, definitely a good cure for a long weekend out in Vegas!

Service is also awesome :)!
Best I've had in town. Been to two other places in the Vegas Valley and this is the best one. I've eaten Korean BBQ in Korea and Yakiniku in Japan so I might know a little

We arrived and were promptly seated and given menus. We decided on the Meat Lovers but substituted spicy garlic edamame for the seaweed salad that was standard. Our sides arrived quickly.  I noticed that we were the minority and the clientele was primarily Asian so I took that as a good sign.  

Having never had Korean BBQ before it would have been nice to get some instruction on what to do with everything. As an example, we cooked our meat on the sides instead of in the middle and it kept sticking to the grill. When there was just a little meat left on one plate, the server placed it on the grill for us and that's when we realized our placement error. 
Another thing that might be helpful is some type of labeling on all of the different items so we would know what we were eating.  
Everything we had was delicious.  I think the standout for me with regards to main dishes was the marinated pork.  All the appetizers were amazing.  The miso soup was so rich and flavorful.  The dressing on the salad was delicious and just the right amount of sweet.  The chili dumplings had a really tasty sauce and I thoroughly enjoyed the spicy garlic edamame.  
We discovered why they have so many reviews, too! Free dessert for posting a review.
Overall, I really enjoyed my experience and would like to try it again, maybe someplace else to see if the experience is the same.
awesome korean bbq. get the gangnam combo for 2. worth the money. so much food! the selection is great and the service is good! will definetly come back again when im in town

Came here to try their happy hour. Food is delicious. I ordered the beef toro and bulgogi. Prices here are affordable and restaurant is clean. I like their design on the inside of the restaurant. Music choice playing was also great. Food came out great. Great customer service and I got side dishes with my order. Definitely will bring my friends to this place. Plus free dessert if you write a review for Yelp for a limited time. :-)

Suddenly craving for Korean BBQ in Vegas, what should you do? You Yelp! Found this restaurant on Yelp and immediately decided to pay it a visit. I went on a Saturday lunch time, I expected there would be a line but the restaurant was pretty much empty.

I got the Gangnam set. It included soup, appetizers, salad, rice, and meat. The best part is it costs only 59.95! I especially love their fresh oyster, Korean Prime Kalbi, and Bulgogi Bibimbap. That Bibimbap was a bomb, it's the best I've ever had. I can now understand why this set is their number one best seller. It's a killer! I was so full that even breathing hurt my belly. Gonna enjoy my food coma now, see ya.

Amazing food and great service
Everytime me and my wife come here we always get 2 orders of the beef toro. It is so good with any of the 3 sauces available. They always have great customer service and menu knowledge. They also provide great side dishes,we always get extra.

I'm Korean and this restaurant's food is really awesome taste, and all servers are very kind to us.
If you come to here, i would recommend a korean kalbi definitely

We tried this place based on all the Yelp reviews, and it certainly did not disappoint!!!  We came in with a big group which included kids.  They had so much fun cooking all their food.  The portions are ample and very good.  Definitely will come back when we're back in Vegas.

In from out of town and looking for a quality place to eat. We were shocked by how many reviews and how high of a rating it has. Turns out the food is delicious, the vibes are perfect, and staff is nice. Next time I'm in Vegas I will go out of my way to come here.

We went to Gangnam because the reviews were great and it was open late. I'm so glad we went. Their food was delicious and there was no wait. Even tho it was 10 pm, the servers were very friendly and attentive. The plates of meat were smaller than most places I have been, but the prices were great and smaller plates meant we could try more things. Everything was wonderful and we will definitely be back whenever we visit Vegas.

At first we were intimidated by the ala carte pricing. $1.95 for rice and $1.00 for dipping sauce (salt & sesame oil), but it comes out to less then other Korean BBQ places and we left just as full. The portions were generous and service was great! We got cooking pointers and sauce recommendations. Atmosphere was trendy and clean. Would definately eat here again!

The working efficiency is almost zero. We ordered bbq and we don't need them to cook meet in the kitchen, we just need them to give us the fresh meat and we cooked by ourselves. It cost us almost 30 minutes just wait for the fresh meat. The waitress is rude and seems she served Korean people first. I noticed there are two tables who coming behind us, and they almost finished eating and we were still waiting.

I came with my mom and it was both our first times. We got seated in a matter of seconds! We ordered the Las Vegas package, which is $45 for two people. The ingredients were fresher than other kbbqs! I also really enjoyed the mixed greens salad and sauces for the meat. We are locals so we will definitely be back! It has became one of my favorite Korean barbecues.
First time here...food was amazing cant wait to come back. We had calamari, chicken wings, cream cheese wonton, spicy garlic edamame, beef toro, and spicy pork belly
Fun experience and great food. Attentive service. We will be back in April for sure! Don't be afraid to try everything.

ATMOSPHERE: Went in on a weeknight and there was a large party in the back and a few tables taken in the general area. The atmosphere reminded me of an upscale clean Korean BBQ restaurant that I had visited in California and you can't find that in most Las Vegas locations. It is well-ventilated, dimly-lit and the dark and red tones are romantic.

FOOD: my boyfriend and I ordered the Original Bibimbap $10 and the Korean Pancake with Thrifty's Vanilla Ice Cream $5-6. The Bibimbap was delicious and the stone pot was so hot it made the some of the rice crispy, cooked the vegetables and marinated beef well but kept the juices flowing and our stomachs satisfied! The Korean pancake was kind of small  but the ice cream was Thrifty's and that alone was a point.

SERVICE: accommodating and quick! Served us quickly and efficiently. The servers took time to talk to us and find how we were doing. 

Definitely a must try and the people working there are very nice. I say give it a try =)
Best Korean BBQ place I've been to. Ordered the Gangnam combo for 4 and the meats were amazing quality!!

This place is freaking legit!  Coming from California, this place is easily one of the best I've had. The wait was a bit long but that's expected for any Korean spot that's this good. We had the Premium dinner set. I wanted to try their best cuts and you actually save some money by going with the preset meal rather then ordering them individually; trust me I did the calculations.  They also said that the portions were the same whether you order through the set meal for the individual dishes. I don't think any place has authentic Kobe beef in America but this place has the Kobe style beef which was really really good here. If you haven't tried that type of beef you should definitely try it once in your lifetime.  All four of the different meats that came with the meal were all really good so I would recommend you try the filet mignon first otherwise if you eat that last you will be disappointed. The tuna pokey was also really good and so was the beef carpaccio. The meal also came with different dipping sauces to go with the meat and all of them were very good. My wife also said that the salad was really good, I ate a little and I would agree. Even the asparagus came out really well, not overcooked. They put it in foil and cook it in butter and you can taste it. The side dishes are just OK. The bibimbap wasn't that great, the rice wasn't that crispy. All in all, one of the better Asian places in Las Vegas. Service was very good as should be expected in any Korean joint.
Hit the spot!  Good portions, gahlbi was amazing.  Very juicy and tender.  Nice chill atmosphere, attentive servers and great food deliver an all around great experience.

A Korean BBQ that's not all you can eat but the quality of the meat, service, and other food items was exceptional. Big area and benches fits up to 6.

Pleasantly surprised by the customer service. Not alot of employee but somehow very attentive with every table. Since there was a wide variety of choices on the menu, the waiter was really informative of the sauces and questions we had about the menu.

Along with good service, the food quality was pretty good. The side dishes included fish cake, macaroni salad, red sauced squid, kimchi, bean sprouts, and pickled cucumber. Pretty standard. 

For a party of 5, we ordered:
-chicken salad: random but good, comes with a honey mustard dressing
-tempura udon: standard
-house salad: 
-kimchi chigae
As for meats
-Korean prime kalbi
-premium tounge
-bulgogi

Overall will be back next time im in town- perfect for family gatherings and a place to relax. I recommend the meats.
Japanese style BBQ but I enjoyed they serve free Kimchee that taste was great.
Food was amazing!!! More food than we knew what to do with! Lychee cocktail was also very nice!
Amazing!! Favorite in Vegas so far out of all restaurants went too. Great place to bring your friends and family too. Great staffs! Great food!

Ashley FTW  no but seriously, first time Korean BBQ experience and it was everything everyone says it is.

I'll be back here.
Got the Meat combination 2 for 55$. It was good overall, the meats, the service and the atmosphere. This combination comes with a lot of sides
Much tasty.  Such yum. Quick service, and friendly faces.  Got the meat lovers platter for four, and it was yum.

If you like grilling your food at your table in a modern atmosphere with nice staff to take your order and bring you drinks (and help you use the grill), this is a decent place to eat right across the street from the Hard Rock Hotel behind CVS. Priced kind of like tapas, it's not extemely cheap but we thought it was yummy and worth it!  Thanks for a great meal!  :-)
Good food, nice friendly servers. The veggie fried dumplings were pretty delicious. We ordered the gangam package and it was plenty of food to go around

Not expecting such a long wait for a Wednesday night, but apparently this place is popular!  The servers were helpful in choosing from the menu. Ordered the original bibimbap, squash tempura, and flat iron garlic and bacon wrapped scallops for the grill. You MUST order the scallops!!!! So delicious!  Everything else was tasty, too.

Atmosphere was great, people are having a good time, the place is super clean, music is fun. Great spot for family meal, catching up with friends, or an adventure in grilling your own food!

Did I mention the servers were fantastic?? Jihoon took great care of us tonight.

Gangnam is a hidden gem at the corner of Paradise and Harmon (across from HRH). 

My dad and I love coming here during happy hour and it's so fulfilling. The side dishes are especially good *cough squid cough*.

The contemporary interior is well kept and very clean as well. My mom wouldn't stop raving about the color palette. 

The servers are also super friendly and attentive. This is my second time coming here in one week and you'll be sure to catch me here again!
Definitely my new favorite go to for Korean style BBQ.  The prefixed menu options are reasonably priced and the amount of food that comes with it is endless. Every single thing we are was delicious!
The wait wasn't that long and the dwen jang jjigae was pretty good! With the exception of being charged extra for lettuce, was a great experience!

The service is very good. Within a few minutes we had some side dishes. The side dishes are very good, especially the cuttlefish fish and fish cake. We also got the meat lovers special. The meat was very good.
You can not make a bad choice! There are so many tasty sides and meats. Everyone was extremely nice and they maintain a really clean eating space. Love this spot! Kristen is the best server!
Good serivce.  Clean. Fast service. Convenient location.  Had a good dinner. The new servers Jay and calvin tonight were on point.  Much better than normal.  A male and female worked our table.

I really like how this place has a similar feel to a houston restaurant named gyu kaku except it's done Korean style.  Value wise, they give you a plethora of side dishes and sauces with plenty of Korean meat. Whole heartedly, I'm looking forward to coming back hear again.

Great Korean and Japanese style BBQ!! Meat and tofu soup are awesome!! :) We ordered Gangnam course, calamari, beef tongue, zucchini, onions, all good! Must try in Las Vegas!!



服務有待加強，謝謝:)
So good! Love these style restaurants and the food quality was great! 4 of us ordered the gagnam and it was a perfect size.
Great group outing if your craving some Korean grill. Casual atmosphere. Order the gangnam for the full experience.
I come to Las Vegas a lot and this was by far the best bbq restaurant here in town!! The server was very nice and friendly as wel!
Great food. Great service. Food came out in less then 10 min and the service was excellent. Definitely new go to Korean BBQ hang out.

We ordered the 4 person meat lovers meal. There were 5 of us...adults! There were left overs!!! Excellent food, great atmosphere, and wonderful service. We would definitely come back next time we visit.
The staff is always eager to help you out and are always checking if you're okay. The food was great, definitely come here with a big party!

Third time here and I have to say -- the food, service and atmosphere are at least a notch or two above the 4-5 Korean BBQ spots I've been to here in Vegas. Had a GREAT lunch special first time today - portions were generous and the price was very fair for all the food you get. Reminds me of the more upscale Korean BBQ places in LA's ktown. Check this place out and Spring Mountain will be a distant memory.
Food was amazing and staff was extremely friendly. I would recommend this to anyone! The Korean Prime Kalbi was my favorite. The food came out really quick and the staff was attentive to our needs.

The quality of the meats is average. Compared to the Korean BBQ restaurants in LA. 
Service was nice and the side dishes were decent. 
The lunch special is a good deal that comes with 2 sides of meats, soup or salad, rice and appetizer for $12.
Just for the quality of meat I am giving 4 stars. But good service and clean interior!
We ordered the Premium set for 4, every single dishes are very good. Meats are very tender and juicy. We'll definitely come back on our next trip.

Been here a few times. Great Korean BBQ joint. Lots of variety of meats. You don't have to grill anything on the table if you don't want to as there's cooked food ready to order too. Yummy place and highly recommended.
Really nice place in Vegas! Love their food! Best Korean BBQ in Vegas! Waiting time is not too long for Sunday night . It's about 20min! It's about 8 min away from the Main Street!
Its a nice area, friendly and the server were nice. I like this place and the side dishes looks yummy. The meat wise choice looks yummy^^.

My friends brought me here as I'm visiting from out of town for work. Staff are great and will give you a run down on the dishes and what tastes best with what. It's even kid friendly! There is so much to choose from but you won't be disappointed. We had the meat lovers for 4 and still had food left over after 3 adults and 3 kids dug in. Be prepared to shower as soon as you get home because I will smell like you rolled in a bar-b-que pit all night.
Food and service was great. Came in Friday at 530 and there was no wait. Ordered the Gangnam set.  Free macaroon with review.
One of the best Korean BBQ spots I've been to. A lot of side dishes which you can have unlimited refills. The meats were delicious and the prices are reasonable.

We weren't sure what to expect coming in here as we had never been here before or to a restaurant like it. We ordered the meat lovers for two of us and the amount of food was absolutely unbelievable! The quality of the food was excellent! Also, the service was excellent never letting our drinks get hi also, the service was exceptional, never letting our drinks get empty.  We will definitely be back!

This place is so so so so good! Great service and fantastic prices, good music and great vibes!
We finished all our food and are gonna attack some deeeeeeesserts!

This place is awesome ! The flavoring taste just right , and the customer service is just as good ! Must try. The food is extremely well flavored and the environment is also welcoming , it's not your typical Korean restaurant, the design is pretty modern and clean. Pretty roomy , grilling also has ventilation so you don't have to worry about the steam rising up, overall I love this place and would come back.

Had such a horrible experience tonight. My family and I had dinner and barely finishing our dessert when the server asked us to hurry things up as there was a reservation at 9pm. This is so awfully rude to ask customers to leave. This is a family night out dinner. Highly disappointed and discourage anyone to even try this place and experience this rudeness.
Fun atmosphere. Great Food! Get the poke seaweed salad and Harami Miso beef. Busy for a Monday, but great service once we got seated.
This place deserves all the accolades they receive. Food was excellent, staff was awesome and friendly. It's a nice and warming atmosphere.

Service is real friendly and nice. Love their staff's attitude. 

Food is decent. We had Gangnam Combo. I prefer choosing bibimbap over white rice and korean (marinated) prime kalbi over prime kalbi. 

Pricing is reasonable and worth it. 

Be prepared for long lines. I heard they are often busy. However, it is worthy for the wait.
Service was great! They're very attentive and helpful. The Kalbi is really good. Everything here has a high quality taste.
Awesome dinner. Got so much food for the money!  The dinner combo for 4 people left us stuffed.  Will come back again
This place rocks. Great selection of Korean BBQ meats. The place is clean, service is quick and the food is good. What more can you ask for!?

The food is not bad.  They give a large bowl of rice with the entrees.   I like that they let you grill your meats even with the lunch specials. I had Japanese noodles and some bulgogie bibimbab, and yoogaejang.

This place is just outside the strip. The food was great. The Meat Lovers for 4 was just enough food for us all - feeling just in the middle of hungry and full. 

My favorites: Filet Mignon, Pork Belly, Toro, Potstickers, and even the side dishes (Squid, fish cakes, macaroni)

I haven't been able to try the food due to the overwhelming long line of 90 plus minute wait time.   Just not worth the wait in Vegas!  1 star for the long wait.  I would give it no star but that's not an option.
Havent been to Vegas in 4 years. This place for a first timer here is simply wonderful. Highly recommend the flat iron garlic beef. So juicy. I love the dipping sauces!
Good spot for Korean BBQ! There menu is well sorted and affordable prices! Definitely this is going to be the spot!

Super sold! Lots of options. The meal for two was plenty and certainly worth the money. The oysters tasted super fresh and the Japanese peppers were great!

A guy at my table said his vegetarian fried rice and said it was excellent.

The only thing I can complain about was the ice tea. It tested like it came from a soda machine. So the made it and Arnold Palmer and all was right with the world again.

I have never realized just how good we have it in DC as far as Korean food goes.  Our local KBBQ place isn't even the best in our area - but it FAR exceeds the food we had at Gangnam.  Most of the meat was TOUGH and chewy, and none of the sides was particularly exciting.  

It looked like some locals were enjoying bowls of soup, etc. that may be better...but as far as bbq goes, this really missed the mark for us.
First timer.... Simply amazing... STUFFED at a great price... Have to find one of these in TN.
Very awesome bbq in Las Vegas. If you are in Las Vegas, check it out. The beef here are very great.

After a hard workout I needed some excellent swoll food! Absolutely incredible food and great freindly, speedy service.  Support my page here...
Facebook.com/DAVIDGREENMMA
meatlover package are the best package ever. Though it costs over $150 for 6 persons, it worths to eat.

Over 4,300 reviews at 4.5 stars?!? We have got to try this before heading home to Daygo. 

The wait: none, we were seated immediately

I'm going to try and remember everything we ordered:

Appetizers:
-2 steamed eggs: so fluffy!
-1 Kobe beef carpaccio: yum!
-1 Tuna poki: this was alright
-1 shishito peepers: just like anywhere else
-1 house salad: nothing special 

For the grill:
-1 Harami Miso: thinner than expected 
-1 Pork Belly: inconsistent meat to fat ratio where some were almost all fat whereas some didn't have enough fat. 
-2 Prime Kalbi: this was the best out of all the meats. So freakin tender and buttery. It was beautifully marbleized. 
-2 Beef Toro: just good
-1 Korean Prime Rib: had a good marinate to it
-1 scallop with bacon: it has bacon- nuff said
-1 enoki with bacon: love these little mushrooms
-2 kabocha squash: it was cut too thin, just a tad bit thicker would've made it more enjoyable 
-1 Japanese peppers: no kick to it 

Just because:
-1 mushroom medley: already cooked, meh
-1 bibimbap: I didn't try but everyone that did liked it
-1 spicy ramen: the broth was flavorful but needed a kick to it, it is called "spicy" ramen after all. 

Overall experience:
Good food, great company, and friendly service

Nice food, nice service. The best Korean BBQ I tried. Even though this place is not easy to find. It's located at the corner of the plaza. However, it was a really nice experience for the BBQ. Thumb up!
Great value for high Quality Meat.  The best kimchi I've ever had and nice atmosphere. Way better than those all-you-can-eat joiints.
There was a lot of food, we ordered the meat lovers dish for four people. We had enough for six! I love this food!
Very fun meal! The meat was the best part - tender, succulent, and flavorful. Sides were good but I've had better elsewhere. I'll definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas!

Just had an awesome meal at this place! Highly recommend and the prices are great!! Smells so good in here while your eating. Make sure you have the server Back serving you. He is awesome!! Definitely coming back here soon!
Yahoo!! I found a great Korean BBQ place in Vegas.  This place beats many LA Korean Town BBQs.
The food is great here! This is by far the best experience I've had at a Korean BBQ restaurant. One problem was the quickness of the food getting to the table.  Otherwise I would go here again.
One of the best KBBQ that we've visit! Kimchi and bolgogi bibimbap is a must! Staffs are great we really enjoyed our time eating here! We'll be coming back for sure!

This place is definitely one of the best Korean BBQs in Vegas. We have tried quite a few and the quality here has been on par and consistent from visit to visit. Unique options of tapas are available as well and the service is impeccable!

Will definitely come back here at least once every time I visit Lost Wages!!

This is the best Asian BBQ I've eaten at in the US. I've tried many in Korea and Japan and this one is excellent. The meat is all tender and flavorful. Lots of excellent side especially the oysters. Don't pass this up on a Las Vegas trip.
Great value, tried the meat lovers and it was filling and tasty. Very fun experience especially for group
Got the Gangnam grill mix. It was very good. The gulgogi was on point. The two grill was a nice set up for the size of our group.

My girlfriend, sister, my sisters boyfriend and i came to eat here during out trip to Vegas. We loved it.the service was very friendly and they all looked like Korean pop stars. The only down side was my girlfriend burned her tongue off eating one of the peppers. But that's not their fault.
Great food! Had the premium combo with a friend, and it was so good. Highly recommended if you're looking for some good Asian food while visiting Vegas.
Lychee martini is amazing! Perfectly sweet. The $65.00 best selling meal is amazing. I suggest you save the filet minon for last as it is melt in your mouth yum! Everything is delicious.

Absolutely a hit in our trip to Las Vegas!!! Amazing indoor decoration style! The service is nice and quick!!! The food is AMAZING!!!!!! Food per portion is small so you need order at least 3 dishes for one person accepting to the server. However small proportion prevent waste from happening. The combos looks great as well!(gonna try next time!!!) My family is so satisfied here(even my picky brother looool) definitely will be back!!!

Super friendly waitstaff and hostess but the wait time is the reason for 4 stars and not 5. Always a wait but always good food at fair pricing. A must for Vegas locals and the big Asian community that comes from Irvine, California to this place.
Ordered the meat lovers for 2. More than enough tasty and delicious meats to melt in your mouth...!

I really wish that Yelp would have the option to rate restaurants with half star. This place is definitely better than average, however, not super great to be four stars. 
The atmosphere is hip and modern. They play current hits, have big screens and the decor is very nice.
In regards to the food, everything was good. The combos are the best way to go. The portion sizes are good for two people and you get to sample several types of meats. The side dishes are not like your typical Korean BBQ which made me a bit disappointed. They serve the combos with rice, miso soup and a plain salad! I really missed my side dishes!!!! Grrr


The service is good and the price is reasonable. If you cannot get to china town, this is a good Korean BBQ for the area!

I'm from Los Angeles but every time I visit Las Vegas I go straight to Gangnam BBQ. 
The meat selection is the best I've ever tried. Combinations are really worthy. Great customer service, someone is always near by to help you. Nice interior & K-pop music.
If you are thinking about bbq in Las Vegas - Gangnam is the best place all over the town.
Great food and great service ! I recommend getting the bulgogi, Korean prime kalgi and the chicken karage.

It's my first time coming here. now i know why they have so many good reviews. the quality of the food and the service was superior. i would like to recommend to all my friends who is coming to vegas!!!
They've got amazing food there. We ordered three beef dishes and they are juicy and tasting. Definitely recommend this restaurant to those who want to have authentic Korean food in Vegas.

They have a huge selection of
Appetizers! It's not all you can eat but they do have combinations so you don't have to order the meat individually. Overall, we really enjoyed our experience! Definitely recommend :)

First time that I have had Asian BBQ in a long time and I have to say that they do it very well at Gangnam. I love that they have the 4 pre-decided meal combinations to choose from. We got the Gangnam meal and it was just the right amount of food for 2. The meat was perfect, the sides were done just right, and I love the dressing on the salad... A little bit of orange lemon glaze.  I would recommend coming here when you are in town.
Place was bomb dot com! Quick and friendly service. We didn't have a reservation but they took care of our party.

For my first time here I had a great time the food was amazing and the atmosphere was great for my friends birthday. The staff was great and we had a good experience. I would defiantly come back here again.
Great food, but a little more overpriced compared to other Korean BBQ places. Just doing this review to get free dessert. I'm a college student.

I really enjoy this place and used to go every Tuesday for lunch. The servers are great and friendly and they are very attentive.  I love the calamari here it always is crispy, flavorful,  and doesn't have too much batter.
We are very satisfied with our experience here! The bugolgi especially is very delicious and flavourful, and so is the salmon bacon! This place is a must try! We will definitely be back!
We ordered gal-bi & tempura and they were both really good. Also friendly & fast service.  We would come back again.
Here the first time and the service was great and food was amazing!!! Thanks to Kyle and Jerome; fantastic servers!
Great food. We came for the happy hour and the food came early. They forgot our rice. But overall great experience

All the meat quality and the marinade was very good but a little on the sweet side. The spicy tuna kimbap was yummy and the pork belly was very tender. Side dishes was not the best but the kimchi was pretty authentic.
Perfect stop on the way to a red eye flight. Clean, good food.  Orginal korean BBQ with grills on the table.  Good selection.

Our first Korean BBQ experience. Came for the happy hour specials and left satisfied.

The prices are excellent, the atmosphere is welcoming and comfortable. Most importantly the food was delicious. Two picky eaters cleared their plates.
Only my second time eating Korean BBQ. Service was excellent and the food was very good.
Great atmosphere, they have a projector playing a lovely mixture of kpop and contemporary music. Definitely try the bulgogi and beef toro!

The atmosphere of the restaurant is pleasant with modern decor.  The Korean side dishes were yummy!   Nice mix of vegetables.  The prime Kobi is one of the best meat I have ever tasted!!  The bolgogi is excellent! Would definitely come back again.
Soooo good!!! We ordered the meatlovers and even tho its only for two, the 3 of us got full! I love the meats and the service is excellent!

Excellent place. Service was what you would want. Just enough to check on you, but not so much they were intrusive like other Korean bbq I've been to. The quality of the meats were great. I highly recommend the marinated short rib (i forget the Korean name they use). Great place to go for food and a variety of drinks.
The best Korean BBQ restaurant I have ever had! Dobulgi is one of the must try item! The meat are fresh and appetizer are perfect. But the service is poor

Food was good, but service was reaaallllllly bad. We ordered more bulgogi, and after about 15 minutes, we learned it was delivered to another table. The server took it off their table and tried to give it to us... Seriously?

I came here Sunday night and the servers were awesome. Same for the food. 
Due to having such an awesome time we came back for lunch on Wednesday. 
That was a big mistake. Horrible service! One waitress actually smiles and the other one acted like we Are there to eat without paying.
We had to ask for refill / new drinks. The server wasn't attentive at all. Throughout the stay, she came by maybe 4 times and that's just to drop off food. We constantly have to ask for her to bring us stuff (drinks, napkins, bill, and change). 
 I work at a restaurant so I know how gratuity work. 
Restaurants usually charge gratuity for table of 6 or more. And I'm pretty sure my group isn't a table of 6. 
I usually don't care if you add gratuity to my check because that save me the time of calculating. But with this service, our waitress clearly did not deserves $25 tip considering how horrible of a service it was. 
We could have complaint but we're not about to missed our flight. Thanks for the food gangnam and we will tell our friends to never come here due to your rude server.
I cooked my own lunch today and loved it.  Great flavors and I loved the skirt steak.
Food was great. Great prices. Good location. Sangria drink with real fruit was awesome.

With about 50 great Korean restaurants in town, gangnam shines above all the others with great service and really high quality meats and foods. We lived in Europe for 5 months and came back straight to gangnam. First stop after the airport!
Atmosphere is amazing. They had a Korean pop music video playing in the background. Korean pancake and original bibambap were amazing. Waiter was cheeky and funny. 5 stars
Like the food and service here. Nice place to hang out~ don't forget to write a review on Yelp, you can get a free macaron ice cream.
Super good & spicy ramen! Everything we ordered tasted amazing and the atmosphere was really chill, totally nice place to go. Service was awesome as well.

Came here for lunch on Thursday. It wasn't crowded at all and service was attentive. They also have a lunch special for their meats, 1 plate for 8.99 and 2 plates for 12.99. Overall, good Korean food in Vegas and would recommend if you're craving Korean food!

Best Korean BBQ in Las Vegas. The meats are top tier and the marinated meats in particular are where the money's at. Some may find them a tad on the sweet side but it's perfect for me. Come during happy hour to get some small discounts on a few choices such as pork belly, beef toro, and bulgolgi. Also half off drinks during this time so not too shabby. 

The one minor annoyance is the extra suecharges for what I would consider standard at most Korean BBQ joints such as lettuce and sesame oil but servers are nice and sometimes willing to just throw them in so it doesn't feel too bad :)

Check it out and enjoy!
Best Korean bbq I've ever been to! Tofu hut doesn't even compare. Ask for Jin! He goes out of his way to make your experience amazing!

I loved it here....

I was staying across the street at Hardrock and wandered over....being a huge Yaki Niku fan I figured it was worth a try....I realized right away they were not Japanese but that's not important these days...the quality of the meat was good and the service was amazing...

I asked the waiter for atsukan....and he had no idea...so I told him it means hot sake...I was in one of those moods....I did send back a few pieces of the tongue they sent me, however the chef then replaced my tongue order and in addition made me another chefs special dish on the house....my friend and I left full of wagyu beef....happy...and maybe $60 lighter....which is a deal, given we were drinking...

This place is legit! Great customer service (THANK YOU BRENT - you are an amazing fun and super fast server!!! ^^ ), food, atmosphere, etc.. There wasn't one thing we ordered that was not good. A great place to come for lunch, dinner, and even after hours. Come and get some!!! Ask for Brent!
Delicious! Can't believe we never ate here until today. Very unique dishes, great portions at affordable prices. The drinks are well made and you can't beat a free dessert for leaving a review!

Came here with my brothers and sister-in-law during a trip to vegas, and was more than impressed. We had our own private room in the back (even though we were just a party of 5) and the waitress was very attentive, and explained the menu well. The paradise A combo i split with my brother, and we got more than enough food for even 3 people.  The Harami Miso, prime kalbi, and calimari were all top notch. The meat and veggies were brought out quickly and you could cook them to whatever liking you choose. I'd come back here on future vegas trips.

Good Korean food for reasonable prices. There was also pretty good service. I would recommend the Bulgogi and the Korean Galbi in particular. 

P.S. If you dig watching very sexy music videos while you eat good Korean grub, this is the place.
It was really good. Very reasonable price!! Side dishes are good. We ordered several plates and I recommend Korean pime Kalbi. It was very tender!

This place was a real let down.  I had dinner here with a couple friends and we were all of a similar opinion.  First off the prices are a bit over inflated as is evident by the constant "sale" prices on the menu, everything is apparently half off and it still is not worth it.  We ordered a combination that allowed us to try just about everything they had on the menu.  The only items that I would have given more than two stars were the bulgogi and some fried chicken bites in a spicy sauce.  The scallops we ordered were not cooked properly (almost raw) and had a bit of funky fishy taste to them (in an old scallop way).  The service was very poor and quite slow.  When we brought the quality of the scallops to our server's attention, he commented "well, that just how they are here."
As someone who enjoys good Korean BBQ, I had high hopes for this restaurant, but it simply failed to impress and for the money you would be much happier going somewhere else, like Honey Pig.
Amazing! Jay was an amazon se sever! The quality of meat was really good! Food was prompt and service was friendly!
Great atmosphere!  The Gangnam special was awesome, got the meal for 2 with 3 people and added a couple tapas it was perfect.  The beef bulgogi was delicious.  Highly recommended
It's a very nice and clean Korean BBQ restaurant. Foods are delicious and we will definitely come back again!
Very good Restaurants!!!!!!! Must come eat when u come Vegas!!!!!!!! Highly recommended!!!!
Best Korean food I've ever eat in the U.S. BBQ set is awesome, good price, good service.
Great service and most of all, extremely tasty food! We've been to a lot of Asian BBQ places and this has to be one of the best. We're staying in Vegas for a while, will definitely come back!
Amazing BBQ! Fresh and fast service! The meat is absolutely amazing and I can't recommend it enough!
Awesome Korean BBQ!  Got the meat lovers for two and everything was delicious!  We were also very pleased with the service. A+
First time here. Food was great and lots of left overs. Great experience. Desert was great..

Haven't had Korean BBQ since I've moved to Vegas but this is by far my favorite restaurant for the moment! Dave was an excellent server/ bartender and made sure we were satisfied throughout our entire experience and even pointed out a free macron ice cream sandwich was super delicious! I'm coming back here for date night at least a few times a month!

I try first time Korean food in Las Vegas and it was awesome. Everything is fresh n best thing is u can grill it by ur self. It was plenty of verity in very less prize. Service also very nice. Server is alway active and taking care of ur needs. I highly recommend this place. Not even single thing witch will disappoint u. 100 % 5star.

SUCH A GREAT KBBQ PLACE! It's an amazing deal for how much food you get-- we got the Gangnam combo and it was delicious. The service is great, I def recommend making a reservation since the wait does get pretty long. Will def come back again :)

We came from Dallas and found this place through Yelp. Came in at 10:30ish with a party of 6 and was sat quickly. The food didn't disappoint. 
Delicious kbbq! Kobe beef was very soft. Service was great. It was also reverse HH, which was a plus.
I'll come back when I visit Vegas again.

My friends and I opted out of the set menus because we wanted meats that weren't included. We ordered the harami miso, Korean prime Kalbi, pork belly, sweet corn, Kobe beef carpaccio, cream cheese wontons. I got the bulgogi bibimbap. Everything was so good!!! Definitely recommend the Korean prime Kalbi and harami miso tho. Sooo buttery. 

$8 for a pitcher of Sapporo during happy hour. Nice.

The restaurant has a very good staff. The food is off the chain and they played good music videos on the projector screen. The staff knows their stuff and can describe what sauces go best with each meat. The drink menu is pretty good as well.

One word....OVERHYPE

Saw all the extraordinary yelp reviews made me super hype. What a big let down.

We had a party of 5. Arrived 7pm. Place was pack. We got on the waiting list. 2 other partys ahead. Got seated 30 mins later. 

Went ahead and order the Gangnam package for 4. $120. Spicy tofu soup $9.95. The server took our drink orders. 3 waters and 2 thai tea. Waters came out first. Thai tea came out late. When the thai tea came out with was in the smallest cup I ever seen served thai tea and it was just okay. Anyways the raw meats, sides and such came all different times. The server just drop off the mear to us and didn't help us throw the meat on the grill. All self service I guess. 

Service was bad. I clearly needed water refill badly. Empty cup on the edge of table. Servers walking past me over and over. I had to flagged one down to get a refill. Also we ask for extra rice and received it at the end. Everything seem rush. We ask for to go boxes and the server even forgot about that. 

We never got refills on the complimentary side dishes like other koream bbq spots. Their side dishes were good tho. As well as the meats we ordered. But the service totally killed it. Never again I'll go to this spot

Overhype. Overpriced. Just head down to other korean bbq in chinatown.
A bit pricey but the food is delicious. The beef is really tender and juicy. Service is great.
We ordered combo meat lover, portion were generous, enough for three people. Food were so goood. Will come back if we were in Vegas.

I love this place, steam egg is really good, good quality of meat!!!
And their service is really nice, the server is friendly
Sweet service，fantastic foods!!!A wonderful restaurant!! I love original bibalap rice

Wonderful cozy place! Staff is very friendly and very  attentive as soon as we walked in. Food is amazing. Their pictured menu don't do their food any justice. Servings are bigger than what is pictured. So needless to say, this visit is a night of gluttony. Green apple soju cooler is awesome and so is the beef brisket :)

Great food. Enjoyed the meal during the trip out to vegas. Menus were simple to read especially with pictures. Had my doubts for Korean food in Vegas but it turned out to be great. Definitely worth the trip off the strip.

Second time back still sooooo good. Koren food has always been my favorite, from fried chicken, bbq kalbi  or that spicy tofu soup. I want it every day if I could. 

I haven't try their bbq yet but the selection got me saying YOLO. Picture menu are the way to go with these type of join. ( check out their website )

The tofu soup with seafood is delicious and spicy, select your level wisely. All the side dishes that comes with your meal are some thing to look forward to as well, compare to the other korean bbq spots here in vegas. 

These are just my opinion. Fellow yelpie, you guys have to come and experience it your self. 

The service was good, attentive and fast. 
My only issue is, the music playing in the back ground with some bad speakers. I love music, eating and watching music video, I enjoy that too. But please pump up the volume and replace those weak speakers for some JBL or Sony's 

Thank you I'll be Back .
Nice place with good food! Decor is fun and the server was also friendly :) would recommend
Omg. Can't get enough. Everything is so tasteful and good. Can't complain at all. Service was fast too. Love the tongue and green onions. Kobe beef!  Kids absolutely loved the Kalbi.

This is a little slice of Seoul in Vegas. K pop videos on the TV and plenty of BBQ meat on the menu. Order one of the set menus--they combine various marinated and unmarinated meats and lots of sides. Plus kimchi, miso soup, corn, mushrooms, and salad.
Very very good! First time having Korean bbq! It was great, I really enjoyed it ! Had the toro and bolgogi!
fantastic！the first time here with frds and we all think the food is amazing！！！definetely wanna come next time
great place for lunch! service is great. I loved the flavor of the beef and you must try the sweet corn with cheese.
Decent happy hour. Very good value. My favorite was the spicy chicken with lemon sauce. Complimentary sides are a bonus. Service is quick. I would come back.

I should give this place 5 stars just for the service. The service here is one of a kind, all the servers are helping each other and it makes it so easy for the costumer. 

As for the food, we ordered a lot of things and everything was delicious. It didn't feel 100% authentic Korean but this will do to satisfy my Korean craving while in Vegas!

The food here is great, service is excellent! I really liked that they served side dishes with our orders. We ordered the Gangnam good for 6 and it was more than enough food for 10 of us. I would definitely come back here. My favorite was the filet mignon.

Tried it for he first time today. Ordered the Las Vegas and had left overs! The portion was a lot more then I thought it would be, which is a plus! Definitely will scale it down a little next time! Would recommend if yall need your Korean bbq fix.
Best experience of 2015 felt like I was in a amine. Parking sucks though. First time doing something like this it was awesome.
great bbq. best in vegas! much better than others. will come back again! many kinds of great beef. love it!
The service is pretty good. The environment is also awesome. I recommend this restaurant in Las Vegas !

Outstanding food, service, and value.
Our waiter was very helpful He suggested perfect amount and very tasty food.
Food was outstanding and plenty.
Price was so reasonable.
Highly recommended.

I am a flight attendant that comes here all the time whenever I have a layover here. I mean, everything about this place is awesome; food is cheap, hella good and the staff are super nice. The pork belly is to die for! The ice cream macarons are worth the calories. I made Gangnam a regular stop for me when I am here. I also have recommended them to my coworkers...love love love this place!
The side dishes are awesome! I love squid and fish cake. The spicy tofu soup is great. BBQ meat is tender and delicious, cold noodles very crunchy.

Visiting Las Vegas from Philly. Delightfully surprised to find an awesome korean bbq place. We had the kalbi, bulgolgi, spicy pork and filet. All of which was excellent. Decor and staff are 5 star worthy as well. Will definitely be back next time we come to vegas.
Great food, great service! We came to Vegas tonight and this was our first stop. We'd definitely recommend this in the future! Tip: the bacon wrapped salmon is amazing!

This was such a pleasant surprise after a long day! The food at Gangnam as fresh and delicious! I ordered the Prime Kalbi, Cheese Won Tons, also the sweet corn cheese and filet mignon. Outstanding! I have a new Vegas favorite! Servers were very nice and efficient.
Awesome food and fun for the kids!  Wait staff was friendly.   We would definitely recommend and will come again!

Reminds me of the better Korean BBQs in Southern California. The bulgogi and kalbi are delicious but what impressed me the most was how much my vegetarian girlfriend really enjoyed their veggie options. Make sure to come during happy hour too, their deals are really good.

first time here and service was extremely poor. I dont know if it was short staffed because only two servers were working the late shift at 11pm. orders were wrong and so was the wait. no refills on water. get the check, no tip.

We got the Gangnam Combo and added one order of Harami Miso after deciding it was the best of the meats we had already sampled.  Everything was delicious and nothing was over seasoned.  Quality was top notch and all of the side dishes and appetizers were great as well.  A must if you are a local or even just visiting from out of town.

If you've been to LA and had real, LEGITIMATE Korean bbq, you might be a little disappointed but this place isn't bad considering you're in Vegas.

Firstly, kbbq is acceptable in 100 degree+ weather because it's kbbq and it's necessary. Secondly, come during happy hour! They have spicy pork, bulgogi, and pork belly for super cheap! I recommend all those three as well as the japchae. It's delicious. My dad had the bibimbap and loved it as well.

The service is great too, they were very friendly and attentive. 

Like I said, it's not LA good but it isn't bad at all. Give it a try if you're in the mood for kbbq(which you always should be)

Excellent spot with excellent service. Lots of meat choices that are fresh, tender and tasty. The short rib and filet are delicious. Also ordered the squash and karaage, which were also pretty good. Nice ambiance and they got a TV at the bar. Even got a free dessert after posting this! Will come back!

This is the best asain bbq ive ever been to! I would definately consider coming again! Come for happy hour to get 50% off beers and drinks. Good staff, good food, nice music, complimentary servings are superb! Not really crowded and has a good vibe!

Because of their massive amount of reviews and high rating we wanted to try out on a Sat night. 
Food:
We ordered premium combo and they didn't serve us oysters and scallops. We did a lot of talking during dinner and didn't pay attention if they served the right food. We found out after we left and this is not cool. Can we say they treat on their menu? The Kobe carpaccio didn't look as good as the picture. And their shrimp Bibimbap tasted horrible. 
Service:
I understand Sat is always awfully busy. So we ended up eating without drinks. Finally we got our drinks on the halfway of our dinner. BTW, they use very cheap wine to make Sangria. I can't taste the difference but my friend is a wine expert. :(
Very good, delicious bulgogi! It was fun to cook the meat--great interactive. The service was very good as well. I would come back to this restaurant and would recommend it.
Highly recommend. We had the daily special. Three of us had plenty of good food for lass then $50. If you like Korean BBQ you will love this restaurant.
Excellent service way above par. Enjoyed the premium kalbi. Bulgolgi was also great. Happy hour saki is da bomb.

Very solid kbbq for the strip area. Price is very reasonable. Could go for some more banchan (side dishes) and a bit much that rice does not come included with the minimum bbq meat order. Short ribs were the best out the meat we got, which included pork belly beef brisket. Sauces were also a little sweet for my taste, but overall a solid experience!
Meat on meats!! A great experience here. $65 for two people is a great deal. Will come back again.
Really great atmosphere, music, location, customer service, but best of all.... The food is spectacular!
I highly recommend this place! Best Korean barbecue restaurant I've been to.  Nicely decorated and clean restaurant.  Good service and definitely coming back for sure!

これまで食べた米国の焼き肉屋で最も美味しい店。超絶オススメ店。

肉はKorean Prim Kalbi（通常のカルビと間違えないように注意）とHarami Misoが間違いない。
そしてBulgogiの味付けも素晴らしい。単体でもいいのだが、Bulgogi Bibimbapは隠れたオススメNO1！石焼ビビンパにプルコギが足されているのだが、これが絶妙に甘辛く旨い。
つけダレもパーフェクト。タレを始めとする味付け全般が日本人向けそのものなのである。

そして何より素晴らしいのはセット。
通常セットというのはメインに人気のものがいくつか、後は不要な盛り合わせが入るもの。
しかし人気NO1のGangnam setは、これら全ての人気商品を包括するセットなのである。
