一通りの人気の肉に、サラダとスープと石焼プルコギビビンパ。きのこのバター焼き（旨い！）。そこに生牡蠣とイカフライがつくのだが、もう要らないという位満足できる。
これで1人33USDは安い。良い所どりであり大変リーズナブルなセットである。
＊注文時にカルビと飯の種類が選べる。迷わずKorean Prim KalbiとBulgogi Bibimbapをオーダーして欲しい


特にベイエリア在住の日本人は、日頃日式の美味しい焼き肉屋がなく困っているのではないだろうか。
東は新上陸したふたごに始まり焼き肉WESTや老舗の店舗がいくつか。西はロスのSei-Ko-Enにtsuruhashiにまんぷくや牛角、その他著名コリアンBBQ等など。
これまでも充分美味しい焼き肉店を訪ね歩いてきたが、ここは群を抜いている。
日本から来て間もない出張者でも満足してもらえると太鼓判を押す。

ラスベガスながら、ベイエリアの方に是非行って頂きたく、敢えての推薦。
Great place- excellent food and prices and service was top notch!   We'll be back when we are in town again.
This place has plenty of food and is a great value. Meats are delicious and aides wonderful. Happy hour is also great and available all week! Definitely coming back.
Awesome food at Gangnam! First time ever trying Asian BBQ and we loved it!! Especially loved the bibimpap

It was my first time trying out this restaurant. Food was amazing. My boyfriend and I ordered the "Las Vegas" bundle and it was more than enough. Service was quick and friendly. The food was brought out right away. There will definitely be a second time.. a third, and a fourth ;)

Wow. First off. Great service. We walked in and was seated 2 minutes after. The atmosphere here is great. The song is perfect, that is, if you like r&b and throwback songs. 

Our sever Calvin was very attentive and polite. He made sure we had everything we needed. In addition, he brought extra sides when requested. 

I would recommend this place if you're around the area or in Vegas and craving for Korean BBQ.

Amazing food and great service . So glad we chose to come to this restaurant . Love Korean food and this place does it so well . Will
Be back
Very clean and great atmosphere for young people. Also great price for trying a bunch of different dishes!
The food here are great! Great value and big portion. We ordered their tofu soup and original bibimbap. I love the bibimbap here :) it is served in a special pot xD. Worth to try!

This is our fist time try this place. The food was really good as well as the service. We order the Las Vegas combo with 2 appetizers, almost forget to mention they have happy house between 4pm-6pm. There's a lot of food share, we cant even finish it, so we take some home. I would recommend this place to our friends, and we definitely will return.
Really delicious food. Had their lunch deal. Bulgogi and Korean chicken were perfect. Excellent service. We were seated immediately and their service was fast and friendly.

Generous portions 
Good service 
Great quality food 
Music and atmosphere is great :)

We saw this place on the food network and had such high expectations. I was displeased with the service and the food was just okay. We ordered the Las Vegas, which is a meal for two. The meal consisted of five different meats and five different sides. We also ordered some ribs. Additionally, we tried the apple green Yuzu souju cooler. The drink was refreshing and pretty good. This place was a miss for me. I wouldn't give it a second chance.

I came here cause of all the great reviews! 
Services is great 
Food is Good 
Side dishes was Good 
Will be back when I'm in town

Clean, great service and food.
My favorite lunch menu is Bibimbab :D
Will come back for dinner for bbq.

Stopped here for some long awaited Korean BBQ. Totally worth the stop. The food here is fresh and delicious. Ample amounts of side dishes. Friendly and prompt service. Highly recommend this place for your Korean BBQ fix!!

Pretty good! Not too far from the strip, modern interior and friendly staff. We tried the Gang Nam combo ($65 for two)- you get five different cuts of beef. We liked the short ribs the best (un-marinated one). Mostly Korean food with a little flare of Japanese. Would be revisiting next time we are in town.

The wait is long but it is 100 and 10% worth it! I love how all their meats a juicy. Also if you get any of the marinated meats they are amazing! Also The service here is impeccable!! They always get great tips from me. One thing I recommend is either getting here early or getting a reservation because it's always packed.

Server was named Back was a really great server, was visiting from San Diego and San Diego has some really great KBBQ places, so eating here made me feel like I was back in SD, great atmosphere, great food, and great customer service, would definitely come back
Great food and great service. The calbi with rice is really good. Also there is kpop inside.
Clean, good food, good atmosphere, good price.  I highly recommend it when you are in Vegas.

We were so hungry we almost passed on this place due to our doubts in our abilities to cook fast enough... we were wrong. They bring it out fast and the meats are delicious. It is also fun... and we all need more of that in our lives.

Accidentally saw this high rated Korean bbq on yelp and it's not that expensive! It's amazing and was also recommended by other friends. It's hard to find such a good restaurant on strip with such a good price! Worth it hahaha
We did it up gangnam style!! Thanks so much for the awesome service!! This was the best food I've had in a while.

This place serves my favorite Korean bbq!
They have AWESOME Kalbi. With very outstanding service!

If you haven't tried this place you must, it's very unique especially as far as chosing your dish. Each dish is priced seperatly including the veggies but between 3 and up dollar isn't much at all its a great social place and the food is delicious. Must visit it's open late and it's great for all ages including older folks.
Best Korean bbq in Vegas. I eat here all the time, great service. A la carte style but way better than the ayce places in town.
Fantastic BBQ. The fish cake is Amazing gotta try it. Never thought I would eat some of the things but they are highly recommended if you are in the neighborhood.
Great food,  great prices and a great happy hour!  We came with a party of 5 and the food was support quick and delicious.  Everyone enjoyed it.

Best korean bbq in Vegas! There's a reason this restaurant is highly rated. The price is decent. The food is perfectly seasoned! Great side dishes and menu selection. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu! It was a 30min walk from our hotel and it's off the strip but it's TOTALLY worth it!! I will definitely come here again when I visit Vegas again.

My favorite Korean BBQ here in Vegas! The wait is worth it since everything here is so delicious! The servers were fast and helpful as well, despite only a few waitresses manning the entire restaurant. 

We got the Gangnam set for 2 people ($70). Initially, we weren't sure if it would be enough meat for us but it definitely was. We couldn't even finish everything! The fried calamari was my favorite out of the appetizers. I love that they also included Bulgogi Bibimbap but I wished that they had the usual mixture of vegetables in the dish. The meat was very fresh, had great quality, and tasted amazing. I also got macaron ice cream sandwiches for dessert which was the perfect ending to a great feast! The set is a bit pricey but it's worth it!
Delicious food! Great Happy Hour (8.50 for a pitcher and super cheep bbq items)! And a free dessert for a Yelp review! What else do ya need!
Food was good. They have different bbq set to suit different lovers. Most importantly,  they have excellent service.

Great location for Korean BBQ. It's not an all you can eat place but the portions are relatively large. I went with 3 other girls and we split a 2 portion meat lover option and got an appetizer per person. This was more than enough food!

First time trying Korean BBQ and we were very impressed and satisfied. It was about a 30 minute wait, but very worth it! It was more food than we expected so better come hungry! We got the Gangman package for 2 and we could not finish it all. It was all very delicious! We will definitely return next time we come to Vegas!

The food here is incredible! Such good quality of meat and the service was great. 

Would totally recommend to anyone who loves Korean BBQ! Can't go wrong, try the Bulgogi
This place is so good im always craving it i love how the way they season the meat and the staff are so nice
Best Korean BBQ I have ever tried. I from sd, and this place is way better than the ones in sd.

Great dinner celebrating the anniversary with my lady. Enjoyed the quality meat and fast service. Nice atmosphere. Will be back to try other things on the menu. The prime Kalbi was my favorite and steamed egg.
A very pleasant meal. The staff was genuinely nice and felt comfortable eating here! Definitely worth it! TRUST!!
Very nice ambiance, attentive servers, reasonable pricing, neatly presented portions, delicious free smells flying around. I'd def. recommend and come again.

What a wonderful experience! Came in a little early than lunch hour to avoid crowd on Thanksgiving day.

For BBQ we had harumi miso, prime korean kalbi, beef tongue, and pork belly. BBQ was great. Kalbi and miso beef were all juicy. Beef tongue was a little on the tougher side, but not sure whether it's them or we overcooked it :p 

We also had the steamed egg and spicy tuna kimbap. Everything was amazing! The kimbap was really unique - not your ordinary kimbap - I enjoyed it SO MUCH!

Overall I highly recommend this place if you happen to be around the area!
Fantastic service, and variety! 4 thumbs up! Showed up with a party of three and we were greeted with a welcoming sense of hospitality

I loved soo much!!! Specially kalbe prime!! I was worth to wait for 30min
All the side dishs are good and service was also good and kimchi was very good
Food is delicious! Such good deals! Service is quick and very accommodating. Can't forget about the Happy hour. Good deals.

Awesome place for Korean BBQ! Items are worth getting: bulgogi, spicy pork, spicy chicken. Each plate portion is enough for two. For dessert, banana tempura and macaron ice cream! Come hungry, leave with food coma.
Good place for noodles and fried rice lovers..ordered veggie noodles and fried rice..
Great food! Worth the drive from the strip. Will sure come back when we visit Las Vegas again. Kristine gave us great service and always had a smile every time.

I haven't tried them all, but the best Korean BBQ I've had in town. The Harami Miso was great. I especially enjoyed all the Kim Che side dishes, they were very fresh and flavorful without being buried in heat. First review for a free dessert. Well worth it, the macaron ice cream was awesome

Highly recommend - it's a great experience! We chose the "Las Vegas" option - so much variety and so much food!  We might have been better off choosing individual items but we wouldn't have gotten to try everything we did!  The miso soup was one of the best I've had, very flavorful.  The cream cheese wontons and edamame were good, as expected.  The 8 side dishes were a nice touch.  The shrimp were excellent, as was the korean chicken; the spicy chicken was too spicy for me so husband had that to himself.  Alternatively, I had the beef toro to myself; it was very fatty, in fact tasted like the fat on a grilled steak which I love but husband doesn't eat fat on purpose...(!) Get the bulgogi bibimbap instead of white rice; it's a more interesting rice dish with beef in it. Only had 1 piece of the broccoli cheese fondue, was just so much food something had to give!  The salad we didn't even touch until the end of the meal; we were pretty full but it had a nice light dressing that was a good ending.

The spicy tuna kimbab was probably what life is supposed to be (i loved it) the service was quick and the selection while not massive, is still accommodating beer selection is quick and to the point and gives you the best selections from a few different regions all in all a great experience.
Good service,  nice menu selection,  good vibes! I  live in San Diego where there's a lot of BBQ and on top of that, Im married to a Korean.  Believe me, this place is Fire!

We went here for lunch and got the lunch special. There were a variety of meats to choose from along with a huge variety of side dishes. The flavor and cuts of meat were very perfect. The customer service was on point and at no point did I have to look for a server. My water was always full and we were well taken care of. The menu selection is easy and not complicated. I have no issues granting a 5 star review for this restaurant.

This place is awesome!!!!  Y'all have to try the fried dumplings. They are delicious. I had the spicy seafood ramen and it's just the best ramen I ever had. Definetly coming back. Oh and is super close to UNLV :)

I came at 11:30, and the restaurant was quickly full at 12. Atmosphere of the restaurant is very nice. Beef carpaccio, spicy tuna bimbap, and harami miso are all very tasty. Definitely worth coming back again.

I am excited about this place! Just a block or so off the Vegas strip (we walked!) and so inviting. Super courteous staff and fun decor with music videos paying (some K-pop!). The food is magic!  Delicious meats, sides, and I'm so happy they have soju! Great fun cooking on your own grill and so many flavors to tickle your palate! I'll be back!

I love this place. The food was fresh and high quality, the beef and pork were very soft and tasty, even the sides such as kimchi was so good. The price was acceptable, the service was professional since they were very organized and their movements was so quick in order to serve a large amount of customers who were waiting outside. My family came here twice, and we had to wait around 30-45 minutes, but it was worthy. I would recommend for everyone to come here at least once to try it.

Found this gem on Yelp! Went here on a Wednesday about 6 P.M. The wait was not too bad. About 15 minutes. We were sat and then the magic began. We ordered the Meat Lovers meal and let me tell you, it was delicious. The food came out very fast. We were grilling in no time! What a fun experience! Definitely would have costed double on the strip. 

*Tip: make a review and get a free dessert! What what!??
The galbi and fork belly are soooo good. I can see why it is the no.1 restaurant in Vegas.
The food here was really good, and the service staff was courteous and attentive.  Definitely a good place to go for a happy meal!

I gotta say, we came here with high expectations and did not leave disappointed. Excellent meat and dish quality, and great pricing too. Three of us ate Premium for two and it was more than satisfying. Highly recommended!
GREAT FOOD. GREAT SERVICE we will come back on our next visit to Vegas !! We ordered food for 6(7 of us ate) and more than enough meat was brought out to us! We loved it!
Great food! Like being in Seoul!  The meat was juicy and flavorful.  They're was plenty of food, too!
Tasty fresh food, great atmosphere, and fun hip-hop videos on the back wall. Food quantity is insane. We gorged ourselves and still only got through 70% of the food. The Korean rice is amazing.

The ambiance, atmosphere, and overall cuisine was amazing! Loved the hands on approach and vibe of the restaurant! I got a little lost on what everything was but everything tasted really delicious! Definitely a great Thursday night dinner spot.

Not AYCE but the combos gave a great, delicious variety. My family got the Gangnam combo special with the bulgogi bimbimbap (which was AMAZING). It came with various side dishes (which you can request more if you'd like), miso soup, oysters, soft tofu kimchi, salad, and 6 bbq dishes; all of which were great. It's a little on the pricier side but for what you get, it's worth it! Will be coming back for sure!!

There was a short wait when we came on a Saturday around 2pm. It was only 10-15mins so it was not too bad. I wanted to order from the lunch menu but they don't have that option for weekends. However, they have the happy hour menu from 3-6pm, look good but I already over ordered from the regular menu.
Onto the food, we got harami miso, Korean prime Kali, spicy tuna kimbap, fried calamari, bibimbap, and spicy tofu soup. Imo, everything was good, except the tofu soup. The meat cut was high quality, so tender and well seasoned. The appetizers are fried perfectly. Bibimbap was good, but at $12.99, i think I rather get another meat dish instead. The soup was just so so, not memorable. 
The service was okay, no smile when greetings, but otherwise attentive.
I would definitely visit again, with a reservation, since I don't like to wait an hour wait for any food.

Visiting here for the first time. First non ayce kkbq I went to. Better than other ayce Korean BBQ around Vegas. The quality of the meat is what got me! So tender and juicy and oozing with flavor! Quality over quantity! It is kind of pricey compare to others, but you get what you pay for! Coming again with friends and during happy hour (:

We ordered the most popular combo for 4 people. The meat is very fresh and tasty. The portion is huge and we could not finish it with 5 people. The service is prompt. We spent about 1/3 of what we spent at a Spanish restaurant in Aria but the food here is much better. I definitely recommend this place to my friends.

Great potstickers!  Quality meat and clean atmosphere. Place was packed.  Pricing was fairly affordable. Had kpop playing on the wall. Only thing was there could have been more waiters and waitresses.

Great service. Great ambience. Clean. The meat is high quality and yummy. Prices are typical of most Korean BBQ's, which is a little pricey. The meats are separated in smaller quantities which give you the ability to order a nice variety of meats, without having to just stick to one or two or a packaged deal. It wasn't really crowded when I went, but I can see it getting crowded sometimes.

This place reminds me of Gyu-kaku with the variety of appetizers they offer along with the different types of meat and seafood that you can order; even the layout of the menu is strikingly similar to Gyu. In terms of food, however, Gangnam is more Korean influenced, and the meat quality here is far better than Gyu's. They also provide banchan here, and the kimchi was really good! Kimchi Gangnam style!! 

My buddy and I ordered pork off the lunch set menu (looked like pork shoulder), and it was really chewy for me at first (even though it was fully cooked). But I started to enjoy the texture the more and more I ate it. It was better than the actual pork belly in my opinion. The beef toro was pretty good, and its cuts were thick. 

We also tried the chicken wings, steamed dumplings, and the spicy tuna kimbap. The chicken wings were tasty and flavorful. There was too much going on in the spicy tuna kimbap, and it was too sauce heavy. The steamed dumplings were just not very good, and even my buddy said that they tasted like packaged ones. 

Not sure if this place is worthy of their 4.5 star rating. I wasn't impressed by anything, but maybe I'll give it another shot if I'm in the area.
Great food and service!! Will definitely come back and eat here again! The food was very unique. Loved the cheese fondue.
1st timer with friends. This place is hella bomb! Best KBBQ in town hands down. Must try.

I would call this a hidden gem of Vegas!  I found Gangnam on Yelp and Yelp reviewers did not steer me wrong!  It's off of Paradise and Harmon, just across the way from the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino (in the same area as the CVS).  We had to call because we didn't see a sign  in the advertisement section, but it's there!  

When we arrived it was happy hour.  Their happy hour beer was INSANE!  We paid $8.50 for a pitcher of beer!  $8.50!!!  Our server was so awesome!  Since this was our first time here she helped us figure out what we wanted on the menu AND also helped with putting the meat on the grill and letting us know when it was ready.  This was probably one of the most reasonably priced and filling meals we had in Vegas!  They're meal for two combos are huge!  Don't be afraid to ask for their help (cooking or picking something to eat), everyone is really nice!  The ambiance is really good too! When we were on our way out there was a bit of a line, so I definitely recommend calling ahead and making some sort of reservation.

If you're trying to walk to this place from the strip and it's well over 100 degrees, reconsider!  There isn't much shade, the sidewalk is narrow and it isn't worth it!  I learned the hard way lol! 

We will definitely be back!

I grew up in Korea for gd chunk of my life and I live in ktown in LA now. So I know what gd kbbq taste like. This place really treated me and my friends really well, especially server Sooyeon was just so awesome!!! (So thank you haha) Super friendly and great service. We'll definitely be back here again!

The portion size for two was perfect. By the end we were very full and had a hard time finishing up the last bits! The meat were flavorful and there was lots of sides! Would recommend!

-Edmund


We had a meat lovers plate for two and it was great for a first meal in Vegas. My favorite part was the green apple soju (tasted like a jolly rancher) and the spicy pork. The restaurant was very clean and the staff was very helpful! 

-Kristen

Awesome Korean food! Great side dishes! Great service! We ordered Bibimbop of course, and it was delicious served on a sizzle platter. Right amount of veggies. They mix it table side for you, very nice touch. Happy hour special are very good. I ordered the spicy dumplings and garlic chicken wing. I would come back here again and again.
The kbbq is amazing! We made it on time for the happy hour and their deals are awesome ! The sides for the meal is super flavorful and delicious . Loved everything about my experience here :)

Place is good for a Korean BBQ. The staff are friendly and most of the time quick to serve. While they don't have rice cake, the rice was good enough to fill me up. The food portion was sort of small but considering its cheap makes up for it. I'll definitely will be going back here when I'm in Vegas
We liked the beef and the cold noodle. The free appetizers are great. Also the bibiban is good. I will recommend that. The combo is good for group.

Pretty good food, generous serving sizes, good prices, and excellent service. Here are the foods I've tried:

Bulgogi: sweeter than authentic bulgogi
Original Bibimbap: AWESOME! Comes in a flat hot stone plate. Huge serving with lots of meat.
Soy bean paste stew: Yum!
Tempura udon: Noodles and tempura were good but I didn't care for the soup.
Shrimp Sukiyaki(?) Noodles: sweeter than expected.
Awesome food and service! Server recommended us what to do so we wouldn't order so much.

Really good Asian style BBQ. I've been visiting this place three times in two days! The beef toro and pork toro is absolutely tasty. Also we ordered spicy beef soup and bibimbap are so good! We keep eating those stuff every time.

First time at a place like this and NOT the last!! The prices are incredible, especially the happy hour. The food was to die for. Great cuts of meat, the sauces are excellent too. The service was simple and they kept their distance so you got a full experience on your own. Super fun and delicious. Returning customer for sure.
My favorite place to eat when I'm craving Korean bbq!! I love everything here. My favorite is the Korean prime Kalbi. Good service too! I recommend this place, you won't regret it!

We had one of almost everything on the menu. The duck was more on point than Steph Curry during the NBA finals. The pork belly, more filling than Boston Cream. The broccoli fondue, cheesier than this Yelp review. Do yourself a favor, get off the strip, almost burn your hand on a grill, and enjoy some great Korean BBQ.
The food is good. The services is fast. All the staff is very kind and nice. The atmosphere also great. Try the Vegas set here if you wanna try many kind of food.

It was our first time and we had great time here. The servers were very friendly and attentive, and foods were at a reasonable price. The oysters were so fresh, filet mignon, calamari garlic and pork belly were the must try. However, the salmon was not so fresh but it wasn't my thing anyway. We'll be back here again soon :).
Good beef and fried rice! Although we waited for like two hours, it was one of the best dishes we had in Las Vegas!

This place has great food. It's also very good price wise, it definitely won't burn a hole in your wallet. The service was awesome from the moment we talked in until the moment we left. 
I love everything about this place!
I will definitely be coming back

This place was so bomb!! High quality meat and service! Great side dishes and reasonable prices! Definitely recommend the Korean prime Kalbi and prime Kalbi! For sure coming back here next time we're in town!

four Chinese visitors came there for a dinner：）
a really great experience!
food here is very delicious 
and the servers are all beautiful and helpful^_^
hope to come here again
Great food, awesome options and chill place to catch a bite to eat. Would definitely recommend this place in the future!

Modern Korean bbq with a great selection of meats and appetizers. It's a mix between Korean and Japanese and the quality of the meat is much better than all you can eat. I recommend both the marinated and non marinated Kalbi for beef. Spicy garlic and calamari and spicy pork are also great. Close to the strip is well and much better than anything close by.

Took the lady and nana on a little trip for something new. We got in for happy hour and had us a feast. We had the toro, bulgogi, and pork belly; good meats to good eats was the call. We also tried the sweet corn, kabocha tempura, and cheese wontons. Overall, service and attention was to standard, and I will gladly come again.
We were looking for Korean BBQ for a while now. So glad there's one here in Vegas. Service staff is friendly and we love the juicy beef.

This place is amazing!!! The spicy soft tofu and spicy seafood noodles are really good!!! Best place to come with friends. Plus, it closes really late, so if your hunger late this is the place to come.
You can't believe that good Korean food would be in a strip mall. A bit of a wait but worth it

A solid option if you are hungry and looking for good Asian bbq. It also helps that this place is open late at night! We came with a large party and were happily full after. We ordered a set meal, some small appetizers and drinks from the happy hour. My favorite dish here was the fried rice. The portion size was good for the price. I'd come back!

I come from Boston, where there are only a handful of Korean restaurants. Even in Boston, they do not charge extra for 'ssam/ lettuce wrap' for the meats and for the salt/ sesame oil dip. This place charges an extra $2 for the lettuce, another $1 for the sesame oil sauce, and about $1.5 each for a bowl of rice. My husband dines like a true Korean, so he had to order those sides for a complete Korean BBQ meal. I found these surcharges to be very unappealing for a Korean restaurant and won't be coming back to this restaurant for this reason. It comes off as cheap and not allowing patrons to get the full Korean BBQ dining experience. 

Quality of the meat is good, but portions are ridiculously small. The samgyupsal (pork belly) pieces are sliced very thin and contains much more fat than meat (not in an appealing way that typical pork belly fat to meat ratio contains). 

Due to their current promotion of getting a free dessert for writing a review, I believe that the ratings here are highly skewed. The waitress reads your review on the spot then gives you a dessert. I highly doubt these reviewers here are writing an honest and thoughtful review of this place.

Since I've been living in Arizona for a while it's easy to forgot how good Korean food is supposed to taste.  My gf and I loved this place, it's the best Korean BBQ we've had in years. We had the Bulgogi, Kalbi, and spicy chicken with lemon sauce as our meats and all were fantastic. For veggies we had the mushroom medley, also excellent. Great place to take a date, but remember you are going to smell like BBQ all night. Definitely coming back here next time I'm in Vegas.

Hanging out with friends very late at 10pm the first time in Vegas. Found this place on Yelp and decided to check this out since its on the top of the list. We had the love meater for 4 people. The meat is decent and the prime rib and filet are my fav. Might be coming for my second time for my next Vegas trip!

Sadly, one of the worst kbbq spots I've dined at in a very long time. Do take into account that my palate has been spoiled from dining at all the kbbq spots in LA.

I've had this place bookmarked for a long time now, but never actually got to going because of the mixed reviews I was getting. Four and a half stars on yelp and a visiting friend from New York finally got me to pay this spot a visit. We ordered the gangnam combo for a party of three which was more than enough food. This combo is meant to feed two people for $66. The combo came with five kinds of meats, fresh oysters, quartered sweet corn on the cob, bibimbap or side of white rice, miso soup, and mushroom medley. All cuts were subpar in my opinion. Bulgogi was too sweet and chunks were not cut up. The filet mignon was my least favorite. The chunks were rather large. Putting in work for something tasty was worthwhile, but for meats that did not taste at all fresh, that's just asking for too much. The bibimbap was simply sweet rice and beef. Not much veggies and hot sauce mixed in like the typical bibimbap dish. My favorite part of he meal was probably the soon tofu we ordered in addition to the gangnam combo. Soup was tasty and the seafood bits aroused surprise with each bite. This place also does not cook your meat for you. So roll up your sleeves, tie back you hair, and get cooking!

Would I come again? Definitely not. Not worth the money. You might as well go elsewhere that will cook your meat for you for cheaper with better quality meat.

Free dessert with yelp review post.

This is my second time here. First time was for their happy hour korean bbq for a friend's birthday. The happy hour menu is pretty good. However quality is not the best. You pay for what you get. You can get full without busting your wallet... If you're a girl with a normal appetite. 

Next time I went here for lunch.  We called ahead and the person on the phone said there is lunch special available. When we came our waiter said no there isn't and said that person probably didn't know cause he was knew. I was a little annoyed but whatever. I ordered the tofu soup for 10 bucks which is a pretty reasonable deal. However when they brought it out... It was the smallest bowl of soup I've ever seen. I would call this a mug of tofu soup.. It's like the size of a side tofu soup they give you during korean bbq. So disappointed. Flavor wish it's fine.
This is the best restaurant i have gone in Las Vegas. I really like their meats and the service

We were visiting Vegas for the weekend and we couldn't find any restaurants on the strip that had authentic Korean food + BBQ. We decided to take a Uber here and the trip was definitely worth it. The food was amazing, the staff was nice and friendly!

Try the Beef Toro here. It was seasoned with Salt, Pepper and Sesame oil and it tasted amazing. 

If you are also looking for an side soup, get the Kimchi soup - it's the real deal.

After reading so many good reviews on here we decided to try it out. We have eaten at so many great Korean BBQs in New York City so it has to take a lot to impress us. Well, we were definitely impressed.  The Gangnam BBQ for 6 was so good. There was so much food.  I loved the salmon carpaccio. The yuzu sauce was perfect.  Our waiter was very nice and helpful with suggestions. We will definitely come back here the next time we are back in town.

Came in from Miami and stopped in. The food smells amazing as you walk in, K-pop music playing, and the food is fantastic. I will definitely come back next time I visit Vegas again. You can't go wrong with grilled meats!
I was surprise that food was really good and priced well. The service was awesome! I will come back.

The food tasted just okay. Service was poor. 
Ordered the marinated beef and kimchi spicy soup. The marinate tasted a bit too strong and sweet and soup was alright. 
The service was not good at all. The server didn't even greet us when she approached our table and did not look at our eyes or smile the every time she came to our table. Server was too busy (the place wasn't even packed) to check up on us and when we called her, she was not happy. It would have been nice to have more a friendly atmosphere. Maybe it's a good thing we don't live in Vegas.
First time here, but start to loving this place! The food was so yum and service was good too!
Fast and friendly service, but more importantly... DELICIOUS! Got the meat lover and beef capaccio
Delicious food, quick service. Great experience. We ordered the Las Vegas combo meal, and that was already plenty of meat and food for two people. Lots of great options.

Very good food and good price. The beef is very fresh. Love it and will come back.... 
The shirmp bingbingbang is the best...
So many reviews it has to be good!  We arrived super early at opening and just ordered.  Can't wait.  Brought two people who are new to this style of food/restaurant.  Will update later!
Good quality, tasty.  Very nice prompt service.  Smallest 2 person combo for barbecue was more food than we could eat.  Nice atmosphere and diners, very varied.

Don't let the 4000+ reviews fool you; the only reason Gangnam has this many reviews is because they hand out free desserts when customers show them completed yelp reviews, and they are undoubtedly skewed high as no dogs bite the hands that feed them.  This restaurant lags far behind other Korean BBQ joints in New York and Los Angeles particularly in terms of service, and while the food was solid it was by no means outstanding.

Food:
We ordered the steamed egg which was way overcooked.  The BBQ dishes were decent however and the portions are all solid given the price.  The japchae was also on point.  

Service:
Nothing against the waiters as service was prompt, but the level of service was just not up to par for a Korean BBQ restaurant.  At the other restaurants I've been to servers cook the food for the customers, not to mention that beef and pork dishes are cooked on different specialized grill tops.  Once the meats are cooked the servers will slice them into bite-sized morsels.  Gangnam leaves the customers to do all of this on their own, and throughout dinner there was only one grill top which no one bothered to switch out even after the top was charred black.  The fan above the grill was also either off or not very strong so smoke was everywhere.

My friends and I heard about this place for the first time last night. The line up was two hours long so we came back the next day at 11:30am when they opened. We were disappointed. The miso beef was tender, grilled to perfection. The price is very affordable too! Yum!

When I walked in to the restaurant hoping to expect a satisfying Korean meal, I immediately noticed the aesthetically pleasing booths and tables that complement                        The mood and ambience. My family and I chose the "Meat Lovers" package, which consists of a variety of meat expertly marinated. When the platters of meat arrived, my expectations were blown away after looking at the monstrous portions given to us. We cooked the meat in a very clean and sanitary grill and were overwhelmed with the flavored the meat had in it. I recommend Gangnam to any Korean barbaque enthusiasts or meat-eating humans abroad!
Excellent alternative to Gyu-Kaku. The noodles, Filet were much better here. Better quality. Prices a little higher, not many options for BBQ on Happy Hour but quality is worth it. Will return.
Seated quickly and the food arrived shortly after. Great selection of proteins and drinks. We ordered a la carte and everything was delicious. Great service. I would come back!

We saw this place and yelp and wanted to give it a try seeing all the great reviews!

We ordered the Gangnam special for 2 people but easily can feed four.

It came with calamari, fresh oysters, bibimbop, salad, miso. Kalbi, pork belly, and a bunch of other dishes I forgot. 

Everything was perfectly seasoned and well executed I would definitely recommend and come back again!

Great place !! Would definitely come again! If they see that you're a yelper, they'll give you a macaroon ice cream sandwich in exchange for any Yelp review. Nevertheless the food was quite tasty & portion sizes per cost was quite worth it especially if you go during happy hour

Bomb.com 
Food and service is awesome. Good environment. Good portions. The kimchi was good!

Me and the group I was with went to this restaurant because I saw Korean BBQ on a sign while passing by. I hadn't had bulgogi in a while so I pointed it out. 

We hadn't been to a restaurant like this so we were a bit confused, about how to cook the meat. Someone who worked at the restaurant came and helped us out so much. He basically cooked the meat for us, which was amazing. Now I'll know how to cook it myself next time. 

I wanted to ask him if he was the chef because he seemed to know so much about cooking. We later found out that he was the owner. He was so humble and just helped us out no questions asked. 

His customer service was so beyond amazing!!!

Everything that we are was really good as well. When I come back to Vegas, I will defiantly come back here and I highly recommend this place.

We came to gangnam based on a recommendation, and it was a fairly satisfying experience. 10:00 pm is when happy hour began, so we got here as soon as it started. After being seated instantly, we ordered their bulgogi, pork belly, Korean chicken cheese fondue, spicy pork, and bibimbap, and frankly, everything was as delicious as it was juicy, fresh, and tender. The staff was prompt with their service, and was constantly helping us, but not many people were here at 10, so it may not be the same when they're busy. In terms of value from a kbbq place, the pricing and quantity is decent, but I'd recommend an all you can eat restaurant in case you're a big eater. 
Disclaimer: this review is in no way biased because of the free desert you get for reviewing this place.

Best Korean BBQ ever. Great atmosphere, modern setting, a unique dining experience. The menu is very understandable and motivating to read. It's always fun when you get to cook your meats right in front of you. Price is also very affordable for the quality of food that you get. Must try!

Epic meat and bomb food. Choose da gangam style deal all days and swap the bugulgogi for the prime meat. Bombdiggity no doubt dank simpson orgasmic tasting a feast fit for the greek gods themselves. A must have for any korean bbq carnivors out there who wish to feast like wild beasts that have not eatin for dayz. 5 stars for sure
We ordered the Premium set for 4, every single dishes are very good. The meat is very tender and juicy. We'll definitely come back on our next trip.

Friendly and knowledgeable staff were really helpful in getting us situated and recommending delicious items on the menu. 
The two of us ordered three portions of meat, but with all the side dishes, we could have been fine with just two. The bulgogi was our favorite, but make sure you eat that last, as it is the most flavorful. 
They only take reservations of eight people or more, but the two of us only had to wait about twenty minutes to be seated on a Tuesday night. 
It is a long (but doable) walk from the strip. We d have given it 5 stars if they had one more server for slightly faster service and if the kimchi was on point. The other side dishes were very good though, especially the green onions. Yum!
Food was really good. Got the Mongolian beef and the meat was not over cooked, which was nice. Not bad.

Party of 2 on a dinner date visited on a Thursday night, first time we were there and were pleasantly surprised how nice it was.  The booth we had was cozy and our server was excellent at explaining the menu and made sure all our needs were met.  We shared the Paradise combo.  I like that you can get bimbimbap instead of steamed rice.  There was lot of food to split up between us and we left satisfied just like we just had AYCE korean bbq. Everything we tasted was very good and we'll be back again to try another combo because we enjoyed it so much.
Great environment. Waiter and waitress are responsive, fast and friendly. Food is great. Recommend their Jalepeno Poppers.

We got the meat lover combo, it was sooo good, all the meat choices were super delicious, the compliment sides was super fulfilling like always, I would definitely recommend this place to my friends and family! Staff was on top of their game always making sure your drinks were filled n keeping the table clean n clutter free.

The service was very well, servers constantly checking up on us. The food kept coming, and I must say this has to be the highest quality meat for Korean BBQ I've ever had. Meat literally falls apart in your mouth as you bite into it. We ordered the Gangnam order for 2, the appetizers and all, phenomenal! Will certainly recommend this place to anyone in the area.

So so good 
friendly service 
Fantastic food 
Had the original Bibimbap my new favorite

1st time dining at Gangnam, and the service is fast and attentive. The quality of food are top notch. Harami cut is flavorful.  Other cuts are excellent too. They would bring anything we ask right away. We will definitely come back again.
Yum!  I love this place!  I've been here a few times already and great every time.  Love the spicy pork, bulgogi,  bulgogi bibimbop, cabbage kimchi.  Chicken dipped in cheese fondue was good as well.

Brought my 95yr old Grandmother, who loves meat, to try something new! I was worried if she would turn up her nose since she's used to her good ol steak, but she was very happy with the food. Good meat, yummy flavors for affordable price. Service was very timely too! Away from the busy strip with plenty of parking. Dinner was a success!
Great food and an awesome atmosphere! Staff was quick to help with any questions and always stopping by to see if we needed anything.
Great place love love love. Great sauces great taste great service! Will def be back and will def recommend to friends!!
Great BBQ in Vegas. Meat Lover! The filet Mignon is fantastic! On my road trip from west coast to east coast, this is the best restaurant thus far

Super good price. But side dishes are meh and the egg souffle was overcooked.

Miso hangar was really delicious. Highly recommend. Plus you get a free dessert if you write a review!  :)
So impressed! Everything was very fresh. Try every kimchi! All were so good. I now love kimchi! I can't find one complaint. Eat here!
Excellent choice a few blocks from the strip. Spicy Tofu Soup is my fave at every Korean restaurant and it was exceptional here!! In town from Pearland Texas :)
The BBQ and everything here is just great!!! Awesome place , food very tasty, nice service , handsome korean guys!!!!!Don't miss this !!!
We finally came here to try their food. Korean food is authentic and service was not bad. You should come here try their food !
First time Korean bbq pretty good place! They are very attentive service is great I recommend the beef toro for beginners. The sides are good aswell
The beef is well marinated, the seafood is fresh. I would recommend kobe beef and bulgogi

Visiting Vegas from Chicago. Was looking for a place to hit my hunger-spot away from the strip since all I've ever done when visiting is eat at the casinos. Having said that, I'm super glad that I was able to try this place out. I've eaten at my fair share of Korean BBQ joints in Chicago and this was, by far, the best one that I've eaten at. The meat was flavorful, the side dishes tasted great and the price was incredibly cheap compared to what I'm used to. This will now be a regular destination of mine when returning to Vegas.

This place was AWESOME!!! We usually go to tofu hut and this place was a great change of pace! :) the harami miso was my absolute favorite. The duck was excellent too.

Definitely go during happy hour!

Staff is super nice. Great staff. I only ordered the brisket (beef tomo, I think). I'm all about the brisket when I go kbbq'ing. I didn't like it. Not to say the quality isn't good, I just like my kbbq brisket to be thin, like 1/2-1/3 of the cut here. Fatty too, the meat here, to me, is pretty lean. Definitely not the type I was expecting. It's more like a slice of steak. I don't know if it's any fault of the food here, but I eat pretty fast and I was in and out in 30 minutes from sitting to exiting. My hotel is half a mile away, I almost didn't make it... Before I even exited the plaza I needed to number two baaaaaaaaad.  I'm so glad I was being lazy and drove l rather than walked. I would of liked to try the Kobe meat as the pictures other posted looks great, but after this close call I think I'll play it safe.  Oh and the cream cheese wontons, I liked!!!
This place is amazing! Best Korean BBQ this side of the Galaxy. And trust me, I know. I get the bibimbap every time. The macaroon ice cream sandwiches are equally delicious.
Good service, great price and delicious food. We were a party of 6 and ordered 4 portions and could barely finish the food.

My second time here and it's still amazing! The service is great and the food is even better. We tried there happy hour and spent 40 bucks for 3 people and still had food leftover. Goto spot for vegas hands down.
Best Korean BBQ I've had in Las Vegas.  Order dessert early as takes 20 minutes but awesome.  Kalbi and bulgolgi were best.  Service was great.

Great barbecue and great service!! 
Highly recommend and not very expensive. Will certainly repeat.
Fantastic. Great value, awesome food, best service. Our first visit and we are super pleased. Spicy garlic edamame is amazing.

The food,service and atmosphere... all are great. 
Meat lover set was big enough for 2 people. Free refills for Side dishes too.
Food was great , fast service. I live in the Bay Area but next time I'm going here to eat. I recommend eating here. But one server forgot my spoon but it's okay. Food was great so I'm happy.

Excellent. ... the sides wowed me! Loved the oyster mushrooms.  Also had tge chili dumplings which were AWESOME. .. I visit LAS often and will be back for sure! Thanks to my BF for pointing me here tonight
Service was excellent. We got the gangnan package for 2 and it was more than enough for 3 people.  I'd come back again!
very great service and even better food. most definitely gonna return when we come back to Vegas
Must try the bulgogi beef here!! Macron ice cream taste good too! Price is reasonable. Nice place to come!

This isn't your usual Korean BBQ place, no all-you-can-eat here.  But the portions are generous, the staff is courteous, and happy hour just makes everything better!

We happened to arrive during their happy hour, and we were greeted promptly.  Clean, classy atmosphere.  The music is a mix of top 40 and big Kpop hits.  Service is prompt and courteous.  Nothing really noteworthy up to this point.

Then the food arrives -- everything was well-seasoned and good quality.  The meat we ordered was never chewy, a welcome change from Tofu Hut.  Their prime kalbi was surprisingly marbled, definitely my top pick of the evening, followed by the green tea/mango cheesecake for dessert.

If you're looking for tapas-style Korean BBQ, Gangnam certainly makes the grade.
The Food was really super duper delicious, the best marinated beef I've ever had at a Korean spot , great service, good music
Very good authentic Korean BBQ restaurant. Tons of flavorful food. Service is very good. Staff is friendly and helps you with the cooking if needed. Prices are great!
Very authentic Korean BBQ. Good quality food and yummy. Great service! Definitely will come back again.

We were recommended to come here by friends and it was a wonderful experience. Food was delicious and had great atmosphere for a big group. Definitely recommend it! Especially those macaron ice cream sandwiches!
Awesome food and service! They serve various appetizers and fresh food. Servers are also very helpful in guiding you if you are a first time customer. Cozy place too! Must try!!!
The food was really good, my favorite was the brisket and I wanted more. We ate all the food. The salad was good too and it had egg which I loved. It was a nice, clean place.

Great food and service, I came here several times already. The food is always fresh. The appetizers are must tries, my favorite one is the fried wontons. The tofu soup here is also a must try. The only improvement I would prefer is to serve the appetizers first rather than serve them at the last, everything else is perfect.
First time here. Decided on ordering Individual items but they also offer combos. Bi bim bop was great. Served in a large stone platter to share. It was a lot for two people. Will come back.

食物很不错，新鲜，味道也可以。
我们带了两个孩子，店家特意安排了很大的座位，让给孩子们可以坐在没有开火的位置，很贴心。
但是服务不够及时，和在韩国时吃的那些烤肉店相比还是差距很大。
We are from NorCal and we loved it! The meat was so flavorful and delicious! We had lots of fun eating here with out group of 6. We will come back, everyone was super nice too!

This was a really good KBBQ joint! The quality of meat and the side dishes were great. I am from the LA area, so you can trust me when it comes to KBBQ! It is not AYCE, but the gangnam special for 6 people was able to feed our group of 7. Great service as well!
This place has a lot of variety of meat and the price is cheap! Great service too! I like the uni beef and kalbi the best

I came here on a Monday for lunch and waited 30 mins for seating. I had the lunch special and tried the bulgogi and Korean chicken for protein, house salad, cream cheese wonton for appetizer, and added beef brisket and rice. I think the meat was marinated a little too sweet (I am a meat lover btw). I really like the cream cheese wonton, but not the sauce that came with it. The restaurant was clean. It only have one restroom stall for each gender. I had a tall, Korean waiter and he was doing a great job even though he forgot to bring the macaroni salad I requested. It's okay though. I saw him running back and forth, so I didn't get upset. Overall, the food here was mediocre. I live in SoCal and I prefer the kbbq in or near my area because it an all-you-can-eat restaurant and/or buffet. The restaurant was clean. It only have one restroom stall for each gender. They also have a little bar area. So, I think this place is ok, not bad of course.

Very good! Great atmosphere. Loved the happy hour menu. They even do happy hour on weekends. Service was excellent. Their spicy pork was the perfect level of spicy. Brought friends that have never had Korean barbecue before and they loved it! We'll be back!
Great food and service. Close to Campus and strip. Love the side dishes. The happy hour promo is great. Delicious ~

A little long of a wait but friendly customer service and food was fresh. Side dishes are widely available and ample refill. Happy hour menu is good and prices are very good... Friendly atmosphere!!!! Would highly recommend to other people who like Korean BBQ!!!! 
 Cheese fondue is very unique! Thoroughly enjoyed the experience!!

The food here are pretty good. We ordered sea food noodles, spicy ramen and soft toufu, all taste  really "Korean". The service here is very nice and the environment is good. One of my favorite Korean restaurant in Las Vegas.
Great Korean food! Wait was long since the restaurant is small. Being from seoul and having eaten at many places i can say this place holds up to the bbq restaurants there.

The restaurant was great and the waiter was very attentive. The food was great. My family and I had a nice time and I recommend the Korean Prime Kalbi and The Flat Iron Garlic. The Bibimbap was not that great so i don't recommend it.

Great food. Higher quality than AYCE. 
Service is a little slow, but the place is busy.

Went to Vegas for our high school reunion. The day before
our reunion, my husband and I craved for Korean BBQ. Found this place and we were not disappointed. Service was , staff were nice, and food was great. We recommend ordering the Premium grill with a good glass of red wine.
Wow...it was really good...highly recommend it ..try it you won't be disappointed .....
First time here, second time ever getting korean bbq...this was great! Delicious, decent price, clean, and nice atmosphere...if I get a craving for korean bbq again, I will be coming back here!
Nice environment. Great food. Wonderful service. We tried seafood noodles. It's taste so good!
Came here the first time for its good rating. We ordered the Gangnam grill for two. Both the food and the service is excellent. Definitely recommend.

Awesome ! quality of the meats are very good.  Great service too and friendly staff. 

This is my first time to come here but I'm very very satisfied. My family are very satisfied as well.

The meat was very soft and tender. All of our family members enjoyed it so much!! When the meat sizzled as it was cooking, it sounded like music to our ears. I believe this time, it was the best music of all. The kimchi was well flavored and I enjoyed the pickled radish. Overall, the meat is delicious to be eaten in any way and the side dishes and salad is fresh and yummy!!
Meat was tasty. Establishment was clean. Service was fantastic! I dont know why I haven't been here before. The pork belly and beef brisket were the best. Im definitely coming here again.
I really love this place. I made a yelp account just to say how awesome it is. Food was amazing and quick. Only thing was our cups would sit empty at times. Servers were nice and informative.
Awesome service and great food! This is my second time here and I love it! I will definitely be returning for a third, fourth and fifth time :)
The service was good! The food was also good! Also, take the picture for the free desert!

So so service
Good food but poor service....
Wine was not great and they only had one type of soju.
Would probably not come back again gor sub par food and service.

Fun atmosphere. Break from the norm. Excellent service, and good happy hour specials. The food was great. Salmon Jalapeño poppers were the best. Toward the end of the meal our server disappeared. Seemed like they were prepping for dinner. Had to go search for someone to get service, so I dropped it to a 4 star review. Otherwise it was great.
So far the best Korean I've tried in the West Coast. Kalbi soup was just over the moon. And they have a pretty good portion on everything.

BBQ is Great. Sides are good.

Now I knew why 4K reviews 
Cannot wait to try macaron ice cream 
Pork belly is very good 
Will be back
Great customer service!!! Wasn't a long wait. Love their Korean bbq and spicy tuna shrimp kimbap. Also their fried calamari was good. Definitely coming back again. And again

Lovely place. Very authentic Korean meal. Probably one of the best Korean bbq places I've been. There was quite some people so the wait was pretty long but that's expected for pretty good restaurants. The atmosphere is also very nice too, although it's not big, the tables are spread out so it's very roomy. The waiter we had was super nice, 5 stars!!

I love it ! Food was bomb AF ! Service was a little slow but worth it for the happy hour! It is very reasonable for the happy hour 2 pitchers of beer, 2 hot sake plus tons of food for 4 people was $28 per person ! Not far from the strip !
Awesome food at moderate prices! We had everyone's favorites: Harami miso, prime kalbi.  However, the Pork Toro is a must try - it's amazing!

Food was delicious and the staff were friendly and helpful!

I got the bogogi and the chicken fondu

My husband and I decided to go with the Gangnam combo. It was way overpriced! I feel like a fat ass for saying this but it was not enough meat. I'm spoiled by the generous portions from the other KBBQ places I've been to. The vegetables included in the combo were random and awkward too. The combo does not come with your traditional banchan (Korean side dishes). No kimchi, no lettuce, none of the usual Korean sauces for your meat. We did get three sauces-ponzu, glazed sauce, and a somewhat spicy sauce. It wasn't terrible but without my banchan, there was something lacking for sure. Yes, I realize it's not a traditional KBBQ restaurant-some Korean/Japanese BBQ fusion. The service was good though. The restaurant is modern, clean, and trendy but that's not enough for me to come back.
Spicy tuna bimbap is a must.  Kalbi is excellent.  Meat was tender and the flavors are all good.

Was recommended to this place for dinner - service is friendly and fast, and the meat is pretty solid. We ordered the kalbi, beef toro, pork belly, bulgogi and spicy tuna kimbap, and everything was delicious (they also served banchan). Located in a plaza with CVS and close to the airport - highly recommended especially if you're in the area!
Delicious! Everything was perfect! Good meat with great flavor, nice atmosphere and a couple of attentive servers who took care of us well. I would definitely come back here.
Ended up getting the vegas combo. The food was amazing as well as the service. I definitely recommend this place to anyone!
Food is great and their prices are reasonable. I got the beef tongue, pork belly, beef toro, and mushroom medley. I'm still here and waiting to order dessert. Btw, they got macaroon ice cream!
Best Korean restaurant that I had in Vegas. Definitely come back for the meats! Must try the ice cream macaroons
Visiting from out of town and came upon this spot. Wish it was all you can eat but it was still pretty good. Pork belly and the seafood tofu soup was on point.

No. 1 Must Try Asian BBQ in Vegas!!!
Every big city I visited, Korean BBQ would be my first choice and looking for place. No doubt in Vegas, the price and quality of food here is super attractive to me before I arrived. And it far over my expectation during my visit.

Great food and nice ambience...
We ordered the meat lover...different types of meat such as filet mignon,bulgogi,
Pork belly, brisket and spicy beef.
It comes with lots of side dishes such as 
Been sprouts, kimchi,macaroni, dried squid,cucumber , fried gyoza and a big bowl of mixed salad. Everything was tasty and delicious....we will definitely come back when we visit vegas again...

Checked out this place with my friend while we were in vegas. He just returned from a trip to korea and loves Korean food. This place was good although it was missing the sides that generally come with korean bbq and we were surprised to find that the sake was more expensive than the soju. All and all, I'd try it again.

Everything was so ONO! 

Appetizers were on point. Super satisfied. We ordered the steamed egg, spicy tuna kimbap, and beef carpaccio. The steamed egg is amazing, so fluffy!! Spicy tuna kimbap was interesting and unique- a must try in my opinion. And the beef carpaccio was fresh, savory, and umami. 

Our favorite self-gril dishes were the lemon chicken and harami (miso) skirt steak. The servers were attentive and friendly. Prices were very reasonable. Definitely will recommend to my friends and will be returning next time I am in Vegas.
Delicious! The service was great and it was a fun experience. I loved their Bulgogi. This would be a great place for a large party.
Excellent off strip gem in Las Vegas! Prices are reasonable, food is great, and the staff is beautiful and very attentive. I WILL BE BACK!

This place is not on the strip. It's about a 6 minute drive and hidden in the corner next to the foot spa. I'm an out of towner from Dallas, Tx and we have our fair share of Korean barbecue places. But this place has a meat selection very different from the ones back home. They have Kobe meat (super soft and melts in your mouth), scallops, and even duck breast. The meat here is so much more succulent, flavorful, and different from the regular short ribs and brisket.  

My boyfriend and I got the premium meats and it was really worth it! It comes with appetizers like the tuna poke, oysters, miso soup, and beef carpaccio. The oysters were good but left a weird aftertaste. The beef carpaccio was a little on the sour side and the tuna poke was super fresh. This deal also comes with the  best cut meats in the restaurant. The table will be full of your regular Korean BBQ sides like kimchi, bean sprouts, and fish cake. When they bring the meats, it may seem like a small portion but it's actually really filling for 2 people. I really appreciate that their presentation of the meats are sliced and placed carefully on decorated plates as opposed to the meats back home are slapped onto a dingy plate and cut in front of you with scissors. 

The only thing I don't like is that they don't give you advice on how to cook the meats like the Kobe beef. Service here is quick and polite. We were seated within 2 minutes and food came out in 10 minutes.
Finally found a good Korean new place in Las Vegas. Got the Las Vegas bbq meal for 2 and it was splendid.

Awesome service. Good Ambiance. I dropped my tongs on accident and had a new pair before they even hit the ground. All the food tasted great. This place lives up to all the reviews on here. The dessert as you enter draw you in like a moth to a flame. The Beef Sukiyaki in the hot stone bowl tasted very good. I definitely recommend it.

The food is great! Love the kalbi and filet mignon! Our servers we're the best! I would definitely recommend this to my family and friends! This is a must when you're in Vegas!.. So I'll be back on my next visit!
Totally amazing dinner tonight.  This is my favorite Vegas restaurant.  Great meal.   Outstanding meats.   Great flavors.  Awesome!

This place was amazing!!! The service was excellent and the food was great. The meat dishes are very tender and full of flavor. The steamed chili dumplings are probably the best I've ever had. If you are ever in Las Vegas and down on Paradise you have to come here.

I'm a tourist I came back from Grand Canyon so I was so hungry I looked someplace that opens at midnight. I found this place at the first time I thought here is buffet restaurant like anothor Korean BBQ but it's not. I tried Las vegas set for 2 people I thought it's not enough for me but it is a lot of meal that comes with high quility meet. I was so happy on that night. I will come back agian
Great food, fast service. Excellent waiter. Thanks Pack for serving us. We absolutely going to come back.
The meat is very good, the service was very friendly, but price and portion size is a little unreasonable but food was pretty good
Excellent services and very good food. Highly recommend it! I had the Kobe beef and it is to die for. Came from SF Bay Area. We got lots of Korean restaurants but this really a gem.

It is a awesome place!
If you like the meat, you will have fabulous time here! 
The beef taste great
The waitress here is so nice to us.

YAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAASS!! After such an exhausting day I just wanted to eat my weight in MEAT.  it's a nice little restaurant in a plaza just off the strip. the staff is really friendly, really excellent service!! we went with the Vegas set menu which was a plenty of food which ends up being the same value as any reasonable persons capacity to do all you can eat... WOULD COME BACK AGAIN WHEEEEE!!!!!!
Great service and food it delish! Will be back here next time when I'm in vegas. Definitely recommended to all you food lovers.
Excellent service. Plenty to eat if u get the combo. Plus  u get a free desert if u leave a review

Hirami miso is great! Service is fast and the plates are good sizes. We also got the pork belly as per usual and the pork Toro. HH prices make it really affordable :) side dishes are yummy, especially the spicy squid.

They opened pretty recently so we were the only folks there for awhile. Their sauces (ponzu, sweet, or spicy) are yummy, but even if you're not a fan, their meat is perfectly marinated already (we got the bulgogi). All the waiters/esses are super cute and helpful, and they will notice if you are leaving your meat on the grill for a long time and adjust the fire level for you accordingly. The cheese wontons were delicious, and so was the honey pancake. Although, don't expect it to be textured like western pancakes- it is much sweeter, stickier and eggier.
My favorite Korean BBQ spot in Vegas! Love this place! Everything is so flavorful and I always leave feeling satisfied! All the workers are really friendly as well.
Got the meat lovers , we were stuffed and completely satisfied. Made the trip up to Vegas from AZ that much better... Would visit again :)

In town for a conference in Vegas and looked up the best Asian restaurants near the strip. Gangnam popped up at the top, so here we are!  We ordered the Gangnam platter and it was excellent. Quality of the meat was tender and bibimbop wa also flavorful. Very glad I found this place!

Nothing to complain about.  Came here 10:30 to try out their happy hour.  They had no tables at the time with one group ahead of us.  Turn over was quick as long as their customers didn't stick around too long.  Food was delicious and  service was efficient. Good looking desserts as well.
This place is Great! Meat Lovers All Day!!! We had a great time for my friends birthday.  Great location right  off the strip!

So I live on LA which has a lot korean bbq places but when I visit my friends in vegas we always go to gangnam which to me is the best korean bbq in veags. You don't have to wait long for a table and food is spectacular. If your in vegas you gotta eat at gangnam.
Amazing! Great food, atmosphere, and the menu prices are very reasonable for the insane amount of food they give you
Ths place is clean, quick, and great service.  Very comparable to one my favorite Korean BBQ places in the Bay Area.

Great food. Came with 3 people and ordered the meat lovers option for 2. Definitely a lot of food. Wasn't able to finish it all. The cuts of meat were pretty good quality. Will definitely be coming back again.

Happy hour 3-6pm beats the crowd with half price drinks and $3-4 plates. Hot sake fragrance starts the meal of delicious tender marinated Bulgogi, spicy pork, chicken in lemon and even unique Korean chicken with cheese fondue (interesting, but not quite match K flavors). Reasonable prices, nice decor good for 2-4 dining. For large group, private room for 8 can be reserved.

I don't understand the over 3,500 reviews on Yelp and averaging 4 stars. The people were nice and efficient. The wait wasn't too long. We've tried to come before, but heard the wait was over an hour. I think we're spoiled by the amazingly authentic Korean food in the Bay Area where we live. We have a neighborhood in Santa Clara on El Camino filled with great Korean restaurants on both sides of the street. 

There were 4 of us, so we doubled up on the Gangnam dinner and we ordered the steamed egg. They delivered the meats promptly and it was plenty of food. I just didn't think the meat was well seasoned and high quality. It was just okay. We were almost done with cooking and eating the meat and the steamed egg still haven't arrived. We asked our server and a few minutes later, it came out. Unfortunately, the egg was completely overlooked. It was already deflated. The other ones we saw on the other tables seem way better than ours. Seems someone forgot to take it out. 

With all the awesome restaurants in Las Vegas, we have better options for dinner.
Good food quality! Generous food portions. Here to enjoy a birthday dinner for my best friend. It was a great experience overall!

**Vegetarian Review**

Good food! Servers were able to accomodate vegetarian needs. 

We ordered kambucha tempura, veggie dumplings, vegetarian noodles, and bibimbap.
This restaurant is outstanding! Kobe beef is good and delicious. Nice experience in this trip.

Worth the hype and the wait.  Extremely high quality and tasty BBQ at unbeatable prices!  Menu does stray a bit at times (eg cream cheese wantons and spicy tuna served on top fried rice balls), but the core meats (kalbi, bulgogi) and bibimbop (particularly the bulgogi bibimbop!) are all awesome.  Make sure to order a large Hite and do some Korean Soju bombs as well!

The lunch special was great! Salad was tasty and fresh. The dumplings were soft and chewy. The sauces for the meat enhanced flavor and tenderness of the meat. We had filet mignon and bulgogi. With a review on Yelp, you get a free dessert. Excellent meal for the right price.

You get a real bang for your buck, and everything is absolutely delicious. This is great place for date night, or a double date night. The service was great, the servers explained dishes throughly and were very attentive.
Really good BBQ and Bimbimbap I recommend the brisket and the marinated shortrib :-) pretty good value too.

We had to wait for our seats despite having had made a reservation. This is a big deal to us because we have two young children. We ordered the pork belly, kalbi, skirt steak and bacon wrapped asparagus. It would have been a better deal to get the combos but we were not that hungry. The portions were pretty small (4-6 pieces each; 4 ozs) but were quite tasty. The panchangs were pretty good but you have to order two bbq dishes each person to get them for free. Nice atmosphere.
The food was so good, the meat was melting in my mouth.!!! I recommend this place to everyone
We have tried many Korean bbq in California but we believe this the best one we ever have.
The Korean Prime Kalbi was amazing! Also enjoyed the Bulgogi and Bacon wrapped Enoki...all were delish! Kobe Beef was good, but definitely would take 2 Kalbi first!

Just had the chicken fried rice with the lunch special and I will be coming here everyday of my stay for lunch while I'm in Vegas. Also is an amazing experience after having a crazy night out and waking up hung over lol
Soo good!!! The meat lovers combo is amaze balls! We got the combo for two people, so much food!! Worth every penny.
Come for the happy hour great prices, great food and friendly staff! Beef toro is my favorite and my girlfriend enjoyed the broccoli
Great food! Great service! My husband and I was really satisfied.. Must visit the place whenever you come to Las Vegas.
got the meat combo for 2, very good!! alot of food and great service. it's always nice to go to a asian restaurant out of chinatown!

Been coming to this spot since it opened a few years ago , and haven't stopped coming back weekly because it's the best Korean BBQ in the city , and the cleanest ... and it's open till 1 am for those late drunk nights ..
Reservation was good as we didn't need to wait. The food was good. Ordered the lemon soju, true picture was deceiving as it looked like a jug but when it came out was a small cup. Sheesh
Stopped here after 4 hours trip from Utah. We ordered harami miso, korean kalbi, tongue, pork belly, and pork cheek. Pork cheek and harami miso are recommended. Probably the best korean bbq in town.
Food is great ! The service was perfect!!! Christin was the best !! We definitely gonna back

Got the meat lovers combo for 2, and it was A LOT of food. I can eat a ton and it still could've easily fed 3 or 4 people with all the sides and included appetizers. It was all also really good quality -- the toro and steaks being my favorites.

I'm puzzled by all the good reviews of this restaurant. Has nobody in Las Vegas ever had well-prepared Korean food? I was appalled by the meal I was served this evening. It was a graceless, ill-seasoned, flavorless mess. It was as if someone had decided to prepare a "Korean meal" at home, threw  "Asian sauces" on a few vegetables, made a salad, put chunks of cheap raw meat on a board, and served it up with a big hopeful smile.  

I was able to eat the oysters, and there was some tofu thing that wasn't awful, but the rest of it was either offensively nondescript or downright repulsive. Has this place never heard of doenjang?

The surprise hard boiled egg hidden in the salad gave me sufficient energy to get back to my hotel. Otherwise, that was a rather expensive non-meal.

To be clear: this isn't Korean food. This is crudités and cheap raw meat. You could do it at home for $5.
Great experience eating here. The food was great ! I would recommend it to everybody. The service here was good too......
Best Korean food in Vegas! Loved the Bbq and soup! Highly recommended ! Even our son loved the bean sprouts and he's only one years old !

Got the meat lovers for 4 people which was more than enough to feed the 5 of us. Food was great. Especially the marinated meats. Service was on point as well. My only complaint is that I wish they didn't server such small portions of side dishes at a time for a table of 5, which made it annoying constantly having to ask for more.
It's the best place in town!! This is my second time here and it's still incredibly delicious! I will definitely come back here again.

Nice place, good food. Free desert with a review. I didn't like that they messed up my order for dumplings. I ordered veggie dumplings and got dumplings with meat. That's the only reason why they are getting 4 stars. Other than that, the food is great and the icecream too!
Great food and wonderful service! Celebrating my 21st birthday here with my roommates. The ambiance is amazing and you get free dessert by making a review here!
This place is delicious! Portions are big, the combos are balanced (soup, salads, appetizers and meat). We got meat lovers combo and we were very full and very satisfied.
Food is pretty good. One of the best Korean BBQ place in the states. The price is reasonable. Will recommend if you are tired of buffet in Vegas.

I came to this restaurant for the simple reason that I had to get out of the hard rock hotel. This was right across the street and I figured anything was better than spending more time at the smoky trashy hotel that was trying too hard.

My first reaction upon seeing the menu was to be a bit taken aback by the printed discount signs on the menu. Made me think of "regular price 9.95 but just for you it's 7,50--- maybe because the food is old or no one wants to go there."

I worried too much. The food was reasonably good. Tasty Korean BBQ at an affordable price. Service was pretty indifferent. "Yes we have a smaller table but it isn't set up: why don't you sit at the bar."  And I had to wait for a fair amount of time before getting any attention to place my order. The indifferent service might account for my bulgogi being a bit on the cold side. But the food did taste good and was a good value for the money.

I
Very satisfied with our food! Food is good and customer service is awesome! I got the original bibimbap with tofu. Such a good option for vegetarians which is a plus for me!

Went here for the first time and it was great! 
Dining experience - 5/5 I mean it's KBBQ/Yakiniku style so you cook everything yourself which is always fun and awesome because you can control how you want your beef/steak done 

Taste- 5/5 they have a variety of meats/seafood/vegetables you could throw on the grill including Kobe style beef which just melts in your mouth

Cost-4/5 not bad the only pricey item was the Kobe style beef which is ok, could be a little cheaper (comes with 5-6 slices=$21.95) they also catch you on the little things you'd expect to be included with your meal (sauces, rice, etc. they do come with complimentary small side dishes like kimchi, mac salad, etc.) 

All in all it was great! Also if you were to write a Yelp review you get a free desert!
Good food...authentic stews...rather small portions...but if you are in the mood for good Korean BBQ in Vegas this is a good place.
Best Korean  BBQ in Las Vegas. The meat lover combo is really worth, the meat is fresh and environment is good as well!!!!! Best place ever.

This location is really convenient if you're done with class and want to settle for some good food and cheap beers. This is also located near the Kiss mini putt putt if you're trying to take someone on a cheap date. 

I definitely receive my money's worth here, especially for it being a non AYCE Korean BBQ restaurant. The service is fast and friendly. The food is consistently delicious and you really can't beat the happy hour deals. I actually spent less money here for two people than if we were to go to any other AYCE. The pork belly and bulgolgi are really tender and even with a slight char from the grill, they never got overcooked.

Best Korean BBQ I had so far!!! All their staff are nice. We came on a busy Friday but it didn't take long before we were seated. Our server guided us in the menu and we ended up getting the Meat Lover, prime kalbi (w/ is sooooooo good!) and bacon wrapped scallops. All their banchans are twice the size of the usual banchan from other restau. All meat are fresh and tasty. We enjoyed our meal and will surely come back!

Pretty good.

Pros:
Food quality is pretty good. We got the meat lovers amongst four and it was filling. Service was good but a bit disjointed.

Cons:
Background music is terrible quality. Extremely distorted. The value for the food is not good. High prices for the atmosphere. Finally, they give you a free dessert if you rate them on Yelp. I'm not sure I like this since this inflates the reviews.

When I'm in Vegas, I don't typically leave the strip, but we did last time. We came mid-afternoon so there was no wait. I'd say this lives up to the hype! Everything we ordered was really good, and the portions were generous! We had 3 people, and we ordered ordered one of the Korean BBQ sets for two plus two extra meat orders, thinking the set for 2 wouldn't be enough. It would have been enough. :)
Price is very reasonable. They give small side dishes if order 2 bbq items per person. Also, give out free dessert if you write a review. Worth to try.

I consider myself an aficionado of Korean BBQ, and this place definitely lived up to expectations. My group of 5 got the signature Gangnam combo for 4 people and it was almost too much food. Almost. 

The combos were for 2, 4 or 6 people but the staff was very accommodating in providing us an extra miso soup and dividing the 2 bibimaps into 5 bowls. 

Highly recommended.
The best Asian barbecue in Las Vegas. You should come here for lunch it's a very good deal, you get two entrées for under $12. Order the pitcher  of sangria

The Toro beef was amazing. It was so good! The waiter was very nice. My friend got the ramen noodles and it looked really good. I would highly recommend the lunch special for someone looking for food in vegas. Side dishes are amazing! Washrooms are nice.
It's the first time I came to Las Vegas, and this is the right choice. The food is delicious and all the waiters are very nice! I'm very satisfied.

The bulgogi and marinated short rib is really good. I'm from LA and have been to countless Kbb spots but this place is legit! I honestly didnt even use the dipping sauces much because the meat was well marinated. Will come back again with more friends!

I've been here several times and I'm continually impressed. It's my favorite place to take newbies!

I really like the bogogi and the enoki mushrooms covered in bacon. Best ever!

Happy hour prices are good, so come between 3-6pm
