Very good food, great price, great service. Good find among this city and much better value than a casino owned restaurant.
Come here every time we go to Vegas.  Best Korean food we have had.  Good service will be back here again next trip
Love it!  Definitely go at happy hours 3-6pm or after 10pm.  Prices are amazingly inexpensive and the meat service is fantastic.  Try the chicken fondue and the bulgogi
Delicious food~~Recommend Gangnam! Pretty good~:) And good service. Really worthy to try!
Brown Rice Yummy！Beef Toro must to try！服务态度不是太好，太忙了石锅拌饭也好吃，量不是太多！小朋友很爱steam egg！鱿鱼一般般！不接受预约，周末要排长队
Ordered harami and Korean kalbi.  Both were amazing, highly recommended. I added this sentence so it's a review and not a tip.  Pew pew.

Good quality meat. Service was great. Would have been great if the lettuce and sesame oil was included.  But loved the sides they provided.  Binomial was great except too much hard rice from the grill pan. I would come again.

是一間很好吃的韓國烤肉，我點了韓國辣豬肉，肉醃的非常入味，服務也非常的好、很親切，非常喜歡這裡吃飯的氣氛。

而且小菜還是免費續加的很喜歡

Seated with all the Banchan (side dishes) setup nice and orderly around the grill. They have a tapas style menu and a combo menu for larger parties with a variety of foods. We stuck to the basics pork belly and marinated beef short rib. Everything was delicious and the different dipping sauces added the perfect twist. Great service and cute waitresses. Definitely would recommend.
Wow! Love the Meat lover's dinner for 2!  Such fresh meat and good portions!!!  Definitely come back for more!  Great food and great service!!
Great food and service! For sure coming back next time I'm in town! The short ribs and garlic shrimp were awesome!!!
Super amazing food and it is great, they have amazing service. Been to some of the others. And the service here is amazing. Got the belly full and leaving happy.

Delicious and fresh Korean Barbecue. Make a reservation because it can be a long wait. Vegetarians may feel a little bummed by a somewhat limited selection, and may not enjoy the cooking of the many meat selections right at the table. But it's a Korean barbecue, so wha'd'ya want?
Excellent food and service. Everything was delicious, especially the carpacchio. Sauces were also good and went well with all of the meats.

We found this place on yelp. We're so excited as this place has 4.5 stars from over 4000 reviews. Should be great, right? That's what I thought too.

When we walked in, there were so many people waiting inside. So I thought this is a great sign. This place must be good. We waited over an hour and finally got seated. We ordered some short ribs and balgogi, soft tofu soup, and a clear noodle dish. 

All the meat just taste like balgogi, pure sweet, has no kick at all. Soup was too salty. Calamari was blend, I don't understand why they mark it as "must try".  I have korean friends, and I visited bounch korean restaurants. Nothing were like this sweet. 

I am very disappointed, since I saw this place on yelp when I was at salt lake a week ago. 

The only thing that's okay was their kimchi.

Don't pay attention to the bad reviews. I suggest you go and take advantage of their happy hour/lunch specials; they have great quality meat. The interior is very clean, roomy, and low-lit (great place for a romantic meal). The tables are clean and it seems like they take real good care of the grills as well.

I have never heard of this restaurant since they opened and oh my god... I am so glad now that I have! First of all, as a student, I think the location is great! It is literally across the street from UNLV. On my first visit here (also my first time in an asian bbq style restaurant), I was quite confused with their menu, but my server, a lovely Filipino young lady, was very helpful. She took her time explaining the different combos that they offered. I ended up getting the Meat Lover combo, which came out looking very fresh. What I loved most is that it came with miso soup, a salad, a bowl of sticky rice, and 3 different sauces for my meat. On my second visit, I had the same Filipino server. It was also during their happy hour, so select dishes were up to 50% off. I had the Meat Lover again (I can't help it--I love my meat!).

If you are into asian bbq and are near the area, I would highly recommend trying out Gangnam.
Fresh side dishes and meats. We enjoyed the prime rib and mushrooms. Friendly staff and clean environment
This place was great! We got the calamari, toro beef, and Kobe prime beef. Delicious! Good service and it's open late! Loved!
Cute little place with huge tables and spacious seating! Great price and an even better happy hour :)

Delicious food.  We ordered the gangnam meal for 6 and it was so much for 7 of us.  The waiters were very attentive and friendly.  Great service and great food. Will return when we come back to Vegas.

Great food and service. Lunch menu was worth it, came with many different sides that you can choose from. I got the bulgogi, rice, sweet chili dumplings. The tempera kabocha squash was amazing. If I visit Las Vegas again, I will definitely come back.

My wife and I were trying to get off strip. Could not have found a better place. Just across from hard rock, worth the short cab ride from the Vegas strip. Try the meat lovers combo. You get a nice assortment of things to try.
Had a fantastic dinner here tonight.  We ordered the set dinner with extra meat.  The meat tasted good and sweat.  I will come again next time.
Best Korean restraunt next to campus! Great quality food! Great service! Good parking! Must go!
As a first timer to Korean bbq I was thoroughly pleased with the food and also our waiter mr back was awesome!
Great and attentive staff. Wide range of variety at a good price! Yuzu soju is amazing!
Great food, friendly service, great happy hour, fun environment. We especially liked the calamari and bulging for grilling. Highly recommend!

Great food!! Had the Gangnam set, said it was for 2 people, but it fed all three of us without having to order anymore! It was deeeeelicious!! I can't believe this is only steps away from my overnight hotel.

LOVE THEM. :) good service.
Always crowded though,
But they've continuously been improving over time!

Good prices and great side dishes.  Nice atmosphere, very well decorated.  Centrally located near the Hard Rock.  They also have happy hour and reverse happy hour in the evenings.  Happy hour is 3 to 6 and reverse happy hour is 10 to ? They had fish cake, macaroni salad, and bean sprouts side order.

Great service, well seasoned food, decent price! Five stars! The oysters weren't that great but that's easily overlooked by the rest of the food! Taking a star away because the honey toast wasn't included in desert special. HOW COULD YOU?! Ha!

Seriously, one of the best Asian BBQ houses I've ever been to! Wonderful staff, extremely knowledgable, and honestly a valuable steal of a happy hour menu. I ate like a king on a working man's budget IN VEGAS. Think about that for a second  Get here now and leave those other places alone. My recommendation: The Korean Bulgogi is thinly sliced, perfectly seasoned and you get to cook it YOURSELF for only $4. Can cook and burn water? No problem...your wait staff will help you out. 

This definitely receives 10 BGLS (black girl lip smacks) for me

Loved this place! My aunt and uncle recommended this place to us so we decided to try it since we were in Vegas for the evening. I personally don't eat red meat, so instead I ordered the Dynamite Shrimp, calamari, and spicy tuna bimbap. I loved all of them! Really yummy food and great customer service.
Omg the beef Toro is to die for! And you get a free dessert for writing a review.  That's why this is my first review ever ;)

If you love Korean food or even if you've never tried it, you have got to go to this quaint small restaurant.  I have had Korean bbq in several states and this is awesome. Stop by if you're looking for something really good.  The service is very good  also, very friendly staff.

Best Korean BBQ in Vegas. No matter you are in the middle of exploring the west or staying for the games, it's a perfect place to have an authentic retreat close to strip while avoiding the crowd and lines. Lucky locals to have this.
Best love is short rib!

Great service! Lots of good food ! With very reasonable price! Ordered the meat lover set for 2 and we are very satisfied. Nice atmosphere with the music, very cozy and quiet perfect for a lunch date. :)
Great food! Really cool experience! So much food for a good price! We had the chicken and the beef! It was a neat experience to cook the food in front of us and it was my first time having Korean.

I'm a big fan of KBBQ places and this one deserves 5 stars. First the prices are super decent for a KBBQ near the strip. Their happy hour is awesome. I enjoyed the toro, bolgogi and chicken cheese fondue.

Def a must try, absolutely f'n DELICIOUS. Had filet mignon, duck breast, shrimp, salmon, broccoli, and zucchini. Everything was super fresh and delicious! The complimentary side dishes were all really good too! My boyfriend and I had two cocktails, the meats & veggies mentioned above, two house salads, two miso soups, rice, and mochi ice cream, and the total came out to $80!!!! Can't beat it, and the experience was a lot of fun. We had to wait an hour on a Tuesday, but it's better than an empty restaurant as you know they're turning out a lot of food. It was definitely worth the wait, and you can put your name in and have a drink at the bar over at the Hard Rock to pass the time. Would absolutely recommend trying this place out, you won't be disappointed!

I read other's review before choose restaurant for lunch with family.   Great service and great food.  Three of us ordered two items from protein menu, rice, salad and dumpling appetizer.   Also we ordered one egg spicy ramen to share.  Our tummy is so happy.   It is my favorite Korean BBQ place in Las Vegas!

This was the best korean bbq I've had in las vegas. The meat was high quality, the sides were delicious, and the waitstaff was very friendly and attentive. I've quite alot of experience with korean bbq, I've had the good, the bad and the ugly of korean food......this place my friends is truly the top of the good, a true gem and a must visit while in las vegas
Visiting from SF Bay Area and the food was delicious. Enjoyed from the Happy Hour menu, as well as the regular menu. Staff was great & accommodating.
There's a lot of peoole on Sunday afternoon but it's really worth waiting. Food is awesome!

Very tasty food.
Don't like that they charge for salt and sesame oil.
Portions are good for the price.
Chicken Karaage very crispy and tasty 
Banchan were great, included dried squid. YUM!
Theres a nice variety of korean dishes!The athmosphere is very cozy.Make sure you try their banana tempura for dessert!!
Great service & great food. Be sure to come for happy hour! My favorite is the bulgogi & spicy pork.
We ordered the gangnam combo and the meat was perfect. The kalbi was the best one I've had so far. Very cute interior decor.

Slow service. This is around 2pm non rush hour 
Ordered an Udon Tempura the comment is it's coming. It's coming. More like oops we forgot
Edit: showed them this review to get free dessert (promo). I hope they didn't spit on it
Great food, comfortable atmosphere and very friendly staff - kudos to "Back" and "Frank" who were very friendly and kind!  Highly recommend this restaurant!

We came here for my lovely gal's birthday dinner and I was overjoyed to learn that the place had a Japanese flair to their menu. And if anyone knows me, they know I have a sick addiction to edamame. Sick. This place didn't make that addiction any better whatsoever with their delicious garlic stuff, but it definitely hit the spot good. And that's just soybeans, I'm not even talking about the awesome meat! We chose the brisket, the filet mignon, the pork belly, just about anything and everything; all were delicious! All decently priced. They give you 3 different sauces to dip your protein in- there's like a ponzu tangy one, a house special one, and a spicier version of the house special- which I preferred- cause I loooove spicy. Only thing that was so-so for me was their steamed egg. It's one of my favorite things to eat when I go out to eat Korean BBQ and I was just a little disappointed considering everything else was so good. But if anything try some of their gyoza. Deeeeee freakin licious! Service was good and the room we got was pretty awesome. I'll be back for sure.
The food is great, and the combo comes with a large amount of enjoyable food. Every order comes with a great amount of side dishes.
